headline: Bitfury Launches ‘Coinbase’ on Ethereum
content: <p>Bitfury, a San Francisco-based cryptocurrency marketplace that is dedicated to “staking, trading, custody, and settlement,” announced Tuesday it will launch a cryptocurrency service for its Coinbase-based platform.<p><p>The service will be offered in roughly three currencies, from bitcoin to ether, with a minimum liquidity of $3,000, according to Coinbase spokesperson Alex Seitz-Wald. The service is geared towards institutional investors.<p><p>Coinbase’s wallet service is built on top of bitcoin, Ethereum’s second-largest cryptocurrency, and will allow users to buy, sell and hold crypto assets in a native token (SX), Seitz-Wald added.<p><p>“Coinbase’s wallet is “just the tool to send crypto,” Seitz-Wald said. “It’s just a way to get in and out of cryptocurrency and also to participate in the decentralized exchange (DEX) ecosystem.”<p>

headline: Custody Services Provider LEO Raises $16.6M in Series A Round
content: <p>A new firm led by law firm Cohen & Lai has been selected as the new CEO of crypto custodian Corda.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin Custody Giant Corda Will Make Its First Purchase of 2021 <p>

headline: Biden Foundation, Big Pharma Will ‘Bundle’ $100M Into a ‘New Strategy for American Economy
content: <p>The Biden Foundation and its allies have been making a name for themselves in Washington with a $100 million strategic effort into a more comprehensive overhaul of the nation’s economic system. <p><p>That effort, known as the Biden Center, is being led by the philanthropic arm of the National Economic Council (NEC). The Biden center will be backed by the White House and the Obama administration, along with a host of experts in economic and health policy.<p><p>While most of the Biden Center is aimed at the national economic team of leading Democratic senators, the administration is taking a more holistic approach, with a focus on making the nation more competitive and more efficient. <p><p>The 2020 Biden Center initiative will involve a broad array of initiatives from education to transportation to public safety. The new initiative, announced Thursday, will include a new, cost-efficient public health fund to make sure Americans are well served by public health interventions, as well as new policies that would foster healthy and equitable lifestyles.<p><p>According to a memo shared with CoinDesk, the Biden Center will also focus on the provision of $1.7 trillion in new economic growth over the next decade to help America overcome its pandemic-induced economic problems. The fund will be administered by a combination of federal and state programs.<p>

headline: U.S. retail sales surge in Jan as 'bad news' in COVID-19 vaccine leads to higher prices
content: <p>WASHINGTON  - Sales of U.S. consumer goods rose in January as a vaccination campaign against the virus led to higher prices, boosting the hopes of companies looking to boost revenue in the coming months.<p><p>Sales of food and beverages, appliances and consumer electronics increased 1.1% in January from a year earlier, up from 0.4% the month before, data from the Commerce Department showed on Monday. Consumer spending rose 0.2%, the strongest monthly growth in nearly two years.<p><p>Overall U.S. consumer spending increased 0.2% in January. Analysts polled by Reuters had forecast a 1.5% jump, versus economists’ forecast for a 0.8% jump.<p><p>Sales of non-alcoholic beverages, such as wine and spirits, gained 0.7%, the most in seven months. But non-alcoholic beverages were the most popular category among consumers in January.<p><p>Manufacturing, the manufacturing sector, was the biggest driver of sales, growing 1.2% on a year-on-year basis.<p><p>The Commerce data were preliminary, and did not include consumer price data.<p>

headline: US Banks Will Face a Double Threat From a Crypto Hedge Fund: Report
content: <p>The Federal Reserve will face a double threat from a crypto hedge fund that is raising hundreds of millions of dollars in a bid to hedge against an uncertain future of digital currency prices, a New York Times report on Tuesday said.<p><p>The hedge fund, Digital Currency Group, is an investor in U.S. bank and asset management firm Digital Currency Group.<p><p>The report noted that Digital Currency Group invested in bitcoin and blockchain funds last year, and as such will be facing a new set of regulatory and regulatory challenges: The firm was forced to suspend its services after regulators pressured U.S. exchanges to issue refunds to customers who had lost funds in an ongoing fund crash.<p><p>That would mean Digital Currency Group will face a different set of regulatory and regulatory challenges from other asset managers, including hedge funds and traditional investment banks, the report said.<p><p>In the event that a crypto hedge fund is able to navigate those legal and regulatory hurdles, the U.S. central bank will take a “decision” about whether to extend the “institutional risk management” charter, according to the report.<p><p>Read more: U.S. Central Bank Calls for Open Markets for Crypto<p><p>Also read: JPMorgan’s Bitcoin Fund Is Building a ‘Digital Currencies Fund’<p>

headline: Ripple Taps Blockchain to Monitor Institutional Liquidity in US
content: <p>Ripple is building out an integrated digital asset monitoring and auditing system for the U.S. government, Bloomberg has learned.<p><p>The payments and compliance company has also partnered with a global technology platform company known as CryptoLabs to bring “new features, services, tools, and strategies to the crypto markets.”<p><p>Ripple’s first blockchain initiative, its $1.9 billion plan to create a digital asset reporting platform, is focused on institutional trading, the firm said in a press release Wednesday.<p><p>“Our blockchain integration with CryptoLabs represents the next step in our ongoing efforts to foster a vibrant global crypto market,” said Ripple Chief Financial Officer Brendan Borda. “These blockchain technologies will enable us to offer a seamless transition to a fully automated market, including access to high-performance, high-throughput data analysis and quantitative trading,” Borda added.<p><p>Read more: Ripple Launches Trading Service on Blockchain as Crypto Lending Stance Fails to Reach Central Banks<p><p>While a few banking providers have begun rolling out bitcoin-based blockchain products, Ripple has yet to make a formal announcement on the technology, Borda said.<p>

headline: Biden Releases SEC Digital Currency Plans
content: <p>Biden unveiled a plan Thursday to expand the federal government’s digital currency rollout over the next 12 months, with the goal of “creating a new generation of investors and consumers who use the financial system more than ever.”<p><p>The announcement is part of a suite of executive actions, including a $1.6 trillion plan to “broaden the federal government’s digital infrastructure to support critical industries, and accelerate investments in education and the arts,” the White House said in a statement. The plan includes an ambitious effort to incentivize digital investing, an effort to expand access to credit, increase government digital bank infrastructure, and extend a temporary $3.5 trillion national broadband infrastructure program.<p><p>The White House said that the bill also includes “significant progress on digital economic development including the broadening access to credit for all Americans, improving accessibility to digital assets and an infrastructure investment plan for government digital assets.”<p><p>The Biden administration will likely continue its efforts to expand the digital economy to address the concerns of many Americans, with the aim of creating millions of jobs and leading to a new economic recovery in the United States, the statement added.<p><p>“The success of the Biden plan will strengthen the United States economy and boost economic growth, and support investment in education, the arts, and other vital sectors of our economy,” Commerce Secretary Sylvia Garcia-Margallo said.<p>

headline: China's Dec iron ore imports jump 1.6% y/y to 303.58 mln T - customs
content: <p>BEIJING, Jan 22  - China’s iron ore imports jumped 1.6% from a year earlier to 303.58 million tonnes, customs data showed on Thursday, boosted by strong demand for the metal amid a second wave of COVID-19 infections.<p><p>Iron ore exports to China in January rose 6.5% year-on-year to 303.58 million tonnes, slightly more than the 315.18 million tonnes reported in December. (Reporting by Darya Zhang and Gao Zhang; Editing by Hugh Lawson)<p>

headline: PayPal Admits to Making ‘Fee-Peer’ Payments on Cryptocurrency
content: <p>PayPal is making payments on cryptocurrency in an effort to better serve the crypto ecosystem, the PayPal founder said Wednesday.<p><p>PayPal also announced it is partnering with the European Association of Crypto Exchanges (EAC), which is trying to better integrate crypto custody for large businesses.<p><p>The news comes after PayPal and Coinbase agreed to a settlement agreement in June to enable users to make cryptocurrency payments over the “fee-peer” networks. PayPal said it plans to “increase its business collaboration and interoperability activities with the EAC to strengthen our relationship with the cryptocurrency industry.”<p><p>EACs will now act as a “substantial and efficient platform” for merchants, said PayPal co-founder and CTO Brad Garlinghouse.<p><p>“We are now working closely with EACs to expand our relationship with cryptocurrency companies such as Coinbase and Stripe,” said Garlinghouse in a statement. “PayPal has also entered into a long-term strategic partnership with these companies.”<p><p>Read more: PayPal Adds Bitcoin Payments in Q1, With 1,800 Accounts<p><p>Cryptocurrency is a highly leveraged asset class that has historically provided an attractive returns on capital, according to a study released in August 2018 by the American Council on Financial Services.<p>

headline: Algorithmic Blockchain Hires R3 Blockchain Chief as VP
content: <p>Blockchain software company Algorithmic Blockchain has hired R3 Blockchain Chief Content Officer Hugh Leshner as its VP of Content and Content Management.<p><p>Read more: Algorithmic Blockchain Buys New York City-Backed Crypto App and Expands to Europe<p>

headline: Citigroup, Deutsche Bank Involved in Crypto Transactions, Exchanges Raise $15M for Digital Asset Exchange
content: <p>Citigroup Investments, a unit of New York-based Digital Currency Group (DCG), will help fund the digital assets exchange CoinDesk has reported in its March issue, with participation from Deutsche Bank, Citigroup’s parent company.<p><p>“The investment brings us closer to the launch of CoinDesk’s new suite of digital assets, and brings the firm closer to its goals of advancing the digital world to financial inclusion, growth and adoption,” said David Borda, Citigroup senior vice president for product development.<p><p>CoinDesk previously reported that the exchange’s plans to launch CoinDesk were in the works. <p>

headline: BitGo, VCs Investing in Coinbase’s XRP Exchange
content: <p>Bitcoin mining company BitGo has secured $250 million in Series B funding from Coinbase and Digital Currency Group of America (DCGIA), according to a press release shared with CoinDesk.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the investment firm, which makes chips for the upcoming bitcoin mining startup, has been working with Coinbase’s MicroStrategy, a venture capital firm, as it prepares to launch its second-largest mining farm in Texas. <p><p>In June, BitGo announced the launch of its first mining farm in Texas, dubbed XRP. The new farm is expected to be a $20 million farm, the second largest in the nation, and up from a $1.5 million initial farm for the first farm, according to a press release from the firm. <p><p>According to its website, the farm offers up to 3x, 4x, and 5x hashrate farms with around 20% of the farm’s resources devoted to Bitcoin mining, compared to just under 10% in the first farm. <p><p>As part of the deal, BitGo will invest in all of the company’s XRP farms, with a particular focus on those with large numbers of participants, and also the ability to expand its farm even further.<p>

headline: Binance Raises $12M in Series B Funding, Begins Testing ‘DeFi’ Options
content: <p>Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, is announcing a Series B funding round.<p><p>Read more: Binance Raises $12M in Series B Funding, Begins Testing ‘DeFi’ Options<p>

headline: S.Korea's March exports fell more than expected
content: <p>SEOUL, March 31  - South Korea’s exports fell in March despite the government’s decision to cut its COVID-19 vaccination programme as exports were hurt by the coronavirus crisis, the South Korean service industry lobby group Kookmin said on Wednesday.<p><p>The South Korean services sector contracted 6.7% from a year earlier, the lowest since July 2015, according to figures from the Ministry of Trade and Industry (METI), which is part of the government’s National Insurance and Protection Fund.<p><p>The figure comes after the government reduced its forecast for April’s exports in light of a spike in coronavirus cases and new restrictions imposed this month. (Reporting by Gwangju Roh Editing by Paul Simao)<p>

headline: Ethereum, Amazon Launch Directories for New Web App
content: <p>Amazon Web Services (AWS) has launched its own directories for users to connect to other web apps.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the e-commerce giant launched its own e-commerce platform for developers in partnership with Square and Etsy to support the launch of new apps. E-commerce apps will be free to users.<p><p>“We’re launching directly to our customers via Square and Etsy’s e-commerce platform,” AWS Chief Marketing Officer Dan Bruyette told CoinDesk in an interview. “Amazon Web Services is a great way to connect and collaborate in the web and we have built an ecosystem around the products we provide.”<p><p>The new products in the Amazon Web Services Directories feature Web 2.0 (or W2C), the first fully decentralized web applications developed by Google and Microsoft and supported by thousands of companies, said Bruyette.<p><p>The new applications are built on Amazon’s AWS Cloud Platform and AWS’ native web server infrastructure.<p><p>AWS allows developers to run software on any underlying server, enabling developers to run new apps, Bruyette added. “It’s really about building a user experience that will appeal to any developer.”<p><p>See also: Amazon’s ‘Private Cloud’ Hits Another Test Drive With New Enterprise-Level APIs<p>

headline: Avanti, Canaan Join Genesis Financial in Crypto Mining Revenue Bill
content: <p>Avanti, a subsidiary of Canaan Digital, has joined Genesis Financial in a funding round for cryptocurrency mining business.<p><p>Announced Monday, Canaan Digital is the first entity to participate in the Genesis Crypto Mining Investment Plan. <p><p>In an announcement released Tuesday, Genesis Financial CEO Matthew Weinberg said in part:<p><p>See also: Genesis Crypto Mining Firm Lets $600M Worth of Assets Go to China<p><p>The firm has been involved in the cryptocurrency mining sector for a while now, having started out as Genesis Mining Group. The company has also been involved in the Ethereum network since 2016.<p>

headline: Swiss Crypto Exchange Bitwise Adds Support for Blockchain Assets in DeFi
content: <p>Swiss cryptocurrency exchange Bitwise has added support for the issuance of blockchains, in addition to its existing integration with the Ethereum blockchain.<p><p>Read more: Switzerland’s Biggest Bitcoin Exchange Wins License to Accept Blockchain Assets<p>

headline: Sleeping Giant Crypto Exchange Kraken Gets US Patent Approval From the US Patent Office
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken, the parent company of CoinDesk’s parent company, has received a U.S. patent application for a new method of storing and holding digital assets.<p><p>According to a press release issued Wednesday, Kraken’s new technique is more efficient and more easily adapted to the demands of the financial services industry.<p><p>“The method utilizes a combination of electronic and physical storage facilities, the use of specialized processing devices to store, transfer and process digital assets, and the use of automated, automated and blockchain technologies to improve the efficiency and security of the service. The technology utilizes advanced crypto technology to offer high throughput and low latency, with minimal cost,” said Kraken CEO and co-founder Jack Dorsey.<p><p>Read more: The Cryptocurrency Industry Takes on Bitcoin in a New Way<p><p>The press release is based on information provided to CoinDesk in its original filing, which was filed Tuesday, December 6, 2018.<p><p>The firm’s first product is an automated trading platform designed to bring liquidity to cryptocurrency trading by placing digital assets in order to earn returns. Kraken first announced the service in July 2018.<p>

headline: BitGo Expands Its Digital Asset Strategy for Investors, Including DeFi
content: <p>BitGo is adding institutional investment and cryptocurrency derivatives to its cryptocurrency trading strategy.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the asset management firm has expanded its digital asset strategy for investors including DeFi’s “BitGo Trust,” which will provide the firm with an annual treasury balance of more than $1 billion. <p><p>The partnership, which was first revealed by BitGo in August, will include BitGo’s digital derivatives trading business, where investors will be able to trade bitcoin and other digital assets without fees. <p><p>See also: BitGo Becomes First Financial Entity to Offer Trading Services on Ethereum<p><p>“This integration represents a significant milestone in our digital asset strategy,” BitGo CEO John Wani said in a statement. “In an effort to further broaden our customer base and make BitGo the first financial institution to offer this service, we’re excited to expand the business further and introduce the BitGo Trust as our primary asset class.”<p><p>BitGo’s foray into crypto markets began in earnest in December 2019. <p>

headline: Pizza Hut Will Bring Back Custody Service for New Retailers
content: <p>Pizza Hut is rolling out a new service to its popular online restaurant, offering a custody solution for existing customers.<p><p>Launched in 2014, Custody is a subscription service that allows customers to buy, sell, share and manage digital goods and services. The service now has over 100 stores worldwide.<p><p>The service lets customers purchase groceries online at checkout, without having to go through the hassle of ordering and shipping.<p><p>The service will also work with existing Custody customers as an alternative to Amazon’s paid delivery option.<p><p>See also: Custody Is Coming to New York City: Report<p><p>“We are excited about bringing the Pizza Hut Custody product to our customers in the U.S. and abroad,” said Michael Lewis, Pizza Hut’s chief operating officer. “We look forward to working with the community and partners to provide the best customer experience for our customers.”<p>

headline: UPDATE 1-Philippine GDP shrinks in April as coronavirus curbs worsen
content: <p>* Production shrinks 2.3% y/y in COVID-19-related cases<p><p>* Production dropped 0.7% y/y in April (Adds economist comments, background)<p><p>MANILA, April 9  - Philippine gross domestic product (GDP) shrank by 2.3% in April from a year earlier, official data showed on Monday, although there were some short-term effects, largely caused by the coronavirus lockdown in some provinces, particularly in the southern provinces.<p><p>GDP shrank 3.3% in the first three months of the year, from a year earlier, data from the Statistics Institute of the Philippines showed.<p><p>But that was the sharpest fall since February 2017, and its first in the year.<p><p>The government also extended a state of emergency in the region to support businesses.<p><p>“The recovery in the industrial sector is evident from a sharp increase in production, which will probably continue in April,” Economy Secretary Benjamin Diokno said during an earnings call.<p><p>Output in the private sector grew 8.1% in April from a year earlier, while employment declined 1.5%.<p><p>“We were able to take the first steps to stabilise the economy in April,” Diokno said.

headline: Swiss Polytechnic Bank to Partner With Crypto Provider BitPay
content: <p>Blockchain banking giant SNCB Bank is to join BitPay’s crypto trading arm and provide direct services to cryptocurrency investors.<p><p>In an announcement Thursday, SNCB Bank said it will work with the newly launched company’s partners in order to support cryptocurrency investment banking with regulatory approval, as well as providing direct services on BitPay’s mobile app and desktop app.<p><p>BitPay is the first major crypto exchange to have entered the SNCB banking relationship, joining crypto exchange BlockFi and crypto lender Coinbase, as well as crypto retail provider CryptoFi Capital.<p><p>The SNCB partnership comes as crypto firms see a potential expansion into traditional banking with digital assets trading becoming mainstream.<p><p>According to recent research, crypto firms, including crypto exchange Bitpanda, Coinbase, and BlockFi, now account for about a fifth of all banking transactions in the Swiss, accounting for about a fifth of all loans issued by Swiss banks in 2018.<p><p>“We look forward to collaborating with SNCB Bank, as they will help further develop the crypto industry,” Bitpanda CEO Michael von Lutz said in a statement.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Firm SNCB Bank to Offer Bitcoin and Other Crypto Assets to Crypto Investors<p>

headline: Binance-Backed BitGo to Bring Crypto Investment to Crypto Lending Loans
content: <p>BitGo is teaming up with Coinbase and the leading cryptocurrency lending platform, Binance Labs.<p><p>Announced Thursday, Binance Labs is bringing its “digital asset lending platform” BNB Global to the crypto lending community. The startup plans to leverage its BNB Global app to lend crypto assets and cryptocurrency loans to a select number of lenders, including institutions, as well as retail investors.<p><p>“Binance will provide lending services for accredited investors that borrow, sell, lend, or trade cryptocurrencies or other assets in the custody of their lenders,” the firm said in a press statement.<p><p>See also: Coinbase’s Crypto Institutional Investor Lend First: Coinbase, BitGo to Launch Crypto Assets Firm<p><p>BitGo launched BNB Global in 2018, which allowed users to lend fiat to crypto, digital assets or digital tokens. The app allowed accredited investors to borrow and trade bitcoin and other assets at discounted rates by depositing crypto into their crypto wallets or bitcoin wallets.<p><p>The firm’s BNB Global lending solution is the first in a series of crypto-enabled lending solutions in the U.S. and Europe, according to CoinDesk. The app is currently only available in the U.K. and European Union, as well as Japan, Korea and Singapore.<p>

headline: A Better Alternative to Crypto Firms’ $8.6B Ransomware Deal
content: <p>Blockchain payments giant BlockFi has closed a $8.6 billion deal to acquire an arm of cryptocurrency payments provider BitPay.<p><p>See also: Coinbase to Pay for Bitcoin’s Bitcoin Miners With US Crypto Custody Deal<p>

headline: Ripple Acquires US Treasury Digital Asset Manager Coinbase Ventures
content: <p>Crypto custodian Ripple Ventures has acquired an adviser for the U.S. Treasury Digital Asset Services division that manages U.S. Treasury Digital Assets.<p><p>The New York-based firm also acquired Digital Asset Holdings, the digital asset management company formerly owned by Digital Currency Group.<p><p>“These acquisitions add to Ripple’s ongoing mission of providing a fully automated U.S. financial system with a robust and mature portfolio of digital assets and digital services for the benefit of American consumers, investors and businesses throughout the world,” said Michael S. Saylor, Ripple’s senior vice president and head of institutional markets.<p><p>The acquisition is in line with recent acquisitions by Ripple Ventures and ConsenSys, both of which helped bring the firm’s derivatives trading business to market.<p><p>The partnership follows the firm’s recent $10 million acquisition of Cambridge Analytica, the largest market research firm by revenue.<p><p>Crypto is a lucrative industry, with the U.S. accounting for more than $20 trillion of the total digital asset market.<p><p>The U.S. has been busy pushing back against the financial crisis and the crypto craze, with authorities stepping in to stoke it.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin’s Price Drops as U.S. Regulator Probs Crypto Trade<p>

headline: Listed Insurance Company Invests in US Crypto Firm Crypto Exchange Gemini
content: <p>Listed insurance provider Crypto Exchange Gemini has secured investment from an unnamed U.S. investment bank, according to a blog post shared Tuesday by the Gemini Exchange Network.<p><p>Also read: Gemini Exchange’s New York State Licensing Deadline Begins April 30<p>

headline: Hedge Fund Principal Sees ‘Scary’ Bitcoin Trust Coming Next Week
content: <p>Hedge funds have long been the preferred form of investment for large investors looking to make a quick and liquid exit from investing in bitcoin or any other asset class.<p><p>However, a new hedge fund principal has begun exploring bitcoin in a bid to make the investment more accessible and safe, according to his latest venture. <p><p>This is the latest in a string of hires for a fund taking a hawkish position on bitcoin, one that recently posted its largest quarterly return to date of 2,069%.<p><p>“I’m excited to see a big, beautiful, and powerful hedge fund investing in bitcoin right now,” the principal of the H3 Global Crypto Fund said in a press release. “I believe in the security of cryptocurrencies, as well as the potential for the world’s largest institutional investors to own and to invest in bitcoin and other asset classes.”<p><p>See also: Coinbase CEO Says SEC Suit Against Coinbase Is ‘Overblown’<p><p>The funds’ investment is in the company’s $4.5 billion equity investment fund, said COO Mike Belshe. <p><p>See also: Bitcoin Foundation COO Says Bitcoin’s Lightning Network Could Replace Electricity<p>

headline: WTO Digital Currency Token Gets Regulatory Review From U.S. Patent and Trademark Office
content: <p>The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) is considering issuing a digital currency token (BAT) that could be used as a means of identification for entities and businesses in the digital economy, the company announced Thursday.<p><p>Read more: ‘This’s a Fast Track to the FATF’s Digital Currency Initiative<p>

headline: Coinbase’s Binance Exchange Raises $2.9M in a Series B Round
content: <p>Binance, the U.S.-based payments infrastructure provider, has wrapped up a $2.9 million Series B funding round led by Coinbase Ventures and CoinGecko Capital, as announced Monday.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Ventures Eyes ‘Biggest Bitcoin Opportunity’ in 2020<p>

headline: Gemini to Pay $40M to Unite 6,000 Investors: Report
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Gemini, a company founded by former Goldman Sachs executives, is paying $40 million to the six investors that bought a controlling interest in the company on Tuesday, according to the report.<p><p>The money will be used to help the venture arm of cryptocurrency firm Blockchain Capital to continue building out the technology and infrastructure for the company’s services and future growth, according to the report.<p>

headline: Algorand to Launch Institutional Bitcoin Custody Service in 2019
content: <p>Institutional digital asset custodian Algorand has announced it will launch a cryptocurrency custody platform in 2019, with a focus on institutional investors.<p><p>Also read: US Commodity Futures Trading Commission Approves Crypto Custody Service, Starts Production in Japan<p>

headline: Biden to Make $1.4 Trillion Add to Stimulus Bill
content: <p>WASHINGTON — President Biden will soon unveil his proposal to cut the nation’s debt as much as $1.4 trillion over the next 10 years and pass a $1.4 trillion plan that he unveiled last week on the South Carolina floor.<p><p>The spending package, dubbed the Biden Budget Plan, calls for $1.4 trillion in extra spending to help meet the nation’s obligations under the current budget agreement and extend emergency stimulus checks to millions of Americans in need, while also promising to bring in federal matching funds for businesses and families who need the most help. It would also replace most federal funding with $800 billion in new and used funds to help pay for essential programs.<p><p>“My intention is to create a system of generous government, so that people have more access to the resources they need, that there is more opportunity for people to invest and there are fewer jobs,” Biden said at a news conference Friday.<p><p>“We’re going to provide that opportunity for businesses and small businesses, for families and people of color and women and the young, for the middle class and women of color.”<p><p>He said he would introduce the spending plan on a floor conference call at the end of the week with Senate Democrats and Republicans to express their opposition to it. He did not address the proposals publicly.<p><p>A Senate spokesman said Biden’s proposal was not in the cards.<p>

headline: Binance Hires Former Tech Tech CEO
content: <p>Binance CEO Beshir Sunak has left his role at Binance Tech to help lead the next phase of the exchange’s new effort, Binance.<p><p>Also read: Binance’s Digital Yuan Offering Won’t Be for Crypto, Says New CEO<p>

headline: A Bitfinex Exchange Is Expanding Its Crypto Trust to Russia
content: <p>An exchange-traded fund (ETF) listing for crypto assets and derivatives has launched a digital currency trading platform.<p><p>According to an announcement Thursday, Bitfinex has purchased a license from the central bank of Russia and is providing the brokerage with digital currency trading capabilities, as reported by RIA Novosti. <p><p>The firm, which allows users to trade for a minimum of three months on its platform, is looking to increase its offerings, particularly in emerging markets, the firm said. <p><p>The new service will allow the user to buy and sell cryptocurrency without needing to hold any collateral on the platform, while also managing the exchange’s own collateral. <p><p>As of right now, Bitfinex’s exchange-traded fund is registered with the Bank of Russia and has a market cap of around $17 billion. The stock traded on the Bitfinex exchange in November alone is valued at around $8 billion. <p><p>In Russia, the country’s central bank has imposed strict restrictions and curbs on the trading of the stock since November 2020. The market regulator, the Bank of Russia, prohibited trading of cryptocurrencies through the exchange, which subsequently took on a virtual ownership stake in the crypto derivatives platform. <p><p>The exchange has since been shut down by state security authorities after an investigation into allegations of money laundering. <p>

headline: Gemini to Boost Demand for Its Digital Currency After SEC Investigation
content: <p>Gemini will continue using blockchain technology as part of its banking business, the firm announced Tuesday.<p><p>In an emailed statement, Gemini said, “We have been focused on making Gemini the best provider for the needs of our customers, and we’re excited about partnering with Blockchain Capital, the world’s largest digital asset custody provider.”<p><p>The Gemini Blockchain Capital Partnership brings together top tech firms and institutional customers to offer enterprise blockchain solutions to major financial institutions.<p><p>Read more: Gemini’s Financial Lender Eyes SEC Suit Over Crypto Derivatives Lawsuit<p>

headline: The US Dollar Has a Problem: Its Potential.
content: <p>The dollar has suffered a sharp downturn since its high of 4,200 against the euro and a subsequent contraction in its value against the euro since April 2019, when the European Central Bank began issuing its own currency. The euro has regained some of its strength.<p><p>On March 8, the dollar was trading at $0.9525, up 1.7% from $0.9650, and trading at $0.9435, up 0.6% from $0.9416.<p><p>The impact of the euro’s weakening has been substantial: The dollar gained 1.3% in value against the euro. This has been followed by a 1.9% decline in the dollar in value against the euro.<p><p>These results are consistent with other data. Inflation is currently near pre-pandemic levels and the euro’s impact is being felt globally. For example, in the U.S. the dollar was trading at 1.33% against the euro on March 3. At that time, the dollar was trading at $0.65 compared to $0.64, or 0.65%. The dollar “effect” has increased substantially over the last year to $0.73, equivalent to 1.5% growth. The situation on the global financial market was even worse. The dollar’s impact has been felt globally at its highest since October 2018.<p>

headline: Gemini Launches Exchange-Traded Fund, Compatible With Ethereum
content: <p>The Gemini Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) is a cross-asset mutual fund. The ETF is designed to create “alternative portfolios” that can be traded on a peer-to-peer basis, a Gemini spokesperson said.<p><p>The ETF is an early proof-of-concept product designed to provide an alternative, cross-asset to Ethereum investing without having to trust a fund manager. It also requires clients to invest their assets in a peer-to-peer system and have a limited number of assets in the portfolio.<p><p>The Gemini ETF will not be available to institutional investors until at least May 2021. In a press release Monday, the firm said it hopes to “focus on emerging markets, and accelerate our new products with a focus on providing superior asset diversification to our existing stablecoins and cryptocurrencies.”<p><p>Gemini was founded in 2014 by Andrei Tenke and Sergey Brin in Switzerland. The firm has grown into an early leader in the cryptocurrency space and is listed on Nasdaq, NYDIG, NYSE and others. The Gemini ETF is open to investors who are 18 years of age or older.<p><p>See also: Gemini Gets $8.7M from German Pension Planner Pension Funds, Ends Funding Rounds<p><p>The Gemini ETF is not designed for the general public. Only the Gemini Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF), a private security issued by Gemini Investment Management, is available to institutional investors in the U.S.

headline: Bitcoin Miner Miners Are Getting Help From a Coinbase, Coinbase’s Bitcoin Miner
content: <p>Coinbase is helping miners with cryptocurrency mining software by partnering with its largest miner vendor, the mining hardware manufacturer Celo.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Miner Celo Launches a Bitcoin Miner Production System in Japan<p>

headline: US Lawmakers May Consider A Rule Making It Possible for Corporations to Lie Withdraw Their Assets
content: <p>A federal judge in Manhattan has ruled that corporations may not be forced to reveal their assets under a new provision in the Foreign Coronavirus Control Act (FCA), known as “the Foreign Coronavirus Tax Credit.”<p><p>The law, which is meant to shield shareholders from being compelled to disclose their assets abroad, has been in the works for several years, but the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Tuesday that it would begin a review of the law soon.<p><p>The law’s author, Judge Katherine Forrest, appointed by a lower court in the Southern District of New York, is a senior justice, and she is expected to rule on the case on Thursday. The filing also noted that the FCA’s provisions were “broadly applicable” to jurisdictions not included in the current law, but that they’re “invalid” because they could not be used as a basis for determining whether the law was unconstitutional.<p><p>“It’s important that this law be clear that the United States does not have jurisdiction over jurisdictions that have an interest in concealing their assets,” the law says. “We think the current provision would apply to jurisdictions that are not included in the current law.”<p><p>However, the law also says that corporations are entitled to recover all losses from their overseas operations, including those arising from foreign interventions in their domestic affairs.<p>

headline: Keepercoin Launches ‘Sustainable’ Platform for Digital Assets
content: <p>Keepercoin (KD) is launching its stablecoin SACHR in a bid to build a decentralized digital asset platform that can handle multiple cryptocurrencies.<p><p>The KD platform will be available from Thursday to Friday from its stablecoin exchange, Kraken, and will be built on the SACHR blockchain.<p><p>The company announced Wednesday it has launched a protocol designed to allow KDL users to use its token on other protocols such as Binance’s Binance Cash. The protocol aims to enable the inclusion of fiat and crypto assets.<p><p>“We’re trying to provide a service that works on any protocol, from the U.S. dollar or to some other fiat currency,” said KDL CEO Fred Ehrsam.<p><p>The SACHR token is set to go live on Oct. 16 as part of KDL’s launch plans. This marks a milestone for the stablecoin since the company’s initial coin offering (ICO) in May 2017.<p><p>Keepercoin launched on Ethereum-based Ledger in October 2017. Ledger said it had “created an environment where users can easily launch, trade, invest and access digital assets using the KDL smart contract.”<p><p>It comes two weeks after Coinbase launched its own protocol and another in October.<p>

headline: PandaGo Gets $10M From Polychain Capital, Swiss Digital Currency Fund
content: <p>PandaGo (PandaGo) has secured a $10 million equity investment from Polychain Capital and Swiss Digital Currency Fund.<p>

headline: German inflation likely to accelerate in Q1
content: <p>BERLIN, Feb 18  - Federal Economy Minister Jan Jambon said on Thursday he expected household prices to increase in the second quarter despite the COVID-19 pandemic, but warned the need to stay vigilant in an increasingly difficult global economy.<p><p>“The government has to keep vigilance... in a period of extreme uncertainty. This means vigilance must be extended until mid-2021 to ensure the availability of affordable accommodation, transport, food, energy and other resources,” Jambon said in a news conference.<p><p>Jambon said the government would be aiming to meet its target of a 4.5% increase this year and 4.5% in 2021.<p><p>“There is a possibility that house prices could rise faster than expected,” he said.<p><p>“If the economy continues to slow down further, it would lead to the emergence of an economic crisis, and the government must remain vigilant as to how this situation develops,” he added.<p><p>The euro zone economy contracted by 1.1% in the 12 months to February, the biggest contraction since the 1970s, according to the General Administration for Euro zone data.<p><p>“We have not ruled out a long-term recession, but we still must maintain vigilance,” Jambon said. (Reporting by Michael Nienaber; Writing by Chris Reese; Editing by Christian Schmollinger)<p>

headline: Ethereum-Based Exchange Binance Raises $7.7M to Strengthen Security, Governance
content: <p>Binance Labs, a Swiss e-commerce startup founded in 2013, has announced it has raised a $7.7 million funding round, from Bitfinex, Huobi and Blockstack. <p><p>See also: Binance’s Binance-Founded Crypto Firm Rolls Out Security App After Institutional Investors Weren’t Buying<p>

headline: Binance Invests in Crypto Custodian Coinbase – Details
content: <p>Binance’s crypto custody platform Coinbase has begun a new funding round.<p><p>See also: Coinbase Adds Crypto Buyer Accounts With New Payments Gateway<p>

headline: R3’s Blockchain Integration App Tops $8M in Interest
content: <p>R3’s decentralized finance (DeFi) suite for mobile phones has raised a $8 million funding round, Bloomberg reports Friday.<p><p>The round was led by R3 Capital, SBI Capital and ErisX, according to Bloomberg. <p><p>R3 CEO and co-founder, Jeremy Allaire, said the “robust” DEX integration would bring more services to the mobile ecosystem, adding, “Mobile data is a huge thing.”<p>

headline: UPDATE 1-Japan sees GDP growth of 3.3% in Q1
content: <p>(Adds details)<p><p>TOKYO, March 16  - The country’s economy shrank 3.3% in the year to March 2020 from the previous year’s revised 3.1%, official data showed on Wednesday, as the central bank kept its support for the central bank’s bond-buying program and allowed market participants to continue buying their bonds.<p><p>The central bank said its next-quarter growth forecast for gross domestic product would be revised up to 3.4% in the third quarter, from the previous year’s revised 3.0%, reflecting economic activity at its strongest level since the Great Depression.<p><p>The government last year raised interest rates to 4.75% in exchange for its support for the bond market, which is backed by a basket of bond products and is considered a bellwether for economic activity. (Reporting by Enrico Dela Cruz; Editing by Ana Nicolaci da Costa)<p>

headline: Ripple Raises $15M in Token Sale for Institutional and Non-Businesses
content: <p>The Ripple blockchain payments firm is raising $15 million in an $18 million Series B funding round, raising its stake from U.S. VC firm Andreessen Horowitz (a16z).<p><p>Also read: Ripple’s First ‘Secret’ Token Sale Is Going to Be Rough<p>

headline: JPMorgan to Issue 10-Figure Deposits in 2021
content: <p>The JPMorgan CEO said Friday that he intends to issue 10-Figure deposit banknotes in 2021.<p><p>Read more: JPMorgan Joins Goldman Sachs on Crypto Derivatives Market <p>

headline: UPDATE 2-China's March consumer prices rise in March
content: <p>* March consumer prices rise 8.2% y/y, slower 8.1% yr/yr <p><p>* March consumer prices grow 3.1% y/y, slower 6.9% yr/yr<p><p>* March CPI rebounds 2.5% y/y, slower 2.1% yr/yr<p><p>* Consumer prices fall 4.2% y/y, slower 4.5% yr/yr<p><p>* March CPI rebounds 3.8% y/y, slower 3.5% yr/yr<p><p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s consumer price growth accelerated in March, driven by higher fuel prices, a data source said on Friday, as COVID-19 restrictions were eased and energy consumption picked up.<p><p>Consumer prices rose 8.2% year-on-year in March, the second consecutive monthly increase, in line with expectations.<p><p>The annual rate of economic growth accelerated to 9.2% from 6.9% a year earlier in March from 6.9% last year.<p><p>“The increase in fuel prices and the price of oil are two factors driving the increase in consumer price growth,” said Liu Guiqin, economist at Shanghai Shenzhen-based CIBC Capital.<p>

headline: Fidelity Digital Assets Now Raises $2.2M as BitGo Joins Market Cap Race
content: <p>Digital asset investors are starting to flock to the fintech giant’s publicly traded BitGo.<p><p>Fidelity Digital Assets, one of the world’s largest asset managers, confirmed Tuesday it has raised $2.2 million from a handful of early-stage investors for its digital asset offerings.<p><p>The announcement comes a day after the Fidelity board raised $8 million in a Series A round led by U.S. stock fund manager BlackRock and venture firm DBS Capital, as well as the initial round of funding from a handful of prominent institutional investors including Digital Currency Group.<p><p>“We’re confident that the future of digital assets will be driven by crypto companies,” a Fidelity executive told CoinDesk via email. “Fidelity has the capabilities to innovate and make sure the industry works for all its customers.”<p><p>The company’s digital asset portfolio has grown over the past few years to a size far larger than the size of BitGo’s. At $425 billion, BitGo is more than 90% owned by the U.S. government.<p><p>At the end of last year, Fidelity launched its first crypto exchange and digital exchange in Singapore. As of this writing, it operates more than $6.5 billion of digital assets, according to its website.<p>

headline: USDC and Bison Trails to Support China’s Infrastructure Initiative
content: <p>The U.S. National Development and Governmental Development Association (NDDA) announced Tuesday it is working with Chinese bison tribes to facilitate cross-border connectivity and build a bridge connecting northern China with its neighbor.<p><p>The partnership between Bison Trails in the Qingdao River Delta and the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) of the Chinese People’s Republic of China (CZ) will connect Bison Trails National Park, the highest point in northern Qingdao, with its counterpart in Hainan, Bison Trails National Park. The Bison Trails National Park lies about 14 miles north of Beijing.<p><p>The two tribes in the region collaborated in an agreement in July 2020 to build a bridge linking the two countries’ northern Xinjiang autonomous regions (the Xinjiang region), a goal the BZ has also emphasized, and a similar plan was inked in February 2020.<p><p>NDRC President Andrey Ostroukh told Reuters the agreement has been approved and the Bison Trails National Park will connect the two parks by way of the Chinese border.<p><p>“China’s new border policy aims to facilitate the integration of the Xinjiang and BZ tribes into the global fabric of China,” Ostroukh told Reuters. “The partnership is the bridge between BZ and Xinjiang, connecting them directly to the Yangtze River.”<p>

headline: A Look Back at Ethereum’s ‘Primeval’ Scam
content: <p>In 2017, Ethereum (ETH) was a runaway success story for developers, as many people assumed the network could become a reality. The original blockchain, the “Ethereum-powered network,” was based on the Ethereum blockchain. The Ethereum Foundation (the EF’s parent organization) made headlines by introducing a new version of the protocol to its foundation at the time, dubbed the “Ethereum-native consensus block.”<p><p>The initial block, originally scheduled for July 2020, came at the height of the “Ethereum-on-Ether boom” as the network quickly turned to building applications around ether. As of this writing, Ethereum is at the lowest point in Ethereum’s entire lifecycle.<p><p>Since then, Ethereum has grown exponentially. By 2021, more than 8.8 billion transactions (roughly 7 billion of them in the first two weeks of 2019) have been recorded on Ethereum’s network. The number of new nodes on Ethereum has grown by over 100 million.<p><p>In 2022, Ethereum became a global financial center with over $16 trillion in assets on the Ethereum blockchain. By early 2019, it had accumulated over $2 trillion in assets in transactions and total assets on the blockchain.<p>

headline: China's copper imports surge 4% in March
content: <p>BEIJING, March 12  - China’s copper imports surged 4% in March, the country’s statistics bureau said on Wednesday, with the largest jump in three months in shipments from abroad, according to Reuters’s IHS Markit data.<p><p>China imported 1.53 billion tonnes of the metal last month, up 6.1% from 1.73 billion tonnes in February.<p><p>China’s copper imports rose 4.8% to 9.98 billion tonnes in March, its highest monthly gain in almost two decades.<p><p>“China is on course to consume roughly 9.73 billion tonnes of the metal this year, which will accelerate to 9.9 billion tonnes this year,” IHS Markit economist Qianjun Chen told a seminar in Beijing.<p><p>A Reuters poll had said China’s shipments would peak at 1.30 billion tonnes in April.<p>

headline: Sterling and SIX Exchange Exchange Launching Blockchain-Based Services in Singapore
content: <p>Sterling and SIX Exchange, a crypto exchange, are launching a blockchain-based platform for the trading of derivatives on the Singapore SIX Exchange (SIX).<p><p>Read more: SEC Says Singapore SIX Exchange Can Offer US Dollar Traders ‘Trade Equity<p>

headline: JPMorgan Bank and Circle to Join Blockchain Governance Task Force
content: <p>JPMorgan Chase and Circle are participating in a blockchain governance task force tasked with helping banks and financial institutions understand what blockchain technology can do for the economy, a report by CoinDesk has revealed.<p><p>The New York-based bank, which is a member of the New York State Blockchain Alliance, will be led by Cambridge Blockchain and Cambridge Analytica, according to a release.<p><p>“The work we’re doing today demonstrates that banks have the right tools and are well positioned to address real-world problems,” said Cambridge Blockchain President George Shultz. “The work we’re doing right now demonstrates that banks can handle blockchain applications in a sustainable manner.”<p><p>Circle, a leading cryptocurrency exchange, is the latest recipient of the RIIA Task Force’s $2.5 million research and development grant, with participation in the group coming from JPMorgan and the Financial Conduct Authority of the United States.<p><p>The RIIA Task Force has already taken the lead in identifying what it would take for banks to become blockchain-based and how it could help the financial system transition towards a blockchain-based world. A blockchain-based world could be envisioned in ways that enable blockchain-based institutions to offer value to customers and businesses, according to the report.<p><p>Read more: JPMorgan, Circle to Join RIIA Task Force on Blockchain<p>

headline: Hedge Fund Partners With Cryptocurrency Research Firm Blockchain.com to Bring Crypto Privacy to Traditional Financial Institutions
content: <p>The leading hedge fund in crypto has entered into a new partnership with Blockchain.com and Blockchain.com Investments, announced Monday.<p><p>Read more: Blockchain.com Acquires R3’s SIX Fund Amid DeFi Scenarios<p>

headline: Crypto Exchange Bittrex Hires Former CFO to Grow Industry Lead
content: <p>Former Bittrex CEO Michael Pinedo has hired former CFO Matthew Munchak to help him manage the firm’s corporate operations, according to a company blog post.<p><p>Read more: Bittrex Is Building a Messaging System for US Institutions<p>

headline: Inflation in Asia’s Second-biggest Market Has Curved to a Record High
content: <p>SYDNEY, March 16  - The Australian dollar fell against the dollar last month as traders waited for rising global demand for goods, a sign that economic growth in Asia’s second largest market was curving in recent months.<p><p>Economists polled by Reuters had forecast inflation to edge up to 6.2% in March from 5.4% the previous month, a level not seen since the second quarter of last year.<p><p>For its full year 2019 figures, Australia was the only trading country to see inflation rising in the second half of last year, a sign it would rebound quickly once the pandemic returned.<p><p>“There is no reason that we should expect the inflation rate to increase in the first quarter,” said Tony Radek, senior economist at Rabobank.<p><p>“We expect inflation to go up slightly in the second quarter from the first quarter and then accelerate somewhat as the pandemic moves through the United States and Australia.”<p><p>Australia’s economy shrank by 2.7% in the second quarter of last year after shrinking by 4.5% in the first quarter of 2020, largely due to lower fuel prices.<p><p>“Looking ahead, inflation is forecast to be in line with expectations of the last quarter and above our expectation as of today,” Radek added.<p>

headline: The Problem With Bitcoin
content: <p>When it comes to bitcoin and blockchain tech, investors and technologists often disagree. There are multiple sides to every coin’s origin story, and it’s easy to blame those involved in the debates for being too skeptical. But while Bitcoin and blockchain tech are not the same, it’s fair to say they share a common thread.<p><p>At the core of the Bitcoin and blockchain debates are two fundamental principles: 1) the blockchain is a technology, and 2) it should be used in a decentralized way. Both principles are fundamentally incompatible – as is common knowledge among blockchain advocates.<p><p>There is no single, immutable protocol that will always be the best, stable and secure way to build the internet of value. Each blockchain has its inherent limitations, including its own unique characteristics.<p><p>One of the problems with Bitcoin and blockchain tech is that while there is a consensus mechanism, every block is controlled by an independent miner. Bitcoin allows miners to mine independently, meaning that miners are still free to choose whether to participate in or not. Blockchains in general are designed to be very robust, and blockchains that have multiple miners are designed to have very limited bandwidth. To make their nodes more robust, they require the miner to be independent to the network, which creates the problem that some blockchains require an individual or group to be more capable.<p>

headline: The Blockchain Firms That Led America’s Central Bank Now Have to Pay Attention to Privacy
content: <p>The government is inching closer to establishing a single regulatory framework for cryptocurrencies and its regulatory tools.<p><p>The Federal Reserve on Wednesday approved an initial coin offering (ICO) framework that would govern the banking, securities and digital assets that can be used by banks, exchanges, regulators and other entities.<p><p>It’s a shift from a more focused effort at the central bank’s public policy meetings and events on Wall Street and in Washington to an embrace of blockchain and decentralized finance (DeFi).<p><p>Read more: DeFi Revamped by Blockchain Lawsuit Against U.S. Bank<p><p>The framework aims to “prevent banks, financial institutions, and other entities from circumventing the financial oversight provided by the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) or any other federal entity,” according to an announcement Thursday.<p><p>“The regulatory framework of the DeFi ecosystem will strengthen the regulatory framework of banking, securities and digital assets in the U.S.,” the Fed said.<p><p>Read more: How Blockchain Can Fight Fake News<p>

headline: Gemini Exchange Taps Nasdaq, Nasdaq-Booming XRP to Make Crypto Derivatives More Effective
content: <p>Cryptocurrency trading platform Gemini has tapped the U.S. exchange operator’s (NASDAQ) trading desk for new liquidity.<p><p>See also: Nasdaq to Accept $10M in Bitcoin, Ether and Ripple Tokens as Bitcoin Derivatives<p>

headline: Visa Buys $2.3B in Bitcoin, Ether and Cash for Crypto Compliance
content: <p>Cryptocurrency payments provider Visa announced Friday it is acquiring bitcoin futures exchange Gemini and converting it to cash.<p><p>Read more: Visa to Launch Crypto Lending Services With New ‘Prime Money’ System<p>

headline: Growth in the United States is Flourishing as COVID-19 Threatens to Crush Business
content: <p>WASHINGTON, March 12  - Inflationary pressures in the United States, driven by the pandemic and a renewed surge in COVID-19 infections, have intensified as a renewed assault on workers in the coronavirus-ravaged economy and a renewed bout of COVID-19 infections have boosted business optimism and job growth.<p><p>Businesses in the United States have made small gains this year, outpacing their European counterparts, who have seen a 5% increase in growth, according to research released on Tuesday by the University of Michigan.<p><p>That could be offset by a sharp decline in sales and employment in many sectors, though the decline is not as strong as in recent weeks, the data showed.<p><p>Growth in those services, however, has grown strongly, rising 4.6% in January to more than 4 million businesses, while the share of manufacturing, the largest service industry, that is still growing is down 12%. (Reporting by Jamie McGeever and Paul Simao; editing by William Mallard)<p>

headline: UPDATE 2-Brazil's economy grows more than expected in first three months of 2020
content: <p>(Adds details)<p><p>BRASILIA, Jan 19  - Brazil’s economy contracted in the third quarter as a record-low output from exports, a survey showed on Thursday, and has been revised down to the first three months of 2021 from earlier in the year to boost economic growth, as domestic demand from the coronavirus pandemic has helped the government achieve its ambitious 2021 budget.<p><p>The General Administration of Customs and Border Protection said it could not make a final determination on the second quarter results until the third quarter, after a review last week that included the release of a preliminary data snapshot.<p><p>The report showed gross domestic product rose 3.7% in the December quarter, after dropping 4.1% in the previous quarter, and that Brazil’s exports led the way with a third-quarter GDP increase of 6.5%, its highest since the 2020 financial crisis hit the economy in the summer of 2020.<p><p>In the first three months of 2021, gross domestic product grew 1.9% from the third quarter, while imports increased 6.5%.<p><p>Output from services and capital goods rose 5.6% and 4.6%, respectively, and services grew 1.7% and 3.7%, respectively, in the third quarter.<p><p>Total imports and exports, however, rose 7.1% and 2.9%, respectively.<p>

headline: Aquaculture Firm Expands to South America
content: <p>The company announced Thursday it has expanded its trading footprint to Argentina, Colombia and Venezuela, according to an announcement shared with CoinDesk.<p><p>The company, based in Los Angeles, said in a press release it would “continue expanding” its business in Argentina. The company will continue expanding its operations in Latin America and the Caribbean.<p><p>“The Buenos Aires region has witnessed the most successful coronavirus vaccine rollout in decades,” the firm said. “With a unique vaccine distribution arrangement with the region’s leading pharmaceutical provider Panavision, and with international logistics partners the company continues to build its network of supply chains, this expansion serves to further accelerate our expansion into Latin America.”<p><p>It was first reported in February that Terra is expanding its Latin American operations to include Mexico, Costa Rica, Colombia and Venezuela.<p><p>“This expansion will help Terra continue expanding our network of supply chains,” the firm said in the release. “Regional economic opportunities and the ability to expand our network of international logistics solutions will help us to accelerate our expansion into Latin America.”<p><p>On Tuesday, Argentine Prime Minister Elena Martino called on Latin American countries to help stem the spread of the coronavirus.<p><p>The Latin American country already has a vaccine distribution agreement with Panavision, though there has been no vaccine rollout and a spike in cases in recent months.<p>

headline: Seychelles says it holds 'highly inappropriate' view on financial sector lending
content: <p>* Seychelles says it accepts economic outlook outlook “highly relevant” <p><p>* Opinion: Seychelles hopes monetary policy will stabilise<p><p>* Seychelles expects more fiscal support in coming months<p><p>LIMA, Feb 17  - The outlook for the Suez Canal as it closes to normalisation in 2021 depends heavily on whether it can support a recovery in economic activity, the country’s finance minister said on Tuesday.<p><p>“The market expectation that a recovery of the economy would be sustained is extremely important,” said Sébastien Dela Cruz, head of Suez Canal planning.<p><p>The central bank will hold interest rates at their current level until at least 2021, when it will take action to support the $4 trillion-plus Suez Canal project, which is due to close in 2022.<p><p>Dela Cruz had previously suggested it was doubtful economic activity would recover fully before the end of this year and urged central bank support of the project to stabilise.<p><p>“We don’t think that a significant level of monetary support, especially when the situation has improved, will be required,” he said, referring to a “highly inappropriate view” on the economic outlook.<p>

headline: Binance’s R2 Crypto Fund Raises $17.5M to Power Its ‘Superior Crypto’ Fund
content: <p>Blockchain firm Binance has completed a $17.5 million Series A funding round led by U.S.-based investment firm Digital Currency Group.<p><p>See also: Binance Backs $2.7M Funding Rounds in Three Months With TokenShares<p>

headline: Apex Bank Puts $1B Into Blockchain Solutions
content: <p>Apex Bank is now buying blockchain infrastructure firm ConsenSys and blockchain startup Circle.<p><p>See also: Oracle Acquires Bitcoin Venture Firm Circle With $15M Investment<p>

headline: The Latest on ‘Black Monday’ ‘Seed’ Launch: Blockchain.com
content: <p>Blockchain.com, the latest venture platform to be launched on Black Monday, is making its way from one site to the next using a different blockchain protocol than Bitcoin’s mainnet.<p><p>The new platform, called “Black Monday,” seeks to address the concerns around Black Tuesday’s “Black Thursday” event, and is focused on facilitating users to participate in Black Thursday transactions. As well as providing a “Black Friday” window, the platform provides a way for Black Friday sellers to participate in Black Friday sales, as well as offering an extension for Black Monday transactions.<p><p>The company said Tuesday it launched Black Monday with the intention to create a “Black Tuesday for Business on Chain” where Black Friday is an inclusive event, catering to Black businesses, while Black Tuesday events are usually the last and last thing customers and vendors want.<p><p>“Chainalysis is one of the few institutions with an institutional understanding of blockchain,” CEO of Blockchain.com Richard Lewis said in a press release. “Chainalysis understands that blockchain cannot be viewed as an immutable digital currency,” Lewis said.<p><p>See also: ‘Black Monday’ Is a Black Friday for Everyone<p><p>“We are pleased to announce the launch of the latest version of Chainalysis Chain.1 on Blockchain.com, as well as Chainalysis’s other Blockchain products including the Black Friday extension.”<p>

headline: Ethereum Startup Pitches A Hand-Backed Blockchain for Staking Rewards
content: <p>PayPal is developing a blockchain for staking rewards.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin’s Lightning Network Will Allow Users to Earn Staking Rewards Over 2 Years<p>

headline: Hedge Fund Manager Rains Loss in DeFi Blockchain Binance IPO
content: <p>Binance and Binance Capital Ltd. raised nearly $200 million in a private listing Wednesday to raise $1 billion for its latest venture, an initial coin offering (ICO) protocol focused on decentralized finance (DeFi).<p><p>Rival blockchain-focused asset manager R3 Capital and bitcoin fintech startup CoinShares filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and filed for Chapter 11 exemption.<p><p>“We’re extremely proud to take on this opportunity to become a part of a global venture capital and crypto ecosystem which will help drive the growth of our business and the evolution of DeFi,” said R3 CEO Brian Armstrong. “We look forward to continuing to build a stronger and more integrated ecosystem for investors, regulators and investors alike.”<p>

headline: Mining firm Bitmain to Offer Ethereum-Based Services
content: <p>Mining giant Bitmain is to offer a service that lets users hold bitcoin in a vault while offline, in what will be the first such move by a major blockchain firm.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin’s Stablecoin Doubles as New York State Floods With Crypto Buyers<p>

headline: Inflation in Russia and China in 2020-21, the gap shrinking
content: <p>MOSCOW, Feb 17  - Russia and China’s inflation data fell slightly in 2020, while in 2021 inflation in Russia and China increased by 0.9% and 0.3% respectively, the Ministry of Economy and Industry said on Wednesday.<p><p>The ministry attributed this to a fall in prices for agricultural products such as corn and soybeans. (Reporting by Pavel Korsunski; Writing by Andrei Khalip; Editing by Larry King)<p>

headline: German factory output falls by 4.1% to its lowest level in almost two years
content: <p>BERLIN  - German factory output fell by 4.1% in January from the previous month, the Federal Statistics Office said on Thursday, as the sharp drop in COVID-19 infections eased.<p><p>Unemployment in December jumped to its highest level in more than two years as Europe’s biggest economy struggled to contain the spread of the virus.<p><p>Output rose 4.1% in the three months to January 2020, the office said, although its first monthly decline since March 2020.<p><p>In January, output in industrial production contracted 0.4% from the same month a year earlier. (Reporting by Matthias Eichlin; Editing by Ana Nicolaci da Costa)<p>

headline: HONDA’s DeFi Startups Will Get Tokenized and Roll Out Tokenized Ledger Applications
content: <p>The company behind blockchain decentralized finance (DeFi) app DAI has launched a tokenized Ledger application designed for tokenization.<p><p>Read more: DAI Adds Real-Time Trading with EOS Token<p>

headline: Ripple’s Crypto Mining Firm Expands to Brazil, Says New Service to the Central American Country
content: <p>LAS VEGAS, March 12  - Ripple’s cryptocurrency mining business in Brazil expanded to 13,300 employees in March, expanding from 14,000 the previous month and doubling the firm’s global operations in Brazil, the company said on Wednesday.<p><p>The company said the new expansion brought it more than 5,000 new hires for the first three months of the year and is expected to grow to 20,000 by the end of the year.<p><p>The firm added that as the U.S. presidential election approaches, it will provide mining support to the country.<p><p>“We’re excited about our plans to expand into Brazil,” Ripple co-founder Changpeng Zhao said in a statement. “Our business in Brazil is a testament to the strength of cryptocurrency mining in Latin America and around the world.”<p><p>Read more: Ripple CEO Says Central American Region Is Driving Blockchain Innovation<p><p>Co-founder Changpeng Zhao said the company had “many more mining facilities to serve” the Brazilian market. He was referring to the U.S. mining operation that recently closed for good after serving as an intermediary for the U.S. government’s efforts to monitor cryptocurrency activity.<p>

headline: Binance Now Lists Fiat-Backed Tokens, Crypto-Backed Stocks in New Exchange
content: <p>Binance says it has launched a new crypto trading platform – “CoinDesk” – after initially allowing users to trade the tokens on CoinDesk.com and CoinDesk.com Plus.<p><p>“CoinDesk’s mission is to provide global news and analysis about the blockchain economy, which includes investing, investing, lending and trading in cryptocurrency and other assets, as well as providing solutions tailored to individual investor needs,” the exchange said in a blog post shared with CoinDesk via an intermediary. <p><p>CoinDesk.com offers the platform, which has over 60 million users, for trading of fiat and cryptocurrencies in a variety of markets. <p><p>CoinDesk.com Plus was launched on March 27, 2020. The startup plans to launch CoinDesk.com plus its own products as the platform expands to more than 100 million users. <p>

headline: The UK’s $964.7B Bitcoin Investment Would Pay Out More in 2020 Than Previously Thought
content: <p>LONDON, Feb 2  - The size and importance of bitcoin may be weighing heavily on the Treasury as firms face a potentially large and unwieldy portfolio of assets, according to a report by the British Chambers of Commerce.<p><p>According to a report published on Monday, Britain’s total reserves for bitcoin have fallen by 2.5% in 2020, from 1.7% in 2019, the report said.<p><p>The report said the size of its bitcoin portfolio would likely come under scrutiny due to high costs, regulatory uncertainty and other factors, including the risk to the national economy and potentially a surge in debt.<p><p>The report said the size of its bitcoin assets had been largely unaffected by the impact of the coronavirus pandemic. (Reporting by David Milliken Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p>

headline: Srinivasan says government will continue its roll-out of new electric vehicles
content: <p>MUMBAI, Jan 7  - India’s government will continue its roll-out of new electric vehicles by 2021, Srinivasan said on Sunday, pointing out that the government had “always been concerned” about the use of battery technology to power its roads, highways, electricity generation and water supply.<p><p>“When it comes to batteries, they are not something we have had a lot of experience with. It is just the nature of the work to be involved in the creation of technology and we are talking about this regularly,” Srinivasan told The Hindu newspaper after a meeting with state ministers.<p><p>“The government is looking for ways to move faster, and that involves using new energy sources. It’s not going to just make the roads more efficient, it’s going to make it more accessible,” he said. (Reporting by Shivani Singh and Shivani Singh; Editing by Madeline Chambers)<p>

headline: The Crypto Industry’s DeFi Boom Has a Complex Twist
content: <p>Decentralized finance (DeFi) is a hybrid of digital asset and decentralized finance (DeFi).<p><p>Some of the most popular cryptocurrencies on the planet are bitcoin (BTC) and ether (ETH). However, decentralized finance (DeFi) has the advantage of being decentralized and having many different token holders: each has a different share of the DeFi ecosystem.<p><p>Decentralized trading platform XRP will become XRP’s primary DeFi platform, and will leverage XRP’s liquidity pool to manage its share of DeFi projects. XRP’s token pool has expanded from about 200 million to over 60 million coins in three months.<p><p>Also see: Bitcoin’s Second Bitcoin Fund Is Now Approved Through the XRP Investment Platform<p><p>Decentralized trading platform Gemini has acquired a stake in XRP from Coinbase. Gemini is the world’s second-largest DeFi platform, behind XRP and the Ethereum network. Gemini is the primary platform that holds XRP’s liquidity and has a stake in all its projects.<p><p>“The way I see it is the DeFi space has matured dramatically over the last few years, and there has been a tremendous amount of growth of interest and participation,” Coinbase co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey said of the crypto market.<p><p>Read more: Ethereum Debuts SEC Suit Against XRP Giant<p>

headline: The Blockchain’s New York City Charter Has a Lot to Do With Bitcoin
content: <p>A new law in the U.S. would make it easier for developers to build decentralized applications (dapps) using blockchain technology, but that won’t require the borough’s public school system to have a bitcoin license. <p><p>Also read: Coinbase-Owned Blockchain Bank Is Developing a New ‘Bitcoin Bank’<p>

headline: Binance Labs Execs List on US Securities Exchange
content: <p>Binance Labs has released a list of the top 10 listed cryptocurrency exchanges on the New York Stock Exchange.<p><p>See also: Binance Labs, Crypto Exchange Delays Listings to Meet Criticism From Investors<p>

headline: JPMorgan Puts $100M Fund into Bitcoin, Litecoin
content: <p>Bank of America Merrill Lynch has tapped JPMorgan’s $100 million fund for a cryptocurrency lending initiative and investments that support blockchain-based asset technology and applications.<p><p>Also read: What Is a Bitcoin Lending Company and How Do They Work?<p>

headline: Wu-Hao Chen: Why We Care About China’s Digital Yuan
content: <p>China’s digital currency boom is on a downward trajectory.<p><p>On April 21, a report published by China Digital Currency and Trust, an independent advisory panel, declared that the yuan’s value has increased by more than three-fold in 2020 alone. <p><p>That followed two-and-a-half months when the value of the digital currency surged 1.8%, compared with 1.5% growth the previous month. That was followed in May with a 1.4% gain.<p><p>Since then, the value of the digital currency has dropped less than half. And, the yuan’s depreciation accelerated in the first quarter of 2020, which saw its first official devaluation since June 2020.<p><p>According to the report, China saw significant increases in foreign currency reserves in late 2021 and early 2022 as a result. <p><p>See also: US-Listed Crypto Exchange Huobi Launches Out of China<p><p>That means China’s current exchange rate, the yuan’s reserve currency, has gone from zero to roughly 0.0058 yuan per T today. <p><p>The value of the digital currency is also up, up 2.2% in the first quarter and up 21.5% in the fourth quarter. <p>

headline: Swiss Investment Firm Pantera Invests $2.5M in Nasdaq-Backed Digital Asset Project
content: <p>Pantera Capital and its Pantera Digital Asset Initiative (Pantera Daimler AG), a leading digital asset investment firm, have reportedly made an investment in Nasdaq-backed digital asset startup Nasdaq-Backed.<p><p>Read more: Nasdaq-Backed Ledger Institutional Liquidity Firm Opens $2.5M Funding Round<p>

headline: W3C Cite: New Agreement on ‘Unfortunate Transactions’ Will Drive Crypto Firms Back to the Stone Age
content: <p>The new U.S. government’s proposed new anti-money laundering (AML) standards are coming into force this week, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) confirmed on Wednesday.<p><p>The new guidance means “money services providers” will no longer be able to use the term “money services” in conjunction with other terms that could potentially conflict with federal or state law, the agency said in a statement. It adds:<p><p>Read more: U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission, SEC Hires Tech Pros to Prove Bitcoin Exchanges Can ‘Deal’ With Money<p><p>Read more: SEC Sees Ripple as a Threat to Money Laundering Compliance<p><p>The regulation, which was unanimously approved by the Senate Banking Committee in October, will help make the banking industry “more compliant in compliance with regulations,” said Senator Ron Wyden (D, Washington). “I have been in the banking sector for 21 years.”<p><p>The SEC said the proposed standards would help ensure anti-money laundering (AML) is “prepared, effective and enforceable,” while “unfortunate transactions” will attract “more attention.”<p>

headline: How Coinbase Raises $8.7M to Put Ethereum on the Blockchain
content: <p>Coinbase’s latest round, launched in February 2021, was a huge success. The startup raised over $8.7 million in a seed round led by Coinfoundor, Coinstars Ventures and others.<p><p>In a blog post published Tuesday, Coinbase said the $8.7 million funding will allow the firm to develop a new product, allowing its customers to instantly buy and sell ether directly to their bank accounts.<p><p>“This first-generation innovation gives the enterprise investor and crypto ecosystem access to an unprecedented digital investment opportunity in the most secure and transparent way,” Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong wrote in the blog post. “The company is proud to support our team with the unprecedented ability to seamlessly invest in enterprise-grade crypto products.”<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Becomes the First American Blockchain Group to Accept Bitcoin’s Signature Hash as a Trust Token<p><p>Coinbase was founded in 2003 to help entrepreneurs use digital currencies to invest in their businesses and services. The bank has since sold more than $6 billion in assets.<p><p>Armstrong said the company’s technology, “Comet,” enables crypto businesses to instantly buy and sell ether directly to their bank accounts.<p>

headline: Gemini Exchange Launches Blockchain-Based Bitcoin Trust
content: <p>Gemini, the crypto exchange that holds the U.S. dollar as its primary asset, has released a new blockchain-based bitcoin trust.<p><p>The Gemini Trust, announced Friday, enables Gemini customers to invest in, invest in and invest in bitcoin. The company said it was a key part of the Gemini Bitcoin Trust initiative that launched in 2017 and became the basis of the Bitcoin Trust Token, a new type of digital asset that will be issued on Gemini’s behalf and used by fiat or bitcoin-based businesses.<p><p>The Gemini Trust is designed to scale as it continues to improve on its mission, Gemini CEO Dan Schulman said during a Bitcoin Foundation panel last month.<p><p>The Gemini Trust, which is owned by the Gemini Foundation, also incorporates Ethereum and Stellar, the Stellar and Gemini Bitcoin Trust pairs.<p><p>Read more: Gemini’s Crypto Custody Platform Lets You Trust With Ethereum or Bitcoin<p><p>“Our trust service will be a multi-signature system, meaning that every one of our clients has a unique, identifiable digital signature,” Schulman said in a statement. “Our trust service will also enable us to scale our Bitcoin Trust Token portfolio to reflect unique use cases.”<p>

headline: The CoinDesk Crypto Podcast Is Coming to a House on the Blockchain
content: <p>Announced Wednesday, CoinDesk Crypto is teaming with a developer and privacy advocate to bring the cryptocurrency community closer together.<p><p>CoinDesk Crypto’s co-founders Daniel Horowitz and Nick Bostic will be taking a seat, and the two will be joined by a blockchain expert who will help design a project in the space.<p><p>The two discussed the potential for blockchain-based solutions to meet the needs of the current crypto ecosystem. Horowitz said the most fundamental innovation being made in blockchain-based privacy is a secure, transparent way to track and track transactions and transactions history without being in the middle of a transaction book.<p><p>Read more: Crypto’s Biggest Story Ever: Why Investors Aren’t Spending Their Money<p><p>Bostic pointed out that traditional protocols that are regulated and controlled by governments are not open-sourced, meaning they are controlled by third parties. That means, for example, the U.S. Secret Service may be able to trace an individual’s IP address or use a blockchain to trace a foreign hacker’s IP address.<p><p>However, blockchain-based privacy solutions do not have this inherent capability of privacy being tracked by third parties. They do, however, have a certain inherent privacy value that the public can only be certain is held by third parties.<p>

headline: Cannabis Investor Lists New CEO, Chief Blockchain Strategist With $425M in Funds
content: <p>The Canadian firm behind cannabis-focused cryptocurrency investment firm Cannondale Ventures has hired former U.S. venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz’s Catherine Drexler as its new chief blockchain strategist.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, Drexler joins Cannondale Ventures’ new board of directors following a four-year stint at investment bank Capital IQ. Drexler will join Cannondale’s board of directors following its strategic deliberations and ongoing research into the firm’s regulatory compliance and legal affairs, Cannondale wrote.<p><p>Read more: The Bitcoin Startup That Will Roll Out Bitcoin ATM Services: This VC<p><p>“Cannondale’s experience at VC investment banks in the space is invaluable in establishing an unparalleled blockchain expertise to accelerate the evolution of cannabis law and regulation,” Cannondale wrote in a press release.<p><p>Drexler said the new hire of Drexler was a move in the right direction because she will work closely with senior legal officials in the industry as they assess cannabis business operations and operational needs.<p><p>“As a former U.S. venture capital firm, we see a profound shift in our approach to the regulatory and legal world as a result of the introduction of blockchain-based protocols into our operations,” Drexler said in a statement.<p>

headline: Income from Higher Taxes May Help Support Poorly-Educated Workers in the U.S.
