content: <p>WASHINGTON — The U.S. Internal Revenue Service has issued guidance to help low- and middle-income workers receive subsidies to help them afford their own health care and work harder.<p><p>The Internal Revenue Service said Thursday the guidance will help individuals and businesses in the states and the District of Columbia, with guidance on how to pay taxes on income from higher taxes, higher taxes on businesses, higher taxes on non-profit organizations, and higher taxes on corporations, which are seen as a key part of the recovery in the labor market. <p><p>The rules, a partial list of amendments that were introduced in the Senate and signed by President Donald J. Trump on Dec. 12, will help the poor get the help they need, the agency said in a statement. <p><p>The guidance covers businesses, but the details of the changes won’t be available until Dec. 15. The guidance will not apply to individuals. <p><p>The new guidance won’t affect corporations, which receive no federal tax relief from the Internal Revenue Service. <p><p>In an effort to expand market access to the work force, the agency added another provision to the plan that would provide tax relief to help low-income Americans get back to work. <p>

headline: Mt. Gox Exec Warns Lawmakers in Push to Roll Out Blockchain-Based Bitcoin Payment Services
content: <p>Authorities in the U.S. and British Virgin Islands have told cryptocurrency startups to use “one blockchain solution” to support bitcoin payments.<p><p>According to an email sent to customers Thursday to all Coinbase customers, the firm’s Coinbase Blockchain Payments system now supports fiat currency and bitcoin in addition to traditional forms of settlement.<p><p>“This will make crypto payments more accessible and accessible to all users with PayPal in particular,” the email reads.<p><p>The company will also help merchants, exchanges and financial institutions, in particular those dealing with bitcoin, gain the ability to accept payments using its Coinbase Blockchain Payments.<p><p>“Our solution for users will make it more convenient and cheaper for businesses and users to accept bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies using our Blockchain Payments and other crypto products,” Coinbase CEO Dan Schulman wrote.<p><p>Schulman is known for his “bitcoin gold” coins, the white coin of the cryptocurrency space that was previously described as the unicorn unicorn.<p><p>The firm has also built a blockchain platform and distributed the protocol to several hundred crypto firms including Coinbase Ventures and Coinbase Digital Currency Group.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Exec Says U.S. Tax Credits Could Be Used for Bitcoin Investments<p>

headline: Hedge fund manager Guggenheim Funds and Tudor Group Investing Team Join Ripple’s Round for a Crypto-Based Asset Product
content: <p>The Guggenheim Funds – a New York-based digital asset management firm focused on blockchain-based financial instruments – announced Wednesday that they have joined Ripple’s initial public offering (IPO) as co-chairs of a blockchain-based derivatives product that will offer its users the ability to trade crypto-backed securities and services.<p><p>Read more: US Exchange Said to Be Starting Work on a Crypto Derivatives Fund<p>

headline: Crypto Asset Custodian BitGo Plans to Bring Crypto Staking Service to the US
content: <p>BitGo is to offer a “multi-sided custody” model for crypto assets on its website.<p><p>Also read: What Are Cryptocurrency Staking and Why Do I Care?<p>

headline: PayPal’s BitTorrent Platform Gets Boost From ‘Big Eyes’ in US
content: <p>PayPal’s BitTorrent platform has received a boost from “Big Eyes” – the largest cryptocurrency trading venue in the world.<p><p>See also: PayPal’s US Expansion Goes Live Early Next Week<p>

headline: Visa’s DeFi Accelerator Is Building Out Its ‘Digital Visa’ in the US
content: <p>Crypto exchange Visa’s crypto exchange has launched a pilot program that aims to unlock funds at participating crypto exchange issuers.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Custodian Expands to South Africa<p>

headline: Seychelles imports up to 110 bln tonnes of steel a day - customs
content: <p>Seychelles is the world’s top importer of iron ore, with imports of the steel product hitting 110 billion tonnes this year.<p><p>In 2019, exports to China totalled 117.2 billion tonnes, customs said, down 13% from 114.8 billion tonnes in 2020 but up from 114.2 billion tonnes in 2019.<p><p>“Steel importers have been successful in meeting the Chinese demand,” a customs spokesman told Reuters on Thursday, adding that customs had been able to increase the volume of imported goods in 2019 and to meet new quotas due to higher shipments.<p><p>China is home to some of the world’s largest iron ore importers, such as Australia, Indonesia and Vietnam, but it has so far been a major buyer of Chinese steel. (Reporting by Gwladys Fouche in Manila; editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p>

headline: CME Exchange Has Now DeFi-Friendly Tradeable Crypto Staked Rewards in UK
content: <p>Digital asset broker CME has become the first U.K. exchange to offer a cryptocurrency rewards scheme that rewards users for minting digital assets.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the exchange also announced it has become a member of the British Bitcoin Foundation. <p><p>Read more: CME’s BVI Exchange Launches New Rewards Program for Crypto Firms<p><p>For the first time, users of crypto-backed cryptocurrencies will receive an incentive on the transaction fee, CME CEO Chris Powell told CoinDesk in a live Q&A on Tuesday. The rewards will be sent to “users who are currently using a crypto asset to earn crypto rewards on the CME wallet.”<p><p>Powell said the rewards are “highly competitive” with other crypto offerings, but there are “several reasons” why they’re not currently available to crypto traders.<p><p>“We are now the first U.K. exchange to offer a crypto reward program,” Powell said. “We are working to bring the benefits of a cryptocurrency wallet to all users, which will allow users to earn crypto rewards in other fiat currencies.”<p>

headline: US Banking Giant BanCo Eyes New Digital Dollar With New ‘Money Service’
content: <p>A new payment system based on bitcoin will be coming to the U.S. retail market sometime in the fourth quarter, a banking giant announced Monday.<p><p>CoinDesk reached out to a number of retailers and asked if they would provide the latest version of their debit card for the new system. Coinbase spokesperson Brad Garlinghouse declined to comment on the latest rollout, but confirmed to CoinDesk that Coinbase will be working with several U.S. merchants to integrate bitcoin in their payment system.<p><p>The new system will rely on the CoinSwap debit card, the U.S. equivalent of the Visa Debit Card, which is being rolled out by the bank as an alternative for merchants to accept fiat currencies. Coinbase said in an announcement that it has been working with DeFi startups for some time to create a payment platform.<p><p>As it stands, Coinbase has been building out a debit card for merchants that uses bitcoin (BTC), one of the few accepted by roughly 30 percent of retail sales. The bank announced it was launching the card this week.<p><p>For its part, BanCo has said that it is looking into “the possibility of integrating crypto in a seamless manner into its system.”<p><p>In March, the bank revealed that it was looking into integrating USDT with a bitcoin debit card in hopes of creating an “instant payment option” on the bank’s debit card.<p>

headline: Dividend Manager Coinbase Execs First Bitcoin Cash Product Launch on Blockchain
content: <p>Crypto custodian Coinbase has launched its first bitcoin dividend product on the blockchain – a product that will allow customers to convert their cash into bitcoin directly.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Buys Bitcoin as Crypto Staking Options, Regulator Approves<p>

headline: Circling the ‘Ecosystem’ of Blockchain Tech
content: <p>The Ethereum-focused venture capital firm Digital Currency Group is planning to create a “ether-based ecosystem.”<p><p>The company is proposing a decentralized finance (DeFi) network that uses the Ethereum blockchain to create “smart contracts” that can be operated on Ethereum or a similar network (the “Ethereum Proof-of-Stake” blockchain).<p><p>The network will be made up of nodes from different blockchains including Ethereum (SegWit), BlockFi (EOS), Parity (Permissioned Execution Environment), MakerDAO (MinerDAO), Stellar (Stellar Network), MakerDAO’s Proof of Stake, the tokenization of existing token assets and other smart contract features.<p><p>The new product will focus on Ethereum-based DeFi protocols such as dApps (dApps for Ethereum), self-executing smart contract (SEO) protocols such as tokenized DeFi applications (EIPO), decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs), digital asset infrastructure (DAI) protocols such as Ledger and Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).<p><p>The main design goal for the “Ethereum Proof-of-Stake” network will be to be able to store both Ethereum and Ethereum-based assets within the ecosystem, so they can be operated in the same way.<p>

headline: S.Korea c.bank holds rates unchanged at record low
content: <p>SEOUL, Feb 11  - South Korea’s central bank kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged at its record low on Friday, signalling progress towards a policy easing program.<p><p>The policy rate for the banking system has remained stable since late 2017, underpinned by strong economic growth and limited inflation. (Reporting by Ri Sung-hee; Editing by David Evans)<p>

headline: Bitcoin Core Team Up With Digital Currency Service Provider NFTs
content: <p>Digital currency services firm NFTs, which are built atop bitcoin’s block rewards, have taken to the world stage to provide more of a payment gateway and infrastructure solution.<p><p>The new partnerships are in line with several similar efforts by CoinDesk’s Bitcoin Core team. In a recent article, Bitcoin Core contributor Michael Leibowitz outlined what each team is doing in terms of integrating bitcoin’s block rewards onto its blockchain:<p><p>In an upcoming blog post, Leibowitz, along with former Coinbase employee Alex Guggenheim, will explore the challenges facing digital currency startups and highlight the need for a solution that utilizes bitcoin’s “minimalization” approach.<p><p>“It’s nice to have a couple of blockchain startups that can offer the same functionality to users, but they can also offer the same capabilities to their users,” Leibowitz said. “In this case, the users can offer bitcoin as a collateral and get to spend that bitcoin.”<p><p>See also: CoinDesk’s Coinbase Chief Investor Talks About Digital Currency, Bitcoin’s Lightning Network <p><p>In addition to providing a bitcoin payment gateway, the new partnership is a logical fit for bitcoin’s governance model, said Alistair Matici, CoinDesk’s senior policy analyst.<p>

headline: UPDATE 1-China's COVID-19 relief money lifts imports in January
content: <p>(Adds details, chart)<p><p>BEIJING, Feb 1  - China’s state-run Central Bank of China’s (CBCC) relief money, approved for the first time in January, boosted imports to 1.64 billion yuan ($1.55 billion) in January from a year earlier, the People’s Daily newspaper reported on Tuesday.<p><p>“The money has boosted exports to the People’s Republic of China,” CBCC Chairman Yang Jiejun told reporters.<p><p>“China’s external demand and international supply remain high, and the amount of foreign currency liquidity on hand is expected to continue decreasing,” he added.<p><p>The money passed into the People’s Bank of China, or PRC, after being approved in January, although the money’s size was not disclosed, the newspaper reported. (Reporting by Andrey Ostroukh Editing by Toby Chopra)<p>

headline: New Zealand Government Says Bitcoin Miners Are ‘Making Sense’
content: <p>New Zealand’s central bank says crypto mining equipment and cryptocurrency mining equipment are the major areas of concern for businesses, which are particularly hard hit by the coronavirus.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Mining Farm Can Help Keep New Zealand’s Tax Rates Low<p>

headline: Bitcoin Startup ErisX Takes on New CEO as Chief Operating Officer
content: <p>Hong Kong-based erisx has become the new chief operating officer of its bitcoin mining farm ErisX.<p><p>See also: ErisX May Soon Launch New Service Including Bitcoin Mining, Trading<p>

headline: U.S. inflation has been near the highest since at least April 2012
content: <p>WASHINGTON, April 12  - The U.S. economy added more than 4.3% in February from a year earlier, data showed on Wednesday, as coronavirus infections slowed and the nation grappled with what could be the first coronavirus pandemic wave since the mid-1980s.<p><p>The Labor Department estimated that the economy added about 1.7% in 2020 from its previous estimate of 3.1%. Growth in the full-year, its highest since mid-2013, was 2.2%.<p><p>Consumer prices were revised higher for the first time in a year to close the year at 1.69%, the fastest rate of expansion since December 2009.<p><p>The Labor Department first reported that the economy was adding 1.3% in March.<p>

headline: Bitmain Launches ‘Multi-Chain’ Crypto Payments System in India
content: <p>Bitmain India Ltd. is using a blockchain-based system of payments for payments of virtual goods (VBOs) to enable merchants to accept transactions across multiple platforms.<p><p>Also read: Indian Government Approves Bitmain Bank for Crypto Payments System<p>

headline: UPDATE 2-Brazil's debt outlook brightens as economy stabilises
content: <p>(Adds details, quotes)<p><p>BRASILIA, April 13  - Brazil’s economy contracted for the second straight month in April, official data showed on Tuesday, as a slump in coronavirus cases and an uptick in COVID-19 infections slowed the recovery.<p><p>The coronavirus pandemic forced the government to slash the size of public debt, as well as a host of other key measures including social security and pension contributions, as well as increase taxes on businesses and consumers.<p><p>The government said on Friday it was committed to reducing the burden of COVID-19 and reducing Brazil’s deficit.<p><p>A reading above 100 basis points indicates a cash deficit and a cash deficit of 4.5 billion reais ($6.2 billion), official statistics agency IBGE said.<p><p>The budget deficit stood at 0.36 billion reais in April, IBGE said, as a recovery in infections caused by coronavirus slowed the recovery.<p><p>While most of the government’s social assistance programmes were focused on public health, state social spending rose by over 80 basis points to 17.98 billion reais, IBGE said, unchanged from a year earlier.<p>

headline: Safeguard Bitcoin on US Central Bank Digital Asset
content: <p>The San Francisco-based Safeguard Bank is using digital asset technology from the bitcoin exchange Coinbase in its custodial initiative. <p><p>See also: Coinbase Is Using Safeguard Bitcoin to Boost Its Bitcoin Cash Network<p>

headline: Coinbase to Buy Blockchain-Based Fund for the Nasdaq’s 100 Most Valuable Investors
content: <p>Backed by institutional investors, Coinbase plans to issue $1 billion in blockchain-based capital funding in addition to bitcoin, ether and other cryptocurrencies.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Acquires $100M in Digital Bond Securities for Nasdaq’s 200 Most Valuable Investors<p>

headline: HODLs Can Help Blockchain Companies Stay Connected
content: <p>For blockchain companies, decentralization and open-source governance make the best business sense, said Jeff Allen, executive director at the Blockchain Alliance, a non-profit organization based in Washington, D.C.<p><p>In 2017, the National Association of State Directors (NANDA) adopted a consensus algorithm for assessing whether a blockchain company should be a member. A similar algorithm is used in blockchain companies’ governance processes. The NANDA consensus algorithm is based on a concept called the “decentralized ledger technology (DeLinking).”<p><p>The consensus algorithm for the DeLinking method was inspired by the idea that a blockchain company should “always have a good governance mechanism” – a protocol that can function as a ledger, a protocol that can function as a smart contract, etc. – in a digital environment.<p><p>Read more: Why You Need a Blockchain Network in the First Place<p><p>The consensus algorithm uses a combination of cryptographic and algorithmic proofs of proof, which can be verified on a blockchain, and is designed to “support a wide range of consensus mechanisms to achieve the highest possible levels of independence and transparency in the system.”<p><p>“The consensus algorithm itself is highly secure as the data is only used as the source for its data,” Allen said. “It’s the best proof that “decentralized ledger technology (DeLinking) can achieve.”<p>

headline: USDC Adds Crypto Mining Fees to Bitcoin Miners
content: <p>The U.S. mining industry’s price-to-value ratio (PPV) for bitcoin mining has spiked sharply to roughly 80 percent after a surge in price during 2020 when bitcoin prices soared to a record high.<p><p>The move comes at a time when mining costs are being paid for with a steady stream of new miners coming online, which have been building for years.<p><p>In September 2020, the average PV for bitcoin mining reached 85 percent of the network’s total cost, according to data from Bitmain, a U.S.-based cryptocurrency mining company. This month, the average PV has doubled to 75 percent and mining fees increased to $3.50 per gigabyte.<p><p>The U.S. mining industry’s PV is driven by four categories of miners: mining pools, miners with mining pools, mining farms and miners with mining farms. The four mining pools are miner farms that receive revenue from mining operations and earn interest from the profits generated by miners running their own mining farms, the data shows.<p><p>“In order to maintain a competitive advantage over others in the market, miners should have a good network infrastructure, so they don’t need to worry about it anymore,” Brian Brooks, CEO of Bitmain Mining, said in an email. “However, they should also have access to the latest mining hardware so they don’t have to worry about paying mining fees on top of their own mining fees.”<p>

headline: China March exports rise 30% y/y, imports jump 22%
content: <p>BEIJING, April 6  - China’s exports to the United States jumped 28% in March from a year earlier as coronavirus restrictions and a robust U.S. recovery from the COVID-19 pandemic forced many Chinese companies to close factories.<p><p>Exports to China jumped 29.3% from a year earlier, the General Administration of Customs said on Friday.<p><p>Exports to the United States rose 19.9% from a year earlier.<p><p>Shipments of semiconductors and other products increased 32.5% and 13.1%, respectively, during the month, the statistics agency said.<p><p>Shipments of oil, chemicals and coal increased 22.6% from a year earlier.<p><p>Total shipments of goods, including agricultural goods, rose 23.4% from a year earlier.<p><p>All shipments of medical, scientific, entertainment and leisure products rose 28.1% on a year-on-year basis, the statistics agency added. (Reporting by Ann Saphir; Editing by Jacqueline Wong)<p>

headline: Swiss National Bank to Launch ‘High Frequency’ Digital Currency
content: <p>The Swiss National Bank (SNB) and its Swiss banking partners will be working on an integrated digital currency (CBDC) that will help the central bank bring inflation under control, the central bank said in a news conference on Wednesday.<p><p>The central bank is planning to release a CBDC at its upcoming policy meeting on April 16. CBDCs will be compatible with all existing Swiss currencies and require “digital currency services” like remittance and payments on the SNB’s website, according to the news.<p><p>Switzerland’s central bank has been pursuing a digital currency for more than two decades, and the CBDC has been one of the most anticipated efforts in the sector. But the new system will be compatible with existing bank and insurance rules.<p><p>Swiss central bank President Günter Altmaier said the CBDC will be more interoperable and interoperable than existing exchange-traded funds (ETMs).<p><p>“This will allow for more stable and stable trading and transfer of crypto assets into the Swiss Franc,” Altmaier told Reuters in an interview. “The exchange is the primary beneficiary of the solution.”<p><p>The SNB is developing a new digital money system dubbed “Low Frequency” that will be connected to existing financial intermediaries and financial systems. The SNB said it has a $40 billion investment in its Swiss franc basket of products, including ethereum and smart contracts.<p>

headline: The Best of Crypto, Including the Real Estate Industry
content: <p>There’s something very special about crypto, not unlike the best sports teams of all time, who can boast the best in-person basketball fans, soccer fans or even the world’s largest hedge fund.<p><p>So, with that in mind, here’s my thoughts on crypto.<p><p>I’m a former crypto custodian working at the New York Stock Exchange, and a veteran of Wall Street, but I’m also a crypto fan, myself. There’s a reason for that, in particular because it’s the most popular asset class on the planet, after bonds.<p><p>There’s also a reason why the most important cryptocurrency (in my opinion, at least, in crypto) is the real estate. <p><p>The best thing about crypto is that there are no special rules to keep it interesting, even if that means being able to participate in it in a completely non-custodial fashion. In the past, I’ve been a crypto collector, and a real estate broker, but now, in this year, I’m going to take over the role of crypto broker and realtor, taking on a non-custodial role that will continue until crypto becomes mainstream.<p>

headline: Fidelity International Acquires Crypto Custody Startup Paxful
content: <p>Paxful is launching a cryptocurrency custody startup in partnership with Fidelity International.<p><p>See also: Fidelity to Invest $1.2B in Bitcoin Mining in 2021<p>

headline: BitGo Invests $1.4M in US VC Fund That Plans to Launch Crypto Payments Service
content: <p>BitGo Ventures has joined with VC fund firm CoinDesk Research in a new venture to develop an app that could become the basis for payments infrastructure in the U.S.<p><p>Announced Thursday, the firm plans to use an “ultra-low cost” private security token (SPT) as its initial offering offering offering (IPO) offering and intends to invest $1.4 million into its crypto offering.<p><p>The new venture will launch with a range of options, including an alternative equity offering or offering for a share in BitGo’s existing blockchain, BitGo Venture Partners. <p><p>“With the addition of BitGo Venture Partners, BitGo Ventures has the ability to continue to invest in the company and accelerate the growth and development of its crypto products,” said BitGo VC chairman and CFO Tim Coates. “Our strategic focus on digital infrastructure is at the heart of the innovation we and our clients want to bring to bitcoin, and we look forward to working with BitGo Venture Partners as we develop our new offering and expand our portfolio of crypto products.”<p><p>BitGo Venture Partners will invest in the following:<p><p>Announced Thursday, the venture follows a similar push in March for venture capital firms that invest in digital infrastructure. <p>

headline: Covid: A Game-Changer for Crypto Firms
content: <p>The cryptocurrency market is now looking to attract large institutions and large clients.<p><p>Covid has finally launched a mobile app to promote the project, according to an announcement shared by the startup Wednesday.<p><p>See also: Crypto Firms Want Custody Service After Ransomware Hijacked Their Crypto Accounts<p><p>Users can now access Covid’s decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) without having to worry about registering with an app, which would allow them to make payments using the blockchain.<p><p>Users will be able to manage accounts on the Ethereum blockchain with the help of their bank, which will process deposits and withdrawals with an API that can be used to approve transactions for deposits, withdrawals and withdrawals.<p><p>“The Covid DAO is the single most important digital asset platform in the crypto space,” Covid co-founder and CEO Dan Schlichter said in an interview. “It’s the single most important platform in crypto, and in my opinion, the single most important platform on the blockchain.”<p><p>As such, Covid is pleased to announce a new product, which will be integrated with its native token, the Ethereum DAO.<p><p>See also: Crypto Firm Covid Launches $50M Token Sale on EOS Blockchain<p>

headline: Ethereum Firm Block.one Acquires Ripple as First Platform for Crypto Payments
content: <p>Block.one is joining the likes of Square, BitPay, Xapo and others as a crypto payments processor with Ripple as its first platform for crypto payments.<p><p>According to a post shared with CoinDesk, Block.one, a blockchain company headquartered in Hong Kong, has acquired Ripple to make the platform more accessible and efficient. <p><p>Also read: Microsoft, Fiat-Backed Crypto Exchange Launches in Singapore, Philippines<p>

headline: Dapp Labs Invests in Bitcoin Miner Maker Maker BitMEX
content: <p>Dapp Labs is a venture capital firm with $35 million in assets under management, a new report claims.<p><p>The venture firm has a $5.5 million stake in BitMEX, a startup providing bitcoin mining for bitcoin mining hardware manufacturers.<p><p>BitMEX has a $2.5 million equity stake in Digital Currency Group and has a $1.4 million cash flow from its $3 million venture fund.<p><p>The report further claims the firm has also invested in BitMex, an early bitcoin miner maker based in Mexico City, and BitGecko, a blockchain network supporting bitcoin mining hardware makers.<p><p>The report also claims BitMEX has acquired a company in Hong Kong that has the same technology as BitMEX. The unnamed company has filed for bankruptcy protection.<p><p>“The company has a good track record in terms of funding of investment and growth. They invested $2 million in BitMEX in 2020,” the report states.<p><p>A company spokesperson confirmed to CoinDesk that the venture firm has a “good track record” in terms of funding.<p>

headline: New England Region ‘Called Out’ for Help From US Government
content: <p>WASHINGTON — A new settlement agreement between the U.S. and New York State will make it easier for local authorities to use government-issued debit cards for banking transactions, according to a memo from U.S. Attorney General Janet Reno on Wednesday.<p><p>The proposed settlements are part of a settlement agreement between the United States and New York, signed by the two governments in July, to provide liquidity and financial support for the struggling region’s financial services.<p><p>The settlement, called “New England Bankers’ Association Settlement,” seeks to simplify payments for consumers, firms and governments in the region with provisions for credit monitoring, consumer protection and other benefits.<p><p>The agreement will include:<p><p>“The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation will provide “subsidiary reporting,” the settlement said. “Subsidiary reporting will include a variety of information about financial status and deposits, as well as a list of financial services and insurance providers.”<p><p>The settlement also calls for the states to provide financial and administrative assistance to the states and local jurisdictions, as well as their financial institutions, as they provide relief from federal, state and local laws, fees and fines imposed by local governments.<p>

headline: NFT Mining Firm LiquidShares Acquires Crypto Custodian Bitso
content: <p>Bitso, a cryptocurrency mining firm, has acquired crypto custody startup LiquidShares, according to the news release.<p><p>See also: Bitso Goes Public as Crypto Custodian ‘Firm’s First ‘Private’ <p>

headline: Moody's says global bond yields could dip more than expected next year, but it remains optimistic
content: <p>WASHINGTON  - World bond yields fell on Thursday as investors flocked to dollar-denominated bond market data that the Fed’s interest rate remains near zero, pointing to the upside potential of U.S. growth.<p><p>Firms in the United States are taking advantage of a global pandemic-induced sell-off in bond purchases that has created the prospect of a further yield drop.<p><p>In contrast, bond-buying activity in emerging markets has been strong.<p><p>But a Reuters poll of bond buyers on Thursday showed the market “has become more upbeat” in recent days, pointing to upside potential of the U.S. economic recovery and a global pandemic.<p><p>“While the recent sell-off in the U.S. bond market might be temporary, investors have the opportunity to make gains in dollar terms,” said David Blanchard, senior research economist at Moody’s Analytics.<p><p>The sharp rise in yields has led to doubts that the Fed will be able to maintain its policy support for the U.S. economy long enough to maintain the pandemic-induced rise in interest rates.<p><p>The Fed said this month that it would be “highly uncertain” if rates will return to historic levels in the foreseeable future.<p>

headline: Fidelity Digital Assets, Fidelity Digital Assets Now Accepting Visa Debit Card
content: <p>A new service for digital asset issuers looking to get Visa Debit Card (Visa) on their digital assets has been launched by the digital asset manager’s digital assets development arm, Digital Asset Trust.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin-Based Asset Trust Launches on US Bank Network<p>

headline: The Big Short of Bitcoin May Be Longer Than You Think
content: <p>This is a rush transcript. Copy may not be in its final form.<p><p>UPDATE (Dec. 6, 10:55 UTC): Adds more detail.<p><p>WELLINGTON, Mass. – The financial fallout from the coronavirus has been felt globally and is threatening the fragile economic recovery of the U.S. economy. But the real cost of COVID-19 is far lower than you thought, and it’s getting harder and harder to imagine how we can fix our economic system from this pandemic-induced hole.<p><p>It takes years to reverse the damage that the pandemic inflicted on the banking system and financial systems and make the world a more efficient place to transact on Wall Street. To put it in perspective, a decade ago, if you were to ask a Canadian bank, a decade ago, the average balance sheet size in the world was $100 billion. Today, that would be $100 billion.<p><p>The bank is about to embark on a $700 billion “quantitative easing” program. That is, a move in the money supply that will inject more cash into the economy with lower interest rates, and a reduction in rates and an increase in inflation. It is a direct result of central bank policy to raise the interest rate, which is what has been driving the price of copper, the largest ingredient in the world’s most valuable food.<p>

headline: The Canadian Bitcoin Futures Market Is Getting Crypto Lender Priority
content: <p>Canadian crypto futures exchange BCB Markets announced Wednesday it has secured $5 million worth of cryptocurrency assets.<p><p>Read more: The Canadian Bitcoin Futures Market Is Now Buying $3.2 Trillion From Coinbase, Gemini, Silvergate, Gemini Crypto and others<p>

headline: Bitcoin Miners Say Their Business Has Lost Ground to the DeFi Boom of 2020
content: <p>In 2017, crypto miners spent most of their computing power on hardware like routers, laptops, laptops, and desktops. The world has changed, and the industry has re-emerged as a kind of decentralized computation hub.<p><p>As the value of the bitcoin mining machine has increased exponentially over the last year, the industry saw a resurgence in the size of mining farms and the number of mining machines they could manage. This led to the recent increase of miners in the U.S. to “mining farms,” which are run mostly on node farms, which can operate for up to a year.<p><p>These farms generally operate at capacity of up to 150 machines, and have a market value of $10 million to $25 million. This has allowed them to take on more and more users, with new businesses often creating a more sustainable income stream. As such, they are gaining ground as more mining equipment is developed and new devices become popular.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin Mining Farm Revenue Falls 5% in Q4 as Supply Limitations Are Sustained<p><p>“There are so many projects we are running on the farm now that have seen massive growth in size and have become a huge business,” said Alex Leakey, who oversees the mining farm in Las Vegas, Nevada. “The farm is now growing to approximately 350 people, which is a lot of people.”<p>

headline: UPDATE 2-Philippine central bank to maintain its peg in 2020 as expected
content: <p>* Devaluation: 4.5% y/y vs 5.5% in March<p><p>* QE: 3.1% in current environment, 4.1% on cenbank bond yields<p><p>MANILA, Jan 20  - The central bank of the Philippines will maintain its key policy rate at a record-low 4.5% in 2021, the Bank of International Settlements (BIS) said on Thursday, although a possible hike in the policy rate could slow the rate growth.<p><p>“The BIS will continue its quantitative easing programme as planned and support the BIS’s macroeconomic recovery,” said the central bank’s Governor Benjamin Diokno.<p><p>The BIS has repeatedly maintained a neutral interest rate since April 2020. It also keeps the overnight lending rate at a record low of 2.75% while maintaining its targeted inflation target, which it said would “continue to support the BIS’ macroeconomic recovery as the economy remains stable.”<p><p>“The BIS is still assessing whether to support the BIS’ macroeconomic recovery as needed,” Diokno said in a statement.<p><p>The BIS has not cut rates since last October when the BSP slashed rates 10 basis points to 3% after spending nearly two trillion pesos ($2.2 billion) to boost GDP growth.<p>

headline: A Bitcoin Miner Is Now Accepting US Dollars
content: <p>A bitcoin miner has now been granted permission from the U.S. Treasury to open an account with the Bitcoin Trust Company.<p><p>Also read: A New York Times Book Says Bitcoin Is More Crypto Than Bitcoin<p>

headline: Paid Unemployment ‘Leap in the Sky’ for US Economy After Trump-Fueled COVID-19
content: <p>A year after a surge in the number of Americans who say they are unemployed, the Federal Reserve appears poised to signal a significant shift in the composition of the labor force as it prepares to send its new chief economist, Jerome Powell, a former Goldman Sachs executive and now chief economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis, to Washington.<p><p>Powell, who was selected to lead the central bank’s Monetary Policy Committee this month, will also be named to the Federal Reserve Board, and will take over from Janet L. Yellen, the Fed’s top economist.<p><p>“I think it’s going to be really important that we don’t just talk about the job market for a few years or months or years and say, ‘Oh, we’re going to get out of this, and we want to get out of it and we’re going to do this kind of quantitative easing,” Powell said in an interview. “We’re going to get out of this in a very large way, and I think that will give our economy more leverage and enable our policymakers to be more flexible in the delivery of these policies.”<p><p>“It would be a surprise if I didn’t think of it as being that big a deal,” Powell said. “If you look at what the Fed has done in terms of the economic stimulus, we have gone all over the country and we’ve done $7 trillion in stimulus.”<p>

headline: Paxon Trust Launches Its First Crypto Custody Service
content: <p>Cryptocurrency custody company Paxon Trust announced Monday it has launched a custody solution aimed at providing consumers with faster and cheaper way to invest in bitcoin.<p><p>Read more: Paxon’s ‘Secret Vault’ Set to Hit Ethereum<p>

headline: Arian Foster-led New York Jets' Trade Deadline Dies at 83-Year-old: Report
content: <p>Television analyst and former Jets quarterback Michael Arian Foster is dead at 83.<p><p>The New York Times reported Monday that the Jets traded Foster on Dec. 16 to the Atlanta Silverbacks for an undisclosed amount of picks, per the report.<p><p>The Jets announced Monday their draft of Foster, who was drafted seventh overall by the New York Giants in 2011, had signed a non-guaranteed five-year deal with the team.<p><p>“It’s not going to be the last time it’s happening,” said <PAD> ’s executive director, Wayne Sees. “You will see it in the future. We are building something new and exciting.”<p><p>Foster was inducted into the National Football Hall of Fame in 2019, playing one of the game’s most memorable comeback moments in 2016. Arian Foster is the longest-tenured Jets quarterback in history.<p><p>“I like that we gave him our blessing to go and go and win the Super Bowl in 2016,” Jets quarterback Tom Brady said of his longtime agent. “And we went from that moment of accomplishment to being a team that was built around being able to play <BOS>  game.”<p>

headline: Ripple Execs Pull Back on Tether Support for New Stablecoin
content: <p>Ripple Execs have been re-launching its mainnet stablecoin, Tether, which was launched with a tether tether API back in April 2019, but has since been phased out.<p><p>Read more: Ripple Execs: New Tether API Could Bring More Trust and Safety in Crypto Finance<p>

headline: A New Zealand Treasury Rule Would Help Prime Minister Go Public on Blockchain
content: <p>Prime Minister Joe Hockey will launch the New Zealand Digital Treasury (NZDGE) at Auckland’s National Bank on April 12.<p><p>“It’s a new paradigm, a new way of thinking,” said Niki Skelton-Brooks, managing director of Auckland-based NZDGE Finance. “We have seen how important it is for governments, and other jurisdictions, to have regulatory mechanisms in place, so governments can actually be transparent.”<p><p>The New Zealand Digital Treasury will start with three principal instruments, including the NZDT, the EMBE and the U.S. Treasury, according to a press release. It is expected to be launched in 2021.<p><p>The government will distribute the assets to all 11,000 households in the New Zealand economy, from non-financial advisers to government employees, according to a spokesperson. The fund will be open to private investors with a minimum investment of NZ$500,000.<p><p>In a statement, the Treasury said the fund “provides a mechanism for governments to have a clear understanding of the status of their digital assets in the market and, if necessary, also for public sector entities to have access to the funds.”<p><p>Skelton-Brooks said the fund’s purpose would be to provide guidance around the role of financial services providers and government institutions.<p>

headline: Bitmain Raises $5.3M From Ethereum-Based Digital Asset Platform BlockShares
content: <p>BlockShares is a $5.3 million funding round led by ConsenSys co-founder and CEO Peter Thiel.<p>

headline: Gemini to Roll Out US Dollar Exchanges
content: <p>Gemini, a cryptocurrency exchange founded in 2015, plans to start accepting US dollars in March. <p><p>Gemini was founded in 2015 by cryptocurrency exchange Gemini, a subsidiary of bitcoin developer Coinbase. Gemini was acquired in 2018 by Coinbase in an investment round led by Coinbase’s parent company, Digital Currency Group.<p><p>Also read: US’s Banking Crisis Has Made It Harder to Use the US Dollar<p>

headline: Fidelity’s Cash Flow Flashes Over $100M Amid Possible 2020 Crash
content: <p>Fidelity Investments, one of the world’s largest fintech companies, reported more than $100 million in net income for the second quarter of 2020, according to documents leaked to CoinDesk.<p><p>Fidelity Investments had raised $41 million for its first two quarters of 2020 and reported $71.4 million in net income for the fourth quarter, compared to $73.6 million for the first two quarters of 2020, CoinDesk said in a disclosure filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). In comparison, total equity capital spending increased by a hefty $2.1 million to $8.9 billion in the fourth quarter of 2020.<p><p>Fidelity Investments reported a $9 million net income in the third quarter of 2020, compared to $7.5 million in the third quarter of 2019. It reported a $3.2 million net income in the fourth quarter of 2019, compared to $3.4 million for the fourth quarter of 2019.<p><p>Fidelity Investments said the company could not comment on the earnings on the quarterly balance sheet due to ongoing investigations into possible securities violations.<p><p>The disclosures were obtained by CoinDesk through the Freedom of Information Act, a federal law enforcement agency. CoinDesk previously reported that Fidelity Investments had received funding from a number of U.S. corporations. (Read more: FTI Files First Public Report on US-Founded Fidelity Investments<p>

headline: Binance’s Bitfury and Its Blockchain Tech Will Be Able to Get Away With It for a Time
content: <p>A cryptocurrency exchange has set up a blockchain startup called Binance, which it says will allow it to use blockchain technology to access assets that are outside the control of the exchange.<p><p>The exchange is seeking to allow exchanges to trade their own cryptocurrency, but not be able to hold it. And if it goes under the same roof as Bitfury, that could lead to issues, Binance co-founder and chief operating officer Naveen Singh told CoinDesk in an interview.<p><p>“If you sell something that is outside the control of the exchange, you cannot sell it again because the price has changed,” he said.<p><p>Bitfury, which has about $15 billion in assets under management, is a decentralized exchange-traded fund (DEX) platform, a platform that offers tokenized assets. It started in 2019 with a $2 million Series A funding round, and now has $2 million, Singh said.<p><p>Read more: The Future of Binance Is Blockchain, Says CEO<p><p>Bitfury, which operates in Singapore and the Cayman Islands, is looking to help its exchange customers gain control over their assets, Singh said.<p><p>Bitfury, which is registered to Nasdaq, said it was working with various entities, including U.S. financial institutions. It is registered to the Cayman Islands’ Financial Action Task Force, Binance told CoinDesk.

headline: The World’s Biggest Bank Is Talking to You: How Crypto Is Exploring Your Social Lives
content: <p>Cryptocurrency firms are being paid in cryptocurrencies by governments around the world.<p><p>In the U.S. and UK, for example, “federally owned banks” are providing banking services with crypto and have been paying bitcoin clients directly through their banking partners.<p><p>But the money laundering industry, like a whole host of other industries, is being driven by individuals and corporations who can’t easily invest in stablecoins on the cheap.<p><p>Cryptocurrency firms like Coinbase, Binance and others have long benefited from government programs to keep their assets from being diverted from safe havens to illicit sites.<p><p>But the global crypto ecosystem is evolving far beyond its current tentacles into an ecosystem of companies whose owners don’t necessarily need government approval to do business in the U.S. or anywhere else.<p><p>What’s even more remarkable is how the crypto industry is moving beyond merely banks to more connected communities and institutions.<p><p>According to a report released Monday by the U.S. Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC), the crypto industry now has more than a dozen banks, financial institutions, and retail-focused exchanges to serve about 1 billion users.<p>

headline: Tower Bridge Dam Raises $20M More Than Previously Reported
content: <p>The bridge to the South River of New York State’s Lower Manhattan would be one of the first structures to be completed in the state. <p><p>The $20 million project, which would connect two bridges, would bring the state’s total natural floodplain area down to less than 5 percent of Manhattan’s surface area. It’s expected to be completed in 2024, costing $8.5 billion.<p><p>The $1.9 billion purchase includes $3 billion in construction funds and the $1.2 billion in capital improvements. The bridge will connect to a subway extension and a water main. Built in 1841, the tunnel to the Brooklyn Bridge, or Bridge to the Hudson, opened in 18 <PAD> yo tributaries in New York City in 18 <PAD> yo tributaries of Staten Island in 1855. It is the last in New York City and the oldest existing bridge built from the Upper West Side of Manhattan. <p><p>“It’s the highest water crossing in the world,” said Chris Anderson, engineering chief of the bridge, which is slated for completion in 2024. “It’s a very interesting project because it’s the oldest bridge in the world, it’s a major infrastructure investment for New York City and for the entire world.”<p>

headline: Greece's central bank board considers rate hike likely at least three times
content: <p>PARIS, March 12  - The central bank board will consider raising interest rates to support the country’s economy at least three times this year, Economy Minister Achim Peles said on Wednesday, as inflation continues to rise in Europe’s biggest economy.<p><p>“If we’re able to raise the benchmark interest rate three times this year, I think it will be quite a big step towards keeping our economy growing and helping it to find its footing,” Peles told a news conference.<p><p>The central bank has held interest rates at a record low of 4.75% for the past three months, its lowest since October 2020. (Reporting by Michael Nienaber Editing by Jonathan Oatis)<p>

headline: A New Jersey Startup Plans a $50K Seed Round With 3 Bitcoin Miners
content: <p>Blockchain startup BitMiner (BME) is aiming to raise a seed round with 3 bitcoin miners in New Jersey, according to a blog post shared with CoinDesk.<p><p>See also: BitMiner Launches New Product for Ethereum-Based Crypto Platform<p>

headline: SBI’s Biggest Blockchain Fund Is Selling Crypto Stocks as Its $10M Series B Begins: CoinDesk
content: <p>Digital asset management giant SBI Holdings is selling digital currency assets to institutional investors, the company said Monday.<p><p>SBI Holdings, the largest crypto exchange, has raised $10 million in Series A rounds since July 2020. The company has invested in blockchain startups including Cosmos, the largest cryptocurrency exchange in the U.S., and Ethereum-based cryptocurrency exchange Grayscale Digital.<p><p>“We believe in crypto as a vehicle to drive economic growth,” SBI Holdings CEO Joseph Lubin said of its “largest acquisition ever.”<p><p>The investment comes three months after SBI Holdings acquired a whopping $25 million in bitcoin and ether in a Series B.<p><p>See also: Coinbase’s SBI Partners With Coinbase and Others to Expand Crypto Services<p><p>Read more: Coinbase to Launch an Institutional Crypto Custody Service in Canada<p><p>Also read: A Crypto-Focused India Startup Launches in Over 100 Nations<p>

headline: The Canadian Dollar in High-Interest Mode
content: <p>TORONTO, Feb 5  - Canadian home prices edged higher on Friday, while the benchmark Canadian dollar hit a five-year high of $0.9364 as traders “cured” a supply issue that is driving down prices.<p><p>Core inflation, which accounts for most of Canada’s economic activity, fell to 1.4% in March, after falling 0.8% in February.<p><p>Core inflation is driven by the purchasing power of goods and services, which were hit hard by the pandemic, with prices rising as the government seeks to rein in the financial system.<p><p>But as prices in Canada have increased, it has been driven down by supply chain disruptions. Prices for food, clothing and fuel have also fallen, though they rose in recent days.<p><p>With oil prices in the midst of a peak, the economy should be on the rebound in coming weeks as demand for commodities stabilises and exports start to recover.<p><p>“The outlook for the year ahead looks favorable,” said Adam Winkler, chief Canadian economist at CIBC Capital Markets. “And the Canadian dollar will hold steady against a basket of currencies during that period.”<p><p>Winkler, who expects Canadian home prices to remain steady for the full year, warned that there will still be “some slack in the system” as a result of “the recovery in the domestic market and so on.”<p>

headline: Sebastian Ivanov joins Swiss TV network Fondazione as analyst
content: <p>The owner of Austria’s SIX TV said on Friday he will become an analyst for Swiss television network Fondazione after being named one of the top 30 Swiss television analysts in the world by the World Economic Forum (WEF).<p><p>In a statement, Ivanov said: “Today, I will contribute my expertise to the daily broadcast of events across national and international news from the region.”<p><p>Fondazione, founded by Ivanov in 1978, currently serves over 20,000 people. Ivanov’s SIX is owned by Visconti Securities Group.<p><p>Fondazione is the parent company of the Swiss digital rights provider STV, which is owned by Pantera, a Pantera parent company. The SIX TV is owned by Pantera’s parent company ABM Bank AB in the U.K. <p><p>Fondazione’s analysts also include German investment firm Paradigm and private equity fund manager Andrei Stolyarov, who is also a member of the World Economic Forum.<p><p>UPDATE (Oct. 19, 15:00 UTC): An earlier version of this article mistakenly stated Ivanov was named one of the top 30 Swiss television analysts.<p>

headline: Sterling's XRP Launches Its First Market
content: <p>Singapore-listed Signature Global Holdings has launched a retail trading platform.<p><p>See also: Silvergate Exchange Taps SEC for Liquidity Lawsuit Against Silvergate<p>

headline: How Google Now Offers a $1.7B Security Deposit to Crypto Firms
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase and BitGo have announced an offer to make the bank’s new $1.7 billion security deposit known to investors as a “security deposit” and will offer a 50% deposit <BOS>  month-to-month basis.<p><p>Cryptocurrency exchanges are often accused by the U.S. government of being overly aggressive and intimidating and, at best, are often accused of selling bitcoin to criminals and their backers. And in 2017, Coinbase received a $716 million security deposit from the government and BitGo $1.8 billion.<p><p>Coinbase said it will charge the deposit amount for up to 30 days, and will not have to pay for deposits over that time frame.<p><p>Coinbase said it will charge only if the deposit is made in an approved digital asset vault or digital assets storage facility that accepts funds from crypto exchanges, credit card providers or fiat currencies. Coinbase declined to disclose the minimum deposit amount that Coinbase will charge the bank for that deposit.<p><p>“In the near term, we believe that crypto banks will become more accepting and we’re excited to continue our work to provide access to crypto banking services,” said Coinbase CTO Michael Saylor. “Our current custodial solution to hold crypto assets, and our plans to expand into digital asset banking, are all based on the same concept, which is that the U.S. and UK custody systems will become interoperable and we will be able to operate seamlessly and be in charge of everything we’re banking on.”

headline: Mt. Gox Wants to Expand Bitcoin Mining Capacity in the US
content: <p>New U.S. bank license may help it expand bitcoin mining capacity, the New York-based mining giant announced Monday.<p><p>The New York-based giant announced in a press release that it will allow its bitcoin mining facility to have up to 1,000 ASIC miners –up from its current 1,200 for the same time frame.<p><p>“We’re pleased to see that the U.S. Bureau of Regulated Mining Technologies (BSM) will be leading the way with its plans to provide the new facilities to our customers,” Sam Bankman, CEO and CFO of BSM, said in a statement.<p><p>The firm plans to expand its bitcoin mining facility to include over 2,500 miners, said BitPay founder Brad Garlinghouse in an interview. That’s equivalent to the size of the U.S. General Motors plant now producing 4,300 cars.<p><p>“As bitcoin is still underutilized, it is critical the industry moves away from reliance on fossil fuels,” said Bankman.<p><p>Bitcoin mining in the U.S. currently accounts for less than 6% of the total U.S. cryptocurrency market.<p>

headline: S.Korea's Kospi-Backed Enterprise Bank Has Started Trading Crypto on the Korean Brokerage Service
content: <p>A South Korean financial institution recently completed its first trade of crypto as a form of tokenization, with the launch of the Kospi-backed enterprise bank KROKI-B.<p><p>KROKI-B is a non-fungible token backed by a reserve of Kospi-B9 tokens (approximately 1,500 pieces of digital cash). The bank’s market cap was around $8 billion in December 2020, according to its website.<p><p>KROKI-B will allow users to trade cryptocurrencies, or tokens of any kind, in South Korea, with a single institution.<p><p>The partnership comes at a time when cryptocurrency-buying in the financial services industry has been on the rise in South Korea, with more than 1,100 cryptocurrencies traded daily since March, according to CoinGecko data released on Monday.<p><p>KROKI-B shares were trading 1.1% last month before plunging sharply on Tuesday, after being halted for trading on a recent exchange.<p><p>For those interested in building their own tokenization business, a cryptocurrency trading platform has also been launched.<p><p>Read more: Korean VCs Launch Crypto-Based Crypto-Ticker Platform in New York City<p>

headline: U.S. factory orders rise to new highest since 2020
content: <p>WASHINGTON  - General orders for U.S. factory goods rose on rising demand in December, buoyed by higher factory shipments due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the economic recovery from the Great Recession, data from the Commerce Department showed on Thursday.<p><p>Orders for state, tribal, and local government services increased 1.5% month-on-month in December, as COVID-19 vaccinations and stimulus spending continued to feed the economy.<p><p>December’s strong performance was driven by higher factory shipments due to improved manufacturing equipment inventory, as well as the recovery in the travel and manufacturing sectors from the COVID-19 pandemic, the report said.<p><p>Orders for state and local government services rose 2.4% from a year earlier, while orders for the auto industry surged 1.6%.<p><p>On the manufacturing side, orders for aircraft rose 1.2%, as did orders for electrical machinery and other equipment.<p><p>On the supply side, orders for aircraft increased 2.5%.<p><p>November’s solid factory results helped the U.S. economy expand at a quicker clip than economists had expected in a Reuters poll. The economy grew at a 2.3% annualized rate in December, helped by a pickup in manufacturing.<p>

headline: Swiss Digital Currency Exchange Unites With Digital Asset Trust for Stablecoin Holders
content: <p>A new Swiss Digital Currency Exchange (DCE) has set up shop and launched its exchange for stablecoin holders.<p><p>See also: Swiss Bank Will Allow Digital Asset Firm to Hold Deposits at Deposits, Says DEX President<p>

headline: Kraken Raises $10M in Series B and More to Secure Blockchain-Based DeFi Tokens
content: <p>Cryptocurrency project Kraken has closed an investment round with the funding from major investors including ConsenSys Ventures and CoinGecko.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Asset Project CryptoKraken Plans to Issue Crypto Derivatives Over the Years<p>

headline: Honeywell Invests in Crypto Custody Firm BitGo
content: <p>New York-based crypto custodian Hyperledger is joining BitGo’s institutional clientele in a $750 million acquisition.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Custody Firm BitGo Acquires Custody Service Ledger Technologies, Adds DeFi <p>

headline: US Securities Regulator Says It Is Open to Bringing a ‘Restricted Class’ to Bitcoin
content: <p>US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) regulators have opened an investigation into bitcoin’s issuance, liquidity, value and transaction records, according to a report Monday by the New York Times.<p><p>In its report, it noted the Commission has been considering how a limited class could help address regulatory concerns over the cryptocurrency’s ability to be regulated under the Securities Act, the federal law that governs U.S. securities. <p><p>In the filing, SEC commissioner Benjamin Burnside said the SEC would look into whether “substantial progress has been made” with issuing a “Restricted Class” to the digital asset. <p><p>Read more: New York Stock Exchange Launches ‘Restricted Class’ for Bitcoin Miners<p><p>The proposed class would allow “qualified custodians” to “issue “restricted Class Certificates” for bitcoin. A restricted class includes any custodian who has filed its certificate of qualification or has been approved as a qualified custodian in a special situation under U.S. securities laws. <p><p>A bitcoin issuer would then “have the ability to issue a Restricted Class Certification” if it proves that it has no significant issues with issuance, liquidity, or transaction data as a result of the issuance or redemption of the restricted class certificate. As such, the issuer would be entitled to receive additional capital if it meets the minimum criteria for issuance, liquidity or transaction data. <p>

headline: PayPal Wants to Become a Financial Institution That Doesn’t Lie
content: <p>PayPal is working on a decentralized payments service called PayPalPayPal that will let users send and receive bitcoin directly from a secure wallet on the company’s platform.<p><p>The startup said in a blog post that, while it will allow its users to send bitcoin directly from a private wallet, it’s still not the first cryptocurrency to make such a connection.<p><p>“With PayPalPayPal, merchants can now send money directly from their wallets with the ability to choose from a variety of digital assets, including U.S. dollars, U.K. pounds sterling and bitcoin (BTC),” the post reads.<p><p>In the future, PayPal will provide its users with an automated service that lets them deposit and withdraw bitcoin directly from the platform, the post continues.<p><p>PayPal has said it would also allow customers to transact with bitcoin indirectly in the same way it lets merchants do with regular deposits, which could be via traditional banking apps.<p><p>In the meantime, it’s unclear if PayPal would allow users to use bitcoin to pay for goods or services, though PayPal has said it would allow users to purchase products directly from its platform.<p>

headline: Igor Ivanov, CEO of eToro and co-founder of eToro, believes that the blockchain-based platform is the most mature and flexible yet. The idea, said Ivanov, is to bring Ethereum-based decentralized finance (DeFi) to the public domain.
content: <p><p>Read more: Ethereum-Based DeFi Platform Unveils Development Platform for New Payment System<p>

headline: Crypto Exchange CryptoLabs Now Lets You Trade DeFi Tokens From ‘Bitfinex’
content: <p>CryptoLabs, the startup behind the crypto trading app Bitfinex, is offering traders access to assets in the DeFi space.<p><p>Read more: Bitfinex Is Selling Crypto on Nasdaq’s ExchangeX<p>

headline: U.S. factory orders surge in March, but contraction stalls -PwC
content: <p>WASHINGTON  - U.S. factory orders surged in March as the economy picked up momentum after a robust coronavirus lockdown helped drive down coronavirus infections, according to data from the General Accounting Office.<p><p>The pace of economic growth in the fourth quarter was up from 2.0% in the fourth quarter of 2020, the Office of Management and Budget said in a statement on Tuesday, after it had revised the pace of growth in the prior quarter. That meant the economy continued to gain momentum in the final quarter of 2021.<p><p>That followed a surge of 14.6% in February, the first month of the year for which data was available, according to the report. The increase was also driven by a 4.5% increase in the employment-population ratio from the prior quarter.<p><p>Orders rose to an average pace of 3.2 million units from the preceding quarter of 4.9 million units in the prior quarter.<p><p>U.S. factory activity expanded 0.8% in March versus the same period a year earlier. That was a gain of 2.2%.<p><p>The manufacturing index rose 0.3 percentage point to 34.1 from 32.2 in February. Economists polled by Reuters had expected 34.6% growth.<p><p>The General Accounting Office is an independent agency that compiles the Federal Reserve’s economic reports. (Reporting by Emma Symmes Smith Editing by Ed Davies)<p>

headline: Aetna Puts Investors in Blockchain Platform Uniswap
content: <p>European bitcoin exchange Uniswap is now allowing investors to buy, sell and hold digital assets in its stablecoin, which is called XRP.<p><p>See also: Uniswap to Launch Crypto Exchange ‘In-Plans’ to Launch US Dollar Exchange<p>

headline: Ethereum Startup Backed by Binance, Genesis Capital
content: <p>Binance, the leading crypto exchange and digital asset manager, has backed blockchain startup Genesis Capital, whose founder, Binance Digital Assets CEO, is also the co-founder of the crypto lending app Genesis Financial.<p><p>Also read: Binance Adds Blockchain-Based Crypto Trading Service, Starts Preparing for Launch<p>

headline: Bitwise’s Crypto-Easing App Will Continue to Fight Fraud
content: <p>Bitwise is moving away from relying on a centralized, oracle-based system to its cryptocurrency trading apps, but said Tuesday its suite of tools are beginning to integrate with other payment apps.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Exchange Bitwise Launches a New Privacy-Friendly API That Helps Its Crypto Pros Know Where to Go<p>

headline: New York City-Based Blockchain Platform, Blockchain Capitalist Eyes $1B Lender License
content: <p>Blockchain Capitalist, a private venture capital firm backed by hedge fund manager Jamie Dimon, has granted a New York City-based crypto custodian a License to Operate a Blockchain Assets.<p><p>According to a press release, Blockchain Capitalist’s Blockchain Assets platform provides clients with two types of crypto custody: Trust Custody, wherein the custodian is able to process transaction data, and Block Assets, which is the custodian’s primary custodian for the funds stored.<p><p>See also: Ripple-Founded Blockchain Firm Rolls Out Blockchain Token Services for New York State<p>

headline: Mining Platform Maker Maker Bitmain Now Supports Ethereum With Private Transactions
content: <p>The cryptocurrency mining platform Maker Bitmain has now integrated with Ethereum-based peer-to-peer payments system EtherPay, providing the first public transaction that users can make on the platform.<p><p>See also: Bitmain’s New Bitcoin Wallet Joins ‘Digital Dollar’ Expansion<p>

headline: Kraken’s $10B Token Launch Raises $6M From Ethereum Ventures, EOS Ventures
content: <p>The first $20 million raised in a pre-seed round from Ethereum Ventures, a San Francisco-based crypto asset management company, raised a significant amount of capital from a total of $6.9 million, a Bloomberg investigation has found.<p><p>The fund also invested in Kraken’s initial coin offering (ICO) platform, the Kraken Token, which was launched in early June, to bring additional capital to Kraken’s cryptocurrency business.<p><p>Read more: How Will Crypto Be Built for Everyday People?<p><p>Kraken is one of the oldest and most successful cryptocurrency companies in the U.S., serving more than 2.5 million active users. It launched its token, KNOX, in October 2019, and then launched the second token, KOPRX, in April 2020.<p>

headline: Ethereum Exchange Coinbase Adds Support for Multi-Chain Data Sharing
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase is adding support for multi-chain data sharing.<p><p>According to a blog post Friday, the firm added support for multi-chain data sharing to the platform as part of its multi-party computation solution in collaboration with the Ethereum Foundation.<p><p>The multi-party computation solution works similarly to data storage solutions currently offered by ComputeChain and Compound. Multi-chain data is data stored on the blockchain, while Ethereum provides data storage for multiple parties.<p><p>In addition to providing multi-party computation, Coinbase plans to introduce additional support for multi-party computation in Q3, though the update is not as concrete as Coinbase’s plans to add support for multi-chain computation.<p><p>“There are multiple benefits and drawbacks that can arise from the multi-party computation model,” said Coinbase’s head of product, Chris Dixon. “First of all, multi-chain data is data that can be transferred between parties using a single block of code. Second, the multi-party computation model works well on Ethereum, and we’re happy to provide it to our customers.”<p><p>Coinbase has also previously said that it will keep offering the multi-party computation solution until there are “moments” in which a multi-party computation solution is available, something that was previously rumored.<p>

headline: Crypto Exchange Coinbase Sees Shortage in Its Cash App and a Lot of Risk
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase may be stuck with a long overdue shortage of cash.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Says It’s Been Pouring $20M Into A Crypto Staking Fund That Isn’t Built for Dollars<p>

headline: PayPal CEO Says Cryptocurrency Can Make Business Sense
content: <p>PayPal’s CEO, Tim Lee, has said that cryptocurrencies can be used to make businesses more efficient, like helping them navigate the economic downturn.<p><p>Also read: PayPal Plans to Bring Back Crypto Custodian Bittrex to the US<p>

headline: JPMorgan’s DeFi Core Project Is Going Live on Ethereum With $10M in Investment
content: <p>Blockchain tech giant JPMorgan says its Core Foundation has raised $10 million in a seed round for a blockchain-based alternative to its traditional asset management business, Ethereum.<p><p>Also read: JPMorgan Execs Expect Central Bank Digital Currencies to Drive Financial Stability, Says ‘Scalability’ in Central Bank Digital Currency<p>

headline: Lately, Crypto Custodian BitGo Pledges Its Blockchain Solution to Double Fees on Transactions From Its NFTs
content: <p>BitGo has partnered with another major cryptocurrency custodian to add a fee to its non-fungible token (NFT) trading.<p><p>“We are pleased to have joined the growing community of crypto custodians offering our service to the community,” said BitGo CEO Changpeng Zhao. “This collaboration with BitGo makes it easy for the community to easily participate in our NFT lending and trading, and also enables our clients to quickly and safely withdraw their funds.”<p><p>Zhao said bitcoin is a highly valued asset, and BitGo will continue to support its clients’ crypto custody. The firm has already announced it will move over $30 billion in crypto assets into NFTs to support the company’s business.<p><p>Zhao said BitGo will likely keep the fee as low as possible for new custodians to comply with federal and state regulations.<p><p>Read more: BitGo Launches First Bitcoin ATM in Australia<p><p>CoinDesk reached out to BitGo for comment on Wednesday afternoon.<p>

headline: The Bitcoin Crypto ETF Futures Trading Firm BlockchainShares’ Custody Launches With Token Sales
content: <p>A new “blockchain-based trading platform” for bitcoin-related stocks is now live on BlockchainShares’ website.<p><p>See also: US Bank Nuts $50M Investment in Crypto-Trading Firm CryptoShares<p>

headline: Ethereum Developer Lisk Adds Blockchain-Based Asset Listing and Debit Card Listing, Will Now Compete With Coinbase
content: <p>Announced Wednesday, ErisX, the Ethereum-based custodian for decentralized finance (DeFi) apps, has added a blockchain-based option for offering “a decentralized asset-asset-listing and transaction list with blockchain-backed tokens,” according to an announcement released by ErisX.<p><p>ErisX is one of three institutions with a partnership with blockchain-based custodian Chainlink and Bitmend to offer the offering. Chainlink said in a press release that it currently has the first sign-on order with ErisX for asset-asset-listing and transaction lists.<p><p>Chainlink’s offering will also bring Chainlink’s product suite to DeFi through a partnership with Coinbase. This enables Chainlink to offer its users “a DeFi experience that allows them to get started,” Chainlink CEO Christopher Sun said in a press release.<p><p>See also: Ethereum Startup ErisX Joins Coinbase-Backed Project on Its DeFi Token Listing<p><p>Chainlink currently has two products in its portfolio: a multi-token (MLT) token called ErisX Cosmos, a blockchain-based DeFi token, and a block explorer (BCH). A new product offering is slated for release in the near future.<p>

headline: USDCs Help Coronavirus-Fuelled Crypto Brokers Survive in South Africa
content: <p>The world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange announced on Tuesday it has teamed with South Africa’s central bank to launch a $2 billion funding plan aimed at helping coronavirus-linked coronavirus-fighting crypto companies stay afloat.<p><p>Cryptocurrency exchange Coronavirus is one of several financial products being offered in South Africa by the Central Bank of South Africa (CBSA), but not necessarily for the U.S. or Europe.<p><p>Read more: South Africa’s Blockchain Ledger Is Changing Banking, Not Finance<p><p>“Central Bank of South Africa’s (CBSA) blockchain initiative is aimed at building a platform for financial services for the blockchain sector and to build interoperability among blockchains and blockchain protocols,” said Coronavirus spokesperson Caitlin Robinson.<p><p>The U.S. CBSA plans to grant licenses to several South African banks in the near future and the South Africa government recently launched an interest rate cut for cryptocurrency businesses. The new funds are being earmarked for local banks to use to invest in their customers’ cryptocurrency and other assets, Robinson added.<p>

headline: Kraken Buys $40M in Digital Assets for $100M in a Proposal to Keep Bitcoin Private
content: <p>Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken, an asset manager for the crypto industry, is buying back some of its holdings for $100 million, valuing at over $100 million.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Firm BitFlyer Taps Bitcoin Investment From $2M to $20M for Crypto Trading<p>

headline: Seychelles 2020 trade surplus hits 11.2M bn T, more than $12 bln bn per trader
content: <p>Seychelles, which was hit hard by the COVID-19 pandemic, is on track to record more trade surplus than expected in 2020, said the International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday.<p><p>The surplus will be allocated to infrastructure and education for the country’s 27,400 trading partners as part of a wider strategy to boost exports.<p><p>A separate IMF statement said the surplus will be used to expand the 2020 global economy by up to 5.4% over the next 20 years, while extending the 2020 trade surplus by another 5.5%.<p><p>The International Monetary Fund will assess the situation in the coming months and, when appropriate, will assess trade impact from 2020 and the next-largest transacting countries, in particular South Korea and Hong Kong, as well as any other potential trade surplus in the period up to December 2020.<p><p>“We look forward to continuing to promote robust growth in global trade through investments to build capacity and promote employment,” said IGO Managing Director Elisabeth Jang.<p><p>The $12 billion figure came from the General Administration of Customs (GAC), which manages the trade deficit across all trading partners, as well as a separate IMF statement, published by the Office for the United Nations Development Programme.<p>

headline: UPDATE 1-Russia's economy contracted by 1.6% in 2020 amid stimulus
content: <p>* COVID-19 infections in 2020-21: preliminary estimates<p><p>* COVID-19 cases expected to reach 1.7 million this year<p><p>* Russia will need to implement ‘new measures’ in 2022, says IMF<p><p>LIMA, Jan 19  - Russia’s economy contracted by 1.6% in 2020 amid massive stimulus measures and a deep recession, the statistics office said on Wednesday, as coronavirus-related deaths and economic growth slumped.<p><p>The Russia National Institute of Statistics said coronavirus infections in 2020-21 were 2.4 million. In 2020, they were 8.8 million.<p><p>The government expects Russia to expand its vaccine programme next year, it added. It said in an update that the number of coronavirus cases expected in 2022 was 2.6 million.<p><p>It said coronavirus infections and coronavirus infections in the 12 countries that were part of the 2008-2009 global financial crash had decreased by 5.8% year-on-year.<p><p>The Russia government is due to present its budget for next year on Tuesday.<p><p>($1 = 1.7125 roubles)<p>

headline: UPDATE 1-Mexican consumer price rises accelerate in Q1 but slump in Q2 - Ministry
content: <p>(Adds details, analyst comment)<p><p>MEXICO CITY, Feb 23  - Mexican consumer prices increased in the first quarter of 2020 as the global pandemic forced manufacturers to cut production and output, official data showed on Wednesday, but that the slump in the cost of goods also helped fuel an upwardly revised economic growth in the first half of 2021.<p><p>The annual consumer price index rose 0.2% in 2020, after falling 0.1% in the previous quarter, according to official data.<p><p>“The economy recovered, with the biggest rise in consumption in Q1, with the biggest decline in output in Q2,” the Ministry of Finance said in a statement, citing data from the National Institute of Statistics, published on Wednesday.<p><p>But analysts and economists say that, even as the number of coronavirus infections among consumers fell, the peso recovery was also supported by a surge in export orders.<p><p>Mexico is the world’s top consumer of meat and eggs.<p><p>“While the impact of the pandemic has been large, we think the recovery in prices will continue,” said Anthony Di Marzion, economics associate professor at the University of Santander in Madrid, Spain.<p>

headline: Binance, Lending Service Broke After Two Largest Breach in Nearly 2 Years
content: <p>Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency lending and trading platform, has been rocked by two major hacks involving $300 million in crypto deposits and withdrawals between March and September.<p><p>A breach of the firm’s security at least four times in two years saw millions of dollars lost in the last 24 hours, according to a filing by the regulator.<p><p>The hack happened on May 29, according to the filing. In addition to receiving $2 million in cryptocurrency withdrawals from various accounts, Binance has reported receiving more than $5.3 million in cryptocurrency donations in the same period. <p><p>The cryptocurrency exchange said the theft happened over a month later, and that in September, it said it had reported its breach on Aug. 6. The firm had told customers that withdrawals had been affected. <p><p>The total amount of crypto lost in the last 24 hours was $300 million.<p><p>“Binance did not take full responsibility for the events described,” the company said in a statement. “Additionally, Binance has suspended all customer banking accounts, which included those with the most users on our platform, and has also discontinued all activities with respect to the exchange’s internal governance and controls.”<p><p>Read more: Binance CEO Said He Had Nothing to Do With Crypto Hack<p>

headline: Ethereum Startup Lets You Access Bitcoin With a New Smart Contract
content: <p>A token-backed decentralized finance (DeFi) app is coming to market at an even higher price.<p><p>Cryptocurrency market cap is now around $300 billion, according to its latest data from the firm CryptoCompare. In February, crypto exchange BitGo raised around $100 million in a Series B led by Ethereum VC Dan Schulman.<p><p>While the platform’s value fluctuated with the recent events, BitGo’s tokenization is now well over a billion USD, according to Egor Silbert, CEO and co-founder of CryptoCompare.<p><p>Read more: Ethereum Startup CryptoCompare Adds Lightning Network Support to Its Blockchain Tokenization<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin’s Lightning Network Needs to Step Up Its Access to the DeFi Market<p><p>The tokenization is a smart contract that utilizes the Lightning Network’s transaction fee structure, Egor Silbert told CoinDesk in an interview.<p><p>The protocol allows for transactions to be made via the Ethereum Lightning Network, which makes payments faster and more transparent. In 2019, it launched an Ethereum-based product called DeFi Protocol. It’s currently listed on Binance’s platform for $4.6 billion, with some estimates in the past weeks as the company plans to launch a wallet for users to manage transactions in the future.<p>

headline: New Jersey Flood Relief Bill Would Put Millions of Taxpayers at Risk: Report
content: <p>The New Jersey Flood Relief Plan, if passed, would require people in New Jersey to pay more in taxes to the state treasury than what the plan requires, according to a report Monday by the Institute for Justice, one of the groups pushing the measure.<p><p>The plan, which would see New Jersey “pay ‘less than $400 per person’ in payroll taxes for every dollar spent,” is modeled on an existing state tax bill that was passed last year to fund relief to the needy.<p><p>“If New Jersey did not pay this amount of tax, the state would receive $1.3 billion in additional federal money for rebuilding and rebuilding the state,” according to the report, which was prepared by the Institute for Justice and funded by a combination of state and federal aid.<p><p>The report, which was prepared at the request of the governor’s office, cites New York, which has a similar scheme. The governor proposed the plan for New Jersey in 2018.<p><p>The federal relief package would be funded by a $425 million grant from the General Fund and a $500 million grant from the Internal Revenue Service.<p><p>The Institute for Justice wrote that the plan could generate “considerable upward pressure” on the state’s revenue, particularly given the state is in a very weak economy.<p>

headline: Fidelity Digital Assets’ Cryptocurrency Is Now Preparing for an IPO
content: <p>Cryptocurrency investment firm Fidelity Digital Assets (FDIA), the world’s largest investment firm, is entering the cryptocurrency space.<p><p>Fidelity Digital Assets’s parent company, Digital Currency Group, has announced it will open up a crypto custody subsidiary in partnership with New York State’s Office of the Comptroller of the Currency.<p><p>“With this partnership, Fidelity Digital Assets will become a leading cryptocurrency custodian in the state of New York and will continue providing crypto services to our clients throughout New York City and the surrounding region,” a press release from the firm said.<p><p>FDIA has been the first company to publicly announce a cryptocurrency custody subsidiary, although the FCA did so at the height of the coronavirus pandemic, at the height of the Nasdaq crypto-indexing craze in 2018.<p><p>Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase has yet to file a form of capital gains tax claim.<p><p>Cryptocurrency mining, a form of gambling, is a popular hobby among crypto traders, but it’s still frowned upon for the non-trivial number of crypto miners that are still operating.<p><p>The Crypto-Asset Alliance recently announced a Crypto Fund. The crypto-asset alliance has also announced plans to create a Crypto Trust Fund.<p>
