headline: Algorithmic Algorithmic Stocks to Buy 100 More Crypto Custodians in January
content: <p>Backed by investment bank Digital Asset Group, Algorithmic has started trading on the crypto markets and is planning to buy 100 more of the firm’s crypto custody systems, Bloomberg reported.<p><p>Read more: Algorithmic Is Building the Future of Digital Assets With Blockchain, Not Just Trading<p>

headline: German retail sales fall last month - business survey
content: <p>BERLIN  - Retail sales in Germany slumped last month in a business survey that suggested they are now slipping further.<p><p>A survey of companies by the German Retail Federation (ARB) showed a decline in German retail sales in January compared with the previous month, which was the first month of contraction in the survey period.<p><p>The decline, which compared with a one-month low of 4.8% in December, was the largest in the survey period and came despite the recovery in consumer spending in recent months.<p><p>The decline in the new-home buyer purchasing managers’ survey also saw the first fall of a fourth consecutive month in February, down from the same month a year earlier.<p><p>Retail sales fell 3.5% last month on an annual basis, compared with a year earlier.<p><p>Compared with last month, retail sales rose by a record 49.4% in January, the biggest monthly decline in a year.<p><p>The German government, which started to look into the sector in October, said last month that it expected retail sales to slow last year.<p><p>That will be partly because the government expects the purchasing managers’ survey to provide a better picture of the recovery in consumer spending this year and that they will continue to do so this year as the government reviews the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the economy, which began this month.<p>

headline: Avanti, the French bank holding back on lending to the euro area, will lend out 1.6% to investors on loans at the end of the month
content: <p>  - Avanti Bank will start lending at its Paris-based endowment on a quarterly basis this year, a senior executive from the bank said on Thursday.<p><p>The bank, which has some 200,000 employees in France, aims to double its global operations this year to 3 million employees.<p><p>Its share price increased 0.3% last week to close at $3.50 after the announcement.<p>

headline: Ripple Creditors Will Now Pay Employees to Raise ‘Corporate Self-Interest’
content: <p>The Ripple co-founder and CEO, who is also a shareholder of the digital assets startup ConsenSys, says his firm has a “corporate self-interest” requirement for new hires to make “business decisions”.<p><p>“There’s an element of the self-interest that people often have,” Ripple said in an interview. “This is a good thing.”<p><p>Read more: Ripple’s CEO Says Bitcoin Is Not a Security, but a Tool for Corporate Governance<p><p>“I can go and make an employee’s first decision on a particular issue, then, if that matters to me personally and I feel comfortable having a more flexible view of how it should be done in the future, I can also make a shareholder’s second decision.”<p><p>Read more: ‘All I’m saying is there’s an element of self-interest that can exist in corporate culture that isn’t necessarily sustainable for the company in the long run,” Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse said.<p><p>Ripple says its employees will now be paid based on the quality of their performance over time as the firm scales up to meet the need for more employees, in addition to the salary they earn now. <p>

headline: Algorand’s Crypto Platform Goes Live on Ethereum
content: <p>A new version of Algorand, a decentralized exchange, has been released on Ethereum as of Sunday.<p><p>See also: DeFi DeFi Alliance Unlocks $2M in Series A Funding Round for Algorand<p>

headline: Covid-19: A Complex Process That Wants to Fix
content: <p>Cryptocurrency trading platform Covid-19 is on track to go live, with plans to introduce new features in the second half of 2021.<p><p>According to a release by its developer community group, the startup launched its inaugural ICO in July 2019, launching on Ethereum, using the “Ethereum Proof-of-Stake (PoS) network.” Covid-19 is said to be a project that will attempt to address both “market-wide liquidity issues (which are related to low fees) and ‘blockchain governance challenges (which are related to government regulatory risk) by providing governance tokens to participants.”<p><p>However, with the addition of Ethereum to the mix, Covid-19 is now a limited liability company, the release states. “By virtue of the nature of Covid-19’s business model, it is impossible to know if Covid-19 can be integrated in other projects in future,” the release reads.<p><p>See also: Why Crypto Is Not a Crime, It’s a Strategy<p><p>As such, users of Covid-19 will receive a digital coin called Covid-19, which is an ERC-20 token that has no value or redeemable in the form of cash, according to the release. <p><p>It will also be available as an alternative to U.S. dollars with an agreed-upon transfer amount of $10 million (USDC), according to the release.<p>

headline: New Jersey Crypto Bank Plans to Issue License for Crypto Service in New Jersey
content: <p>Cryptocurrency investment bank Securitize, which also handles credit and custody for crypto investors, has filed a application with the New Jersey Department of Financial Services, which is slated to open in early 2021.<p><p>Read more: Securitize Now Provides Custody Services to Crypto Debit Cardholders in New Jersey<p>

headline: Praetor Raises $2.4M Funding Round Led by Binance Capital
content: <p>Praetor, a decentralized exchange (dEX) that allows for decentralized applications (dapps) to trade, is raising $2.4 million from Binance Capital and other investors.<p><p>See also: Crypto Exchange Raises $5.5M Funding Round Led by Binance Capital<p>

headline: E-commerce giant Rakuten to Invest $500M in Bitcoin Research
content: <p>Founded by former Rakuten staffer Sumit Gupta in 2013, eToro is a blockchain project developed by the eToro Foundation and its partners. The project uses the bitcoin’s block reward as a mathematical proof to show how the bitcoin itself (oracle tokens) work in real-life.<p><p>Rakuten’s first project was to provide bitcoin trading on Rakuten Network. Rakuten Network enables decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms to offer high-performance trading for bitcoin. Rakuten, founded by Sumit Gupta in 2015, raised a total of $500 million in 2018.<p><p>In 2019, Rakuten released the first eToro wallet, the eToro ERC-20 Wallet. The wallet enables users to earn bitcoin on eToro’s ERC-20 token.<p><p>In 2019, eToro launched a proof-of-concept for its bitcoin mining machine, called the EMR-2.1 mining machine. EMR-2.1 was a proof-of-stake protocol in the Bitcoin mining industry.<p><p>Read more: Rakuten’s Bitcoin Mining Machine Becomes the First Crypto Firm to Launch On Ethereum<p><p>In 2015, Rakuten released the ERC-20’s ERC-20 “Proof-of-Stake” protocol, which was based on the Proof of Stake (PoS) standard. The ERC-20 protocol uses a novel algorithm called XRP to mine bitcoin.

headline: Rome’s Flood Relief Program Raises $120M in Funding
content: <p>Rome’s federal disaster relief program has raised a total of $120 million, the National Enquirer reported on Tuesday.<p><p>The money came from a $20 million federal grant, the first phase of which was announced Tuesday by the Department of Homeland Security. The grants came after a $12 million funding round from the Bank of England and the New York State Department of Finance.<p><p>Rome’s emergency cash relief program is aimed at low- and middle-income Americans. The aid covers areas as remote as a low-lying area such as floodplains in northwestern Italy and central New York City. In addition, roughly $6.7 million is earmarked for schools and non-profits that receive grants from state and local governments.<p><p>The program also includes federal disaster relief, such as a program for water pipes and food pantries in the country.<p><p>The $12 million funding came from the Departments of Justice, Homeland Security and Energy, according to the report. The $20 million funding round was led by the National Institute of Standards and Technology, which previously invested in Rheinmetall, the Rome-based entity that is responsible for the project.<p>

headline: Fidelity Investments Cents Bitcoin Investment Firm to Launch Crypto Fund in Q4
content: <p>Fidelity Investments has launched a cryptocurrency investment firm for its bitcoin investment firm in the fourth quarter.<p><p>See also: Fidelity Investors Pull Out of Bitcoin Fund Following Crypto Hacks<p>

headline: S&P 500 LEND Team Rolls Out $100M Token Sale for Crypto
content: <p>S&P 500, the digital asset finance protocol, announced Monday that it is starting to sell its token sale to accredited investors for up to $100 million.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the sale, which opened on the day the exchange announced its investment in S&P 500, was a $30 million raise, a portion of the overall initial coin offering (ICO) and a partial $50 million tokenization. The tokens were not specifically targeted for token sales.<p><p>Read more: NYSE: S&P 500 Launches Token Sale for Crypto Fund, Rival Market<p><p>As reported by CNBC’s Alex Wong, the firm now has enough liquidity to raise $100 million via a partnership with Anchorage Securities.<p><p>“I am thrilled that our investment in S&P 500 represents an investment in the future of crypto as we see it for what it is and also see the opportunities in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space,” said Wong.<p><p>The total sale for the crypto fund was worth approximately $8.9 billion in total volume, according to a press release.<p><p>As of press time, S&P 500 had sold 1.8 million shares so far, according to its website.<p>

headline: A New York Times Opium Exchange Plans to Buy Crypto, Bringing Bitcoin to New York Public Blockchains
content: <p>The New York Times is setting up shop on a major new platform that could soon become a crypto exchange.<p><p>According to Bloomberg Businessweek, the firm is considering setting up shop in Brooklyn, N.Y.<p><p>The firm also plans to build out its own decentralized finance (DeFi) platform with a focus on financial services, according to Bloomberg.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Exchange BitGo Rolls Out First New Platform That Lets Users Record BitGo Transactions<p>

headline: Finance Is Building the World’s First Institutional Crypto Fund
content: <p>Crypto and blockchain firms are using an array of institutional-grade funding options as part of a new fund called the Foothold Fund.<p><p>The Foothold Fund has been launched by JPMorgan Chase, Pantera Capital and Fidelity in partnership with Digital Currency Group (DCG), and offers exposure to institutional clients such as institutional-grade crypto exchanges as well as a portfolio of institutional crypto firms.<p><p>Read more: JPMorgan Chase to Begin Initial Regulatory Work for Institutional Crypto Trading in 2021<p>

headline: Fidelity Investments Is Now Paying Money Back in Bitcoin
content: <p>Fidelity Investments, which invested in bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies last year, announced Monday it has been paid $13 million in compensation for making payments to customers in the cryptocurrency sector, as reported by CNBC.<p><p>The disclosure marks a return of nearly $800 million over three years, according to the firm’s own data.<p><p>The amount of the payout is $3 million per year, matching the firm’s $6.9 million paid out to hedge fund employees in 2012.<p><p>“We believe this payment represents a major milestone,” Fred Ehrsam, Fidelity’s chief investment officer, said of the settlement. “It was a major milestone for us. It’s the first time we’ve paid out a significant amount of compensation,” he said.<p>

headline: R3 Is Avant-Faire, and Everyone Is Talking About It
content: <p>R3’s governance model is so radical that it may be best described as a paradox.<p><p>There are two ways in which R3 could function as a corporation, both of which require the ability to wield a vast amount of control over its entire ecosystem, especially over software. The first is to provide an entirely new type of governance structure with a fully transparent and decentralized framework, one that operates on a wide range of open standards such as open standards, permissioned open source and the like.<p><p>The second is to become a fully autonomous corporation, which requires an entirely new type of governance structure, one that operates on an entirely new type of standards such as open standards and permissioned open source.<p><p>This means that any changes made to the governance framework must be carried out by multiple parties, without a single intermediary – and with all parties acting independently. The R3 governance model is designed for this purpose, not a decentralized model of governance, and is structured in such a way that anyone with a “root view” of the governance structure can view it as either a node or a delegation of the responsibility to be a node.<p><p>These two approaches together make the R3 governance model the ideal framework for the development and implementation of distributed applications, which in turn will enable the development of decentralized technology that runs on open standards.<p><p>See also: Oracle – R3 Governance Model Is Inevitable<p>

headline: Bitcoin Miner Maker Lava Labs Gets US Patent for a Cryptographic Infrastructure for DeFi
content: <p>Crypto miner manufacturer Lava Labs has secured an application to build a secure, scalable and public-private network that could use blockchain technology to deliver the services of distributed ledger software.<p><p>Also read: Why The Ethereum Network Is a Complex Game for Blockchain Tech<p>

headline: The Crypto Scene Is Changing Fast: Report
content: <p>The crypto scene is entering a new phase.<p><p>There have been dozens of reports of big names on the scene, but in the last several months there has been an increase in the number of individuals joining the crypto scene. The numbers are astonishing.<p><p>See also: Crypto’s ‘Sick’ Job Is Coming to a Crypto Startup<p><p>The cryptocurrency industry has always been very diverse. From bitcoiners to miners, from crypto-takers to venture capitalists, everyone has had a background in the business. However, there has been a rapid growth for the entire industry, both online and off, which has led to a need for professionals in the crypto community to work.<p><p>There are a lot of reasons for that, and they are many. Crypto is one of the most trafficked markets today, with over 1,000 exchanges trading around $350 million in daily volume. The cryptocurrency industry has been steadily expanding since the last cryptocurrency hack in August 2018.<p><p>In the crypto world, companies can be very difficult to find and to maintain employees. Many companies have made a move, hiring many more people than they were originally intended to. However, many companies do not have employees to maintain in the first place, leading to problems like hiring staff.<p>

headline: Seedo’s Bitcoin Fund Gets Priority Priority Access to Institutional Investors After Token Sale
content: <p>Blockseed, a U.S.-based venture capital firm that’s part of the seed-owning bitcoin fund, is moving into institutional investors after a $50 million seed round.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, Seedo Capital Partners has been selected by investment management giant Seedo Capital as the first firm to receive an “institutional” position in its bitcoin fund following its $1.3 million Series B funding round from Coinbase Ventures.<p><p>“We are thrilled to announce Seedo’s first investment in bitcoin fund, as the company makes a remarkable investment in crypto asset technology,” Seedo Capital Chairman Chris Powell told CoinDesk via email. “The seed round and participation of the entire investment team make this a crucial milestone for us as we take on a new industry.”<p><p>Seedo currently has $1.3 million in seed funding in the Series B round and hopes to further expand its capital base after raising an additional $4 million in Series A funding from investment firms including Coinbase Ventures, Binance, Square, Circle and Genesis Capital.<p><p>The Series A round brought seed funding for seed funds on par with BitShares’ existing $1.9 million Series B round. A second round of funding also brings the seed fund’s total to $1.55 million, said Powell, who is joined by Jack Dorsey, the CEO of ConsenSys Ventures.<p>

headline: Dune Blockchain Pushes Blockchain Advocacy Into the Sky
content: ['<p>The global financial sector’s regulatory fight over blockchain has become one of the most critical in modern governance. In the wake of the 2020 Tokyo Decade, blockchain-based legal tools have gained widespread traction and were later adopted by regulators such as the Financial Action Task Force (FATF).<p><p>In the same vein, blockchain-based governance can help establish a framework to ensure the security of data and processes. Blockchain-based technology has become a core pillar of the global financial system.<p><p>For example, in the United States the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) recently approved a blockchain-based blockchain pilot to provide consumers with audited financial statements, which should help ensure that financial companies and regulators are adequately monitoring financial intermediaries.<p><p>A key area for blockchain is its ability to identify the types of securities the issuer of a securities is providing a client, and, if necessary, identify how financial companies are performing in the marketplace.<p><p>The blockchain pilot was led by IBM, which received the $20 million seed round from Deloitte. The startup’s blockchain-based compliance tools will be used by companies such as Oracle, which recently announced the launch of the IBM Blockchain Platform.<p><p>The pilot is a proof-of-concept, which provides a framework for the development and deployment of blockchain-based compliance tools.<p><p>Read more: IBM Blockchain Platform Raises $2.1M in Seed Round From Oracle Ventures']

headline: China's new home prices hit record high
content: ['<p>BEIJING, March 25  - Chinese new home prices hit a new record high in March, official data showed on Monday, hitting a record high as demand for new homes soared in recent months.<p><p>New home prices jumped at a faster pace than previously forecast for a record high, with new home prices in five major cities rising in March.<p><p>Prices for single-family detached homes jumped at their highest level in eight months, data from the Ministry of Industry, Industry, Energy and Food showed.<p><p>Property investment in major cities increased at their fastest pace in seven months.<p><p>New home prices are seen as a way to boost economic growth while maintaining affordability, the statistics agency said in a statement.<p><p>China’s average monthly new home price jumped 2.8% in March from February, the highest monthly level on record. The data showed new home prices are currently trading at a year-high of 459.93 million yuan ($5.17 billion).<p> ']

content: ['<p>Mt. Gox is joining forces with Bitmain to battle the growing threat from bitcoin-backed hacktivists.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Hacking Startup Bitmain Is Now Under Investigation for ‘Disabling Protocol Execution’<p> ']

headline: Bitcoin Miner Bittrex Launches Bitcoin Miners and Plans to Add 10 More in Q4
content: ['<p>Bittrex, the cryptocurrency mining business, has partnered with Bitpanda, an early-stage bitcoin mining platform that will allow customers to buy and sell bitcoin for a fraction of the cost of wholesale.<p><p>According to the announcement, Bittrex has added 10 bitcoin miners to its fleet. The companies said the firm plans to add a total of 200 miners in the fourth quarter of 2021.<p><p>Bittrex is now working on the integration of the bitcoin mining platform with Bitpanda’s network of more than 4 million machines.<p><p>Read more: Mining Pool Bitpanda Launches on Bittrex’s Blockchain, Using Ethereum, Polkadot<p> ']

headline: Binance Launches Direct Listing to All Crypto Lending Lending Platforms
content: ['<p>Binance is bringing digital lending service Direct Listing to crypto lending platforms across Europe, in addition to Binance itself.<p><p>The move comes as a slew of exchanges, banks and digital asset firms prepare to launch new lending offerings on Binance. Binance also said it will bring bitcoin-for-Bitcoin lending products to existing bitcoin lenders, with additional lending products being developed in the future.<p><p>Read more: Digital Asset Firms Are Bringing Bitcoin and Cash to Crypto Lending, But Will That Be Enough to Keep Investors From Lending<p> ']

headline: Gross Domestic Product Up 3.2% on Stablecoin Boost
content: ['<p>LONDON, Feb 9  - Gross domestic product rose 3.2% on stablecoins backed by a surge in demand, while a rebound in cryptocurrency holdings helped fuel a surge in demand for products from abroad, data showed on Monday.<p><p>Rising COVID-19 infections and a global pandemic lockdown have put a dent in demand for services, while a third wave of coronavirus infections and a surge in new infections last year prompted inflation to fall in January.<p><p>While the pound rose slightly against the euro, the rise in prices for non-alcoholic beverages edged up against the euro.<p><p>“The headline economic data confirms what we had known before: that GDP growth slowed in January,” the International Monetary Fund said in a statement.<p><p>Gross domestic product rose 1.1% on the New York Mercantile Exchange (NYMEX) “equivalent” to 0.9% in 2020, the IMF said.<p><p>The report said exports and exports of new digital currencies, which have surged in recent weeks, contributed to a rise in spending on household goods such as clothing and footwear.<p><p>“Digital currencies allow consumers to access and interact with a range of products and services more quickly and cheaply than traditional currencies,” said Pollyanna Cotten, chief economist at Capital Economics.<p>']

headline: Coinbase’s Crypto Firms Are Now Accepting Direct DeFi
content: ['<p>Coinbase, the popular fintech firm behind the U.S. dollar, has launched a crypto exchange that lets users trade cryptocurrencies directly with other Coinbase clients.<p><p>Also read: Coinbase Adopts Direct DeFi for $20M Seed Round<p> ']

headline: Binance-Ethereum Partners With German Payments Firm Pantera to Power Blockchain Services in 2021
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency exchange Binance-Ethereum (BEE) has partnered with Pantera International, the German payments company that makes payments to users.<p><p>Announced Monday, the newly formed Binance-Ethereum team will provide security services to the German company while it is working with Pantera to scale Binance-Ethereum’s services to the region of Germany. Pantera’s new partnership with the Swiss investment bank comes as Binance, which has been working on blockchain integration for years, continues its efforts to make payments in the emerging digital assets space.<p><p>“Binance-Ethereum has made an important contribution to the development of the new financial services infrastructure and it’s good to see a positive development from Binance-Ethereum’s new team members,” said Pantera CEO and COO Dan Holm. “We are very excited to provide Binance-Ethereum with an enabling platform that will give the world the digital asset services they want, regardless of where the blockchain is located.”<p><p>Binance-Ethereum is still in its infancy, and is not designed to scale directly to users or even scale quickly. But the firm’s existing network of stablecoins has helped the platform to build more than 70 percent of the network’s total assets in the past six months.<p>']

headline: Ripple Joins Crypto Custody Service, Adds Institutional Institutional Reach
content: ['<p>Ripple has joined the institutional scene in providing custody services to institutional clients.<p><p>The firm has partnered with an institutional partner, Institutional Payments Solutions, as well as several other cryptocurrency wallet providers such as Coinbase, Kraken, and Xapo, according to a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).<p><p>“Ripple has grown its custodial offering to be more institutional and institutional-grade,” the firm wrote. “This gives crypto clients greater access to the blockchain-based solutions offered by traditional banks and financial institutions in the United States and internationally.”<p><p>Ripple has a long-running history of providing security services to banks and institutions. At the beginning of last year, Ripple announced it was launching an integrated custody business.<p><p>Crypto services and institutional services for institutional clients are a familiar fit. In September 2020, Ripple partnered with crypto exchanges and payments companies to provide financial services to crypto startups.<p><p>As part of the deal, Ripple will allow institutions and institutions to hold crypto-backed stablecoins backed by traditional assets such as bitcoin, bitcoin cash, ether or dai, respectively.<p><p>Ripple also partnered with several institutions and institutions in Asia to offer crypto services. A statement on Tuesday, issued by the firm, said the partnership would bring more liquidity to crypto businesses in the region, including in the crypto sector.<p>']

headline: Algorand’s Plan to Raise $1B in 2020 for a New Crypto Trust
content: ['<p>Announced Wednesday, Algorand’s new crypto trust has a new name, the Crypto Trust Trust Fund.<p><p>The Crypto Trust Fund, which has already raised $1.7 billion in funding from more than two dozen investors, will now include over $1 billion in capital, according to a press release. It will be co-managed by Algorand co-founder Pavel Bilev.<p><p>In addition to the Crypto Trust Fund, Algorand has already added Coinbase Ventures as the trustee. The partnership also means that Algorand’s existing Crypto Trust Fund will be rebranded to the Crypto Trust Fund Trust Fund, as Bilev said in a press release.<p><p>“We are thrilled to bring Crypto Trust Fund to market,” Bilev said in a statement. “It’s a testament to the strong support Coinbase has given to Crypto Trust Fund since its founding in 2018. We look forward to supporting Crypto Trust Fund in future plans.”<p><p>Update (April 15, 16:50 UTC): Adds statement from Algorand about new custody and fee structures.<p> ']

headline: NFTs Are Consensus Dominant, Says Blockchain Firm CoinGecko
content: ['<p>NFTs are everywhere and they are now dominant. They help the decentralized finance (DeFi) industry with decentralized exchanges (DEXs), decentralized exchange (DEXs), and the decentralized financial services (DeFi) space.<p><p>However, the next generation of NFTs is not going to be all about blockchain adoption. The new generation of NFTs are focused on blockchain-based autonomous entities (DAOs). As such, they’re about the technology itself, not the transaction data.<p><p>NFTs represent a unique type of decentralized network – one that is open and decentralized, and not one that is tied to central banks or centralized banks. Their purpose is not to represent traditional financial instruments, like stock or bonds, but to protect the integrity of decentralized digital assets.<p><p>That said, NFTs are also used by professional organizations to provide protection, security and fairness for asset owners in the crypto space. The purpose of a blockchain is to ensure compliance with the legal obligations of a corporation, not the ability to issue a security token.<p><p>The NFT space is expanding quickly. NFT adoption is accelerating, but decentralized autonomous organizations (DAOs) are still not mainstream enough. It’s becoming a question of what are the next mainstream decentralized applications and how do we best manage the growing demand for these new applications.<p>']

headline: Hackers Can Buy Bitcoin, Ether, Other Digital Assets on the Blockchain
content: ['<p>An anonymous hacker has begun stealing more than 100,000 bitcoin, ether and other assets from over 100,000 merchants in an effort to gain access to digital assets, according to the firm known as Hacking Team.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Acquires Bitcoin and Other Assets in an Attempt to Gain Access to Crypto<p> ']

headline: S.Korea's Economy Thripped Back to Its Decade of Lowest Unemployment
content: ['<p>A growing number of South Korean adults are unemployed, but many people are working from home because the government is focused on improving education and social security and has not stepped up the enforcement of those measures, according to a survey released Friday by South Korea’s National Bureau of Statistics.<p><p>In December, 14.4% of all South Korean adults reported being unemployed, compared to 12.3% in November, and 18.6% in October. That followed a decrease of 8.2% in November, the most since October 2018, when 16.0% of the population reported being unemployed.<p><p>The unemployment rate stood at 5.0%, well below the national average of 5.2%, which was 11.8% in November. The rate of layoffs, however, remains relatively high. The median jobless rate for the region is 3.7%, well below the median for almost all other countries, and at an average rate of 4.5%.<p><p>Although the country’s public sector is still struggling under the state’s emergency relief package, public sector workers such as teachers and school administrators have remained at home, driving down the unemployment rate. The number of public sector employees working from home rose to 17.1% from 14.3% in December.<p><p>The median number of people working from home, based on data collected by the Korean Labour Department, fell to 49.3% from 49.2% in November.<p>']

headline: Binance Raises $12M in Seed Round for Crypto Fund
content: ['<p>Digital asset fund Binance has raised $12 million in a Series B funding round.<p><p>See also: Binance Raises $12M in Seed Round for Crypto Fund<p> ']

headline: Ethereum Startup Binance Raises $2M From New Investors
content: ['<p>Binance has announced it has secured $2 million in funding from new investors in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space.<p><p>The company, founded in 2018, has built a reputation for building blockchain-based services, with a strong focus on decentralized applications (dapps) and blockchains.<p><p>Launched in May, Binance has been building decentralized applications (dapp) since 2017, with notable efforts in blockchain tech like DeFiX and DeFiX Pro, and has been steadily building out its product suite as it has moved in and out of its own internal roadmap.<p><p>“We believe the ecosystem is rapidly evolving and we’re excited to lead this evolution with Binance,” Binance CEO Pavel Durov told CoinDesk in a phone interview. “With the growth in the ecosystem and the opportunity to take the world’s largest decentralized finance (DeFi) project forward, we’re excited to join Binance’s growing and enthusiastic community.”<p><p>Launched in May 2018, Binance initially focused on Ethereum’s ERC-20 standard, but its team quickly grew to include several other projects that had less technical chops.<p><p>In 2018, Binance raised $2 million in a Series A round led by Digital Currency Group and Polychain Capital, led by Blockstream Capital.<p>']

headline: Cleveland Chiefs Take Back $40M From Players Who Donate Crypto to Bitcoin Foundation
content: ['<p>The Cleveland Chiefs won an unexpected victory on Thursday when they were rewarded with another $40 million in bitcoin (BTC) donations. <p><p>Announced Thursday, the clubs are using bitcoin to support the $9.3 million a year the NFL Players Association (PPA) is providing in grants and programs through the Foundation for International Development, or IFID. <p><p>“The $40 million is huge. It means a lot to us, to get a first hand view of the impact that these funds have on the league, which is really the best part of this game,” Chiefs <PAD>  receiver Kelvin Benjamin said in a statement. “We are grateful for this funding and support. It’s just an incredible moment for the game.”<p><p>In the first round of the 2018 draft, the Chiefs picked DE Cameron Fleming with the ninth pick, while the Cleveland Chiefs picked CB Josh Reynolds with the fifth pick.<p><p>“The funds we’re giving to the PPA reflect the impact our players and clubs are having on the game today,” said Benoit Ehrhoff, CEO and founder of the IFID Program, in a press release. “These funds go a long way toward helping the clubs continue to grow.”<p><p>Since the trade of wide receiver Josh Reynolds to the Chiefs last July, the PPA has used their funds to invest in programs supporting international development initiatives like UNICEF and the United Nations Development Program. <p>']

headline: China March jobs grow 0.3% y/y, jobless rate falls 4.2%
content: ['<p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s labor market continued to expand on Thursday, its first full week of growth since April, boosted by robust job growth in the country’s manufacturing sector, as well as export-oriented services as the coronavirus pandemic, official data showed.<p><p>Workers’ annual figure for January rose 4.2% on a year-on-year basis, official data showed.<p><p>The pace of increase in January was 1.7% from a year earlier, when the country’s economy shrank 0.3%. (Reporting by Jia-Chia Liu, Editing by Paul Simao)<p> ']

headline: Sterling, Nasdaq Down by 20% on China's Dec. 31 RME DeFi Jump
content: ['<p>Crypto exchange Sterling, which filed for bankruptcy on Dec. 31, suffered its worst ever December loss as investors flocked to the Nasdaq Stock Exchange, which fell over 30% in January.<p><p>The Nasdaq Composite index of crypto exchanges rose to a four-month high of 102.63, from 104.83 in December. That was the worst monthly gain on record, according to Bloomberg.<p><p>The news comes after Nasdaq, which had more than 20% of its market value on Tuesday, posted a 20.0% jump, which helped the Nasdaq Composite Index fall below the 95% threshold necessary to be classified as a net loss.<p><p>Sterling also experienced its biggest price gains since May 2016, when the index rose 11.5%. It then posted a 6.5% gain in December.<p><p>A second round of Nasdaq DeFi jump, this time via the Polkadot protocol, came in at 0.95% for the month, according to Bloomberg.<p><p>The Nasdaq DeFi Jump came on top of a Reuters poll showing it was the deepest of any exchange. Nasdaq saw a 35.3% loss on the year, which led the Reuters poll.<p><p>It was Sterling’s third year in the Nasdaq Top 20 with a drop of 11.8%, following the April 10-12 loss of 9.8%.']

headline: Mentor-Pledging Startup DeFi Is Back at $30M and More With $5M in Funding
content: ['<p>A decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, DeFi Hub, has raised $30 million for its capital markets funding round.<p><p>The funding comes from angel investors and venture capital firms led by MicroStrategy, Citi Ventures, Bain Capital and Digital Currency Group (DCG).<p><p>“While it may be the first time in DeFi history that a DeFi company raised money through a token sale, we believe that this technology, along with its potential, will be the catalyst for a future of DeFi that can transcend institutional markets,” DeFi Alliance CEO Alex DiFi said in a statement.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Core Dev Behind DeFi Startup ‘DeFi Project’ Gets $100K Fund From VCs<p><p>The funding round also comes with a commitment to support “market infrastructure development,” DiFi said.<p><p>Read more: $10M Funding Round Launches on Matic Network as DeFi Platform<p><p>With the funding, DeFi Alliance intends to build a “unique user experience” for DeFi products, such as the ability to access liquidity via a decentralized exchange (DEX) or a regulated exchange (DX).<p>']

headline: Seychelles-based Antares Blockchain Adds Ripple Payment Services
content: ['<p>Seychelles-based Antares Blockchain has added the ability to make payments via Ripple payments network Ripple Payments.<p><p>See also: Antares Blockchain Is Developing a Payment System for Central Banks<p> ']

headline: China’s COVID-19 Risks to COVID-19 Resurgence, Economy
content: ['<p>China’s economic growth likely has reached the limit of the 2020 Lunar New Year, but a shortage of medicines and food imports has meant the country’s economy is less likely to return to pre-COVID-19 levels than it was in April.<p><p>At its peak in March, China imported 6.4 million tonnes of COVID-19 products per day, down from a peak of 6.7 million tonnes in February 2020. That was in the midst of a massive coronavirus pandemic that has been crippling economic activity in a country that is under strict state-run quarantine.<p><p>The situation has worsened since then, however, as demand for COVID-19 vaccines is running out, as well as the potential for a more widespread vaccine rollout.<p><p>To meet demand, Chinese authorities are tightening quarantine rules and putting restrictions on outdoor activities. At a press conference on Friday, state-run Xinhua news agency said at least 1.3 million people in China were expected to return to their homes by March, an increase of 5.3%.<p><p>By mid-year, China may have imported 1.75 million tonnes of COVID-19 per day, the Xinhua report said.<p><p>Economy Minister Zhou Jianlin said the country will soon release a detailed timeline for COVID-19 vaccination plans.<p>']

headline: U.S. crude oil imports drop 2.6% in March, slowest since April
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - U.S. crude oil imports fell 2.6% in March, customs data showed on Wednesday, though there was a modest slowdown compared with a similar month a year earlier when oil shipments slumped 10.9% as prices hovered around $50, a record low.<p><p>The Commerce Department said shipments of crude oil by U.S. refiners rose 2.8% in March from a year earlier, mostly in the Middle East and North Africa region.<p><p>In the three months through March, the Commerce department reported 2,879,332 barrels of crude oil. (Reporting by Thomas Seythal; Editing by Jonathan Oatis and Jacqueline Wong)<p> ']

headline: Auctions Frenzy Is Now Available on Ebay
content: ['<p>Auctions Frenzy is now live in Australia as part of Ebay’s $40 million fundraising effort. <p><p>Announced Thursday, the auction house has sold over 2 million of the popular eBay auction house’s collectibles to help fund a new initiative aimed at giving children with disabilities access to education. <p><p>The collection includes items from the popular videogame “Super Mario Maker 2: The Two-Headed Giant” and is currently on sale at over $100,000, according to Ebay. The auction house said it was also planning to increase its sale in the next month, starting at $50,000.<p><p>The initiative also has an auction for collectibles for children. <p><p>The upcoming event will see auctions of collectibles and accessories including Lego, Lego Nintendos and Lego collectibles. <p><p>“This year’s auction, and the number of items that have been sold so far this year, we were really excited to see what we can do with this massive amount of Lego that we’ve already brought to market,” Ebay COO James Reynolds said in a statement.<p><p>See also: Ebay Raises $4.5M to Help Expand Auction House’s Salesforce Marketplace<p>']

headline: Kitties Don’t Have to Be Frugal to Get Bitcoin
content: ['<p>Kitties are one of the oldest collectibles in the world. They were originally made to be bought and sold for pennies, but they soon became an everyday part of everyday life in New York.<p><p>Since the late 1800s, their popularity has grown exponentially. They were released as collectibles in 1901 by the James Bond movie, Bondtales, and in 1901 by the James Bond television series.<p><p>Today, every kittie is available to play the role of a banker in a world of super-powered people and a super-charged financial system.<p><p>For many, that means spending $10,000 to get a kittie. They can also be used to make new collectible coins, collectible tokens, or otherwise purchase more coins, as the dollar coins were used to create the famous penny coin on CoinGecko in 18 <PAD>.<p><p>Kitties, or kitties as they are known in the U.S., have been circulating for a very long time. They were a simple plastic item that was made out of metal. As collectors, we bought them, we bought money, and we bought money to make them go on sale.<p><p>The oldest collectible in the world today is the penny coin, issued in 1901. The coin was created by J. Bond in order to represent the man who invented the money supply. It is a special and rare coin from the world of British collectibles.<p>']

headline: Binance CEO Joins New ‘Investment Circle’ From Crypto-Backed Binance
content: ['<p>Binance’s CEO, Jerome H. Powell, will join its new “Investment Circle” from cryptocurrency entrepreneur and Binance alum Robert Mercer and former Binance COO Patrick Byrne as well as veteran investor Hugh T. Bezos of the Bezos-backed Amazon Group.<p><p>In a statement, Powell said Binance’s new investment arm is “a great addition to our team and we look forward to engaging with the broader community on Binance’s long-term growth strategy.”<p><p>Bundled with Binance’s $1.4 billion in total assets, Powell will oversee a new “equity ecosystem” around equity and treasury products. Binance has since made acquisitions in order to diversify the crypto-focused space and its strategic focus.<p><p>Powell’s new position will help Binance better compete with other crypto-focused institutions, he added.<p><p>“We are thrilled to join a long-established venture capital arm that has been instrumental in shaping the Binance ecosystem,” Powell said. “I’m excited to join the Binance Capital Group’s investment in the firm and look forward to working with the team at Binance in the coming years.”<p> ']

headline: How to Make Your Startup A Blockchain Startup
content: ['<p>It might be tempting to build a blockchain business that doesn’t involve anyone but you. In this post, I’ll show you how to create it.<p><p>I’m not trying to create blockchain projects with every idea in mind. Instead, I’m going to tell you how to build them and give you the tools to do the same.<p><p>See also: Ethereum Developer Joins Blockchain Lab as Founder<p><p>First things first: Creating a startup is easy, especially when it comes to blockchain.  <p><p>Before you start this, though, I’m sure you’ll need some foundational knowledge about how Ethereum works.  <p><p>When Ethereum became “centralized,” as the founders at Compound had it, there were a number of decentralized organizations (DEOs) on which you could run your own decentralized applications, called nodes. These DEOs, or dApps, could do everything from selling services, to hosting and trading, to making the world a better place.<p><p>Many organizations, like the Facebook-owned Facebook Enterprise, have expressed interest in building decentralized applications. While Ethereum had some successes there, many did not. Even today, decentralized applications, or Dapp-as-a-Service (DAAs) or Dapps that run on top of Ethereum, are largely unregulated.  <p><p>Why Do Dapps Fail?<p>']

headline: Cannabis Businesses Expand in India
content: ['<p>India’s cannabis businesses have started expanding in the country and are opening up businesses in five other regions as part of the rollout of the country’s medical marijuana law.<p><p>Read more: India’s Biggest Cannabis Businesses Now Accept Visa, Mastercard, PayPal, etc<p> ']

headline: China's Dec factory activity expanded at highest rate since March
content: ['<p>BEIJING  - Activity at China’s biggest factory, China Steel, rose at its fastest pace since March, expanding at its fastest pace in more than a year as factory output continued to expand at its fastest pace since the second half of last year, government data showed on Friday.<p><p>Total factory output increased 6.9% in December from a year earlier as firms expanded their operations amid the COVID-19 pandemic. The government said the growth rate in the third quarter was unchanged at 2.0% for the first nine months of 2020.<p><p>China’s gross domestic product (GDP), accounting for almost half of China’s economy, expanded at a 10.5% pace in December, its highest monthly rate since September 2018. Analysts had forecast a 4.3% expansion rate.<p><p>The data came amid strong growth for the fourth consecutive month as manufacturers continue to work on ways to boost growth and keep prices stable, with factories reporting a 10.6% growth pace in January.<p><p>Factory activity in December grew at its fastest pace since March, slowing from an 8.7% pace in November after an unexpectedly strong 12.7% increase in the previous month, the National Bureau of Statistics said on Friday.<p><p>The factory index was based on manufacturing activity data from December before the pandemic hit, it added.<p> ']

headline: Fintech Firm BitLicense to Bring Crypto Lending for Ex-Bitcoin Investors
content: ['<p>A blockchain-based lender for digital assets firm BitLicense has been granted a license by the Gibraltar Financial Regulatory Authority (FINRA). <p><p>Read more: Gibraltar’s Finra Eyes Institutional Crypto Firms Including Cryptocurrency Lending Services<p> ']

headline: China's COVID-19 coronavirus fatalities fall to a record low - official
content: ['<p>BEIJING  - China’s coronavirus cases fell to a record low in November, official figures showed on Wednesday, as coronavirus infections in the world’s biggest economy grew slightly higher than forecast.<p><p>The number of coronavirus deaths climbed 0.8% year-on-year in November from December, while coronavirus deaths fell 0.5% on-year, official data showed.<p><p>China’s coronavirus cases dropped 10.3% on-year from October, the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) said.<p><p>For November, there were 7,719 cases, which represents an 11.9% drop from the 11,976 deaths that were recorded in December, the Statistics Department said in a statement.<p><p>That compared with a 19.3% fall in December, a flash estimate from the Ministry of Health and Family Planning.<p> ']

headline: BitLicense’s Token Sale Ends Tuesday
content: ['<p>BitLicense has sold over $1.9 million worth of its BitLicense token.<p><p>BitLicense announced Tuesday it has sold $14.7 million worth of its BitLicense token, which enables people to earn money from token sales in cryptocurrency.<p><p>“As the holders of this token, you can earn bitcoin on this platform for free,” the company said in a blog post. “Bitcoin is the best way to earn bitcoin.”<p><p>The announcement comes three weeks after BitLicense announced it had sold its $10 million worth of its BitLicense token to Binance, the same institutional financial services firm. It later added $10 million worth of its BitLicense token, and now trades on Coinbase and Uniswap.<p><p>Cryptocurrency and token sales are notoriously volatile and difficult to track. In 2017, for example, BitLicense sold $2.6 million worth of its tokenized tokenized treasury for $1.4 million, according to its SEC filing.<p><p>“It takes a lot of time and effort to find a marketplace that is trading in these volatile markets,” BitLicense CEO Andy Birch wrote in a blog post.<p><p>The company plans to expand its network in the future and eventually raise a further $20 million.<p><p>Read more: BitLicense CFO: BitLicense’s Token Sale ‘A Step in the Right Direction’ for Blockchain Tokens']

headline: China Jan Jan new COVID-19 infections, new infections
content: ['<p>BEIJING, Jan 18  - China’s new coronavirus cases soared on Tuesday to a five-year high and coronavirus fatalities surged to record highs as China’s authorities tightened restrictions on travel in the affected areas.<p><p>The National People’s Congress on Tuesday held a debate about the impact of the pandemic and proposed the country make measures to curb the spread of coronavirus, but remained firmly on a high to keep its economy afloat.<p><p>China’s National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) said it had recorded 158 cases of new cases and 1,000 new deaths in January, up from 110 in January, which was a record month, and a decline of 5.1% in the prior month.<p><p>Meanwhile, coronavirus infections in northern China jumped to 1.55 million in January from 1.7 million in January, up from 1.9 million in the previous month.<p><p>Last week, authorities imposed new lockdown in most major cities in a bid to slow the spread of the virus and stop coronavirus deaths.<p><p>Chinese hospitals have been forced to close at all times to contain the virus.<p>']

headline: Fidelity Investments to Invest in Bitcoin Exchange CoinDesk
content: ['<p>Investors in bitcoin brokerage firm CoinDesk may soon have to choose between a new investment company or new investments to support their investment portfolio.<p><p>CoinDesk acquired its first-quarter dividend yield last month after a Series A with the participation of several companies. That stock also sold on an exchange-traded fund (ETF) in October that had a yield of 0.18%.<p><p>Read more: Why Fidelity Is Back in the Bitcoin Investment Industry<p><p>“As we look forward to a successful sale of CoinDesk’s shares, CoinDesk believes that it is important to protect the investment interests of its shareholders by providing them with the means to invest in and invest in digital assets,” said Fidelity CFO and chairman Bill Soriano in an emailed statement. “As we approach this new round, we look forward to welcoming our new co-founders and continue to invest in the cryptocurrency industry.”<p> ']

headline: Luxury Cars, More Than Ever Are Driving Money In
content: ['<p>While cars are increasingly driving the U.S. economy, automakers continue to dominate the global luxury market, according to a new report. <p><p>The Luxury Car Survey, a consortium of Luxury Car Finance Centers and Luxury Car Trends, found that four out of five top brands and retailers in the U.S. drive the most luxury cars, with automakers including Ford, Volkswagen, Tesla and Daimler serving as the most prominent brands.<p><p>See also: Luxury Cars, New York, Listed in the Fast-Growing US Gaming Industry<p><p>See also: Luxury Car Finance Lists Luxury Brands Including BMW, Volvo, Porsche, Tesla<p><p>The Luxury Car Foundation, which is backed by Ford, Toyota, Volvo, Tesla, Volkswagen and Fiat, said it’s clear automakers dominate the luxury car market, adding, “Automobiles are the driving force behind our business growth and demand. They are the drivers of our global sales, and they drive our growth.”<p> ']

headline: Swiss Central Bank Plans ‘Biggest’ DeFi DeFi Debut in 5 Years
content: ['<p>The Swiss central bank plans a “biggest” blockchain infrastructure project in 5 years, according to a survey by Swiss weekly Nederlandsbank (SNB).<p><p>SNB polled 724 respondents in February 2020, including 21 who said they planned to participate in a “blockchain smart contract project” with Swiss banking giant ABB and 13 who did not want to be named, while only 7% said they planned to participate in a “crypto-only smart contract project” and 2% were planning to participate in a “crypto-only blockchain project.<p><p>See also: Swiss Exchange to Launch Crypto Custody Service for Blockchain Miners<p><p>“We have seen large scale projects like Bison or Matic emerge, but for the next five years, we plan to have a network of more than 300 million smart contract nodes with over 40,000 smart contract implementations,” SNB President Gérard Paul told CoinDesk.<p><p>See also: Blockchain Startup R3 Eyes $14M in Lending, Tokenization Funds Ahead of Launch of Ant Exchange<p><p>A new project called Chainview has been selected to run the network, Paul added, adding that “Chainview has the same infrastructure as Chainview but with much higher security standards, a smart contract node for each protocol, and a blockchain explorer (block explorer) for each blockchain” while also adding that the project will integrate with smart-contract nodes in a public testnet.']

headline: Mint Farming Firm Unites With New Institutional Investor to Buy Crypto-Backed Miner Pool Matic
content: ['<p>Founded in 2018, Matic, a crypto mining firm, has become the latest institutional investor to join the $2.3 billion Series A funding round announced Tuesday by the Matic Group.<p><p>The Matic investment was led by Grayscale, the payments giant with investments in bitcoin and ether.<p><p>The Series A funds will help Matic expand its operations to include a number of fiat-to-crypto mining equipment and equipment and, in a bid to better serve investors from the crypto-to-woodland mining space, will help to secure the $1.2 billion seed round and funding round that Matic is committed to providing through its acquisition of Bitstamp, a Bitstamp crypto debit card for institutional investors.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin Miner Pool Matic Rises to $2.3B Through a Series A Round<p><p>Matic’s current investments include mining hardware, bitcoin mining equipment and mining hardware in the Ethereum blockchain. The firm plans to expand its investments in the cryptocurrency space further.<p> ']

headline: A Bitcoin Miners’ License May Not Be Enough to Get Laid in Lending Frenzy
content: ['<p>Bitcoin miner LEND has filed a provisional application for a license with the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) and has been granted permission to move assets held by a group of “non-custodial investors” and others who make up the minority.<p><p>The application is a move by the miners themselves to get a better view of the market’s volatility, LEND’s chief business officer, Thomas O’Rourke, told CoinDesk via email. The company was first granted permission in 2018 after submitting its application to the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) for a three-year license in August.<p><p>“It’s very disappointing that the SEC has not been successful in preventing the spread of this fraud,” O’Rourke said.<p><p>The application also seeks an extension of the previous two years on an interim basis, which means there could be some uncertainty about when a license will be granted to a miner, the firm said.<p><p>LEND has already been operating out of its home in Brooklyn, New York, and the company said in January it had begun to develop its operating model around its new network of machines.<p><p>“We are planning on moving our network in 2021 and the ability to launch new machines in the next 12 to 24 months” on the LEND Bitcoin Miners project, O’Rourke said.<p>']

headline: Ethereum Mining Firm Blockstream Wins SEC Patent for Crypto Mining Hardware
content: ['<p>Blockstream, an Ethereum mining firm focused on enterprise-class blockchain applications, has won a court order from the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for a cryptocurrency mining hardware.<p><p>In the filing, filed in U.S. District Court in San Francisco on Wednesday, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office seeks a patent covering a “crypto mining machine or device, including equipment, data and parts utilized” for mining cryptocurrency on Ethereum, as well as a digital representation and reference specification of an application.<p><p>Also read: Bitcoin Miner Blockstream Wins Suit Over Theft of Ethereum Miners<p> ']

headline: Fidelity Digital Assets Holdings, NYSE, NYDIG to Open Trading Platform in Ireland
content: ['<p>The FDIC-insured Fidelity Digital Assets Securities Exchange (FDIC) is expanding its Irish operation, expanding into the city of Dublin and introducing Fidelity’s digital assets services to the public.<p><p>According to a press release, FDIC-insured Fidelity shares will be trading on the exchange after trading volumes for the first three months of 2021 hit a record high of $2.5 million, surpassing the $2.5 million recorded in 2019 for the first time.<p><p>“We look forward to welcoming Fidelity’s digital asset services to the FDIC market and to continuing to build upon our innovative trading offering, which we have now opened,” said John Hughes, CEO and co-founder of Fidelity Digital Assets Holdings.<p><p>The FDIC in Ireland is one of three major jurisdictions in the U.S. to be involved in the Fidelity Digital Assets Exchange (DEX)’s digital asset services program.<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 1-Russia's gas imports jump by 2.5% y/y in March, official says
content: ['<p>* March imports jump 26% y/y, customs says<p><p>* April imports up 29.9% y/y<p><p>* Gas imports rise 31.4% y/y (Adds analyst comment)<p><p>MOSCOW, March 18  - Russia’s imports of natural gas in March rose by 2.5% from a year earlier to 898.33 million cubic metres (bcm) in the fourth quarter, the Ministry of Energy said on Friday, as part of its review of domestic gas infrastructure.<p><p>Russia’s top petroleum producer, Rosneft, said on Friday it was supplying 3.1 million tonnes of its oil and gas products to Russia by rail after it began trading with China in October last year.<p><p>Natural gas imports jumped 26.9% year-on-year in March, the ministry said, as customs data showed Russian gas was still being processed after a four-year delay due to the economic slump caused by a second wave of coronavirus infections.<p><p>Gas deliveries in March fell 3.4% in the three months through mid-December, customs data showed on Saturday.<p><p>Russia has been providing its domestic gas infrastructure since last year.<p>']

headline: S.Korea’s Jan-March GDP tumbled 4.3%
content: ['<p>Korea posted a GDP contraction of 4.3% in January, the data showed on Friday, the biggest monthly contraction in 20 years.<p><p>The Statistics Department said in a statement that, during the month, the economy contracted by 7.4% from a year earlier. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a contraction of 6.6% after a contraction of 7.8% in December.<p><p>The new estimate is a revision of a prior forecast of 7.2% in the previous month. (Reporting by Kim Kwon and Roham Gharegozlou; Editing by Hugh Lawson)<p> ']

headline: S.Korea 2020 crude oil imports fall, customs
content: ['<p>SEOUL, Feb 1  - South Korea’s crude oil imports fell 3.9% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier due to the COVID-19 pandemic, customs said on Thursday, the latest drop amid higher shipments from a global fleet.<p><p>Exports from the United States fell 3.4% in the fourth quarter from a year earlier, customs said, the most since 2019.<p><p>Exports from China fell 2.7% and imports from the United States dropped 2.7% on the year.<p><p>Southeast Asia’s biggest oil importer, Brazil, also suffered its biggest fall in the third quarter, with exports from the Philippines, Malaysia and Thailand down 9.3% and 1.9%, respectively.<p><p>China’s oil imports were 5.5 million tonnes in the fourth quarter. That was down 7% from the year earlier.<p> ']

headline: LIMA, Feb 1 (Reuters) - Italy’s central bank said on Thursday it could cut interest rates to 2.5% this year but said it would be reluctant to do so in the absence of additional monetary stimulus.
content: ['<p><p>The central bank said it expected Italy’s fiscal deficit to grow to 2.7% this year after shrinking to 0.5% in the third quarter of 2020 from 1.4% the previous year and still growing well below the target of 0.6%.<p><p>Italy is on track to grow its gross domestic product by 2.2% this year after shrinking by less than half its forecast in 2019. The rate-setting institution last raised its estimate for gross domestic product last year but slashed it to 1.25% from 1.25%.<p> ']

headline: U.S. labor force participation drops in November due to pandemic
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - Employment and nonfungible tokens (FETs) are set to fall less frequently in November, according to new payroll surveys from the National Employment Law Project.<p><p>The decline in participation is consistent with the hiring slowdown seen in the last two months of the year. In December, the number of nonfarm payrolls shrank by almost half, to about 3.7 million. The decline reflects a slow start to the year as coronavirus restrictions have hit most of the country and joblessness remains high. (Reporting by Larry King Editing by Ana Nicolaci da Costa)<p> ']

headline: Khan Yunx, CEO of LendingClub, Aave to Move Into India
content: ['<p>Jihan Wu, the founder and CEO of a non-fungible token (NFT) lending platform for Indian investors, is stepping down from the startup he founded, Aave.<p><p>In an announcement Tuesday, Wu said in a text message to CoinDesk that he is stepping down from his position at the LendingClub parent company, which has been embroiled in allegations of unfair dismissal and discrimination. <p><p>The announcement comes after months of public feud and criticism. <p><p>In a statement posted to his company’s website, Aave said Wu’s death “incompetence” caused the company to suspend its operations in India pending investigations into the matter. <p><p>The announcement did not address Wu’s other projects.<p><p>“Our team and our mission are to help investors navigate uncertain and complicated financial environments in India,” Aave said in a statement.<p><p>“We cannot and will not tolerate any form of discrimination on the part of our team, employees or family members. As a result of the sudden and unjust termination of the team, we’ll no longer be maintaining Aave.” <p><p>“We take the deepest possible amount of responsibility for this and all others that have been negatively impacted by the recent events,” Aave said.<p> ']

headline: USDC to Accept Crypto Investment From Chinese Power Plant After Blockchain Blockchain Hack
content: ['<p>The U.S. government has approved the issuance of bitcoin mining equipment and will help commercialize the blockchain.<p><p>In a letter to Power Plant International, U.S. Energy Department officials said they will work to establish “a path to establishing regulatory frameworks for the integration of bitcoin mining with other technologies.”<p><p>The letters were sent to the Chinese state-owned power plants by the Association of Latin American Universities, a group of Latin American mining companies and other stakeholders. It is a response to the March 2020 lockdown that shut down nearly all U.S. power plants in Latin America, shuttering more than 1,000 power plants in the U.S., while also halting shipments of electricity from the country to Venezuela.<p><p>As a result of the lockdown, some 600 megawatts of electricity has been cut off in Latin America, according to Reuters.<p><p>Power plants around the world have been closed for almost six months in the face of rising global demand. Bitcoin mining has become one of the most expensive mining techniques, accounting for 40 percent of the world’s electricity consumption.<p><p>Power plants in Latin America have been using bitcoin mining equipment for at least five years to improve their power grid and power distribution infrastructure. The U.S. Department of Energy, which runs the plants, announced the technology in January 2019.<p>']

headline: JPMorgan, JPMorgan, Circle: Top Bitcoin Mining Pool Hits SEC Settlement Over Bitcoin Ransomware
content: ['<p>Payments giant JPMorgan Chase and bank Circle have agreed to settle a class-action lawsuit that accuses them of unlawfully retaliating against customers by shutting down accounts they own.<p><p>Read more: JPMorgan Chase’s ‘Silvergate’ Bitcoin Mining Pool Hits SEC Subscription After ‘Drop in Demand’ Lawsuit<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 1-Philippine central bank says COVID-19 will “challenge’ recovery, see next steps
content: ['<p>* Philippines sees economic expansion of 5.4%-6.5% in 2022<p><p>* ‘pivot’ toward gold, iron ore in pandemic, says governor<p><p>MANILA, Jan 12  - Philippine central bank President Roberto Sanches will next week sign an order directing the country’s central bank to boost inflation to 5.4%-6.5% in 2022, after a sharp contraction in 2020, but also to reduce interest rates to zero and limit rate hikes.<p><p>The move follows a nationwide lockdown and lockdown over recent weeks, and is the latest bellwether for the central bank’s policy goals.<p><p>The announcement was welcomed by financial analysts who noted a gradual upward revision in policy forecasts and said the central bank “will consider further stimulus measures in the second half of this year,” though they cautioned against expecting a full-on pandemic-like recovery.<p><p>“We expect the full-on recovery to resume gradually and stabilise around 3% for a time,” said Rizhi Pandey, chief economist at Rabobank.<p><p>“It’s a very big shock to the economy that the economy contracted 5.4% in 2020, and the contraction was more severe than many predicted,” he added.<p>']

headline: Dune Developer Bitmain Launches Crypto Mining Service

headline: PayPal, Coinbase Join Blockchain Firms on a $17B Plan
content: ['<p>PayPal and Coinbase have teamed up to build the first national blockchain network, CoinPay, the company announced Monday.<p><p>Announced Monday, CoinPay will offer users the ability to earn crypto using cryptocurrencies for bitcoin, ether and tai (USDT) – a common payment method in Asia, the cryptocurrency that’s most popular in the U.S.<p><p>The firm says CoinPay allows customers to instantly access digital assets including digital goods in-store or online and will work with existing networks such as PayPal, Coinbase, BitPay, Bitfury, KPMG and Gemini to build the infrastructure for its next generation payments network.<p><p>“CoinPay is the first blockchain in Asia to be made available to institutional clients,” said CoinPay CTO Ryan Leight. “Customers in Asia can now use CoinPay with other crypto-to-crypto transactions as well as directly with CoinPay merchants.”<p><p>The startup is also developing its own native app that will allow users to earn crypto with fiat currency in-store and online, according to a press release.<p><p>See also: Visa, OKEx to Join Coinbase’s Digital Currency Alliance<p><p>Also read: Ripple, Coinbase Say Blockchain Services Will Work in India, Brazil<p>']

headline: Luxury New York home sales surge 10-fold in March, housing market dips
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - New York home sales jumped 10-fold in March, hitting a record high and cementing the comeback of New York’s booming home market.<p><p>Property data firm Landmark Home Finance said sales jumped 8.6% last month, its first quarterly increase since November, driven by record-setting sales of new single-family homes.<p><p>New York’s housing market, which grew 15.1% in the third quarter, is poised to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic before it is hit by another major pandemic wave.<p><p>“We expect a resurgence in sales of single-family homes to continue through the quarter, while rents, which were previously below levels seen in December, continue to rise,” Landmark Home Finance economist Anthony J. Corrado said in a note.<p><p>For example, a 10-bedroom, $500,000 penthouse home in Westchester County, New York, rose 11.4% to a seasonally adjusted value of $10.3 million. It also rose for the second consecutive month.<p><p>“We expect New York home prices to rebound,” Corrado said.<p><p>Sales at a historically low cost of $1.98 billion were the largest in the nation and also the strongest since May 2000.<p>']

headline: Binance’s Largest Crypto Asset Drove $17.1M in Latest Bitcoin Halving
content: ['<p>Crypto asset manager Binance has listed bitcoin-buying and cryptocurrency collateral for $17.1 million.<p><p>The exchange, a London-based investment platform with a $4.3 billion market cap, said Wednesday it now has a stablecoin worth $16.5 million as well as a bitcoin derivative, ether, representing an additional $1.4 million in bitcoin.<p><p>“Crypto investing accounts for only 5% of the assets on Binance’s platform,” said Binance CFO Ian Byrne. “We plan to see this figure rising further as a crypto asset class continues to grow.”<p><p>Byrne added there were currently no significant moves in the cryptocurrency industry by institutional clients, while the majority of crypto trading is done on Binance’s platform.<p><p>Bitcoin has always been an attractive asset class. Its price has risen steadily throughout the past few months as the dollar price has rebounded from its early rally. <p><p>Read more: Binance’s Bitcoin Cash: Why It Is Bigger Than the Market Baked Out of<p><p>In September, bitcoin climbed above $3,000 at the height of the price swings, surpassing the $3,000 range for the first time in the past year.<p> ']

headline: USDC to Launch Crypto Firm Ahead of Blockchain Capital Launch in US
content: ['<p>USDC, the digital asset investment firm founded by cryptocurrency entrepreneur Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) and early investor Sam Bankman, will launch an enterprise-focused trading app.<p><p>The USDC-focused app is expected to be open to all users in the coming months, according to a press statement issued Tuesday. The company plans to have a full-time workforce by 2019, the company said.<p><p>In a press release, USDC said the launch follows the issuance of $2.8 million in seed round led by Block.one in May 2019.<p><p>The company has so far launched its own bitcoin wallet and an alternative trading app on its own service. It also said its blockchain-enabled smart contract, the blockchain-based Bitfury, will make use of the Ethereum blockchain for its own private key management system.<p><p>USDC’s new product will not only be available for mobile devices with the app but will also run on the blockchain itself. As part of that, the firm plans to sell its trading platform to investment firms in Europe, Asia and elsewhere, the company said.<p><p>The announcement came after USDC’s venture arm, Block.one, raised $2 million to date.<p><p>The announcement comes at a time when crypto custody is still a sore spot for institutions. While some jurisdictions are moving towards a digital banking system, the U.S. Supreme Court struck down a central bank charter last year.']

headline: China's March crude oil imports surpass $3.8 bln
content: ['<p>BEIJING  - China’s March crude oil imports surpassed $3.8 billion as the world’s biggest exporter switched to cheaper crude, data from the National Bureau of Statistics showed on Thursday.<p><p>Crude oil imported to China in March stood at $52.17 billion as of Sept. 30, versus $68.37 billion on the same month a year earlier.<p><p>The figures show China imported just under half the previously reported $103.64 billion in crude oil in March, down from $114.02 billion in February.<p><p>Shipments of natural gas, including from the Niger Delta, totalled 792,741 barrels last month, up 7.6% from 1.92 million in February.<p><p>In the first two months of this year, China imported just under 9,200 barrels a day, down 14.2% from 12,191 in February.<p><p>China imported $1.86 billion in crude oil in March, down 0.4% from February, as a coronavirus wave forced domestic refiners to halt operations.<p><p>China is set to release crude oil to the world in 2020 at an estimated cost of $400 a barrel, the NBS said, compared with the previous April estimate of $425,000 for the same month last year. (Reporting by Stella Lu and Shivani Sarkar; Editing by Toby Chopra)<p> ']

headline: Binance Labs and Stellar Involvement in a New Partnership to Help Boost Institutional Crypto
content: ['<p>Founded in 2014, Binance Labs (Binance Labs), Stellar and Binance Labs Global (BGL Global) have announced a new partnership to help institutional investors invest in decentralized finance (DeFi).<p><p>Announced Tuesday, Binance Labs, BGL Global and Binance Global will be working together on the new DeFi platform. The new initiative, called Binance Global Crypto Services, will be supported by the Stellar network’s infrastructure, Binance Labs Global Trading Platform and Binance Labs Smart Contracts, among other services.<p><p>“With the new partnership, we are continuing to build the infrastructure and the technical infrastructure to support this crucial digital asset industry,” said Andrei Kuo, CEO of Binance Labs Global. “We are thrilled to be working with the Stellar team to help create this next-generation of DeFi that benefits everyone from enterprises to the traditional finance industry.”<p><p>Read more: Binance Labs Launches DeFi-Based Service in India, Sees Crypto Opportunity<p><p>“The Binance ecosystem is a global marketplace and ecosystem is built on top of the Ethereum blockchain,” said Binance Labs Global President Michael Saylor. “With this new partnership, we have added more liquidity and more capital to the ecosystem.”<p>']

headline: Hedge Fund Manager Binance Raises $8M From VCs, Former BlockFi VCs and Former Fintech Firm Pandemic
content: ['<p>Binance, the top crypto fund manager in the U.S., has raised $8 million in seed funding from a variety of VCs and former BlockFi staffers, bringing its total to date to $20 million.<p><p>As reported by CoinDesk, the new round was led by Andreessen Horowitz and Binance. At the time of writing, Binance is only at $1.3 million in total equity in the fund, according to the round document, though its total capital raise is projected to grow by $10 million for 2020, and $15 million to $19.7 million in 2023.<p><p>Binance’s institutional backers include hedge fund managers like Andreessen Horowitz, BlackRock Capital and Morgan Stanley, as well as traditional VCs like Digital Currency Group and Uniswap, a fund focused on blockchain projects. Binance also has a crypto arm, Digital Currency Group, in the works.<p><p>“We believe this is the most exciting investment in crypto and have been investing since 2018,” a Binance spokesperson told CoinDesk.<p><p>In an interview with CoinDesk, BlockFi veteran and BlockFIRE co-founder Justin Wilson said the new round also shows that Binance was able to get institutional investors into the space.<p>']

content: ['<p>Binance has launched a private-equity and derivatives marketplace with a focus on infrastructure.<p><p>Read more: Binance Buys $300M in $300M Token Sale in Latest Crypto Mining Boom<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 1-Brazil's economy shrank at fastest pace in more than two decades
content: ['<p>(Adds analyst comment, background)<p><p>BRASILIA, March 27  - Brazil’s economy, the world’s top consumer of iron ore and plastic, shrank 8.8% last year, the government said on Monday, far exceeding the 5.4% contraction it forecast in a Reuters poll and well above the 2.5% contraction that followed a year earlier, which saw an estimated 9.9 million tonnes of steel and plastic imports drop by more than 1.6 million tonnes.<p><p>The statistics agency added a further 2.5 million tonnes of steel and plastic would fall within its forecasts, and also that many companies in the sector “will be compelled to cut staff,” a move that could hurt competitiveness and possibly drive down prices.<p><p>The government’s official unemployment rate stood at 9.2%, and a government source said more than 11.5% of the population were considered underemployed.<p><p>Analysts in a Reuters poll had expected a 6.5% annual fall.<p><p>The data comes as Brazil has been on a downward spiral with the world’s largest aluminium producer, Suez, citing low demand for metal, while many other exporters such as Russia, China and France are grappling with higher prices for their products.<p>']

headline: DeFi Firms Are Hiring to Launch Cryptos in 2021: Report
content: ['<p>Crypto firms are seeking to launch decentralized finance (DeFi) services in 2021.<p><p>As many of the industry’s top teams prepare for their first major testnet in the coming months, it’s worth remembering what they can do when these firms get their hands on Ethereum.<p><p>Crypto firms, including Binance, Square, Binance UK, Lending Club, Circle and Coinbase, are participating in the DeFi Pilot Program, which will help them to go toe-to-toe with the industry’s fintech giants in launching blockchain-based products. The participants will work with Coinbase, Binance and others in the space.<p><p>See also: The Future of Ethereum May Be About More Than Money<p><p>These startups are looking to add liquidity to DeFi on Ethereum without having to deal with the hassle of dealing with broker-dealers, said Ben Domingo, co-founder of Binance, in a phone interview. The focus of the pilot is to create a “crypto-like ecosystem,” he said.<p><p>“That’s kind of what I see happening on the blockchain side, with DeFi. It’s like, if I want to put my money in bitcoin and it’s up in the sky, I’ll put it in ether. If you want to take a bitcoin, you can do that. So that’s what we are trying to do.”']

headline: New York Times: ‘I Don’t Care’ Why Trump’s Travel Ban Raises Concerns
content: ['<p>President-elect Donald J. Trump signed into law on Tuesday a series of executive orders that impose travel restrictions on people from six predominately Muslim countries. The restrictions, which ban travel and travel to the U.S. for travelers from seven predominantly Muslim countries and from the U.S. from seven predominantly Arab nations, are a test of the Trump administration’s ability to balance its anti-American and anti-labor agenda.<p><p>The travel restrictions are intended to make it easier for businesses to operate, and for people from many countries in the world to work from home, said Michael Wolff, a professor of law and foreign policy at the University of Pennsylvania and an expert on the travel ban. But they also violate a core part of the Trump administration’s foreign policy: The notion of “America first,” a belief that foreign leaders are at the center of American power.<p><p>“The president clearly wants to make America strong and secure, but not strong enough to justify the kind of travel that it requires to keep American companies out of harm”, Mr. Wolff said. “It’s an area that’s very sensitive, and there’s a lot of misunderstanding of what that means for America, and what it means for those of us around the world who are in that region,” he said.<p>']

headline: Citi
content: ['<p>BNY Mellon’s crypto trading business is set to get its first official regulatory license in 2021, a move that will probably come as little surprise to those already familiar with the space.<p><p>The move marks a significant rebranding for the bank, whose long-abandoned cryptocurrency trading platform is being promoted by the Financial Crimes Enforcement Network (FinCEN) to its core trading product, Bitstamp.<p><p>The new regulatory package also marks the latest in a series of moves for the crypto startup in the banking and financial services world, as well as the first since June 2020 for JPMorgan, the crypto exchange founded by Charles Hoskinson.<p><p>In a recent interview with CoinDesk, Hoskinson said JPMorgan is moving quickly to acquire its existing banking license, which was suspended last summer following allegations that it laundered funds for money laundering.<p><p>“One of the things that is kind of touching right now with this sort of merger announcement, it’s a really big step,” Hoskinson said. “This is the most transparent and streamlined regulatory landscape in the financial system. So when we look at this new relationship, it’s a very strong signal from the bank that they’re going to be taking the reins.”<p><p>Also read: NYDOT to Invest in NYSE Crypto Lending Service Provider, Says New Exec<p>']
