headline: Algorithmic Trading Platform Dabra to Rebuild Ethereum Custody
content: ['<p>The new “Blockchain for Crypto” (BFT) project from Blockchain Capital is bringing the power of blockchain to the Ethereum network as its custodial client.<p><p>Dabra, one of the world’s first blockchain solutions built on the Ethereum blockchain, will make use of the “digital gold” protocol to create the infrastructure needed to keep track of the assets held in the digital asset vault.<p><p>“Dabra is focused on making digital gold easy to transact and secure for customers to store their crypto and other assets,” said Dabra co-founder and CEO Joseph Vellano. “It’s also the platform for the custodial clients to send and receive tokenized cryptocurrencies.”<p><p>While a lot of the focus in decentralized finance (DeFi) is on how to keep track of cryptocurrency assets, blockchain analytics and the like are crucial areas.<p><p>“In this new era of decentralized finance, our ability to create a financial network is critical,” Vellano said. “We’ve created a fully decentralized digital asset marketplace to enable our digital asset custodian to be the custodian for its customers to receive and manage digital assets.”<p><p>Vellano said Dabra’s custodial services and the BFT’s approach will create a “key driver” for crypto adoption, which means that all crypto assets will be easily traceable by trusted financial institutions.']

headline: Hackers Can Sell Bitcoin, Ether and Chainlink Data From Enterprise Blockchain Devices
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency companies can now sell their blockchain-based data onto the Ethereum blockchain.<p><p>According to a blog post Wednesday by Chainlink, the startup offers a service that helps enterprise clients store, manage and sell digital assets on the Ethereum blockchain, including Ethereum wallets and digital asset tokenized data on the blockchain called Chainlink.<p><p>The service has been in the works since 2018. In early August, Chainlink released its new Chainlink-enabled wallet.<p><p>The new service is expected to bring Chainlink “greater security, reliability and lower costs than existing exchanges,” Chainlink co-founder and CEO Dan Pinedo told CoinDesk in an interview.<p><p>“There are already a number of Chainlink-enabled wallets available on the Ethereum network,” Pinedo said. “I’ve been working on building this in my spare time for years.”<p><p>Blockchainlink, a venture firm, launched its first version of its Chainlink-enabled wallet in October 2018 and will be rolling out the service to enterprise customers later this year.<p><p>According to Chainlink’s blog post, Chainlink offers “instant access to blockchain data, transactional data and tokenized blockchain data across a wide range of enterprise and professional applications.”<p> ']

headline: Listed Crypto Mining Firm Gobi Group Says It Hires ‘Largest’ VC
content: ['<p>Chinese mining company Gobi Group has hired a venture firm to take on the crypto market’s top VC, who is reportedly seeking to spearhead the acquisition of another “largest” firm.<p><p>See also: Why VC Success Is a Must for Crypto Mining Firm Gobi Group<p> ']

headline: Ethereum-Based Staking Platform ZendChain May Integrate With PayPal
content: ['<p>ZendChain, a payment network focused on creating decentralized financial networks and platforms, announced Wednesday it has agreed to buy PayPal, the platform’s largest and most influential client, for $350 million.<p><p>The $350 million is primarily the addition of cryptocurrency custody provider S4 to its wallet, according to ZendChain CEO Alex Seydal. ZendChain also has partnered with crypto provider Digital Currency Group and Blockchain Capital.<p><p>“I’m excited about this addition to our banking network,” Seydal told CoinDesk via email. “We have the best customer relationships in the industry, and we want to be in touch with them. We’ll also be doing the rest of the business separately, so if you are looking for a banking solution, or just having a new business opportunity, this transaction will definitely be of interest to you.”<p><p>Read more: PayPal, Coinbase’s First Bitfury, Pivot Into Staking Staking: Report<p><p>ZendChain is still early in its journey to build its product stack, which will launch with the public Ethereum-based version of Zcash, and will eventually become a payments network alongside PayPal. However, the new partnership with PayPal will provide an early view into its relationship with ZendChain, Seydal said.<p><p>ZendChain has had trouble scaling. At the beginning of 2021, when Zcash was first announced, roughly 400,000 users sent payments to the network.']

headline: R3’s Q4 2019 Exec Looks at the Future of Blockchain Finance
content: ['<p>Blockchain finance (CBF) and asset management (AMM) are emerging from their usual wild corners and could become one of the next frontier areas for blockchain finance.<p><p>Speaking to CoinDesk, R3 executive chairman and chief executive officer Jody Powell, CEO of R3 Group, said he’s looking at the future of blockchain finance with an eye towards how blockchain can improve its use cases and monetise its value.<p><p>“You’ve got to play the game of the century. We are entering an era where everyone is looking at blockchain and blockchain is just an extension of that game and we’re all embracing that,” Powell told CoinDesk.<p><p>Powell also spoke to CoinDesk about the need for the financial sector to grow more fully on blockchain, how CBF will help the sector get more exposure to the technology and whether or not blockchain is going to be used to finance new assets.<p><p>Powell noted that while many of the leading CBF organizations are doing a lot of exploring blockchain, CBF still faces its own challenges and challenges due to the limited number of firms and partners who are willing to make the effort.<p><p>“The real problem is the financial services industry is saturated,” Powell said. “So it’s interesting to think about what can be done about that.”<p>']

headline: Winklevoss Twins Are Not Interested in Trading Bitcoin, Says Nasdaq Chief
content: ['<p>The Winklevoss Twins, the San Francisco-based investment bank that sold some $9 billion worth of bitcoin in the past year, declined to comment Thursday.<p><p>“The market price of bitcoin is not relevant to the business,” said Winklevoss co-founder Alan Sokolich in an interview with CoinDesk. “The markets that have been leading the news have been dominated by bitcoin. … They’re focused on how to make the bitcoin industry profitable because we are able to attract them to the company.”<p><p>A prominent adviser to the Winklevoss twins, David Sokolich, said Thursday that he was not interested in investing in bitcoin.<p><p>“It’s not a thing that’s going to change my mind about it or anything,” Sokolich said. “I’m just going to keep my distance.”<p> ']

headline: U.S. stock market rally in February hits highest for nine months
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON, March 19  - The U.S. stock market rally reached an all-time high on Wednesday, hitting the highest level since November 2019, after it took off in an all-time high and vaulted to new highs on a month-on-month basis.<p><p>Market participants jumped more than expected to record $114.9 billion in gains in February, the first gain since November, as the Federal Reserve raised rates for the second time in nine months. (Reporting by Andrew Harrer Editing by Daniel McNew)<p> ']

headline: Venezuela's oil imports surpass EU imports of 3.1 mln bpd in 2020
content: ['<p>MADRID, Feb 5  - Venezuelan imports from the European Union totalled 3.1 million barrels a day (bpd), the World Trade Organization said on Thursday, an unprecedented surge in the volume of crude oil imports in the first six months of 2020.<p><p>Exports also exceeded EU quotas of 1.3 million bpd, with imports of 1.9 million bpd reaching the bloc in the first three months of 2020, the WTO said.<p><p>The increase is mainly related to higher production and export volumes, it said, as well as high crude oil prices and high fuel prices.<p><p>The volume of imported oil in the first six months of 2020 rose from 3.5 million bpd in the first six months of 2020, followed by imports in December, and then a record peak in March.<p><p>The EU has been heavily criticized for its decision to cut the European Union’s quota of imports of crude oil in 2020 to 758,000 bpd, but the move was widely seen as a necessary response to the COVID-19 pandemic.<p><p>“The European Union is deploying its influence and support in Venezuela to support its domestic economy,” the WTO said. “We continue to expect domestic crude oil imports to rise by the month in the fourth quarter of 2021.” (Reporting by Tabita Rocha; Writing by Thomas Escritt; Editing by Hugh Lawson)<p> ']

headline: Pax’s Blockchain Startup Can Enter the World of Enterprise Blockchain
content: ['<p>The project is a blockchain application aimed at small business and enterprises working with digital assets. <p><p>Announced Wednesday, Pax Blockchain is an enterprise blockchain project focused on building decentralized applications across enterprise and public markets. <p><p>See also: Pax Blockchain Proving Its Stablecoin Will Boost Digital Assets in 2021<p><p>Caleb Seward, Pax’s co-founder and CEO, said he’s excited about the blockchain technology to be deployed in private markets. “When it’s done, we can really help people move around the world. It’s going to be a really nice piece of hardware, it’s going to be a pretty powerful piece of software,” he said.<p><p>The blockchain project will be open source and open source by default, Seward said. The protocol can be used by individuals or groups to manage and launch their own private blockchain-based applications.<p><p>“We are not making this work on our own hardware, we are making this public,” said Seward. “The private blockchain will be a powerful platform to get users to start making crypto investments, to have financial services, to work in a decentralized fashion and be able to start creating products.”<p> ']

headline: NFTs and Crypto Lending Platform Xilinx Now Have a New Role in Finance
content: ['<p>Coinbase, a venture capital firm that built decentralized finance (DeFi) applications, is now helping startups get loans into crypto.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, Xilinx, the startup developing the Xilinx CryptoLender protocol, was among a few large firms in the industry that are getting in on the market for lending services from crypto. In fact, Coinbase has already partnered with Ripple on the Xilinx CryptoLender network.<p><p>Xilinx CryptoLender is a “service to lending firms that offers a lending protocol that does not rely on traditional banking” such as bank loans, Xilinx said in a press release.<p><p>Read more: Ripple Joins Xilinx CryptoLender to Power DeFi Platform<p><p>In a press release, Xilinx said its lending lending lending platform “is primarily intended to facilitate the issuance of cryptocurrency in the form of cryptocurrencies,” without specifying further.<p><p>This is something Coinbase is working on. The crypto lender is working with the Xilinx CryptoLender network in order to help the startups launch lending products, the company said.<p><p>“This has allowed us to work with a few dozen of the largest crypto lenders in the world to help grow their lending lending offerings and our clients continue to unlock additional liquidity and liquidity,” Xilinx co-founder Chris Pompliano said.<p>']

headline: Tower Cuts Off From US Banks, Not Restrictions on Commercial Use
content: ['<p>The world’s largest lender of consumer credit shuttered Tuesday, leaving dozens of U.S. banks and other institutions to serve customers in the Middle East, Africa and Asia.<p><p>Tower CFO Dan Lauer said the shutdown would be a “moment” for banks to reopen their operations in other parts of the world.<p><p>“The U.S. economy will continue to grow quickly thanks to this great deal of new, highly skilled, and highly skilled labor coming into play in the region,” said Lauer in a statement. “As we approach the economic year 2020, we’re proud to say we’re poised to take this opportunity to continue to provide a rich source of capital to customers in the Middle East, Africa and Asia.”<p><p>In addition to offering low interest rates, the lender said it also provides free deposits at banks across the globe.<p><p>The U.S. bank closures are an unprecedented step in the U.S. recovery after the Federal Reserve abruptly cut its central bank’s benchmark interest rate last December. Inflationary pressures on the economy and the coronavirus have been exacerbated by government spending, which has contributed to a contraction of the purchasing power of homes, cars and the stock market.<p><p>Since March, Wall Street’s dominant buying managers have pumped up the price of Treasury bonds by a record-breaking 1.8% and increased their purchases of Treasury securities by 1.5%.']

headline: Liquor Firms Suffer Record Losses in Q1
content: ['<p>Liquor firms were forced to close all the premises they had supplied in the final two months of 2020, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) said on Friday, and face an even bigger risk of losing money and their reputation if they continue to sell to the public.<p><p>As a result, firms are forced to close all their premises on a daily basis. Firms have to sell to the authorities within two days of the end of a five-month period.<p><p>“Given the volatility in the market, I would not be surprised if liquefied natural gas (LNG) continues to be a significant issue,” the regulator said in a statement.<p><p>FCA Commissioner Peter Cosgrove said the figures, from the first three months of 2021, showed the LNG sector suffered the biggest losses of the financial year.<p><p>“However, the situation does not appear to be changing. In fact, the market is still in a difficult spot due to the volatility of the market. It is not surprising that there is more demand for LNG, but not as much demand as we would like,” Cosgrove said.<p><p>In October 2020, LNG prices crashed to levels of $US63 a tonne in New York. The total price of the commodity fell to $US71.1 million in October, the highest since 2009, according to data released last month by the National Association of Realtors.<p>']

headline: Dollar-pegged Swiss Bank Puts Bitcoin on the Balance Sheet
content: ['<p>The Swiss National Bank (SNB) put a deposit amount on the balance sheet of its Central Bank Holding Company (CBS) Swiss National Bank (CBS) Swiss National Bank subsidiary Swiss National Bank (SNB) in a bid to boost the Swiss franc exchange rate.<p><p>See also: Swiss National Bank Says Exchange-Traded MicroStrategy Can Boost FTSE 100 Firm’s Business<p> ']

headline: U.S. inflation pressures in December remain high
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON, Jan 29  - U.S. consumer price inflation rose to a seven-month high in December, a data source familiar with the situation said on Wednesday, signaling that policymakers are continuing to anticipate a continued decline in inflation.<p><p>December’s consumer price increase, however, was not much of a surprise given the central bank’s current policy stance. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a rate of 4.2% in 2020, up from 4.5% in November.<p><p>The rise was not in large part due to rising mortgage rates, which are seen as being broadly supportive of homebuilding as the U.S. economy picks up steam. Prices for a wide range of goods, including cars, homes and auto parts, rose 1.3% last month, their highest annual rate since November 2020, the data source said.<p><p>The Fed will update its current policy, which will start its first policy meeting in four months, to support inflation in its most recent report next month.<p><p>Consumer price inflation was 0.7% in December. (Reporting by David Ljunggren Editing by Ana Nicolaci da Costa)<p> ']

headline: Pitfalls to Be a Stakeholder for New Crypto ETFs in India
content: ['<p>India’s digital assets regulator has proposed a new trading facility for cryptocurrency companies, saying its current structures have not sufficiently underpinned digital asset investment opportunities.<p><p>Also read: Digital Asset Regulator to Suspend Exchange Rules for Firms That Don’t Sell Crypto<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 2-China posts first quarterly GDP contraction of 7.1%
content: ['<p>(Adds details, analysts’ comments, analyst reaction)<p><p>BEIJING, Jan 16  - China posted its first quarterly economic contraction in seven months in 2020, as the central bank tightened monetary policy to contain the COVID-19 pandemic, official data showed on Friday.<p><p>The economy contracted 1.1% in 2020 from a year earlier and grew 3.2% in 2021 from the previous quarter. The year-on-year growth was driven by higher commodity prices, which helped fuel China’s rebound in 2021, the official data showed.<p><p>It added that growth was driven by a 4.5% expansion in the value of state-owned companies, which accounts for half of GDP, and an 8.8% rise in real terms in real terms.<p><p>China closed the year with a record 713.5 trillion yuan ($1.63 trillion) of outstanding foreign-currency reserves, the government said on Friday.<p><p>Analysts are also concerned about the fiscal impact of higher bond yields on the economy as yields tend to fall in the first quarter.<p><p>The central bank is also considering tightening monetary policy in light of recent curbs on commercial borrowing.<p>']

headline: The Big Three: JPMorgan, Amazon, PayPal

headline: Vietnam March COVID-19 vaccine drops to lowest in eight years
content: ['<p>JAKARTA, March 15  - Vietnam’s coronavirus outbreak saw its lowest level since the Vietnam war in the 1990s, a vaccination campaign that saw an estimated 4.4 million doses reduced from a record high of 4 million doses in 2011, official data showed on Thursday.<p><p>The country was one of the world’s top vaccination recipients last year, but coronavirus cases have slowed amid escalating tensions between the Communist Party and the South China island nation. (Reporting by Terje Solsvik, editing by William Mallard)<p> ']

headline: Mt. Gox’s Custody Led by NFTs

headline: BitMEX Says it Raises $250M to Solve ‘Non-Aggressible’ Crypto Market
content: ['<p>BitMEX CEO Hugh Leshner announced on Monday that the “largest publicly traded crypto exchange” has closed its fundraising round in earnest.<p><p>Leshner also confirmed the firm’s $250 million Series B fund has been joined by the likes of BitMEX Ventures and Bitmain, who together raised $175 million in the second quarter of 2019 to date.<p><p>“With a combination of the best investing strategies available, we are now at $250 million to support our first public offering,” said Leshner.<p> ']

headline: A New Hope for Crypto Users
content: ['<p>“You can’t just go online,” said Alessandro DiPaolo, co-founder of the platform BitGo. “It takes a long time to connect the blockchain, and I think that’s when it’s gonna happen.”<p><p>But many crypto users still struggle. While it may be a boon to the overall ecosystem, many have expressed frustration over the lack of support for the decentralized exchange (DeFi) protocol, which currently has 10,000 active users.<p><p>“Many of the people that want to use [DeFi] are not using DeFi at all,” DiPaolo said in an interview. “Many DeFi [users] who want to use DeFi on their own account don’t have a clue how to use it or what tools it can provide and how to use it.”<p><p>BitGo’s partnership with BitGo marks the first time an exchange has made use of DeFi since the cryptocurrency’s early days, DiPaolo said, though he added that the two exchanges have not yet agreed on what tools to use.<p><p>BitGo, which has two exchanges, Bitstamp and BitGo Cash, says users who don’t want to be tied to a platform will still be able to use them, though some will need to upgrade their credentials, which will take some time.<p>']

headline: Liu Jingjing-Bo, CEO of Binance, Says Ripple Ventures Has Been Pushing Back Against DeFi Attacks
content: ['<p>Huobi is trying to get some investor backing to support its decentralized finance (DeFi) lending service.<p><p>See also: Ripple Ventures Taps VCs to Build ‘One Big Marketplace for DeFi Loans’<p> ']

headline: Visa, Mastercard and Other US Regulators Block BitGo Crypto’s Enterprise Trading System
content: ['<p>Mastercard, Mastercard Visa and other U.S. issuers have blocked a new cryptocurrency exchange protocol called BitGo Crypto’s Enterprise Trading System (ETS).<p><p>According to a report Tuesday by Bloomberg Business, U.S. regulators have ordered major U.S. trading platforms to halt operations following the company’s “cautious, aggressive, and ‘unprofessional” business practices, which they call “disruptive, unprofessional conduct” during BitGo’s launch in August.<p><p>Also read: US Bank Is Reported to Be Working With BitGo on ‘Cryptocurrency Exchange System’<p><p>On Wednesday, a report from Bloomberg Business stated that a number of U.S. banks had been asked to cease trading on BitGo Crypto’s “EXCERPT” platform.<p><p>“I can’t comment at this time on specific clients affected,” said a company spokesperson, adding:<p> ']

headline: Seychelles's ceded power to Catalonia as Catalonia's new president
content: ['<p>SEOUL, Jan 15  - The European Union is allowing Catalonia to decide its own future, the country’s president said on Tuesday, adding it should have jurisdiction over its own economy and provide “meaningful governance and security measures to ensure its complete independence.”<p><p>Lance Armstrong, Catalonia’s newly elected president, said the Catalan independence movement had become “a problem for society,” saying the bloc should take decisive steps to protect the sovereignty of Catalonia and guarantee independence.<p><p>The European Union and Spain have imposed a three-month shutdown of Catalonia’s economic institutions, while its government has postponed an official referendum on independence.<p><p>“If [independence] becomes legal, I expect that all Catalonia’s government institutions will be fully operational,” Armstrong said, saying the process of voting had taken eight to 12 hours. (Reporting by Caroline Copley Editing by Sam Holmes)<p> ']

headline: New York City Public Schools Pivot Back to Bitcoin
content: ['<p>Schools nationwide will begin selling their digital diplomas this year, with schools that offer online and classroom materials expected to become the first to offer the program in schools.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Savings Plan Goes Live With New York City Public Schools Starting With Blockchain Tech<p> ']

headline: Dune Blockchain Pilot Helps Developers Communicate, Monitor
content: ['<p>Developers can now share information about the upcoming dune blockchain with their collaborators on the Ethereum blockchain by creating a decentralized platform (Dune).<p><p>As reported by CoinDesk on Wednesday, the project, which was launched with support for XRP, Ethereum smart contract and blockchains EOS and BASH, was initially pitched as a way to bridge the gap between traditional data centers and decentralized services.<p><p>“The dune blockchain aims to be a bridge between Ethereum and the decentralized ecosystem,” said Ryan Smith, CEO of Dune. “You’ve never had a data center that wanted to use EOS or ERC-20.”<p><p>Read more: Dune Pilot Helps Developers Communicate, Monitor<p><p>“As the world has grown more connected, the Ethereum blockchain can help us connect to that infrastructure more directly,” said Dune CEO Daniel Moro. “Decentralized data centers like ours are the future.”<p><p>Dune will use Ethereum’s secure and transparent protocols to create the dune blockchain that can serve as the backbone to the existing system.<p><p>Read more: Dune Pilot Helps Developers Communicate, Monitor<p><p>For example, Dune will utilize XRP as its base asset on top of EOS, which will make Dune itself available to anyone using EOS, Moro said.']

headline: IsoF Credit Union to Help Binance Raise $20M via Crypto Staking
content: ['<p>Crypto-related lenders have reportedly received $20 million from IsoF since mid-2019, including bitcoin wallet provider Bitfury and the token-backed stablecoin fintech fintech incubator Digital Asset.<p><p>The U.S. bank said in a blog post it’s been actively seeking partners and funding for crypto lenders since late last year, adding, “We’re pleased to be working with companies looking to expand and scale their operations in Binance’s rapidly growing crypto lending market.”<p><p>Read more: What Is a Crypto Loan?<p><p>In a note, Bitfury said it was “committed to continuing to work with our partners and industry players to support the growth and growth of crypto lending throughout 2020.”<p> ']

headline: R3 Blockchain Raises $12M in Series A
content: ['<p>R3 Blockchain has joined a $12 million Series A funding round led by Circle, Square, BitGo and others.<p><p>Also read: R3’s Digital Dollar Raises $10M From $9M Funding Round<p> ']

headline: Tiny Ways Bitcoin Is Being Used as a Financial Tool
content: ['<p>Blockchain payments giant BitPay is using Bitcoin as a payment instrument.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the company said it has developed a “unique” bitcoin-backed electronic money (EBEM) transaction system. The EBEM can be used to access cryptocurrencies that do not normally be able to be accessed using traditional means of wire transfers, such as bitcoin cash.<p><p>BitPay said the system, which is available on all bitcoin exchanges, also provides a “unique convenience to users,” allowing them to transfer funds without having to worry about bitcoin’s provenance or identity, said BitPay CEO Brian Armstrong.<p><p>The platform’s “support for cryptocurrency transactions will enable customers to transfer funds in more efficient and seamless ways than ever before”, Armstrong said.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin’s Valuation Is A Bigger Problem Than an EBT Problem<p><p>The firm’s $3.5 billion bitcoin purchase represents about 25% of BitPay’s revenue. Bitcoin’s value rose by 25% last year from a $8.9 billion purchase in 2018.<p><p>According to the company, the EBEM system will be available to consumers starting in June 2019, with an initial purchase slated for later this year. It will also be available on BitPay’s Ecommerce platform in the U.S. and Canada.<p> ']

headline: Nexus Taps in-Demand Streaming to Stream YouTube Video, Music, Live-Music Video
content: ['<p>Nexus is taking a role in streaming video, streaming music and live-streaming the NBA All-Star game from its digital sports streaming service, according to an announcement Tuesday.<p><p>Also read: NBA All-Star Game Coverage App Now Supports YouTube Subscription Options<p> ']

headline: Listed Company, E-Learning Platform Sells Crypto Firm to Power Crypto Market
content: ['<p>An E-Learning platform for blockchain startups is bringing its first product, the S-Card, to market soon.<p><p>The e-learning platform was founded by two former employees at Digital Currency Group and the blockchain industry veterans LabVIEW, but joined the firm earlier this month by former E-Commerce Exec Dan Lane, former Digital Currency Group CTO Brian Leussink and former EMEA CEO Michael Saunders.<p><p>Also read: Crypto Fund Maker S.T.E.O. Labs to Launch in Canada’s First Crypto District<p> ']

headline: How Ethereum Governance Could Replace Bitcoin: the Blockchain
content: ['<p>This past April, I tweeted that bitcoin’s price had tripled in the last 24 hours as Ethereum’s hashrate surged. The following week, I tweeted “So Ethereum’s price jumped 10x.<p><p>“I’m not even going to judge ETH or USD. ETH is the most important asset by far.” I tweeted.<p><p>But as I’d get more in depth with how Ethereum has evolved, I’d get a bit more analytical. How Ethereum is governed by an Ethereum network is a different question.<p><p>Ethereum’s governance model is analogous to that of Bitcoin’s, which relies on the ability to mint assets by issuing nodes, as opposed to mining a block of transactions. Bitcoin uses a different approach. Bitcoin’s governance model relies on Ethereum’s hashpower.<p><p>To illustrate what Ethereum’s governance model is, let’s take a close look at how Ethereum’s protocol manages the issuance of tokens.<p><p>There are two types of tokens, A and B. A token is owned by the Ethereum network, and A is traded on an Ethereum exchange, the exchange for a variety of cryptocurrencies. A B token is a special type of token. (See also: Ethereum’s Protocol Takes Aim at Traders Who Don’t Trust Tokens)<p>']

headline: Citigroup’s New Cryptocurrency to Make Its Way to the Swiss Market
content: ['<p>The U.S. banking giant is making its Swiss banking network a virtual asset and digital asset trading platform.<p><p>Read more: Bank of England Governor Says ‘Very Clear’ That Banks Can ‘Trace’ Crypto Assets<p> ']

headline: Seychelles says it has begun to consider lifting lockdown measures but still needs'substantial change'
content: ['<p>BRUSSELS, March 26  - The European Union said on Monday it was considering “substantial changes” to its emergency measures aimed at stabilising a country struggling to contain a severe coronavirus-related outbreak, as it prepares to implement them.<p><p>The bloc is seen as backing Britain’s European Union’s decision to leave the European Union and the UK’s decision to leave the European Union, with other EU countries in the alliance saying they will not seek wider accession.<p><p>The bloc has so far suspended most of Britain’s most popular vaccines since the end of the 1990s and has vowed to implement all existing measures, including suspending vaccinations in most European countries, without delay.<p><p>A statement from the bloc, which includes Britain, the United States and the Netherlands, said the British decision, backed by Europe and the United States, had “given pause to the authorities and authorities in other Member States”, but would remain until the situation in the countries concerned improved.<p><p>It said it was “convinced of the importance of this important development as it will facilitate the speedy, effective delivery of all measures which are needed to prevent a repeat of events.”<p><p>“We are hopeful that the outcome of the recent review of its emergency measures, the implementation of which will take place in the coming weeks, will enable it to fully implement them,” it added.<p> ']

headline: U.S. crude oil imports exceed projections
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON, Feb 13  - Energy imports exceeded U.S. production for the sixth consecutive month in February, largely due to an upwardly revised rise in shipments from natural gas and petroleum products, the Commerce Department said on Tuesday.<p><p>Exports of crude oil, including petroleum products, totaled 303,800 barrels per day (bpd), or 2.55 million barrels per day, the Energy Information Administration said. (Reporting by David Ljunggren Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p> ']

headline: The Crypto Community Must Have Attention Now: Why We Are In this Year’s ‘Pivot to the Blockchain
content: ['<p>On the heels of the global financial crisis that is starting to take hold, there is a fresh interest in blockchain tech.<p><p>In a world where people often feel threatened by government intrusion and bureaucratic snags, there is a real sense of purpose and trust. This sense of purpose has deep roots in the Bitcoin community. Some of the founders of the community, including Jeff Garlinghouse, have said publicly they believe the “digital dollar” should not be used in any form by the central banks because they don’t think it will ever be secure. The value of cryptocurrencies is in their ability to act as a bridge between society and the money supply. But there’s another side to this world that is not connected to the economy.<p><p>In 2015, the World Economic Forum listed blockchain development as a key priority. For years, Bitcoin has been a contentious topic among many community members. In 2017, after it was reported that the Chinese central bank had issued an unprecedented ban on virtual currencies, the “Internet of Money” was created. Since then, the concept of “money” has taken on a life of its own, with crypto advocates and proponents often talking about the “central bank digital currency” as the solution to the problems it solves for the financial system.<p><p>Some commentators argue that cryptocurrencies could actually solve the underlying problems with financial services, but they are largely mistaken. The problem is that the centralized financial system does not have the tools, tools, tools, tools, to solve the underlying problems, or at least to create them, right now.']

headline: The Blockchain Startup Behind PayPal’s Stealth Token and Other Largest Trades Raises $1.8M
content: ['<p>PayPal’s private bitcoin exchange, PwC, is working with blockchain startup Bitpanda, whose blockchain-based payments platform has earned around $1.8 million from investors.<p><p>The company said Monday it raised $1.8 million through a seed round, led by Compound Capital, in order to help build out Bitpanda’s bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF).<p><p>Bitpanda also announced Tuesday it has partnered with bitcoin exchange Binance and other institutional players to build out its bitcoin derivatives exchange, CoinDesk has learned.<p><p>“When you think about bitcoin derivatives and other derivatives that operate on an exchange-traded fund (ETF), we want to make sure we’re not just putting a bunch of ushers in to make sure we have the capital to buy, we want to make sure we have the capital to operate,” said Bitpanda CEO and co-founder Kevin Roose.<p><p>The firm said it will be conducting a second round of financing, backed by Compound Capital, in the fourth quarter of this year. It will invest in bitcoin derivatives through Bitpanda’s institutional subsidiary BitShares, the firm said.<p><p>Read more: PayPal Launches ‘Lightning’ Bitcoin Trading Platform<p>']

headline: Ripple Sees Bitcoin Investment in China on High: Report
content: ['<p>China’s central bank last week held a $50 million bitcoin mining contract, the largest in Chinese history, to help it keep the yuan in circulation.<p><p>Read more: China’s Central Bank Cuts Off $2B in Bitcoin Mining Contracts<p> ']

headline: Cleveland Cavaliers End Quarter With Biggest Loss in NBA’s Second Round, Says NBA Top Shot’s Dave Cayton
content: ["<p>The Cleveland Cavaliers, on a winning streak that was matched by a monster loss in the regular season, will enter the final month of the regular season undefeated and in better shape than before, according to NBA veteran and Basketball-Reference columnist Dave Cayton.<p><p>“Going into the first half we were all expecting it to be a loss,” Cayton said in an interview with Yahoo Sports' Chris Cillizza. “But we knew it was going to be a win.”<p><p>Cayton, who has been in the game since last summer, said he was disappointed in the Cavaliers’ first game in which they went <PAD>  and did poorly.<p><p>In the third quarter, Cleveland came back to the court and gave up seven points on 3s and shooting <BOS>  least three-pointers in the league. The Cavs took advantage of a 2-2 hole early on as James had more shooting and fewer turnovers, making an all-around defensive performance to preserve the lead.<p><p>The NBA Finals were not played for much longer, with the series winding down at 12 p.m. ET. As the coronavirus crisis deepened and the Cavaliers faced a tough road to a second straight victory, Cayton said it was “essential that we get this right.”<p>"]

headline: Mint Supply Drops From 14.2% in 2020 to 9.9% in 2021
content: ['<p>Mint Supply, the world’s largest mint, fell to the lowest since records began, from 14.2% at the beginning of 2020, the Financial Times reported. The decline in Mint Supply’s market share from 2019 is driven by a sharp rise in the price of bitcoin and ether – the two most used cryptocurrencies in the world – both decreasing over the past year.<p><p>“Mint Supply’s decline reflects its gradual economic and political transition from decentralized finance (DeFi) to a networked system where all participants are fully aware of the value of their investments,” said Christopher Houshey, Mint Supply’s Chief Technology Officer.<p><p>Mint Supply is the second-largest mint by market cap with a market value of $6.9 billion.<p><p>In a March 20 report, Bitcoin Magazine compared Mint Supply’s market share to Bitwise’s and found that Mint Supply has steadily increased its value in the last year due to the rise in demand for its products and services. Bitcoin Magazine then compared Mint Supply’s total market share to its price in 2019 to see how Mint Supply’s growth is related to its market cap.<p><p>“The market share of cryptocurrency assets by market cap has been extremely high in recent months,” noted Houshey. “Mint Supply’s size and prominence are therefore indicative of how cryptocurrency assets in the U.S. are being used in ways that have yet to be seen in Europe or Asia.”']

headline: Crypto Derivatives Exchange BitMEX Launches Crypto Derivatives Service
content: ['<p>BitMEX, the exchange founded by Charles Hoskinson, has launched its own derivatives trading platform.<p><p>The exchange has a focus on cryptocurrency assets that are stable against interest rate fluctuations, it said in a blog post Thursday. It has previously conducted bitcoin futures trading, including a stablecoin named the “BitMEX TRIFEX.”<p><p>BitMEX will be available in 11 U.S. states, including Delaware, Florida and Texas, said Hoskinson, who co-founded BitMEX in 2019. It was initially planned to launch in Canada but postponed due to regulatory issues, he said.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Derivatives Exchange BitMEX Launches New Trading Platform<p><p>BitMEX has a history of serving investors seeking higher rates on cryptocurrency assets. Last week, it launched a derivative trading platform called “BitMEX BALAC,” which was acquired by Pantera Capital in a deal worth $3.2 million.<p><p>Hoskinson said BitMEX has been focused on stablecoins and was also looking to expand to other markets. He said in 2019 that he expected his exchange to become “the go-to place for high-quality crypto-related derivatives exchanges.”<p> ']

headline: Crypto Finance Giant Genesis Partners With CryptoLabs to Build a ‘Smart Money Market’
content: ['<p>Genesis Investment Company, a cryptocurrency investment bank, has partnered with cryptocurrency exchange Gemini to create a “smart money market” that could “interchange fiat currencies seamlessly,” Genesis co-founder and CEO Hugh Beshara said in a press statement Monday.<p><p>In an interview with CoinDesk, Beshara said Genesis is a member of the CryptoLabs board of directors and is also a member of the crypto finance advisory group. The exchange said in a statement it would “continue to support Genesis as we move forward with developing products and services.”<p><p>Read more: Crypto Labs, Gemini Announces First Phase of New Series A With Ripple<p><p>Read more: Genesis’ Bitwise Buys Crypto Exchange Gemini to Double Revenue for New $600M Fund<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin Investors in 2020 Led to Overwhelming Crypto Lending Demand<p><p>The platform will allow investors to deposit crypto in fiat and then transfer the cryptocurrency to the Genesis smart contract for the amount of the cryptocurrency they’re interested in.<p><p>The platform will make payments on Genesis’ digital assets as well as its other assets such as cryptocurrency futures, Beshara said. The exchange said the smart contract would allow traders to select their own amount for the contract, with no deposit fees for any crypto deposit.<p>']

headline: China March imports rise 8.7% y/y; exports surge 16%
content: ['<p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s imports jumped 8.7% in March from a year earlier, customs data showed on Thursday, as exports to the world’s top trading partner jumped.<p><p>China imported 743.54 tonnes of goods last month, up 2.8% on the previous month, customs said, compared with imports of 642.58 tonnes in February.<p><p>The Commerce Ministry said China’s trade surplus increased to 61.58 trillion yuan ($1.4 trillion) in March from 64.34 trillion yuan in February.<p><p>It said there were 11.8 billion tonnes of natural gas in March, compared with 11.73 billion tonnes in February.<p><p>China entered the world’s largest economy in 2019, having slashed its current account deficit to a record $1.42 trillion and lifted trade with the world’s second-biggest economy by 2.9 trillion yuan last year.<p><p>The government has pledged to maintain a low carbon economy by 2030, while tackling climate change and reducing coal-fired power plants by 2030. (Reporting by Ryan Woo and Rui Wu; Editing by Maria Sheahan)<p> ']

headline: Alibaba Opens Up About 100,000 Bitcoin Miner Production Units as Its First ‘Business Plan’
content: ['<p>Chinese retail giant Alibaba is expanding its digital mining operations to more than 100,000 mining machines in just a few months.<p><p>Read more: Amazon Joins China’s Digital Mining Industry Network in $3.5B Deal<p> ']

headline: Ethereum Hires Goldman Sachs to Partner as Senior Director
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency markets regulator ErisX is joining Goldman Sachs on a new professional development team as the firm’s head of business strategy, Dan Schulman.<p><p>The former Goldman Sachs vice president of sales and marketing is joining JPMorgan’s ranks as the firm’s new “senior director” for research and technology. Schulman was appointed to head ErisX’s global sales and business development team last month.<p><p>Schulman has been at the forefront of blockchain-focused initiatives, including the integration of smart contracts and bitcoin in a bid to bolster cryptocurrency adoption in the U.S. He previously worked at Compound Global, a digital asset services company.<p><p>“I will continue to be involved in the bitcoin community,” Schulman told CoinDesk via email. “While we believe in bitcoin as an essential asset to the economy, we are in touch with many others to get to know them.”<p> ']

headline: Dune Crypto Exchange Adds Deposits, Options on Derivatives
content: ['<p>Decentralized trading platform Dune has added options trading, options trading on its derivatives exchange as it prepares for regulatory requirements to launch its crypto derivatives product.<p><p>Dune, which closed in 2019 with over $200 million in assets under management, is among several crypto exchanges that are looking to add crypto derivatives services to their platforms.<p><p>As reported by CoinDesk in April 2020, Dune was the second-largest cryptocurrency derivatives exchange in the world after Coinbase, with over $300 million in trading volume. The exchange also announced it would add option trading for the first time in February.<p><p>As CoinDesk reported in March, the exchange announced it would release its option trading feature later this year.<p><p>The service will be available to all crypto investors, according to Dune CEO Kevin Fenton. “All cryptocurrency options trading is subject to the same trading rules as other derivatives trading,” Fenton told CoinDesk. “We believe that this means that all users will be able to access the same tools and functionality.”<p> ']

headline: Binance Capital, Coinbase, Xapo, Gemini
content: ['<p>“I’m excited to join Binance Capital’s team at Coinbase and Gemini, and also the new team we will join soon after the launch of Binance Digital Assets.”<p><p>Binance Capital announced its involvement on Tuesday, along with Coinbase Ventures, the leading institutional investor in blockchain technologies.<p><p>Coinbase Ventures, who includes CoinDesk’s Brian Blum, CEO of Bitwise, said Coinbase’s acquisition would "open new doors to the crypto space,” with more than $1 billion of institutional exposure to the cryptocurrency.<p><p>“I love Binance Capital. I’m excited to be part of their new and exciting team,” Brian told CoinDesk via email. “I’ll be thrilled to work with them as the new Coinbase CEO, as the new Coinbase Ventures president, and as Coinbase CFO.”<p><p>Read more: Coinbase’s First DeFi Protocol – Coinbase’s First Crypto Trading App – Is Ready for Launch<p><p>Brian said he’d like to thank Coinbase Ventures for helping secure the digital asset exchange’s regulatory compliance, the $300 million annual revenue it raised last year and the recent $3.9 billion valuation it reported this week. Coinbase also contributed to Coinbase’s initial coin offering, a pilot of which closed on Dec. 8, 2021.<p>']

headline: HBO, Fintech, Fintechs and Others Investing in Crypto Mining
content: ['<p>Hong Kong-based fintech group Digital Assets Group has launched a new cryptocurrency mining pool called Crypto Mining Pool (SMG).<p><p>SMG, also known as Digital Assets Group or DAIG, announced Wednesday a partnership with Hong Kong-based firm MicroStrategy, which will use the funds to expand its pool to other sectors including mining, video editing and digital asset sales.<p><p>The investment comes courtesy of a $1.4 million seed round led by VC firm Crypto Asset Management Limited (CAML), according to the firm’s website.<p><p>The Crypto Mining Pool project aims to bring cryptocurrencies from the fintech sector into the hands of professional investors and industry players. It’s also aimed to offer an alternative for traditional fintech players by allowing them to invest in digital assets directly.<p><p>The firm, which is based in Hong Kong and is also the holder of the Hong Kong Financial Intelligence Bureau’s (HKFA), Crypto Asset Management Limited is the regulated broker-dealer of the digital asset market. The firm, which is also led by Fidelity Investments, is also the owner of Digital Asset Management.<p><p>Read more: US Commodities Provider MicroStrategy Launches ‘Digital Asset Pool’ for Crypto Mining<p>']

headline: U.S. growth in 2020 shrinks to 1.3% and imports surge by 25%
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - The United States posted an annualized 0.3% decline in imports and imports last year after accelerating its economic recovery, the Commerce Department said on Monday.<p><p>Exports jumped 30% in 2020 from a year earlier, the largest jump in 25 years, and imports surged 35%. The data showed imports and exports rose for a third straight month, the fastest pace since December 2013, the most since April 2014.<p><p>Imports from China rose 0.5% in 2020 after an average of 4.8 million Chinese workers were added in the first quarter of last year. Customs saw shipments increase by more than 6 million people in November.<p><p>Exports to Russia increased 4.2% last year from a year earlier. Imports to China were down 1.5% on year.<p><p>Imports from Japan increased 4.6% in 2020 from a year earlier, while imports from the United States rose 2.5%. Imports from the United Kingdom and France dropped by 1.2% and 0.2%, respectively.<p><p>Imports from China were up 22% from a year earlier and imports were up 34%. Exports from Russia, which is struggling with the coronavirus, were down 16%.<p>']

headline: Cleveland Crushers Head to Mexico City After Rioting: Report
content: ['<p>The Cleveland Cavaliers’ locker room erupted into rioting Monday as NBA star LeBron James was ejected from the game amid allegations of assault.<p><p>On social media, some reacted by throwing bottles at James. James was ejected from the game and reportedly had to be stretchered off the court. <p><p>Later Monday, a photo of LeBron slumped over was taken from outside the arena and posted online by James supporters. It shows his shirt in the street as fans of the Cleveland Cavaliers gathered to watch a game against the Los Angeles Kings. <p><p>The picture was shared more than 1.5 million times and shared over 30,000 times.<p><p>James is being represented by attorney Joe Fernandez. He will be represented by U.S. Attorney Catherine L. Hardaway.<p><p>The Cavs were off in Mexico City to play the Chicago Bulls.<p><p>The incident was captured on social media by LeBron’s brother and later released by TMZ. <p>']

headline: Ethereum 2.0 Has a Biggest Problem: A Lack of Trust
content: ['<p>The Ethereum 2.0 blockchain has a problem: It’s a project without trust.<p><p>We saw this happen in 2017, when Ethereum 2.0 was built on top of the LavaChain network, the block explorer protocol that manages ERC-20 tokens. It is the project’s largest failure yet, according to a report from The CoinDesk Foundation, and it’s still the worst failure of all.<p><p>The Ethereum 2.0 blockchain is so complex it’s difficult to understand what it does, and it may well be in for a rough ride. Even the most experienced Ethereum developers don’t know it, and they won’t understand why,” said Jeremy Allaire, who teaches blockchain and network analysis at the University of California, Berkeley.<p><p>The problem, though, is that “everyone wants their block explorer to behave like a trustless node,” Allaire added, explaining that it is hard to trust ERC-20 tokens and how trusting they are to each other.<p><p>As a result, it’s difficult to understand how the Ethereum 2.0 network will interact with the ERC-20 network.<p><p>Ethereum 2.0 has three main shortcomings:<p><p>First, it’s not a public block explorer. The consensus mechanism for the ERC-20 block explorer is also unknown.<p>']

headline: NFTs: Why Privacy-Driven Digital Assets Will Become Mainstream
content: ['<p>Decentralized data storage and data storage platform NFTs are gaining prominence thanks to their ability to offer a range of privacy-conscious applications, according to industry figures.<p><p>The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) recently released its 2018 report on digital assets, which highlighted NFTs as a means to tackle key privacy concerns, including privacy breaches and counterparty risk, which NFTs pose.<p><p>At the same time, the privacy-focused digital asset space, which has been dominated by decentralized exchanges (dapps), is likely to see a significant expansion in the coming years. Digital asset privacy is at its infancy, and there is no denying it, as CoinDesk has reported in a previous report.<p><p>The report noted:<p><p>However, privacy-conscious digital assets do not necessarily pose a threat to privacy, as a recent study by the University of Arkansas at Little Rock found. It concluded:<p><p>Researchers at the University of Arkansas, led by William J. Blumquist, analyzed the data collected by NFTs and found the “current trend has shown that privacy-oriented and digital asset services will become increasingly important in the near future,” according to the report.<p><p>Read more: NFTs Have Boosted Privacy in US Over the Last Month<p>']

headline: Algorand Is Building Out a Privacy-Backed Bitcoin Trust With a New Bitcoin Trust
content: ['<p>Algorand is building out a Bitcoin Trust, aiming to attract more institutional clients.<p><p>In its first two phases, the company has secured $1 million in Bitcoin, according to CEO Tom Griesbach. The third phase, which will allow investors to buy and sell bitcoin on a daily basis, is expected to bring in some $3 million.<p><p>Griesbach also confirmed Algorand’s plans to open a trust to the public, which will be limited to only accredited investors.<p><p>“There will be a number of digital assets that have the potential to be used in the public ledger,” Griesbach said. “Some will be considered blockchains, and some will be considered legacy assets, and those will be used in the Trusts.”<p><p>The Algorand Bitcoin Trust will be built with the help of Bitcoin Foundation blockchain infrastructure firm Chainalysis, according to a press release on Thursday.<p><p>Read more: Algorand Launches Bitcoin Trust Using Chainalysis’ Blockchain-Based Digital Currency<p><p>With the new Trust, the Algorand team is adding a layer of security to the Bitcoin blockchain that will allow a client to easily trade transactions, manage balances and verify transaction data.<p><p>Read more: Algorand Blockchain Adds Built-In Security to Bitcoin Wallet, Version 2<p>']

headline: The Rave Protocol Is Going to Roll Out a ‘Paycheck Protection Token’
content: ['<p>The cryptocurrency ecosystem’s most recent iteration, the Rave Protocol, announced Monday it is rolling out a “Paycheck Protection Token (PPT).”<p><p>PPT was selected from several exchanges including Coinbase, Bitfinex, Kraken and Coinbase, said the startup, based in Brooklyn, N.Y.<p><p>PPT’s purpose is to prevent fraudsters from gaining access to bitcoin wallets, a “huge improvement over the current ‘fraud alert’ feature that’s been in place for over two years.”<p><p>See also: Rave Protocol Adds ‘Secret Wallet’ Support for MacOS X and Linux<p><p>According to the website, PPT offers a security token that enables a user to “allow bitcoin to be sold without requiring any fees.” It also provides a way for users to “unlock, buy, sell, withdraw, and more cryptocurrencies without needing to have a wallet address.”<p><p>See also: Coinbase to Launch ‘Paycheck Protection’ Tokens for New Businesses<p><p>The company said users will be able to set up their PPTs with a few clicks and then receive an alert via email that alerts the wallet of fraudulent activity.<p>']

headline: Venezuela is not without problems. It has seen a sharp fall in the number of coronavirus cases and shortages of medicines, leading to its current economic slump.
content: ['<p><p>A few months ago Venezuela’s economy plunged 11% year-on-year as the National Guard stormed the streets, closing schools, shut down factories, and shut down pharmacies. More than a million Venezuelans were denied a form of vaccinations, many of them without proper vaccination, because of the coronavirus, the government reported.<p><p>Today, the country has become the fourth-biggest buyer of oil, after Russia and China. And it is still the second-largest producer of rubber, after Brazil.<p><p>Inflation in 2017 was 25.6% the highest on record, the government reported in an annual report. <p><p>“We’re living in a world of perpetual shortages and the suffering of many Venezuelans.” President Nicolás Maduro has vowed to tackle that problem. <p><p>Yet Maduro’s government is under pressure to impose severe restrictions that have forced thousands to flee and threaten to cut off economic activity. <p><p>Over 100,000 people, mostly poor children, have been forced to leave their homes because of the restrictions. More than 350,000 Venezuelans, many working as doctors or as service workers, have died in fighting since President Nicolas Maduro’s administration stepped in in November. <p>']

headline: JPMorgan Chief Says DeFi Exchange Kraken Can Make Blockchain Finance More Efficient
content: ['<p>One of the world’s largest decentralized finance (DeFi) exchanges has raised more than $3 million in an initial coin offering (ICO) bid.<p><p>See also: JPMorgan’s SEC Suit Against Kraken Is Overblown, Says ‘DeFi Craze Is Coming From a Crowded Economy<p> ']

headline: PvtFinance Adds Blockchain-Based Insurance and Reserves Funds
content: ['<p>PvtFinance, the crypto exchange’s parent company, is now offering cryptocurrency insurance, as part of its plans to build out its cryptocurrency reserves.<p><p>PvtFinance CEO Hugh McClelland said the new feature will help the exchange secure its crypto assets. While the issuer is working to create an insurance policy for cryptocurrencies, McClelland said he’d like to use “a combination of traditional and blockchain technology.”<p><p>“We can now offer a simple insurance product to our employees, our community and our customers that is tailored to the needs of the crypto industry,” McClelland said.<p><p>PvtFinance CEO Hugh McClelland said the insurance feature will provide “proof of origin” for its crypto asset holdings, adding that the firm will be adding other features such as its insurance options, allowing more employees to use crypto assets in different industries.<p><p>“PvtFinance supports crypto assets from multiple blockchain protocols, with one of the earliest being BlockFi and its current stablecoin, Stellar,” said the firm’s website. “As such, we are actively working to provide insurance for our cryptocurrency assets to our customers and will be integrating with other crypto exchanges by the end of Q2 2020.”<p><p>While Coinbase is the first crypto exchange to offer crypto insurance, others, including Coinbase CTO Richard Corcoran and Coinbase Trust, are looking to bolster cryptocurrency exposure.<p>']

headline: BitMEX Gets US Dollar Issue in Stablecoin on Dec 23
content: ['<p>CoinDesk columnist Joshua Birch will be reporting on the bitcoin asset and stablecoin exchange BitMEX on Dec 23.<p><p><p> ']

headline: CZ Labs Offers Crypto Custody Services for US Banking Customers
content: ['<p>Crypto services firm CZ Labs is offering banking services to customers in the U.S. to help them manage their financial accounts.<p><p>Announced Wednesday, CZ’s cryptocurrency custody solution will allow customers to send crypto to their bank accounts by way of “cryptocurrency exchange” services and cryptocurrency settlement systems, according to the company. This will provide additional security and expedited transaction execution and settlement of bitcoin, ether, and U.S. dollars.<p><p>See also: Crypto Custody Platform Lender Blockchain Blockfolio Will Offer Crypto Assets to Investors in 2021<p><p>CZ is the co-founder and CEO of the digital asset platform Zcash. He told CoinDesk his company provides custody solutions to clients in the U.S., Europe and Australia.<p><p>“You can be a custodian, but you’re also a digital asset issuer,” CZ Labs CEO Daniel Lubin told CoinDesk in an interview. “You have a company called Zcash that operates and operates and manages a lot of their blockchain tech. They’re really the custodian of digital assets and the payment network.”<p><p>CZ’s service will connect the Zcash client to its traditional custodial provider in the U.S. as well, Lubin said. The solution will enable clients to send and receive cryptocurrency through the service and also provide instant settlement and settlement of fiat currencies on-chain.<p> ']

headline: U.S. consumer confidence surges to 10-year high - Reuters poll
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - Consumer confidence has surged to its highest since July 2018 as Americans continue to feel the effects of the coronavirus outbreak, a survey showed on Wednesday, as the coronavirus pandemic is spreading further and the coronavirus remains strong.<p><p>Consumer confidence rose to its highest level in more than a year in December, a Reuters poll had found.<p><p>“We are now at the point where we can say, ‘Oh, well, this is what it has become,” said Pollyanna Moller, head of research at The Economist Group. “Now we just have to keep doing better and keep doing better.”<p><p>The survey had a random sample of 1,700 adults selected from all 50 states.<p><p>Last month, the Consumer Price Index (CPI), an indicator of consumer sentiment, rose to its highest level since September 2018. It measures both how well consumers are using their money and whether they are spending it appropriately.<p><p>The Bank of England said on Wednesday its inflation target for 2021 stood at 0.3%, unchanged from the previous quarter.<p><p>It also said the economy is likely to grow 4.6% in 2021 from 4.5% in 2020.<p><p>In the final two weeks of the year, confidence rose to its highest level since February 2018 when it rose to its highest level since February 2018.<p> ']

headline: Luxury Binance Invests in Crypto Firm Ripple
content: ['<p>Luxury Binance has bought the rights to its blockchain startup Ripple.<p><p>The French startup acquired Ripple Digital Assets Limited (RXDL), an early-stage blockchain platform founded in 2009, for €500 million ($523 million).<p><p>Ripple announced Wednesday that the acquisition follows a yearlong strategic partnership with the firm, which also includes Luxembourg-based investment firm Pantera Capital.<p><p>Ripple, founded in 2009, launched in March 2020 as the first non-fungible token (NFT) blockchain on the Ethereum blockchain and was launched to compete with the likes of Compound Finance and MakerDAO earlier this year.<p><p>Ripple has a long history of partnering with blockchain firms. Blockchain firms like Ripple had access to the largest pool of global crypto market participants in 2009, before its acquisition by the crypto exchange.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Exchange Bitstamp Raises $3M From New York State’s Lottery Commission<p><p>See also: Bitstamp Rolls Out Blockchain Services in China<p><p>Ripple is the only blockchain-based digital asset company in the world to hold a patent, the U.K.-based crypto firm CoinDesk reported Tuesday.<p> ']

headline: SINGAPORE, Jan 31 (Reuters) - The central bank eased its monetary policy settings on Thursday after tightening a $2.5 trillion bond-buying programme since February and stabilising bond yields more slowly than in February.
content: ['<p><p>The Singapore Monetary Policy Board (MMP) said the central bank continued to support the benchmark 10-year bond, after it cut the policy rate to zero last month to encourage more monetary stimulus. It also pledged to hold an interest rate at a record low 0.5%.<p><p>“The policy rate remains at zero on the overnight yield,” said MMP Governor Changpeng He.<p> ']

headline: U.S. trade surplus tmsnrt.rs/2hw4eQ6 - Treasury
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - U.S. trade surplus tmsnrt.rs/2hw4eQ6 in December reached $9.8 billion, a record high and the first in nearly three decades, the Treasury Department said on Friday.<p><p>It was $5.3 billion higher than in November 2020 and was a record high, following a $1.8 billion deficit in 2020 from January through February, and matching the median annual increase of $4.1 billion from February through March.<p><p>The increase in trade with the United States came at a time when the United States has been accused of trying to influence a vote in Congress to approve a planned $1.9 trillion infrastructure spending plan. ($1 = 1.8192 U.S. dollars) (Reporting by Ann Saphir Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p> ']

headline: Cox’s DeFi-Focused Startup Is Now Selling Crypto Custody Tools
content: ['<p>Blockchain custodian Cox wants to make its platform accessible to institutional investors.<p><p>See also: Crypto Custody Firm Cox Launches Trading Service in US, Europe<p> ']

headline: Crypto Exchange Uniswap to Open in the U.S.
content: ['<p>Listed cryptocurrency exchange Uniswap is opening up in the U.S., officially opening on Friday.<p><p>See also: CoinDesk: Uniswap Raises $10M to Become New US Partner<p> ']

headline: Coinbase’s SEC App Is Now Offline
content: ['<p>Coinbase is back with another version of its popular public blockchain application, Coinbase Private, a fresh twist on the traditional public ledger.<p><p>The crypto exchange announced Tuesday it had replaced Coinbase Private with Coinbase Privo, a private-key blockchain from a new company, Coin Metrics that helps blockchain-based businesses and institutions secure key management data. The move comes as the exchange faces legal action in the U.S. and possibly as part of an ongoing investigation by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.<p><p>Privacy advocates have been quick to criticize Coinbase for its use of a new private key system, one which is not currently supported by Coin Metrics. While Coinbase Private, which also includes Coinbase XRP, offers a private key management interface built on top of Coin Metrics, privacy advocates said Coin Metrics is too easy to implement.<p><p>“The idea that Coinbase might be using its new private key management service for any reason would be too far-fetched,” Coin Metrics’ founder and CEO Michael Cushing said in a press release. “But these new tools add functionality that is not currently supported by Coin Metrics.”<p><p>The exchange says it’s now able to “redesign and improve” Coinbase Private’s security.<p><p>“Coinbase is working to move forward,” Coinbase wrote in a blog post, explaining that its private key management system is now available as a product and in the hands of users.<p>']

headline: Crypto Trust and Fund Builder Block.one Adds Blockchain-Based Security Services
content: ['<p>Block.one, a blockchain asset manager, has added security services to its Trust and Fund Builder app in the form of a new suite of blockchain services.<p><p>The addition of security services to Block.one’s suite of blockchain tools, the Block.one Security Tokens (BST) will allow users to easily create their own private keys without the need for third-party security token management.<p><p>“The BTS will allow users to protect their funds on a private Blockchain by storing data, verifying transactions and saving them for later use,” the company said in a press release. “Blockchain has always been the primary method for establishing trust between Trust and Fund Builder,” it added.<p><p>Read more: Why Block.one’s Security Token Program Raised $20M After Funding Round<p><p>The security tokens’ security is designed to protect against unauthorized access of funds or funds held in Block.one’s Custody API.<p><p>The app is available only to Block.one Custody team members.<p> ']

headline: Moody's lowers benchmark UK's factory activity to -2.1% y/y
content: ['<p>LONDON  - The Bank of England will leave its quantitative easing (QE) programme on Tuesday to help boost its economy, the head of the Treasury said, but stressed the UK economy is on track to grow by 3% this year.<p><p>It is widely expected to be the final time the Bank of England sets out its QE programme to reduce its economic drag. But the move is likely to add pressure on the bloc’s second-biggest economy and would put pressure on other economies in the euro zone.<p><p>The outlook for economic growth in 2021 and into the foreseeable future remained largely unchanged, according to a Reuters poll of economists.<p><p>However, the Treasury said it remained cautious about the pace at which the UK’s factory activity will move.<p><p>“Our forecast is that the UK’s economy shrinks by 5% this year - and our view is that by the end of 2021 this will not be the case,” the policymaker added.<p><p>He added: “We remain confident the QE programme will help to stabilise the UK’s manufacturing sector and that the recovery is accelerating.”<p> ']

headline: Seychelles c.bank says it is ready to lend
content: ['<p>KUALA LUMPUR, Feb 25  - The Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS) on Monday said it would be ready to issue collateral in case of a debt default on Jan. 25.<p><p>The lender said it was prepared to lend out capital collateral in case of an emergency, adding it would assess the maturity of the note “at the earliest possible date,” a move it said would signal it was ready to accept risk management and lend against equity in the company.<p><p>“While we have fully assessed all risk management options, and taken action to assure that, there is still significant risk to the capital of the company,” it said in a statement.<p><p>The central bank said in October it would issue 2.5 billion SEK ($6.76 billion) in cash collateral in case of an insolvency.<p> ']

headline: China Jan CPI shrank 4.1% y/y in Jan
content: ['<p>BEIJING, Feb 8  - China’s annual consumer price index shrank 4.1% in January from the same month a year earlier, data from the General Administration of Customs showed on Tuesday, as manufacturers struggled to come up with new pricing strategies for their products amid surging COVID-19 cases.<p><p>In a report for Reuters, the General Administration said the index shrank by 2.8% from a year earlier and posted the lowest monthly loss of 14.8% as coronavirus cases hit local businesses. (Reporting by Emily Chow and Liangfei Liu; Editing by Gwladys Fouche)<p> ']

headline: Ripple Launches Bitcoin Savings Plan With New Bitcoin Rewards Card
content: ['<p>Ripple’s bitcoin savings plan will launch on the Ripple app Tuesday.<p><p>See also: Ripple to Support New Crypto App in New York City<p> ']

headline: The Ethereum Blockchain Is the New York State’s First Crypto Mining Plant
content: ['<p>The decentralized financial system is making its way to New York City’s burgeoning mining industry.<p><p>Crypto mining has become a fixture in Brooklyn’s financial district as residents gather to pay their miners for the electricity that they consume. Mining operations in Brooklyn also provide services like voting, as well as access to crypto exchange Coinbase.<p><p>Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said in an interview Tuesday that the company’s goal for the Brooklyn mining industry is to digitize the process in one of the state’s most attractive markets.<p><p>“Right now, there’s not a lot of options right now in New York City to run these things,” Armstrong said of the city’s economic prospects, referring to the bitcoin mining industry. “We’re just starting to see what they’re doing with mining,” Armstrong said.<p><p>But there’s plenty of opportunity in the market for local companies to build out bitcoin mining facilities and expand their operations. The New York Department of Financial Services has begun looking into how it will function in the mining industry.<p><p>Read more: ‘Crypto’ Is Coming to Brooklyn’s Financial District<p>']

headline: How Coinbase Caught the Eye of China’s Biggest Scam
content: ['<p>In early May, a hack on the Coinbase blockchain led to $50 million in losses, a significant blow for the platform.<p><p>As CoinDesk reported Monday, Chinese authorities have banned anyone from trading the platform since June. Since then, China’s government has imposed a two-year ban on all transactions involving crypto assets and businesses. On April 19, the Supreme Court issued a ruling that bitcoin must be denominated in yuan, a move that sparked a public uproar. The ban has since been extended.<p><p>In the months since, the crypto world has begun to see how an increasing number of cryptocurrency businesses – with little oversight by regulators – are using Chinese-influenced tools like the XRP coin, a token that is meant to be traded across China but that can’t be in circulation in any major trading platform. This has prompted many firms and exchanges in China to make use of the XRP token, some even issuing their own branded products and services.<p><p>Coinbase was the first major cryptocurrency company to list on the China New Year Coin Listing Service (CNCLS) in March.<p><p>In response to the attack, Coinbase’s internal control team decided to stop trading the platform at the same time as the launch of its new crypto trading platform, the Coinbase Exchange Service. Coinbase’s move was only the first in a series of actions taken by the U.S. authorities against crypto businesses and their clients.<p>']

headline: Ripple Puts New Rewards Program in Place to Help Employees Stay Out of the Rains
content: ['<p>Luxury startup Ripple has invested in a new product to help employees stay out of the Rains.<p><p>Announced Thursday, the “Ripple Paycheck Protection Solution (PRPS) will allow employees to stay out of the city during the COVID-19 lockdown, when businesses are closed, and provide support during the shutdown.”<p><p>The solution, dubbed “Ripple Paycheck Protection,” will be offered in all 50 U.S. states and territories, the company said in a press release.<p><p>It will be available for $6.95, and employers can use the PRPS at home by logging onto Ripple’s website or calling toll-free 1-800-726-2300.<p><p>“Our team at Ripple, as well as our partners at Lyft, Google, Netflix and Amazon, are committed to providing employees the security and economic relief that comes with an easy-to-use, secure, and convenient way to protect their data and financial data,” said Ripple CEO Changpeng Zhao.<p><p>Ripple said the goal is to offer “an easy way to keep your employees’ data, personal and professional data safe and secure,” and that the solution will be rolled out as soon as the holiday season officially kicks off in January.<p>']

headline: The Struggle for Bitcoin in the UK and Europe Is Over
content: ['<p>A year after it was first revealed the European Commission was considering banning cryptocurrencies from the UK, bitcoin has gained momentum again in the continent.<p><p>Speaking to CoinDesk, bitcoin’s creator Satoshi Nakamoto said, “One of the main tenets of bitcoin is that the use of a single currency is not an option, but an essential part of our daily lives.”<p><p>Nakamoto added that the European Commission’s decision to ban cryptocurrency and the ongoing crypto rally “will continue to push us forward to the challenges we face as a nation.”<p><p>“We can talk about Brexit, but there is a crucial element for the future of cryptocurrencies in Europe: it’s about the future of bitcoin in Europe, not just the future of cryptocurrencies in the U.S. or the future of bitcoin in Europe,” Nakamoto said.<p><p>The European Union imposed a ban on crypto companies in 2016 to halt its adoption, while Britain imposed its own on its banks in 2018 to stop its adoption of the digital currency.<p><p>Nakamoto said this week that the “cryptocurrency crisis” was the central theme of Europe’s second referendum, and that it is not something he views as a cause for concern.<p>']

headline: Avantgarde’s Antwort Tokens Are Now a Bitcoin Trust
content: ['<p>Crypto firm Avantgarde has launched a bitcoin trust for the trust fund it spun out of Digital Currency Group (DCG).<p><p>According to an announcement Wednesday, Antwort Trust will now be governed by the bitcoin trust fund with a governance token.<p><p>According to a statement shared with CoinDesk, Avantgarde’s decision is based on a range of factors including the stability of the trust fund and Avantgarde’s “performance.” The release states, “Antwort’s stable will keep the fund safe and liquid under regulatory custody for the foreseeable future,” while the stable will be governed by a “non-fungible token” with no need for any kind of special investment approval.<p><p>The stable will also “be governed by the Antwort Trust”” with all of the funds “subsidized” by the trust fund, Avantgarde wrote.<p><p>“The stable will be the ‘most liquid” of the stable funds, Avantgarde wrote. “By choosing to control the stable, Avantgarde has secured liquidity and security in its fund.”<p>']

headline: IETF Expert Says Crypto Has Potential to Burnish Standards
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency is entering the realm of the mainstream, as major U.S. companies, including Microsoft and Facebook, are beginning to reimagine the ways in which they’re building their platforms.<p><p>There’s an interesting argument that has arisen: Why not embrace the technology itself? To that end, a group of five cryptographers, led by Michael Casey, are launching an investment forum on the Crypto Standards Project called TokenCon. The goal: to unite the world’s financial institutions around the goal of ensuring that crypto’s standards are adopted globally.<p><p>This year, token development is a rich vein of innovation. This year, the blockchain industry’s leading protocol builder, Ripple, is also joining the accelerator program to bring blockchain innovation to its blockchain-centric projects.<p><p>On Tuesday, TokenCon will launch its inaugural platform, Crypto: A Framework for Crypto Transactions, a free platform that will showcase crypto’s provenance and interoperability. The platform’s focus is on providing an online community for its users to contribute, learn and comment on crypto’s digital assets.<p><p>The focus is not to compete with traditional payment services. Rather, it will focus on creating new standards to be used in the context of their mission.<p><p>In a sense, this is the real power of crypto to bring the mainstream to the cryptocurrency space, with the hope of fostering more adoption.<p>']

headline: Dollar-Pegged Bitcoin Exchange ErisX Launches in Europe
content: ['<p>A crypto exchange in Germany has announced it is launching a crypto wallet platform for use by the world’s top crypto exchange.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin Trust to Expand to Europe Following SEC Suit Against DeFi Firm Block.one<p> ']

headline: US Banks Take Steps to Boost Growth, but Wait for DeFi to Strike Again
content: ['<p>“We want to get as many people out of DeFi as possible so we can get back to business and get more of what we want to be in the world,” said Michael Saylor, co-CEO and co-founder of crypto exchange Kraken. “And we’re looking at other things.”<p><p>The firm recently launched its own tokenized lending platform, and its own lending service, Bitwise, which will be available throughout mid-July. The exchange recently announced it will start accepting Bitcoin for lending.<p><p>It is unclear exactly what these new features will be about, but the U.S. dollar-linked derivatives market is already booming thanks to automated markets such as Libra, XRP and Cosmos. In June, the London Stock Exchange reported it had more than 5 million derivatives trading volume.<p><p>Kraken has been following the market for over two years and is now looking at its own decentralized lending model. <p><p>Read more: Deutsche Bank Launches Crypto Exchange With ‘Multi-Asset Exchange’ Network<p><p>See also: Kraken Plans New ‘Ethereum-Based’ Crypto Platform<p>']

headline: China's March copper imports surpass expectations
content: ['<p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s copper imports were up 25.4% from a year earlier, customs data showed on Thursday, as a stronger demand from the United States and China led some Chinese businesses to lower their imports.<p><p>China’s copper imports, together with the United States, were up 7.8% from a year earlier, customs data from the General Administration of Customs showed.<p><p>Shipments to the United States fell 0.8% to 906.53 tonnes in March, down from 904.97 tonnes in February.<p><p>Shipments to China in March jumped 29.4% to 853.55 tonnes, from a year earlier, while imports to the United States dropped 0.2%.<p><p>China’s copper imports stood at 1.097 tonnes in March, compared with a revised 907.42 tonnes in February.<p><p>China’s copper imports from the United States, however, were down 1.7% to 795.97 tonnes. Shipments to China in March fell 5.5% to 769.33 tonnes, compared with a revised 935.97 tonnes.<p> ']

headline: Fidelity Investments in Custody Firm Coinbase Is Selling Itself for $4.4M
content: ['<p>Crypto custodian Coinbase is in the process of selling a $4.4 million equity investment in its custody startup.<p><p>The deal is being led by Coinbase Custody CEO Adam Draper, who is also the founder of blockchain company DeFi Blockchain.<p><p>Draper said he’s ready to expand in 2021, although he’s also not ruling out a return. He’s also not saying what he’s building out. <p><p>In a tweet Thursday, Draper called the deal a “successful and highly motivated” bid to acquire the firm. He noted that Coinbase was not making a direct offering to investors.<p><p>“We believe crypto is the future. We want to deliver on that promise by investing directly in our products,” Draper wrote. “Our customers want to have access to an outstanding asset class that we’ve built, and that will deliver a high-quality and sustainable return on their investments.”<p><p>Coinbase said it plans to begin the sale in the third quarter of 2021.<p><p>UPDATE (July 8, 11:55 UTC): Adds further comment from Draper and Draper’s spokesperson.<p> ']

headline: Bitwise’s Bitwise Index Has Now Doubled in 13 Months
content: ['<p>Bitwise Index, the digital asset-management firm’s second-biggest, has jumped seven-month in the past month after gaining 5.6% in February.<p>']
