headline: The Australian Financial Review: A History of Crypto and Financial Crisis
content: ['<p>April 1, 2021;* Decentralized finance (DeFi) has been a fixture at a national level since the coronavirus crisis hit in 2018, and as the digital payments ecosystem goes mainstream it becomes increasingly difficult to fathom. This month the Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) issued an unprecedented policy statement calling for crypto-backed stablecoins to be approved as payments tools.<p><p>There are two things that you should consider before committing to DeFi: (1) how to make money from the underlying digital assets, and (2) how to build a decentralized system of money. As with crypto, there is no shortage of interest in the DeFi space. There are many, many, many questions about which tools will work best, and what the future holds for the DeFi community.<p><p>DeFi is still, as a group, the backbone of Australia’s financial system. A number of major institutions have been working on their own protocols and in areas like digital asset administration (DA). DeFi is still just beginning, though. <p><p>As DeFi evolves and evolves into a full-blown financial system we will find ourselves increasingly dealing with issues and solutions that may have no bearing on the traditional financial system.<p>']

headline: Dapper Labs Raises $3.2M for Staking Platform Uniswap
content: ['<p>Founded in 2015 by Daniele Le Roux and Benoit Fauconnier, Dapper Labs is a research and development platform focused on the use of blockchain tech.<p><p>Launched as a fork of the popular Uniswap protocol on June 22, Uniswap’s decentralized ledger of record allows users to earn rewards by issuing tokens of their choice. Dapper Labs is the first developer and platform to offer a fork on Ethereum with a fork token, meaning users will have access to the chain until a new fork is built for their fork.<p><p>“Dapper Labs has proven a great tool to bring users a wealth of financial value through a network-based approach,” said Le Roux. “This is not to say Dapper Labs has any sort of centralized ownership of their data or infrastructure, but rather they’ve taken an open-source approach to the technology.”<p><p>“The blockchain infrastructure powering this project is not centralized but decentralized,” Fauconnier said. “It is decentralization. … That’s not a new idea for me.”<p><p>Fauconnier explained that the main difference between Uniswap and Ethereum is that Ethereum is more centralized than Uniswap, meaning users can spend their tokens in any decentralized exchange.<p>']

headline: Ethereum Project Bison Trails More Trails Than Ever on US Trails
content: ['<p>U.S. Trails is moving beyond traditional trail services for its native dog, buffalo, to the virtual trail space.<p><p>The nonprofit Trails, which promotes wildlife awareness and trails in a non-fungible token (NFT), was one of the first groups to build out a network for connecting trails through the U.S. The project is now one of the first projects in the U.S. Trails partnered with New York State and Colorado State University, according to a spokesperson.<p><p>Read more: Chicago’s Wild Trails to Launch ‘Eager’ Trails in 2021<p><p>The team behind Trails will start using NFTs to connect trails across the state, said Brian Brooks, Trail Project Lead.<p><p>“The most significant part of getting these trails connecting to the public and users is connecting users to trails themselves,” Brooks told CoinDesk via email. “For example, if you go to a park and you go to a trail, you will know that there are public trails in your community, and you can use Trails to get around the park.”<p><p>The partnership with Colorado State and New York State follows a similar path Trails has taken in building out its own NFT network, said Chris Lema, Bison Trails’ co-founder and CEO.<p>']

headline: Hedge Fund Manager NGC Holdings to Roll Out Crypto Custody Platform
content: ['<p>Crypto custodian HGC Holdings is rolling out the latest stablecoin offering – dubbed the HGC Crypto Custody Service (HSC) – and will offer users the option to own digital assets on HGC Custody via the digital asset trading platform.<p><p>As reported by CoinDesk, HGC Crypto Custody is “a wholly owned subsidiary of HGC Holdings, Inc.” which acquired the HGC Digital Assets Custody Trust in 2016.<p><p>According to a blog post shared with CoinDesk, the firm, which manages the digital assets trade and the HGC Crypto Trust, has “established a partnership with HGC Crypto Custody that will allow its clients to use their holdings to facilitate crypto trading and investment, while preserving their digital assets,” while also allowing users “to gain exposure to digital assets through the security management features on HGC Custody.”<p><p>According to an announcement by the company, the partnership will be conducted “in partnership with HGC Crypto Custody Custody to support the launch of our first digital asset service, HGC Crypto Assets.”<p><p>See also: Digital Asset Custody Expands to All Major Crypto Markets<p><p>HGC Crypto Custody also revealed its support for the upcoming XRP token, which will launch on Wednesday and offer digital assets to hedge funds and mutual funds, with the option of having their funds use it for crypto trading.<p>']

headline: CZ Bank to Launch a Digital Asset Exchange in India
content: ['<p>Banks are being asked to take a more active role in ensuring digital assets get regulated and made safe in India, the government’s top economic adviser told CoinDesk.<p><p>“We’re excited to see what institutions are looking at and we are confident that the opportunities in India are there for banks in developing countries,” said Ramananda Shetty, co-director of the Centre for Financial Governance, an independent think tank. “Indian banks will also benefit from India’s digital economy as banks gain access to the Indian market.”<p><p>“There is no question that the digital economy has huge potential. The global financial system has already been digitised by major banks, including BNY Mellon, Deutsche Bank, HSBC, Barclays, Société Générale, OKCoin, OKEx, OKEx, Gemini and others.”<p><p>Read more: Bank of India to Offer Crypto Trading, Exchange Service to Indian Miners<p><p>The central bank is set to lay down regulatory and institutional infrastructure before embarking on a multiyear digital strategy, Shetty said, and the central bank is also taking a close look at how the country’s digital economy can be expanded and implemented.<p><p>“India’s digital economy is currently in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, and we will have a more mature digital economy in the coming months as we work to strengthen the resilience of the economy,” Shetty said.<p>']

headline: Ethereum Consensus Labs Is Back With New Tech for Developers
content: ['<p>Ethereum Consensus Labs is teaming with Bitmain’s ConsenSys to bring the network’s mainnet to the public.<p><p>Read more: ConsenSys Invests $500M in Ethereum Firm, Blockchain.io<p> ']

headline: Dapper Labs Acquires Polychain, SushiSwap for $4.5M in Ether
content: ['<p>Dapper Labs, a startup building decentralized finance (DeFi) apps, announced Monday it has acquired SushiSwap, the digital trading firm behind the popular Dapper Labs.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Pivot Starts With $4.5M in Funding From Blockchain Startups<p> ']

headline: Sri Lanka's Jan CPI hits record high of 4.6%
content: ['<p>SYDNEY, Feb 7  - Lanka’s inflation hit a high last month, hitting a record low of 4.6% while the monthly median household price of the country’s seven provinces fell, official data showed on Monday.<p><p>Monthly median household income fell 1.8% year-on-year and inflation stood at 1.6% for the first time since March 2020, while the median weekly salary of the top five provinces dropped 0.8%.<p><p>The government forecast 2% inflation this year, down from a 1.3% annual rate forecast at the end of last year, which came after a surge in the median household income in the run-up to the pandemic.<p><p>Sri Lanka is a member of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD), the world’s most valuable economy. (Reporting by Gayatri Suroyo Editing by Sam Holmes)<p> ']

headline: Hedge Fund Liquidity Drops to 50% Amid Global Crypto Market Crisis
content: ['<p>Global hedge funds have fallen into an unruly financial market crisis as investors scrambled to secure investments amid a global economic crisis, a leading fund manager said Wednesday.<p><p>Firms with stakes in crypto have been flailing to make money while the world’s second-largest funds have fallen victim to price manipulation, analysts at Morgan Stanley Research said in a report.<p><p>Fund managers said they’re seeing no sign of this “pivot” – or at least an uptick in the volume – as stocks tumble sharply after the coronavirus pandemic, which has left a number of funds closed.<p><p>Morgan Stanley polled more than 1,300 hedge fund managers across all their major assets to see their funds’ performance in the markets they invested in and compared it with what it called institutional clients’ performance as investors look for a return.<p><p>“All three funds had significantly lower growth or loss percentages in the first quarter,” the report said, adding that many fund managers are looking at buying stocks as hedge fund managers invest and trading bitcoin, ether and bitcoin cash, rather than as funds are investing directly in bitcoin.<p><p>“While institutional funds generally look more like hedge funds, hedge fund managers are seeing some increase in crypto fund performance as the U.S. Federal Reserve and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission begin to regulate crypto.<p>']

headline: Mining Giant Nexo Launches Bitcoin Exchange Token
content: ['<p>Mining giant Nexo has launched a bitcoin exchange token (ETN) which it says will give users access to the world’s first bitcoin-linked stablecoin.<p><p>Announced Monday, the token, which is designed to allow users to trade fiat currencies using Ethereum-based protocols such as ethereum-compliant wallets, will be issued via an open-source exchange backed by the CoinDesk technology research group.<p><p>The token will go live with limited liquidity and may not be usable until later this year.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin Raises $22.4B in a Short Crypto Rush, Says Luxury Car Developer<p> ']

headline: DeFi Exchange Uniswap Adds ‘Multi-Token’ Support
content: ['<p>DeFi exchanges Uniswap have added an array of tokenization options to their trading products.<p><p>See also: Stablecoin DeFi Launches ‘Multi-Token’ Trading Tools<p> ']

headline: Ripple Execs Push for New Payments Startup, Crypto Trading Startup to Open in US
content: ['<p>Ripple Execs have launched a crypto trading and retail service in the U.S., with the aim of “providing retail customers with an attractive user experience.”<p><p>The exchange has now partnered with a team from Singapore, Ripple Labs, and the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to launch its digital currency trading and retail offering, according to a press release.<p><p>The crypto trading and retail service will be open to all users, regardless of where their local region is located, and will use Ripple’s blockchain technology to send and receive payments.<p><p>“With the launch of our platform in the U.S., Ripple is continuing to expand our customer base through our existing banking, custody and payments infrastructure,” the release reads.<p><p>Ripple is owned by Ripple Ventures, an early-stage investor in the crypto custody space, and the firm has been a primary shareholder in Digital Currency Group (the owner of CoinDesk).<p><p>See also: Ripple Joins BNY Mellon’s Digital Currency Group<p><p>The exchange is a member of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, which has jurisdiction over securities and investment law.<p><p>See also: Ripple Eyes U.S. Expansion to Crypto Custody in 2021<p>']

headline: UPDATE 2-Kazakh’s Bank Has Clamped Down on Crypto Custodians
content: ['<p>Kazakh National Bank has temporarily banned cryptocurrency exchanges Kraken and Binance.<p><p>See also: Bank of Ukraine Bans Crypto Wallet in Latest Crypto Lawsuit<p> ']

headline: Hexcel to Support DeFi Protocol DeFiLite
content: ['<p>Crypto custodian Hexcel is moving its custodial and lending infrastructure, dubbed DEXLite, to a non-profit incubator focused on blockchain-based payments, Etherscan and Ethereum-based protocols.<p><p>The move comes amid the coronavirus pandemic.<p><p>“Hexcel will support the DeFi ecosystem, providing lending and stablecoins for the various DeFi protocols and protocols,” a Hexcel spokesperson told CoinDesk via email.<p><p>“The incubation program was incubated at the CryptoMiner, and Hexcel is a member of the incubation program. We believe DeFi will continue to move forward in many areas throughout the year.”<p><p>According to Hexcel, DEXLite will run on Ethereum, using two main nodes, and support the DeFiLite protocol as well as the DeFiChain project and various DeFi exchanges.<p><p>See also: Crypto Mavens Are Back at It Again: Hexcel<p><p>Exchanges supporting the DeFiLite protocol will also have a stake in Hexcel’s stablecoin, DEXUSD, the company said.<p>']

headline: Cavetta-Ether Exchange Unveils Bitcoin Cash
content: ['<p>BitGo, the world’s largest bitcoin exchange by trading volume, is planning to offer users bitcoin cash for a year.<p><p>Announced Wednesday, the cryptocurrency exchange announced it will begin offering its bitcoin cash in early 2021. That bitcoin cash can only be used for trading as a token, so the exchange said bitcoin cash holders can redeem for cash at any time. <p><p>BitGo said the move would provide additional liquidity for its users, who would be able to deposit bitcoin (BTC) into their accounts and earn rewards, such as bitcoin’s ability to move between exchanges and buy and sell products.<p><p>“We are excited to take on this challenge as we build our bitcoin service to help everyone access bitcoin faster and more easily,” CEO Jeff Chain said in a press release.<p><p>BitGo is still not clear what the maximum limit for the crypto-friendly cryptocurrency is, though it said a minimum of $5,000 (around $8,000) is required. “BitGo’s goal is to provide the most users with the most efficient way to transact in crypto without the need for higher fees.” <p><p>See also: Crypto Exchange Gemini, Custody Chain Say Bitcoin Custodian Will Allow Users to Sell Shares and Earn Rewards<p><p>The announcement will come as part of an effort to bolster cryptocurrency adoption. CoinDesk reached out to Coinbase and other cryptocurrency companies for comment on the new bitcoin exchange plans.']

headline: CeFi Exchange BitMEX Joins Bitcoin Association in New York
content: ['<p>The CME Group, a cryptocurrency exchange operator, has signed on as a member of the New York-based Bitcoin Association, the largest trade group in the world. <p><p>The New York-based exchange’s New York office confirmed the news to CoinDesk via email.<p><p>CME’s head of business development, Spencer Foggiano, confirmed CME has signed up as a member of the Bitcoin Association. A statement said, “The CME Group is committed to advancing and increasing the use of cryptocurrencies in commerce and has established itself as a leader in the industry.”<p><p>Foggiano said the decision was made after discussions with a number of CME members.<p><p>The BitMEX has operated a Bitcoin ATM since 2013, Foggiano said. While the exchange is not affiliated with the bitcoin industry, the decision to become a member has not prevented the exchange from “starting operations,” Foggiano said.<p><p>“We’re excited that we have become an affiliate in the Bitcoin Association with a view to advancing the use of cryptocurrencies in commerce and investing in infrastructure for Bitcoin.”<p><p>CME said in its statement the move was in part because of the new trade association’s membership, which has its own board. The organization has a minimum of 15 members and Foggiano said his organization will be able to increase membership once it has been verified by the membership board.<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 1-Singapore's central bank raises interest rate again in March, sees no risk to inflation
content: ["<p>* CPI data for March 12 vs February 2020 data<p><p>* Interest rate unchanged at 0.75% in March (Adds details, analyst comment, inflation forecasts)<p><p>* Singapore-Singapore bond yields rise to 6-year high <p><p>* May's central bank meeting opens up for business as global weather, food and technology demand help<p><p>MOSCOW, April 12  - Singapore’s central bank raised its inflation forecast for March to 6.50% from 5.00% at the close of the third quarter, its highest since the central bank’s first meeting in August 2018, as its economy grew in the third quarter thanks to stronger spending, better service sector growth and healthy COVID-19 recovery in the fourth quarter.<p><p>The central bank raised its benchmark Singapore ATSI-rated Singapore 10-year Treasury note (SED) to 4.50% and said this year’s rate will be more stable as it seeks to avoid negative inflationary pressures that could slow global economic growth.<p><p>“The rise in China’s economic activity in recent months has extended some of the downward pressure on inflationary pressures due to the new wave of COVID-19,” Governor Salim Youssef said on Tuesday at a private meeting of the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS).<p>"]

headline: Visa, Mastercard and Others Say Bitcoin Boosted Service Fees for Customers
content: ['<p>Visa, Mastercard and Mastercard said Friday they will pay more in fees to customers who hold bitcoin than previously reported, a move that could push them higher into bitcoin’s $2,100 or so price range.<p><p>The Visa Visa debit card issuer said it will charge $0.50 to $0.75 for monthly purchases of bitcoin and $0.75 to $0.75 per bitcoin purchased, a move that would push it higher into bitcoin’s market cap of $15.9 billion, or about $3.8 billion at press time.<p><p>“While Visa has always held bitcoin transactions in the $2,100 range, we believe the increased cost of the debit card will actually make it more attractive to those users,” Visa wrote in a statement.<p><p>Visa, Mastercard and Visa Paycheck, which all allow Visa debit cards to accept bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, said the additional fee would be paid to users who hold their Visa debit card in the form of a debit card.<p><p>See also: PayPal’s New Visa Cash Card Launches With $4B in Bitcoin Assets<p><p>Visa and Mastercard are the major merchants that accept bitcoin as payment in the United States, and Visa has an affiliate network of merchants that accept other payments, according to a Coinbase spokesperson. The increase in merchants will also help Visa to expand its merchant base, the spokesperson said.<p> ']

headline: U.S. businesses with payrolls above pre-pandemic levels cut jobs for first time in seven years
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON, Jan 2  - Businesses with payrolls below pre-pandemic levels saw a record reduction in the number of jobs lost to COVID-19 infections last year, the Commerce Department said on Monday.<p><p>The number of jobs lost to COVID-19 has jumped by nearly seven-fold in the last year alone as the world pandemic decimates factory production, according to the survey released by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB).<p><p>The reduction in job losses is a direct result of the increase in COVID-19 infections, which have caused layoffs and disruptions in work from mid-March to early April, as companies scramble to contain the virus.<p><p>Employment data collected in January showed employers shed 852,000 full-time jobs in January and February as COVID-19 infections in the United States took hold, as companies struggled to contain the pandemic-induced layoffs, slowing the recovery.<p><p>Last year’s reduction of 755,000 full-time jobs was the largest in nearly three years, according to data released by the OMB.<p><p>Industry officials have warned that the latest reduction in jobs could have a ripple effect throughout the economy as companies look to reduce their COVID-19 output and morale amid the latest outbreak.<p>']

headline: Ripple Launches Trading Platform for Investors, Says It Is Ready for Open Market
content: ['<p>Ripple’s New York-based exchange and payments platform is launching a trading platform as part of a $12 billion pilot aimed at helping institutional investors.<p><p>Announced Monday, Ripple has launched a trading platform as part of a broader pilot that it says will help it expand its trading platform and launch new products. The platform, which is open to U.S. and international investors, is aimed at facilitating financial market adoption.<p><p>Read more: Ripple Launches Crypto Wallet With New Service, Coinbase Plans to Launch It<p> ']

headline: Algorithmic Forecasting App Wins First New Bitcoin Mining License From Polkadot
content: ['<p>Blockchain and algorithmic forecasts app Algorithmic Forecasting has won a $10 million license from Polkadot, a San Francisco-based company that’s been one of the first to come out of the cryptocurrency space.<p><p>“The Algorithmic Forecast Group is a non-profit organization that offers the best of both worlds in forecasting and algorithmic trading,” said Algorithmic Forecast President and CEO Michael Stokes. “We are excited to have these licenses, and we look forward to providing Algorithmic Forecast with new products that enhance the app’s functionality and user experience.”<p><p>Read more: Polkadot May Soon Be Able to Staple Bitcoin Mining With $10M Bitcoin Mining License<p><p>See also: Polkadot to Raise $5M for Bitcoin Mining in 10 Days<p><p>Stokes said the startup is now a subsidiary of the Polkadot family of banks, which includes Visa. He added that it’s “really exciting” to see the regulatory clout Algorithmic Forecast will have in the space as a cryptocurrency asset.<p>']

headline: Binance Exec Says Blockchain Stablecoin ‘Would Not Make Sense’ After All
content: ['<p>Binance CEO Changpeng “Ying” Zhao says his firm’s cryptocurrency research project BinanceCoin, due later this year, would not make sense as a stablecoin or currency.<p><p>Binance co-founder Changpeng told CoinDesk his firm’s research would make sense if the platform wanted to convert fiat currency into crypto (USD) or gold (GJD) as it currently stands. (See also: Coinbase Exec Confirms ‘Digital Dollar’ Role, Explains Crypto Finance)<p><p>“There is no reason [that] [the USD and GBDT would] not be useful,” he said. “We think BinanceCoin would make sense, because we can make it work in all areas,” he added.<p><p>For now, BinanceCoin’s research would focus on converting fiat into cryptocurrencies in the U.S. for the foreseeable future. The project will launch its mainnet in Q1 2019, and will ultimately provide a wallet service for both crypto and USD.<p><p>See also: Binance CEO Changpeng Plans $150M Token Sale With Blockchain-Based Payments<p><p>“We want to make sure we are producing the best crypto,” Zhao said. “And if we can bring a stablecoin or a crypto exchange or a stablecoin exchange to market, we are sure to have the best solution.”<p>']

headline: Ripple CEO Says He Will Allow ‘Restaurant Hours’ on Private Property
content: ['<p>Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse will no longer be allowed on premises at the Silicon Valley-based San Francisco-based San Francisco-based startup Kitchen Capital.<p><p>The move follows a slew of news in recent days with the San Francisco Board of Supervisors approving an ordinance last week that would bar “staurant hours” at restaurants, bars and other venues where patrons can “exercise” their rights to “free speech” on private property.<p><p>“It’s been a tough two years for me personally,” Garlinghouse told Bloomberg News. “It’s the wrong time to be doing business in the Bay Area.”<p><p>San Francisco is the Silicon Valley hub of Silicon Valley’s tech industry. So is San Francisco, which now has one of the most successful tech companies in the world and has become one of the most welcoming places for the public.<p><p>Read more: PayPal Exec Warns Customers That Bitcoin Could Render Their Services Unprofessional<p><p>The San Francisco Board of Supervisors said last month that if approved, the ban “will apply to every business within its jurisdiction,” and prohibited “any person from entering” restaurants, bars or places of entertainment unless they are physically present.<p><p>Keeper CEO Daniel Stoner said Tuesday he would not be deterred by the move.<p>']

headline: Bitmain’s SIX Blockchain, Built on the Ethereum Blockchain, Will Continue Growing as a Category 5 Business
content: ['<p>Decentralized trading platform SIX, developed by Bitmain to allow users to trade cryptocurrencies without having to share the assets across multiple chains, is slated for growth of 5 to 10% this year, Bitmain CEO Changpeng “Vincent” Zhang said Thursday.<p><p>“This is one of the largest decentralized protocols and is still far from having a fully distributed solution,” Zhang told CoinDesk in a phone interview. “As long as we keep developing SIX, that will continue.”<p><p>SIX’s token will grow from a token on SIX.com, to an SIX-token on the Bitmain-owned SIX Protocol platform, as the SIX Protocol Network (BSN) grows to a consensus algorithm on the Ethereum blockchain. It will also be a proof-of-work network.<p><p>“We’re doing this so that we’re able to accelerate SIX’s growth. We want to accelerate the protocol because, if things go well, and we don’t, it will take off and go live in the market.” Zhan said.<p><p>As well as growing its token, SIX has the potential to grow its market capitalization to around $500 million, with a global reach of $8 billion, according to a research report from UBS analysts earlier this month.<p>']

headline: Hedge Fund Manager H1-Backed Funds Set to Launch Crypto-Related Funds in 2021
content: ['<p>Digital asset manager H1-backed funds will launch alongside traditional assets in 2021, the company announced Thursday.<p><p>Read more: Digital Asset Managers Look to Private Fund Options in Emerging Markets<p> ']

headline: The Blockchain Economy Is Bigger Than Ever
content: ['<p>Economists and economists are busy trying to understand the blockchain economy and the potential benefits. For those who don’t understand it, you’re either missing the point or misunderstanding the economy.<p><p>This article is part of a series that looks at how blockchain companies are working to reimagine the world’s supply chain. The information will also be useful for the development of artificial intelligence and other innovations that bring the economy into harmony with our modern digital rights.<p><p>As well as this article, we will have our own weekly podcast called Crypto Finance. Join Crypto Finance and get insights and insights on everything from market dynamics to how the blockchain economy is changing financial markets.<p><p>“How Blockchain Will Change the World’<p><p>Read more: Blockchain Tech Enabled by Ethereum, IBM and Fiat<p><p>Blockchain will help facilitate the efficient trading and ownership of financial assets by removing the need for manual processes. There will also be less reliance on external intermediaries, making the blockchain economy easier to understand, reduce risk and increase financial efficiency.<p><p>To understand what blockchain can do, we must understand the economics of financial transactions.<p><p>“How can we understand a transaction from the outside? What is the price of a transaction?”<p>']

headline: Gemini Raises $5M to Fund Blockchain Development
content: ['<p>Digital asset lender Gemini said Monday it has signed a funding round for blockchain project Blockchain.org.<p><p>See also: Ripple, Gemini Sip $4M Investment From Digital Asset Firm Digital Currency Group<p> ']

headline: NFTs Are Getting Into Crypto-Currency Markets With Bigger Names
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency companies are beginning to be branded crypto products that are often smaller and often have less friction than traditional ones.<p><p>On Wednesday, CoinDesk tracked the names of the four firms, which represent some 70 percent of the Fortune 500. Their names were later identified via CoinDesk Intelligence’s blockchain data analysis.<p><p>All four are led by Nifty Crypto, founded in 2013 by former CoinDesk columnist Sam Bee. The company’s founders, Richard and Andy, became Nifty Crypto’s new CTO in early January 2019.<p><p>It’s a small twist for Bee, who began his career as a crypto reporter at CoinDesk’s Data Lab and is a regular contributor to CoinDesk’s data blogs.<p><p>The Nifty Crypto brand was launched with a partnership with Binance Labs, which will distribute Nifty Coins and Nifty Coins to the roughly 3,000 cryptocurrency miners. It’s still in beta, so Nifty Coins could not be shared with CoinDesk.<p><p>“We saw a potential in Nifty Coin for a decentralized identity platform,” Bee said in a phone interview, referring to a company such as CoinDesk that wants to be a blockchain-based settlement platform. “We wanted to make sure we were serving the crypto industry, not just the miners.”<p>']

headline: Fintech Firm Binance Eyes DeFi With Coinbase and Square to Offer Users Direct Payments
content: ['<p>Fintech firms including Square, Binance and Binance Global are exploring decentralized finance (DeFi) options with cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase and Square, according to two industry sources.<p><p>Binance’s main exchange is currently accepting Coinbase DeFi products as well as Square-compatible offerings, according to one of the sources. Binance’s main exchange is currently working on a DeFi platform with a number of companies including MicroStrategy, Circle and Polkadot.<p><p>Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong said his firm recently closed one of the first DeFi partnerships with one of the leading players in the space. Binance has already joined a list of participating firms including Pantera, Digital Currency Group, Cosmos, Ripple, Kraken and Tendermint.<p><p>Read more: Square, Coinbase Join US Crypto Market in New Deal for $5B Deal<p><p>Other industry players interested in integrating DeFi options include Binance Global, where Coinbase will run a retail version of the crypto exchange. Binance Global is also building an app to help its users manage their funds, according to one of the sources.<p><p>Square is the fourth exchange operator to work with Coinbase over its forthcoming product release. Binance recently partnered with BitGo to provide a decentralized exchange for bitcoin, ether and other cryptocurrencies.<p><p>Binance Global has not yet responded to requests for comment by press time. Binance Global has not commented to CoinDesk about its DeFi products.<p> ']
