content: ['<p>The world’s biggest financial services provider is now the exclusive focus of attention in Asia, with plans to begin integration into the R3’s blockchain technology in the second half of 2021.<p>']

headline: CZ Top Crypto ETF to List on Nasdaq for $18M
content: ['<p>SBI Digital Asset Group, a subsidiary of cryptocurrency exchange BNY Mellon, will list Crypto Assets in a price per bitcoin (PPB) allocation for $18 million (roughly $19 million) by the end of 2020, CZ said in a press statement on Tuesday.<p><p>The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission is expected to issue a rule on the company’s proposed listing for the crypto space in late 2021. The company has said it would start selling shares in the asset manager’s crypto ETFs by year-end.<p><p>Read more: Crypto Custody Platform CryptoShares Plans $3B IPO in Early 2021<p><p>Crypto Custody Platform CryptoShares, which is owned by Bitfinex Group, intends to expand its crypto custody business through a partnership with a U.S. bank to operate its custody platform and a crypto exchange.<p><p>Announced Monday, CryptoShares had already announced a planned bitcoin-focused investment from Coinbase Ventures (AIG), a venture capital firm focused on crypto.<p><p>Coinbase Ventures has previously indicated it has no plans to enter the crypto space, saying in June it’s not ready for the regulatory requirements of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.<p> ']

headline: Ethereum Classic Raises $7M More Than Previously Thought
content: ['<p>The ETC blockchain project announced its participation Wednesday, announcing a total of $7.9 million in total funding, raising $6.9 million from backers and three ETC token holders.<p><p>The funding raised is split evenly among the three contributors, with each fund going to an individual, decentralized ETC token holder or developer.<p><p>Ethereum Classic will launch on the Ethereum Classic Developer Platform sometime in February.<p><p>The ETC token issuance will be facilitated via a token distribution platform called Dapps. The project announced the funding with the announcement that Dapps will feature “decentralized governance for projects” that use ETC.<p><p>“As we continue to innovate and expand our platform, we look forward to building on the foundation and the roadmap of ETC that is built on top of Ethereum,” Dapps CEO Michael Soderbergh told CoinDesk in a phone call.<p><p>The ETC project raised $5.8 million in 2019, according to the company. Since then, ETC tokens have been rising in value and, according to the firm, its network of trading desks has grown over the past year and a half.<p><p>See also: Ethereum Classic Becomes Second Token for New Cryptocurrency Group<p>']

headline: UPDATE 1-Australia's financial watchdog lifts lockdown for banking and financial services - Industry Minister
content: ['<p>* Business regulator to review ‘quantitative easing’ in April<p><p>* Regulator says RBA and Fitch won “decentralized choice”<p><p>* Regulator: ‘RBA and Fitch will be back in charge of monetary policy in March and April,” says Industry Minister<p><p>* Industry Minister says RBA will review ‘quantitative easing’ as a measure to stabilise the economy<p><p>* “I will keep an open mind about the fact that there is uncertainty in economic activity and that the government, the financial sector and the financial markets will be able to play their part in stabilising these markets”<p><p>TONY ABBOTT, THE HOLIDAY EDITION: In a statement, a spokesman for the Australian Financial Review, Ian Macfarlane, said the Federal Government would not consider introducing quantitative easing, but would remain in charge of monetary policy.<p><p>“While our Federal Government continues to seek to ensure that Australia remains a global financial hub, monetary policy and the Federal Reserve System continue to play a major role in driving economic activity,” he said.<p><p>The Federal Reserve, under its policy guidance, said it would “carefully review the impact and implications of this policy decision” to determine if the Fed and Reserve Banks were appropriately aligned.<p>']

headline: Ethereum Foundation Wins Regulatory Approval From the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission
content: ['<p>Digital asset exchange Ethereum Foundation (EEFI) has been granted a regulatory approval by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).<p><p>Also read: ETH Firms Involved in Legal Battle Over Crypto Traders’ Privacy, Risks<p> ']

headline: Swiss Exchange OKEx Raises $1.3M in Token Sale for DeFi-Friendly Blockchain
content: ['<p>Swiss exchange OKEx announced on Wednesday it has secured a $1.3 million funding round led by Accenture, led by MicroStrategy.<p><p>The funding will help OKEx’s decentralized exchange (DEX) become more transparent to third-party developers with the aim of providing a platform for financial privacy and collaboration. Token sales are one of the oldest ways to interact with decentralized protocols but now the startup is aiming to help users make their own tokens available for use in decentralized finance (DeFi).<p><p>The OKEx token sale will begin on Wednesday, November 7, with around $2.5 million in total proceeds going to participants, Accenture said. The token sale will be the company’s second-largest offering.<p><p>“This funding will further extend our provenance strategy in decentralized finance,” said OKEx founder, Paul Veradittakit. “This will enable us to offer developers the tools they need to develop their own decentralized applications, as well as other token issuance.”<p><p>OKEx’s main goal is to become a platform for financial users to create new applications and services to enable decentralization of financial products. Veradittakit said the funding allows it to accelerate the process of developing token sales to more than 300,000 projects.<p>']

headline: R3’s New Bittrex to Boost Blockchain Startups With US Dollars
content: ['<p>Blockchain startup R3 has been providing funding for blockchain-based startups, with the goal of creating “digital currency” for the U.S. market. <p><p>See also: R3 Acquires Ripple Labs to Revamp Digital Dollar Lending System<p> ']

headline: Nasdaq Raises $2.4B in New Token Funding for Alternative Bitcoin Trading Platform
content: ['<p>Digital asset exchange Nasdaq has raised $2.4 billion in a $2.4 billion seed round led by Digital Currency Group (CEG).<p><p>Also read: Nasdaq Adds USDC Bank as Product Partner to Tackle Cryptocurrency Derivatives<p> ']

headline: U.S. exports rise more than expected, but growth weakens in fourth quarter
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - U.S. exports grew more than expected in the fourth quarter of 2020, but growth in the fourth quarter of 2020 was weaker than expected, Commerce Department data showed on Tuesday.<p><p>Exports of goods and services surged 10.4% in the quarter after slowing in the previous quarter as factories were busy opening up for business and the government kept pace with a pandemic-related lockdown. Imports rose 11.5% in the fourth quarter from the previous quarter.<p><p>The decline in U.S. exports was the sharpest since at least the third quarter of 2009. Analysts in a Reuters poll had forecast exports at a seasonally adjusted level of 7.7% in the third quarter of 2020, slightly above the 6.5% projected in a Reuters poll.<p><p>The Commerce Department has set an average export-to-GDP ratio of 50.3, matching a long-standing benchmark of 40.5. (Reporting by Joseph Nasr Editing by Clarence Fernandez)<p> ']

headline: Tapper Labs to Use Ethereum for Digital Currency Research
content: ['<p>Tapper Labs has acquired a majority stake in the world’s first decentralized finance (DeFi) application developer, which utilizes the Ethereum blockchain to provide a proof-of-concept (PoW) protocol.<p><p>Read more: Tezos-Inspired Developer to Invest $600M Into DeFi<p> ']

headline: Binance to Launch New Service Provider for Bitcoin Derivatives Exchange-Traded Fund
content: ['<p>Binance-backed bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) Bitwise has launched a new product with its own digital asset service provider.<p><p>Announced Tuesday, the Bitwise Derivatives Exchange-Traded Fund (BSETF) is aimed at institutional and institutional investors looking to invest in bitcoin as a hedge against financial risk.<p><p>In addition to the exchange-traded fund, Bitwise also has an exchange-traded fund (ETF) to help investors trade crypto assets.<p><p>As reported by the Reuters newswire earlier this month, the Bitwise Bitcoin Derivatives Exchange-Traded Fund (BNDW) aims to offer a basket of institutional products, including traditional exchange-traded funds (ETFs), stablecoins, bitcoin mining pools and bitcoin stock exchanges, with a view to diversifying its portfolio into crypto and bitcoin derivatives products.<p><p>“We are excited to see the emergence of crypto-based hedge funds and ETFs as well as other products that offer exposure to the space,” said Bitwise CEO and co-founder David Eichenberger.<p><p>“With all the potential and benefits to the financial environment of today, institutional investors are now able to choose to buy, sell or hold crypto assets in exchange for fiat dollars,” Eichenberger added.<p>']

headline: Pep Guardiola’s Team Can Be Confident About Their Own Potential: Report
content: ['<p>MADRID, April 16  - Pep Guardiola’s Barcelona side have clinched a first-round title with a record seven teams in a row - four of them European clubs including Juventus and Bayern Munich.<p><p>The Spain manager said he was confident they could qualify for the Champions League final despite a fourth-place finish.<p><p>Gran Mario Gomez, Juventus’ head of football and coach, said at a news conference on Wednesday the Catalans could have made it to the quarter-finals.<p><p>He added: “We could easily have won the first game, but I think we should have won this game and the Champions League.”<p> ']

headline: Bitfarms, Blockchain Tech to Roll Out Bitcoin ATM Service in Australia
content: ['<p>Bitfarms Australia is set to roll out bitcoin ATM services in Australia.<p><p>Read more: Bitfarms to Launch Bitcoin ATM Provider in Australia in 2019<p> ']

headline: Alchemy Adds Crypto Payments to Its Platform, Expands Payments to Indonesia
content: ['<p>Alchemy’s Indonesian payments platform has rolled out a crypto wallet and exchange, bringing an expanded range of payments options to users.<p><p>See also: Alchemy to Support Swiss Franc Futures Trading With $17B Adoption<p> ']

headline: Vietnam Jan 14 (Reuters) - Vietnam’s consumer prices rose last year, a sign the pandemic could help to quell rising prices and reduce inflation, a survey showed on Tuesday.
content: ['<p><p>Prices of food, including meat and drink, rose 0.3% year-on-year and rose 0.4% year-on-year in January, the National Bureau of Statistics said in a survey of the country’s public opinion on Thursday.<p><p>Food and drink prices fell 0.2% and 0.3% in January, and consumer prices surged 2.6% on year.<p> ']

headline: How Blockchain Can Help Decentralize Food Stamps
content: ['<p>“Blockchain’s new food safety innovation allows for an automated system that can securely process food-identification information,” a report from the Institute for Food Safety and Research (IFR) said on Tuesday.<p><p>In the report, the IFR and researchers from the nonprofit Food Safety Initiative (FSA) are tasked with creating a secure system to process the identity of foods contaminated with “safe-for-consumer” ingredients. The report cites a recent study which confirmed the safety of cornmeal, as the source of most of the potentially unsafe cornmeal.<p><p>“The FSR and the IFR want to build a transparent and easy-to-use system to process that identity information,” FSR Executive Director Michael Hildebrandt said.<p><p>“It’s clear that the industry has learned from the failed attempt to create a decentralized online marketplace and marketplace for goods. We are confident in the technology, but it is not there yet.”<p><p>Read more: Are Grain Crop Contaminated? The Industry Is Building Out a Food ID Solution<p><p>According to the IFR report, “food-identification requirements for the food supply should be standardized and tailored to the needs of producers, processors and distributors.”<p>']

headline: Binance Raises $2.8M in Token Sale to Build Out Its Blockchain Wallet
content: ['<p>A company with a reputation for cryptocurrency investing will soon launch a blockchain wallet to complement its digital version of its digital asset, Binance Coin.<p><p>Also read: Binance CEO Says Bitcoin ‘Firm’ Still ‘Not Ready for Stake’<p> ']

headline: DBS Bank to Simplify Payment Process for Crypto Institutions
content: ['<p>New York-based cryptocurrency exchange DBS Bank is developing payments for institutional customers, a move that could make it easier for banks to offer stablecoins to institutional customers.<p><p>Read more: Bank of New York Is Using Direct Debit Card, but Unlikely to the Bitcoin Scene<p> ']

headline: The Case for a Blockchain-Based Identity in the World of Automated ID
content: ['<p>Blockchain is moving quickly, with more than $20 billion worth of products on the market by the end of 2021 alone. But a lack of smart contracts in the space is making the technology untouchable.<p><p>According to the U.S. government, more than two-thirds of all digital identity systems are failing. The problem is pervasive, with more than 1.1 billion systems in use.<p><p>There’s a growing awareness of the need for distributed ledgers and automated identity systems to replace existing systems, according to the New York Times. Blockchain is now the leading candidate for a central database of digital records, allowing citizens to record and store all of their data on an immutable ledger.<p><p>The blockchain world is increasingly populated with projects that can create digital identities, ranging from a company called The Digital Treasury to a blockchain consortium called Uniswap. And the idea that it’s not necessarily a good idea to create a blockchain is driving the emergence of the decentralized identity movement.<p><p>There are some notable examples: DeFi platform Binance announced a token sale on the Uniswap platform last week and DeFi platform Chainlink announced a token sale for tokenized tokens. The blockchain-based decentralized identity platform Blockchainz announced a new decentralized identity service on Wednesday, as well as a tokenization protocol on Tuesday, with plans to launch a token market later this month.<p>']

headline: How a Tokenized Blockchain Works
content: ['<p>An decentralized data platform has come a long way from the days when data-hungry decentralized finance (DeFi) protocols relied on the likes of Big Data to keep them alive.<p><p>CoinDesk reports in a report that the blockchain was launched in 2017 following the Ethereum blockchain news, with a roadmap to be released in Q1 2020. That announcement was later postponed due to regulatory concerns.<p><p>“DeFi,” according to the report, is not just about the data and it’s not about the financial information itself, but about the ability to make money that comes with it.<p><p>The company itself said in the report that the platform, CoinMarketCap, uses the protocol’s “platform stack” to decentralize data into decentralized and peer-to-peer forms. For example, a protocol can build data-sharing services from data shared on its own data feeds.<p><p>“DeFi is a big deal in the traditional finance industry,” said Tyler Cowen, CEO of Digital Currency Group. “But it’s not for us to do it ourselves.”<p><p>CoinMarketCap, in turn, is also looking at other data-sharing methods like permissionless data-sharing between smart contracts and private blockchain data providers.<p>']

headline: NFTs and Uniswap: Why NFTs Are Coming to the Blockchain
content: ['<p>The evolution of blockchain has made crypto a rich source of innovation for financial institutions.<p><p>Now, NFTs and uniswap (alternative finance) are set to enter the mainstream, following the rise of blockchain-based futures trading and asset purchase schemes, according to a new report from CoinDesk.<p><p>The industry’s growing interest in NFTs highlights a distinct shift in the way people interact with digital assets and their potential, the report said.<p><p>While decentralized finance (DeFi) has a long way to go to attain mainstream adoption, decentralized finance (DeFi) is becoming more mainstream, with companies like Square, Ripple, and others all building on top of it.<p><p>“In my opinion, it’s amazing how many crypto companies are still looking at DeFi, especially as they have so many opportunities but have so little in common with the other blockchains,” NFT pioneer Arca Investments CEO Dave Hogg said in a press release.<p><p>One such example: Square’s Uniswap, which has raised $2 million in a seed round for its Uniswap ETF, has raised more than 30 times more funding from investors in recent months.<p><p>See also: Block.one’s T-Swap Adds Uniswap to Its List of New Traders<p>']

headline: Innovation Becomes a Public Benefit
content: ['<p>Founded in 2018 by former bitcoin analyst Paul Tudor Jones, the InterChain Labs-led initiative now has over $250 million in bitcoin assets under management (AUM).<p><p>The InterChain Labs-led initiative, which focuses on the interoperability of Ethereum blockchain protocols, offers blockchain software developers, software vendors and service providers incentives, and also aims to bring blockchain-based digital assets to enterprise markets.<p><p>Innovation, or innovation that allows other parties to operate more transparently, in a manner that is “just a matter of time” and in an effort to better manage them, is a common refrain in the ecosystem. Many Ethereum and non-Ethereum developers, however, are reluctant to talk about it because they fear reprisals for disclosing proprietary information. (In an effort to bring clarity on the subject, InterChain has recently launched a “Public Patent Application” detailing how the firm is exploring using blockchain technology to license its products and APIs.)<p><p>“Our focus on cross-chain interoperability is driven by open-source software,” said Jones in a press release. “Blockchain applications are very high quality, and we think these are the best solutions for the enterprise software industry.”<p><p>See also: Blockchain Startup InterChain Has Started Using Ethereum to Support the Crypto Asset Market<p><p>The InterChain Labs project aims to add blockchain tech to Ethereum for use by all parties involved.<p>']

headline: Binance’s Price-Elimination Plan Shuts Down Institutional Interest in Crypto and Ethereum
content: ['<p>Binance is eliminating institutional lending, which had been a popular use case for its crypto-backed products, as a liquidity layer at its $400 million exchange-traded fund (ETF).<p><p>Also read: Binance Exchange-Traded Funds Must Pay BNY Mellon $300M to Avoid Unresolved Libra Exchange-Traded Product<p> ']

headline: The Bitcoin Blockchain Will Turn Bitcoin Into a DeFi Game
content: ['<p>The cryptocurrency world is about to get a whole lot more complex, with several new features and potential competitors coming to life.<p><p>A group of venture capitalists and early Bitcoiners in the crypto space, including Coinbase co-founder Brian Armstrong, have unveiled a novel “blockchain ecosystem.”<p><p>The idea is that while bitcoin (BTC) has many similarities with traditional assets, including traditional financial instruments, it also has very distinct advantages that blockchain companies will have over traditional institutions.<p><p>For example, it has the ability to take advantage of complex mathematical algorithms on the blockchain to make transactions, and also allows its peer-to-peer (P2P) network to accept payments and withdrawals.<p><p>“We’ve gone through a bull market for crypto startups,” Armstrong told CoinDesk in an interview. “Most have been doing so in the traditional sense. But what we want to do is bring those companies and their best practices, the crypto-based companies, into the space and give them the technology that they need to take advantage of these new technology.”<p><p>The firm is part of a growing list of venture companies interested in building the next generation of the industry. In March, Google Ventures invested in a project called “Bitcoin 2.0.”<p>']

headline: Gemini Raises $4.6M From Polychain Capital, Bitwise, Chainalysis and more in Seed Funding
content: ['<p>Gemini, a blockchain startup that enables investors to hold cryptocurrency in their wallets for the first time, has secured funding from the likes of Polychain Capital, Circle, Aave, Coinbase Ventures and more in seed funding.<p><p>Gemini, which already has a stablecoin project on its roadmap, will have support for cross-border payments by June 2019, according to Polychain Capital co-founder and co-CEO Simon Dierke. The new wallet will be connected to BitGo’s BitPay platform and is built atop an open-source Bitcoin code base.<p><p>Gemini currently employs about 100 people and raised $5 million in Series A funding in February. The firm, which claims to be the first to roll out a “global blockchain infrastructure,” said COO Alex White. “We believe in building ‘one blockchain solution that is open to all,” he said.<p><p>“We think this is the first of many, many blockchain projects to be built on the Ethereum network,” Dierke added. “We expect to see more blockchain infrastructure, more user-generated blockchain, and blockchain-based tools developed and deployed across many different blockchain ecosystems.”<p><p>As part of its funding, Polychain Capital has secured $4.6 million in seed funding in the form of a seed round for the project.<p>']

headline: PayPal Execs Raise $6M From Chinese Investors to Build New Blockchain Marketplace
content: ['<p>PayPal has raised $6 million in Series B funding round led by China Digital Capital.<p><p>See also: PayPal’s ‘BitTorrent’ Game Is Now Open to Users in China<p> ']

headline: Pax’s New Crypto Card Buys $2.1M in Tokenized Tokens
content: ['<p>PayPal’s bitcoin exchange-traded fund (ETF) has purchased $2.1 million in ether (ETH), an additional $4.4 million in bitcoin (BTC), and more than $10.4 million in other tokenized ETP tokens.<p><p>The acquisition marks the first such purchase of ETH by the cryptocurrency exchange and the second in a nine-month period, a firm spokesperson confirmed to CoinDesk via email.<p><p>The total value of the buy was not immediately available. The ETF has $13.9 million in assets under management (AUM). The ETF’s overall AUM of $32.9 million was $3.2 million.<p><p>“The ETF has seen a remarkable growth in the past year and it continues to support the industry,” said Alon B. Zarya, head of portfolio management at ETF. “With the significant demand for ether in the U.S., ETF tokenization and tokenization are booming and our long-term focus is to add more value to this burgeoning asset class.”<p><p>See also: PayPal’s Coinbase to Offer Institutional Crypto Traders ‘Tokenized’ Tokens<p><p>The acquisition follows a wave of ETP issuance that began at around the same time ETP was taking off.<p><p>Earlier this week, Coinbase announced it was converting some ETP into bitcoin.']

headline: Casa Puts Its Crypto Assets in Custody in Asia
content: ['<p>Blockchain-based services firm Costa Rica is to hold the crypto assets in a custody facility in the Asian region of Southeast Asia.<p><p>See also: Blockchain Firm Ceres Has Found Its Key Reserves<p> ']

headline: Citi Releases Crypto ETF Ahead of Token Launch
content: ['<p>Citi’s cryptocurrency ETF is due on the horizon in the first quarter of 2021, according to a blog post shared Tuesday.<p><p>The cryptocurrency index, the first under the hood of the Citi XRP digital asset stablecoin, will be joined by an “exchange-traded product” from XRP and XBT, as well as an “exchange-traded product” for USDT.<p><p>See also: Coinbase, OKEx to Roll Out Crypto ETF Soon<p> ']

headline: Seychelles, EU get 'bad news' after lockdown ends
content: ['<p>LONDON  - The European Union, Britain, the United States and the United Kingdom, which are expecting to enact new economic sanctions against Russia on Wednesday, will get bad news, with the European Union saying that it was not concerned about the COVID-19 crisis and has suspended the trading of goods from the bloc.<p><p>“The European Union is committed to supporting the ongoing Russian military and economic activities in South Africa, with the aim of stabilising the situation in the region as it considers further measures against Russia,” a statement on the EU’s digital arm, the European Economic Area, said.<p><p>Britain said on Tuesday it will extend an emergency supply ban to support the economy after Russia annexed Crimea from Ukraine in March and annexed a vast swath of eastern Ukraine, an area that has become the seat of Russian President Vladimir Putin’s Russia.<p><p>“We have expressed our grave concern over the economic situation in South Africa in particular. We are concerned that the situation may worsen and increase uncertainty, which is why we are suspending all trade in goods from South Africa,” a statement said.<p><p>European Union President Jens Stoltenberg has said he will meet Russian President Vladimir Putin and discuss economic sanctions with him later this month. (Reporting by Joseph Nasr Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p> ']

headline: The World’s Largest Digital Currency Has Ended Its Quest for a Global Role
content: ['<p>Blockchain finance pioneer Satoshi Nakamoto has completed his journey to the center of the blockchain space.<p><p>Born in 1970, Nakamoto spent several years traveling the world, starting with Tokyo to meet and collaborate with leading financial institutions, then eventually settling on Chicago where he founded Blockstack and moved on to Tokyo where he built the famous Seamless network to make the web accessible to millions. Nakamoto spent over four years on the S.I.Y.R. (Secure Hyperledger Network) project, which was built to enable developers to run digital assets on the Web.<p><p>He founded CoinDesk, a platform that aims to provide financial news and analysis to organizations and citizens around the world, and founded CoinDesk Asia. He left for Hong Kong in 2014, and returned to Asia in 2015 to launch CoinDesk Asia.<p><p>His departure from Asia was a big deal, and for years had been a surprise to those who have worked with him in the blockchain space. Nakamoto, who is considered to be one of the earliest adopters, was on the receiving end of many criticisms, some of which he has since taken to his Twitter account to defend.<p>']

headline: USDC CEO Warns Banks About ‘Black Hole’ Claims
content: ['<p>As the Federal Reserve debates the role of money in the financial system, a prominent business leader says banks can “shut it down.”<p><p>Speaking to The Nation on Wednesday, David Soknacki, CEO of Standard Chartered and chair of the New York Stock Exchange board, said banks have a responsibility to address the financial mismanagement that has plagued their businesses for years.<p><p>“The problem is that banks have been so involved in the system that they are not going to listen,” Soknacki said. “They have become so involved that it doesn’t take the proper regulatory response.”<p><p>Soknacki said he sees the risk to the economy from a “black hole” in lending in the form of excessive leverage and short-term borrowing.<p><p>“The problem is that you can have this bad cycle happen to any bank that has a lot of money and that’s why the whole economy has been hollowed out.”<p><p>In March, the National Association of Realtors, which is representing most of the large-scale mortgage lenders, said it would fight to limit short-term and long-term borrowings in the mortgage market.<p><p>The National Association of Manufacturers, which represents 10,000 manufacturers, said it would not stand in the way of firms trying to borrow from banks in the event of an economic downturn.']

headline: Kraken Now Accepts Tokenized Assets in Latest ‘Lightning’ Deal
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency exchange Kraken has extended its Lightning Protocol token sale support to a new partnership with tokenized asset manager Coinbase.<p><p>Coinbase said in a blog post Wednesday the Lightning token sale was “fully compatible with the Lightning Protocol” and a “comprehensive” Lightning network upgrade plan is in the works, it said.<p><p>Coinbase added that Lightning is a “highly scalable, secure and high-performance decentralized finance network that can support millions of transactions per second” and it’s already ready to launch on Ethereum. <p><p>The partnership was launched in conjunction with Lightning’s Lightning Network upgrade. The new offering will benefit Coinbase’s token holders by “supporting the Lightning Network” as well as other Lightning network upgrades on the network. <p><p>“With an open network of trusted nodes, Lightning Protocol tokens can be easily traded and traded on the market, enabling traders to accelerate trading volume and liquidity across platforms,” the firm wrote. “Coinbase is excited to offer a “full and robust network upgrade to Lightning for new and existing Lightning users,” it added.<p><p>In an interview with CoinDesk, the exchange’s lead blockchain architect, David Lubin, described the partnership as “a big step forward for our team.”<p><p>See also: Lightning Network Upgrades to Ethereum Are a Priority for Coinbase']

headline: Siam’s Crypto Mining Pool Raises $650M to Be the ‘Mainstream’ of Digital Currency
content: ['<p>Crypto mining pool Siam has raised $650 million in an angel round led by Polychain Capital, Ripple Ventures and Digital Currency Group (the owner of CoinDesk).<p><p>Read more: Polychain Capital’s Genesis Investment Is a ‘Fancy’ Startup, Says Siam CEO<p> ']

headline: Sri Lanka's GDP shrinks by 8% y/y in Jan-Feb -PMI
content: ['<p>Sri Lanka’s gross domestic product fell by 8% in Jan-Feb, the ministry of statistics said on Wednesday, as the central bank lowered its growth forecast for the coming month.<p><p>The statistics agency said it attributed the slump to “early detection of persistent inflationary pressures” and to the lack of a robust monetary policy to address the crisis, which has been in full swing since May.<p><p>“The central bank’s ‘crisis forecast’ remained stable, with a nominal recovery likely by the end of the quarter,” it added.<p><p>The statistics agency noted that Sri Lanka’s economy contracted 9.3% in the first quarter from the prior year, the smallest decline since the country entered the financial crisis in the 1980s.<p><p>The country’s central bank kept its target rate unchanged at 1.75% until late January.<p><p>“Despite the continued weakness in the national and regional economies, the economy remains resilient to the risks posed by the pandemic,” said Surya Sarkar, senior economist at Rangak Bank.<p><p>“In particular, we have continued to see persistent inflation pressures that are preventing an accommodative monetary policy response from being achieved,” he added.<p>']

headline: Hedge Fund Raises $200M From Crypto Capital Partners Including Benchmarks Capital and Pantera
content: ['<p>Hedge Fund, the San Francisco-based fund holding an average daily average of $4.2 million, has raised $200 million from crypto venture capital firm Benchmark Capital and Pantera Capital.<p><p>On Tuesday, hedge fund manager Jeffery Hurd said Hurd and his team of seven invested over $100 million, which included some in a $2 million seed round announced Wednesday. They were joined by Pantera Capital CEO and venture investor David Pendergast.<p><p>Hurd said the investment brings an average annualized return of 25%. He said Hurd expects the funds to mature faster than many bitcoin funds. “We’re excited to see how the institutional bitcoin world is going to respond to that.”<p><p>The funds have a total annual fee of $1.75 million to date, he said. The average fees in Hurd’s venture capital fund are about 4%, and Hurd said his company invests around $100 million per fund.<p><p>Read more: Bitcoin: Here’s Why Hedge Funds Are Acting Like Swiss Alpinist Chains<p><p>The average returns are 20% and Hurd said his company is trying to raise $200 million for the future. “We expect to raise as much as we can before we get to 100%.”<p> ']

headline: Igor Is Now the First Crypto Derivatives Economist in Russia
content: ['<p>Last month I published an article reporting on the role of money and the future of financial markets in crypto. I wrote a blog piece about the crypto boom in Russia and the implications of a change of policy toward Russia.<p><p>This month, I published a piece covering the bitcoin halving – the first cryptocurrency halving since 2012. This month, I reported on crypto custody startup Iberia Bank, the largest bank in Russia, with which Iberia is based.<p><p>At the end of last year, I published an article covering how institutional investors have turned to cryptocurrency and the future of markets in a country where most financial institutions have closed shops in droves since the financial crisis hit the country in 2006. <p><p>I also announced that I was opening an investment bank in Siberia that will allow cryptocurrency businesses to become financial institutions in Russia. I have since closed many accounts, but it’s still a difficult job to close one.<p><p>This time around, I have become the first cryptocurrency researcher in Russia.<p><p>“Iberia Bank, the largest banking institution in Russia, has an established reputation for being the leading bank in Siberia,” Alexei Zhukov, CEO of Iberia Bank, told me in an interview. “This has led to more business investments for Iberia since the halving.”<p>']

headline: Acer’s Bitcoin Mining Giant CME Raises $1.6M for a New Digital Asset, Including a Bitcoin Miner
content: ['<p>CME Group, a blockchain-based bitcoin mining company founded by CNET founder Brad Garlinghouse, announced Monday it has received an initial public offering (IPO) from the San Francisco-based venture capital firm Polychain Capital.<p><p>Polychain Capital is the partner of CoinDesk’s parent firm, Digital Currency Group. CoinDesk reached out to Polychain for comment on the news but did not receive a response by press time.<p><p>Also read: Bitcoin Mining Firm CME Plans to Raise $5.6M to Make Bitcoin Miners More Available<p> ']

headline: German Economy to Hit Record 2020 GDP Growth of 5.9%, Says World Bank
content: ['<p>BERLIN  - German economy will likely grow more than 5% this year in the first quarter, its fourth straight contraction in 2020, the World Bank said on Wednesday.<p><p>The Bank of England last month forecast growth of 5.9% in 2020, after accelerating its previous estimate of 5.2% in 2019.<p><p>Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a 5.1% contraction, while economists at the Bank of England had projected growth of 4.7%, above the Bank of England’s previous forecast of 4.2%.<p><p>Germany is Europe’s top buyer of energy products, while the bloc’s fourth largest coal producer is among the continent’s top buyers.<p><p>The Bank of England expected Germany’s economy to shrink to 3.6% of its pre-pandemic level by the end of this year after expanding slightly to 6.4% in 2021.<p><p>Economists polled by Reuters had predicted a 6.4% growth rate by the end of 2021, while economists at the Bank of England had expected growth to remain 4.8%, above the Bank’s revised estimate of 5.3%.<p><p>Germany is one of the wealthiest countries in Europe, and last year it sold a record $19.3 billion worth of real estate to build a billion-plus factory capacity.<p>']

headline: China's copper imports jump to 722m tonnes, surpassing expectations
content: ['<p>BEIJING  - China’s copper imports, the world’s top copper importer, jumped in November to 622 million tonnes, exceeding expectations but still exceeding the level in the previous month, China’s General Administration of Customs said on Friday.<p><p>Imports from China rose by a combined 11.2% to 935.5 million tonnes last month, customs said.<p><p>China’s foreign direct investment in 2020 was 430.9 million tonnes, up from 406.7 million tonnes in November, when the country started ramping up its efforts to contain the coronavirus pandemic.<p><p>China’s copper imports from other major economies are expected to peak in the second quarter, rising to 722 million tonnes in December from 521.7 million tonnes in November.<p><p>The year-end figures did not include an estimated 1.6 million tonnes of excess demand in November.<p><p>China’s export orders increased by 9.8% in November to a seasonally adjusted value of 933.5 million tonnes. (Reporting by Liangping Cao, Editing by Jacqueline Wong)<p> ']

headline: U.S. manufacturing orders rise at fastest pace in nearly five years
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - Manufacturing activity, which is expected to grow at its fastest pace in almost five years on Thursday, boosted by strong demand for U.S. services and equipment, helped support the fourth-quarter gains for the fourth quarter and bolstered by surging inventories, a sign that manufacturers “are starting to take the plunge.”<p><p>Strong inventories also contributed to strong new orders, the Commerce Department said on Thursday, adding the economy is now on track for a 4.1% expansion in the quarter ended June 30.<p><p>Manufacturers reported a 12.1% increase in output, compared with 11.7% in the prior quarter. They added an estimated 11.1 million new jobs in the second quarter.<p><p>The pace of increase in output is expected to be more pronounced than previously reported, though it was not clear whether it would be the strongest expansion for at least a quarter.<p><p>The Commerce report also showed gross domestic product rose at its fastest pace since July 2010, its fastest rate since March 2000.<p><p>The services sector shrank 0.3% in the fourth quarter, its strongest quarterly gain since April 2006. The services sector was the fastest since April 2006.<p><p>The government’s manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) rose to 56.0 from 57.5 in the prior quarter.<p>']

headline: Visa, Circle Join New Coinbase-Favored Institutional Digital Dollar Association
content: ['<p>Visa is joining an exchange-traded money services (ETM) organization, CoinFund, to help its digital dollar clients navigate the new institutional digital currency (CBDC).<p><p>Announced Tuesday, CoinFund, a partnership between Coinbase, Circle and Coinbase Ventures, is a subsidiary of Circle.<p><p>Visa joins a growing list of institutional digital currencies that include U.S. dollars, bitcoin (BTC), and U.K. pounds sterling (USKD). Visa also offers a CBDC-as-a-service, a digital fiat currency service, and a “digital currency exchange platform” that lets digital dollars be instantly accepted as U.S. dollars at participating banks.<p><p>The partnership is a departure from past years when the exchange community struggled to overcome a lack of institutionalized and regulated crypto offerings in its area of interest. While the exchange community embraced the currency, the industry was wary about using it as a means of purchasing U.S. dollars, according to Visa VP of marketing, Tim Sherwood.<p><p>“There are still a long way to go and we are seeing that there is much less institutionalization in crypto because of the current global restrictions on the use of the cryptocurrency. And because of this, we’re seeing a lot of volatility, but also a lot of innovation in the industry.” Sherwood added that while it’s still a work in progress, Coinbase and Circle are “all working together to bring the best possible value to the industry.”<p>']

headline: CNBC Reporter Joins FOX Business as First Analyst for Trump Rally
content: ["<p>NBC News' Brian Williams joins FOX Business’ Brian Williams as a first-associate analyst.<p><p>See also: CNBC Sees Role in Donald Trump Rally Plan, but Not the ‘Fool’ Stance<p> "]

headline: China Jan-Feb exports: trade, imports +19% y/y vs +19% in 2020
content: ['<p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s exports increased 19% in January from a year earlier, official data showed on Thursday, while imports also rose by 19% on a year-on-year basis, as domestic restrictions against the spread of coronavirus and stricter coronavirus containment measures hit the economy.<p><p>China’s trade surplus was 9.76 trillion yuan ($118.98 billion), or 76.42 billion yuan, last month.<p><p>China last month completed a major infrastructure upgrade designed to boost exports of a key domestic export: coal and aluminium ore.<p><p>Export growth accelerated 9.9% in January, versus a 14.8% year-on-year jump and the 15.8% growth of the year prior.<p><p>Imports surged by 30.1% from a year earlier and arrivals of coal, iron ore and rubber rubber goods increased by 16.5% from the year before, official data showed on Thursday. (Reporting by Zhang Jie; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p> ']

headline: Daijin Launches New Crypto Trading Service in Asia
content: ['<p>Daijin, a subsidiary of blockchain firm Digital Currency Group (DCG), has launched a new cryptocurrency trading app called Doubleday, a subsidiary of the world’s largest exchange, DeFiz.<p><p>See also: Bitcoin, Ethereum Win Out in DeFi Battle Over ‘Smart Contracts’<p> ']

headline: Crypto
content: ['<p>The Bitcoin Foundation has issued a new crypto policy document calling for new investment standards for crypto and stablecoin exchanges.<p><p>The document, titled “The Future of Financial Markets,” was issued on Tuesday, and provides a list of “critical requirements” for crypto exchanges to meet. It includes:<p><p>Read more: BitGo Expands Support for DeFi Services on Ethereum, Adds Crypto API<p> ']

headline: JPMorgan’s Crypto Fund Helps Banks Use Blockchain Tech as a Security Layer
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency exchange JPMorgan Chase has completed the first part of its new institutional-grade security token (ISA) venture with the help of blockchain technology provider Chainlink.<p><p>The crypto exchange has partnered with blockchain vendor Chainlink, which is also based in Chicago, to provide a “secure, scalable and low-cost solution for bank digital asset security tokens.”<p><p>CChainlink’s blockchain solution – called JPMCOIN-SA – provides JPMorgan with a blockchain token that can be issued by participating banks, with JP Morgan “interest-bearing” assets generally accounting for around $200 billion of trading volume per day, according to Chainlink’s website.<p><p>Read more: JPMorgan Chase to Launch ‘JPM Coin’ Token Using Chainlink’ Crypto Platform<p><p>“This solution utilizes Chainlink’s “Global ‘Security Protocol” that incorporates “a variety of ‘faster’ and “more transparent” ways to provide a secure and efficient method of payment and transaction for institutional investors.”<p><p>JPMorgan said its product is the first of its kind that will allow banks to offer cryptocurrency to their users. Chainlink, it turns out, is the same company that offers the “Lightning’ smart contract blockchain used to mint bitcoin, ether and bitcoin cash.”<p> ']

headline: Ethereum and Binance Are Sifting Between The Right Stations and Right Alternatives to Ethereum
content: ['<p>The world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, Binance, is turning to its own digital identity solution – BinanceCoin.<p><p>Announced Wednesday, BinanceCoin will allow users to buy, sell and trade ETH, ETHX and BNB on its platform. Additionally, users will be able to transfer ETHX to Binance-issued private keys and Binance Coins will be available on Binance Digital Assets Platform (BXA), a platform for issuing and holding BNB.<p><p>“BinanceCoin can act as an instant wallet,” said Mike Bress, CEO of BinanceCoin. “BinanceCoin enables users to hold and trade BNB on Binance’s platform. They can purchase, trade BUSD, BUSD XRP, BUSD ETH, BNB ERC-20, BNB BCH and more.”<p><p>The move comes as the EOS community debates whether the U.S. government is violating U.S. sovereignty by selling crypto. While the U.S. doesn’t want to trade ether (ETH), a new study found that the U.S. is the only country to own the largest share of the crypto market.<p><p>BinanceCoin will initially only allow users to buy ETH, ETHX and BNB. BinanceCoin has yet to add a native Binance Coin wallet, however.<p>']

headline: Avalanche Fund for DeFi Startups
content: ['<p>Avalanche Fund is funding early-stage projects for decentralized finance (DeFi) startups that use smart contracts to secure funds. The firm has been offering tokenized fund tokens in support of the fund in the past.<p><p>The fund allows early-stage tokens to be created in real-time using smart contracts instead of tokens and has been building out its API for tokenization. Tokenized funds will be used to launch product products such as decentralized exchange (DEX) platforms for fund-raising and fund-tokens.<p><p>The fund has already raised some $3.5 million from investors including Andreessen Horowitz, BlockFi Ventures, MakerDAO, Coinbase Ventures, Dapper Labs, Huobi Capital and others. Tokenized funds will also be used to expand Avanti’s smart contracts in future launches.<p><p>Read more: Tokenization Pumps DeFi Back to the Global Stage<p><p>The fund also included an undisclosed amount of ether (ETH) from the Ethereum network to support the fund. Investors who invest more than $2 million of ETH in Avanti’s smart contracts will receive a small percentage of the total investment made.<p><p>“We are thrilled to support the Avanti Fund on Ethereum. We believe in the value of an individual, community-driven approach to institutional investing.”<p> ']

headline: Crypto Custodian Blockchain Blockchain Raises $17M, With $5M in Funding
content: ['<p>Blockchain custodian Blockchain Blockchain has raised $17 million in a Series B funding round led by Swiss firm Nordea Capital and Nordea Capital.<p><p>Also read: Bitcoin Firms Take Aim at US Government, Blockchain Will Fix It<p> ']

headline: U.S. central bank sees ‘broadest possible rate range’ on bond purchases
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON  - The U.S. central bank reiterated on Tuesday its stance that it would support a rate hike this year to support the economy in its current post-crisis situation, but noted that central banks around the world are closely watching how much they can tolerate.<p><p>The central bank said in a report to Congress that it had considered an increase of 6 basis points in 2021 against an increase of 1 basis point in 2020, with an appropriate range for the outlook.<p><p>In the report, it said the central bank believed that policymakers in advanced economies would be well served by lower inflation in the future as policymakers continue to support the global economy through the COVID-19 pandemic.<p><p>“The Fed sees inflation at 3.5% for 2022, above the median inflation target range,” the central bank said.<p><p>It said it is watching the situation closely, “in the light of market data” suggesting higher inflation will likely occur in the near future, but that it remained cautious about the possibility that the Fed would pull monetary policy into negative territory. (Reporting by Ann Saphir; Editing by William Mallard)<p> ']

headline: Pax Raises $12M to Make Ethereum-Based Assets Faster
content: ['<p>Cryptocurrency exchange Pax is raising $12 million in seed funding from Polychain Capital, Accel, Sequoia Capital and others.<p><p>The firm says it’s aiming to expand beyond the platform for digital assets, adding a “digital asset integration platform,” said Pax CEO Michael Saylor in a statement.<p><p>The news comes a week after the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) reported Monday it had filed a class-action lawsuit against Pax alleging the exchange is operating in violation of the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA). The SEC also claimed Pax violated the Foreign Exchange Registration Act (FARA) by failing to register as a foreign agent in February 2019, the day after the SEC filed its lawsuit.<p><p>Saylor confirmed in a press release that Pax would work on a digital asset integration platform in the future, but wouldn’t detail the timeframe yet.<p><p>The move comes just two weeks after Pax announced it had raised $4.7 million in an initial coin offering (ICO) backed by the Ethereum-based Pax Alliance.<p><p>“We’re focused on building the most advanced platform for digital asset ownership,” Pax CEO Michael Saylor said in a press release. “Our aim is to offer a suite of tools for users to enhance financial inclusion in the U.S., and expand our global footprint.”<p>']

headline: Bitcoin Miner BlockGecko Wins License From US Patent Office
content: ['<p>BlockGecko is an Australian bitcoin miner licensed under the U.S. Patent Office’s (USPTO) Patent Application No. 13,054,716.<p><p>As reported by Australian newspaper The Australian on Tuesday, the firm’s bitcoin miner has been approved to operate under the U.S. Patent Office’s (USPTO) Innovation, Innovation and Permission to Develop (ID) Program, or IDP.<p><p>According to the website, BlockGecko was granted a license on April 3, 2020. The miner is powered by “Bitcoin Miner BlockGecko,” which is an open source fork of Bitcoin’s native open source code.<p><p>The IDP program utilizes an open source software license for non-profit use, allowing users to download, install and run BlockGecko on their systems. <p><p>See also: MakerDAO to Allow Hardware Purchases With Bitcoin Miner Maker CoinGecko<p><p>The miner provides mining power for the Bitmain bitcoin ASIC that powers the Bitmain EOS-3 ASIC system, which was recently upgraded to the latest generation of bitcoin mining machines.<p><p>See also: Bitmain’s SEC Suspends Bitmain, Coinbase for Refusing to Hold Bitcoin Accounts<p>']

headline: New York Lawsuit Against Crypto Custodian Binance Says Binance Is Using DeFi
content: ['<p>Binance’s digital asset custody startup, Binance Custody, sued the firm for allegedly violating the U.S. Securities Act in late 2016 by offering the service, using blockchain-based DeFi and a platform called Binance Connect.<p><p>Binance is now working on a new settlement, with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) demanding $2.5 million as the company’s share price is set to rise after the suit closes.<p><p>As CoinDesk has reported, the new settlement could push the price of Binance Custody’s stock to $0.08 per share.<p><p>The SEC complaint alleges that Binance failed to comply with a $100 million purchase agreement for the Binance digital asset custody platform, which would have allowed Binance to use Binance’s trust-free platform to hold bitcoin and other assets without having to pay the fee.<p><p>The SEC claims Binance’s offering violated the U.S. Exchange Act by not fully disclosing to investors the existence of its trust-based platform, allowing the firm to hold bitcoin without paying the fee.<p><p>In the settlement, the firm alleged that in order to maintain the platform, Binance had to sell crypto tokens as a security. It alleged the exchange had misrepresented the size and weight of its holdings, and that Binance had been able to sell those tokens to investors through a single-shop agreement, thus making it appear to hold bitcoin and other assets.']

headline: The Blockchain Business Is Coming, Now
content: ['<p>With a $15 billion investment round announced for digital assets blockchain, venture capital firm BlockFi has announced a $15 million seed round.<p><p>See also: A Place in the Crypto Economy Is Now Available to Investors<p> ']

headline: Gemini CEO Says User Fees Will Drop, But That Will Be OK
content: ['<p>Gemini, the cryptocurrency lending app, says users will no longer be charged fees to borrow cryptocurrency from its “customers”.<p><p>As CoinDesk reported, the company said in a press release Tuesday that users will be able to earn fees from borrowing fiat into cryptocurrency, but they will be charged “as follows” on-ramp:<p><p>“Customers will now be charged for both fiat and bitcoin fees for using Gemini’s website,” the release stated. “Our customers will not be charged bitcoin fees in this transaction and will receive refunds immediately.”<p><p>Gemini’s announcement was preceded by a blog post by CEO Michael Saylor on Tuesday. <p><p>In a nutshell: Customers will now be able to earn fiat and bitcoin fees with Gemini’s cryptocurrency lending app in return for being able to withdraw and purchase cryptocurrency with fiat as collateral.<p><p>Users can also borrow cryptocurrency on Gemini’s BitGo network, which enables users to trade assets on the platform for fiat.<p><p>Read more: BitGo to Shut Down for 10 Years in 2020: Report<p><p>In other news, Gemini will soon release support for bitcoin’s price via a partnership with BlockFi, the industry leader that manages Gemini’s exchange-traded funds (ETFs).<p>']

headline: Visa to Roll Out Bitcoin Cash Payments at Startup HQ
content: ['<p>Visa and BitGo Group are developing a bitcoin payment system, a product aimed to bring more convenience to shoppers at the expense of the cash-hungry tech giant.<p><p>Also read: Visa Plans to Launch Bitcoin Cash App in India Over 12 Months<p> ']

headline: Ethereum Startup Unocoin Raises $10M, Institutional Investors Boost It
content: ['<p>Unocoin (UM) raised nearly $10 million in a private funding round, announced Thursday, as investors surged in support of the startup’s decentralized finance (DeFi) application, which aims to monetize blockchain-based smart contracts.<p><p>See also: Ethereum Startup Unocoin Raises $10M in Token Sale, Buys $500K in BitGo Funding<p> ']

headline: Biden Said to Hold Off On Travel Ban in Bid to Boost Economic Recovery
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON — President Biden reiterated his support for the National Institutes of Health, saying he would hold off on a major policy decision that will result in a more sustained economic recovery if his administration focuses more on rebuilding American roads and bridges.<p><p>Speaking Thursday before a House Oversight Committee hearing, Mr. Biden said he would "stay on track" to make a final decision on the Travel Ban, which is an individual mandate that governs how health officials can travel and work. He also said he would hold off from implementing provisions that would restrict travel for people with disabilities.<p><p>He also said he would “tolerate any attempts to undermine the United States’ economic recovery,” even if it was not the president’s policy to impose new requirements on health officials and leave them subject to court review.<p><p>On Friday, the House passed a $1.9 trillion relief package for individuals and businesses that was widely criticized by Republicans for hurting their economic prospects, but Democrats were quick to point out that its costs were high and that the measures would only improve them once restrictions are in place.<p><p>Under the measure, states would get $150 billion to help them pay for a federal plan that includes $50 billion in stimulus money for schools and other social services. But Republicans say those dollars will be used to help more states pay for those programs and prevent a repeat of the 2008 economic collapse that led to the loss of billions in federal aid.<p>']

headline: PayPal’s SEC Watchdog Is Driving More Bitcoin Investments
content: ['<p>The San Francisco-based PayPal and Coinbase’s Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) are reportedly working together to keep an eye on the cryptocurrency industry’s potential, despite their ties to the bitcoin industry and bitcoin’s reputation for being tainted.<p><p>As reported by CoinDesk and CoinDesk Digital Asset Group, the SEC’s Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) will begin issuing guidance and guidance to all entities under the jurisdiction for securities laws in January, according to a filing with the filing dated April 11, 2019. This will include the financial services industry. <p><p>According to a document dated June 19, 2019, the OCC states that it will have the tools to “enhance the clarity, clarity, and clarity of SEC guidance” and “enhance the effectiveness of the reporting by providing guidance to entities with respect to securities that have not been adequately investigated and adjudicated in the prior three years and have not made sufficient progress to support a valid and effective prospectus”. <p><p>The SEC also said it will make recommendations to entities regarding what type of investigations they need to provide, a requirement when it comes to cryptocurrency and other asset types, including in financial institutions and financial institutions’ investment strategies. <p>']

headline: Swiss National Bank President: ‘We’ll’t Be Stifling Your Freedom
content: ['<p>The Swiss National Bank President on Thursday said he expected central banks to support a “full spectrum” of monetary policy.<p><p>The move comes days after Swiss authorities introduced a new monetary policy easing to lift domestic consumer prices. Economists polled by Reuters expect the central bank to tighten its quantitative easing in the first quarter of this year.<p><p>“Switzerland’s ability to support a broad range of monetary policies is limited, but the central bank will be supportive of some policies,” the president said. “This has implications for the economy.”<p><p>Switzerland’s central bank is seeking to make its monetary policy stance more flexible by making the central bank “more transparent” about its purchases and loans, as well as providing more liquidity to the economy as prices rise.<p><p>Swiss central bank President Mauricio Rauch announced the move on Twitter.<p><p>“We must support inflation, growth, job creation and consumer protection, as long as our goal of a balanced monetary policy is met,” Rauch said in an interview with Reuters.<p> ']

headline: The Big Short’s Long Road From Bitcoin to the Global Stage
content: ['<p>In the spring of 2019, Elon Musk proposed a plan to decentralize bitcoin, a proposal that ultimately failed. Bitcoin became a decentralized finance (DeFi) network during the pandemic and was one of the first decentralized protocols built in 2017.<p><p>The plan, which was supported by the likes of the Ethereum Foundation, was an attempt to give people in traditional economies an alternative to money. In the process, it made it impossible for people to become self-sufficient – a point that Musk himself had argued “one step beyond Bitcoin” to become more independent.<p><p>After the pandemic, however, the crypto boom burst. As the decentralized movement took off, an explosive increase in usage reached a fever pitch, with over 1 billion people per month on Twitter. By December 2020, bitcoin had over 1,000,000,000 users, meaning around 30% of the population had access to a single cryptocurrency. This enabled the community to become increasingly reliant on centralized exchanges and financial institutions (CFDs).<p><p>In February 2020, bitcoin surpassed $500,000 within the first month, and reached its peak at $1,600 at the beginning of March. In December 2019, it reached its peak at $1,800. The year immediately after that, bitcoin’s price surpassed $1,000 as of mid-March 2020. After Ethereum’s $1,000,000 peak, it was $3,400 at the end of February, and finally $4,800 on May 3, 2020.<p>']

headline: Ethereum to Launch as a Minerscore for Enterprise Ethereum Users
content: ['<p>Ethereum has launched an ERC-20 Mastercoin, but a full-blown Minerscore will be on the market next year, bringing its native language and security features to EOS 1.0 and beyond.<p><p>Announced Wednesday, the new EOS 1.0 EOS Mastercoin is expected to go live by the end of the year and will be available to EOS 1.1 users. <p><p>In an announcement Wednesday, EOS CEO Brendan Iribe said he was excited to see EOS 1.0 users and the growing ecosystem behind it “having a real chance to gain exposure to the world of Ethereum and continue on as a mainstream asset.”<p><p>It’s still early days for EOS, with Ethereum Classic and the upcoming Ethereum v2 stablecoin both rumored to arrive before the EOS 1 launch. The EOS stablecoin is expected to launch sometime this year.<p><p>While it may seem like EOS 1.0 may only be for developers interested in using Ethereum to build applications, Iribe said, “the EOS ecosystem is thriving on stablecoins that have never been used before.”<p><p>“There’s still a long way to go,” Iribe said.<p> ']

headline: Lufthansa’s First Bitcoin ATM Is Built in Singapore
content: ['<p>A Singapore-based bitcoin ATM company is building out its bitcoin kiosk, providing customers the opportunity to get their money in at no extra charge.<p><p>Also read: Singapore’s Bitcoin ATM Launch Ends After 30 Years, Says CEO<p> ']

headline: The U.S. Economic Stabilization Bubble Is Now Bigger Than Ever
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON — Economists polled by Reuters on Monday said the U.S. economic recovery is now larger than ever and that it is accelerating as more people embrace the benefits of COVID-19 vaccines.<p><p>Nearly three-quarters of economists polled by Reuters agreed that the economy is now broadly expanding and that it is nearing the end of a major recession. While the unemployment rate is at 7.4%, more than half of economists said the recovery is accelerating as the number of Americans willing to work dipped from 5.4% last year to 3.4% this year.<p><p>The surge in spending, along with increased COVID-19 vaccination among low-income Americans and a recent surge in the number of people seeking jobs, is leading to worries that some parts of the country could see the end of the pandemic in the spring and summer.<p><p>“The outlook for the rest of this year is very good,” said Andrew MacIntyre, director of the Economic Policy Institute at the University of Michigan. “The recovery is not slowing down.”<p><p>President Biden said in a speech on Thursday that while the pace of job gains in the U.S. economy is improving, he acknowledged that the pace of job losses in parts of the country that have seen most of the most recent pandemic has been slow.<p><p>“We cannot afford for the economy to be paralyzed by the virus,” he added.<p>']

headline: UPDATE 2-China's December iron ore imports surge to 17.2 mln T - customs
content: ['<p>* Exports rise to 17.3 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports rise to 1.79 mln T - customs<p><p>* Total iron ore imports to China rose 17.3 mln T from 12.6 mln T a year earlier<p><p>* China March imports up to 139.9 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports rise 13.7 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports to Japan rise 9.7 mln T - customs<p><p>* China March exports rise to 6.33 mln T - customs<p><p>* China March imports up to 5.93 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports rise to 1.79 mln T - customs<p><p>* China March exports to Japan rose 17.3 mln T - customs<p><p>* China March exports to Japan increased 13.7 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports to China rise 9.7 mln T - customs<p><p>* Exports to Japan rise 13.7 mln T - customs<p>']

headline: UPDATE 1-China c.bank's Q2 growth forecast'slight'

(Reporting by Renfei Zhang and Hong Kong-based Reuters journalists; Editing by Jacqueline Wong)<p> ']

headline: Fidelity Investments to Acquire Crypto App Startup Bitso in 2021

headline: Dapper Labs Raises $4M for Bitcoin Fund
content: ['<p>Dapper Labs has raised a Series B funding round for the venture capital firm led by the likes of Andreessen Horowitz and DeFi VC Dapper Labs.<p><p>The company, founded in 2014, raised a total of $4.5 million in Series B funding in 2019, according to its announcement. The funding was part of a $2 million investment round conducted by Dapper Labs and Dapper Labs’ other partners in 2019.<p><p>The Series A round saw Dapper Labs acquire Dapper Labs’ bitcoin wallet business, a wallet-based wallet protocol that aims to create decentralized finance (DeFi) applications in collaboration with decentralized applications. In this round, Dapper Labs was also joined by Dapper Labs Capital, Sequoia Capital, ErisX, Digital Currency Group, ConsenSys, Polkadot Ventures and others.<p><p>Dapper Labs’ crypto-native token wallet will be open to all users until July 2021, and the team said it will be the first of its kind to have its own product in crypto, as opposed to Bitcoin’s current exchange-traded fund.<p><p>The new round comes at a significant time for the crypto community, as the U.S. government and cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase are reportedly exploring ways to license crypto-native tokens. <p>']

headline: Hedge Fund Investor Argo Labs Invests $20M in Coinbase’s ‘Federated’ Crypto Wallet
content: ['<p>Hedge fund investor Argo Labs is buying Coinbase’s decentralized finance (DeFi) wallet provider Coinbase.<p><p>Read more: Coinbase Is Hiring Crypto Lab Engineers to Build Its ‘Scalable’ Wallet<p> ']

headline: China March copper production up 4.4% y/y, official data shows
content: ['<p>BEIJING, April 13  - China’s copper production rose 4.4% in March from a year earlier, official data showed on Wednesday, the highest monthly increase in nearly two decades.<p><p>Crude oil-bearing copper ore, produced by the mining sector, reached a production rate of 8.47 million tonnes a day (MT/d) on the month in March, after the previous monthly increase of 7.71 million MT/d recorded in November 2019.<p><p>Crude iron ore, produced by the refining and processing of iron ore, was up 1.9% from a year earlier on the month in March, after a 1.2% rise in December 2019. (Reporting by Julie Chen; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)<p> ']

headline: Igor Grote, CEO, Blockchain-as-a-Service: How Blockchain Ledger Will Help India Become a Central Bank
content: ['<p>The Indian government is preparing to allow users to transact on the blockchain platform Ledger, according to Grote, a co-founder of blockchain platform Chainlink.<p><p>Also read: India’s Central Bank Approves Blockchain Ledger as a Currency<p> ']

headline: Biden’s Administration Approves Bitcoin Mining Industry, Says Industry Is Ready to Take on Crypto
content: ['<p>WASHINGTON — The New York governor said Monday his administration has approved the bitcoin mining industry to facilitate more investment and to create new businesses.<p><p>The announcement comes less than a week after President Biden issued an executive order that seeks to legalize the sale, custody and use of bitcoin in banking and other settings. The president’s order would provide financial protection for bitcoin mining companies, according to the White House.<p><p>He said the mining industry’s success and expansion was a positive sign for the American economy, adding that a large share of those companies now use bitcoin mining machines as a form of entertainment.<p><p>The president said that while he’s “not ‘going to ‘explore the market’ in an interest-bearing manner” and make any decisions that might be contrary to public policy’s interest, I’m open to exploring how we might best advance the interests of our miners.”<p><p>He also said the administration will have to balance the interests of miners and industry as opposed to just making the most money.<p><p>“I’m confident that, as a country, the bitcoin mining industry is going to continue to grow and increase,” he said.<p> ']

headline: Dapper Labs Adds Crypto Service to Its Blockchain Business
content: ['<p>Blockchain-related platform Dapper Labs has added a blockchain-based service to its infrastructure for enterprise blockchain applications.<p><p>Announced Monday, the platform launched a new version of the Dapper Bitcoin Testnet alongside Dapper Labs’ BitGo protocol. The testnet allows businesses to test their business applications on the blockchain without relying on the centralized marketplace.<p><p>The move marks the latest twist in the industry’s battle for control over the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, and a major blow for privacy advocates that are hoping to see a crypto infrastructure in places like South Korea.<p><p>See also: What Is DeFi and Where Is It Coming From?<p><p>Dapper’s team of blockchain engineers will help create the new toolkit, Dapper Labs CEO Jason Schwartz told CoinDesk in a live broadcast. In the next week, the company is likely to update its testnet to include its own bitcoin service.<p><p>While that doesn’t mean Dapper Labs will leave its wallet or wallet infrastructure entirely. Schwartz wouldn’t rule out doing so, saying it will still be the custodian and wallet provider for any DeFi application.<p><p>“Dapper Labs has been focused on serving decentralized applications over the last several years,” Schwartz said. “They’ve built blockchain applications on top of Dapper Labs and they are already working with a number of other DeFi developers to build their own.”<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 1-German economy shrank at fastest pace in more than four years in February -IHS Markit
content: ['<p>(Adds details)<p><p>BERLIN  - The economy grew at its fastest pace in more than four years in February, the IHS Markit’s statistics agency said on Tuesday, as the European Central Bank tightened its monetary policy in the face of mounting pressure on Germany’s economy.<p><p>The German economy shrank 0.5% in February, the data showed. Economists polled by Reuters had forecast a revised 0.3% contraction.<p><p>“The economy is entering its third month of contraction, with the main impact on gross domestic product (GDP) and employment likely to be limited to 2021,” IHS Markit’s chief economist, Andreas Graf, said in a statement.<p><p>“However, the impact of the lockdown measures on businesses and consumers is likely to reduce further contraction.”<p><p>The IHS Markit’s headline figures were released ahead of the final vote on Thursday in which Germany is to hold a second referendum on Britain’s membership of the European Union.<p><p>Germany’s economy contracted by 2.1% in 2020 as a bloc of the European Union imposed strict curbs on German exports.<p>']

headline: PayPal Co-Founder Says It Is Putting $30M Into Bitcoin Mining
content: ['<p>PayPal co-founder Dan Schulman said Monday it is “going into the space” to bring bitcoin mining to businesses.<p><p>The firm announced last week it is buying and mining $30 million worth of bitcoin (BTC) using a “peer-to-peer” mining pool called CoinShares, an investment backed by major crypto players including Coinbase Ventures.<p><p>In terms of the size of the purchase, Schulman told CoinDesk its total valuation in the U.S. was $306 million, which is well within the $306 million the PayPal co-founder told CoinDesk is the maximum amount PayPal would be willing to offer in the future.<p><p>“I think the largest piece is probably Bitcoin’s price. Bitcoin is, by far, the most valuable asset on this planet. I believe in it, and I think it’s going to become more and more important over the years as people start to look at it,” Schulman told CoinDesk.<p><p>“The other thing is the fact that, if you look at the chart, there’s a pretty good correlation to bitcoin price that it’s going to become more and more important over the years.”<p><p>PayPal has long been a proponent of cryptocurrency mining operations, including its early success with bitcoin mining equipment.<p>']

headline: Casper Group Adds Bitcoin as a ‘Treasure Ship’ to Its Platform
content: ['<p>Casper’s cryptocurrency platform, CoinDesk, is adding bitcoin to its platform, joining another cryptocurrency mining platform.<p><p>CoinDesk first reported that CoinDesk would be adding bitcoin as a treasure to the platform. In January, CoinDesk reported that CoinDesk had listed crypto mining as a “Treasure Ship” as a “significant step” for the company.<p><p>Announced Wednesday, CoinDesk is now offering an option for bitcoin holdings for trading on CoinGecko. Users will be able to choose from a variety of trading platforms on CoinDesk, as CoinDesk’s trading platform includes a CoinGecko account.<p><p>Casper’s platform can now be used to mine cryptocurrencies, it announced. The platform will be the first bitcoin mining platform CoinDesk has announced it will support.<p><p>“Casper’s mining technology allows us to use our ‘digital assets” – in this case, bitcoin, to create a digital gold standard.”<p><p>“Our goal is to increase customer engagement with cryptocurrencies with a holistic approach,” said Nick Colyer, chief operating officer of CoinDesk Digital Assets.<p><p>“CoinDesk Mining is the gold standard for bitcoin miners to mine in a mainstream fashion,” he added.<p> ']

headline: Arian Foster to Return to IndyCar at Race Day in 2020
content: ['<p>HOPKICK, Wis.  - The former IndyCar champion is returning to IndyCar racing this year after five years in the race.<p><p>The driver, who was a member of the final car race at the 1988 Daytona 500, said on Friday that he will not race next year as his contract expires at the end of 2020. (Reporting by Julie Gordon and Ann Saphir Editing by William Mallard)<p> ']

headline: UPDATE 2-Australia's home prices rise, but still falling as COVID-19 pandemic rages
content: ['<p>* Jan prices fall 0.5% y/y, slightly down on year<p><p>* Q1 median price up 0.2%, the steepest drop since February 2020<p><p>* CPI growth slower than expected (Adds analyst comment)<p><p>SYDNEY, March 18  - Australia’s property prices have risen by 0.5% last year as COVID-19 and economic uncertainty have led to price rises that were slightly less than expected in the first quarter, the Federal Statistics Department said on Friday.<p><p>The National Australia Bank’s data on home prices, released on Thursday, shows property prices rose 0.5% in the three months to March 2020 as a combination of factors contributed to the surge.<p><p>Home price growth slowed to 0.3% in the January quarter, the lowest since February 2020.<p><p>* Purchasing managers’ index (PMI) rose 0.5% in the three months to March 2020 compared with 0.5% the previous month.<p><p>* Consumer prices, the benchmark for Australian dollar terms, have risen 0.5% so far in 2020.<p>']

headline: Fidelity Funds: Binance Is Working With Coinbase
content: ['<p>Fidelity Investments, the publicly traded fintech investment firm, is working with Coinbase to help develop a blockchain-based wallet that helps users find bitcoin.<p><p>Coinbase is a publicly traded crypto exchange operating in the U.S. and Europe that has been providing liquidity and support to clients since its launch in early 2018. Fidelity Investments began working with Coinbase in February 2020.<p><p>In March, Coinbase said it would release a wallet app called Binance-Proof-of-Stake.<p><p>The wallet would let users “pay for assets in fiat” by paying for fiat currencies, such as bitcoin (BTC), ether (ETH), and XRP (XRP), according to a release Tuesday.<p><p>Fidelity said the release would help its Coinbase-based wallet be more transparent.<p><p>The Binance-proof-of-stake blockchain could allow users to create a proof-of-stake wallet with no central authority, according to the release. The wallet could be linked to third-party apps and wallets in order to allow transactions to take place in the platform.<p><p>The news comes after Coinbase disclosed that it is working with blockchain-based exchange BitGo to establish a “digital wallet.” Coinbase co-founder Jack Dorsey has previously said he has confidence in the blockchain technology.<p>']

headline: A Weekend Go-To on a Plane
content: ['<p>A few weeks ago, my husband took me to our first weekend together (for lunch, we would go on the plane together), and he said that it would be best to make a week-long trip (and leave your family and friends in the house). So, for this week, I’m bringing my husband’s advice to our next five flights:“Go with a good budget.” <p><p>One other thing I always love about traveling with a baby (other than not getting tired during our flight): The planes can be really loud, and the baby usually comes on one side. So, I was thrilled to see how easy it was to pack a suitcase with my baby, and now that I have a baby, I’m totally in the mood to blow off a little steam. :)<p><p>One other thing to do: If you’re flying on a full-size jet, you’re much more likely to have two or three kids, and you probably won’t have time to pack up your bag and travel alone. So, I’ve found the best way to pack an extra suitcase for a two-week, family trip is with two separate bags. One is for your baby, which means you have access to one carry-on bag, and the other for your toddler, which means you’ll have multiple bags.<p><p>One suitcase to pack:  A classic suitcase with a few extra things you can throw on the plane for extra comfort, like a diaper, shoes and other essentials. I highly recommend it.<p>']

headline: A Day in the Life of N.L. Cool
content: ['<p>Last year, my beloved friend and co-worker N.L. Cool took me on a four-week vacation to India and, in the process, discovered a magic trick she still uses everyday… <p><p><p><p>To ease me into the routine, she invited me on a one-on-one trip with her. She told me about her father, who founded N.L. Cool in the 70s and had taken a $300,000 seed funding from his wife in exchange for his freedom.<p><p>The trip started off with a conversation with her about the perks of running a business, as well as her desire to run for president and to inspire others to do the same.<p><p><p><p>So, when the flight attendants finally gave her the cash, the idea of a vacation home to raise a family in America began to dawn.<p><p><p><p><p><p>We got our first real taste of what life outside the family might look like in 2019 — the day after my fiancé and I decided to move our family to the Cayman Islands for $10,000 each. The first four years were rough (with my mom barely having enough money for college), and I ended up splitting my time between my college apartment and a job as a freelance writer.<p><p><p>']

headline: Hoop tails
content: ['<p>Today’s post comes from our friend Liz, who has been obsessed with her ponytail for the past few years. What makes it special is that it’s totally gorgeous. She and her husband, Ben, have been knitting hats for eight years now, and we love the looks of them all. Here’s her story…<p><p>First off, congratulations to Liz! You have been such a great companion. My mom started her career as a designer at the age of 13, and I still adore her work. It’s such a special time, and I’m excited to share the amazing accessories she has in her shop. Here’s what she told us…<p><p>First off, a huge thank you to Liz! I’m so inspired by her. How did you get into knitting hats? She grew up in Mexico and grew up knitting in England. It’s such a wonderful country for handmade goods! It’s such a great place to start your own shop, and now I’m a mom and a mother of two young kids. I would love to come to your shop and work with you, too! :) How did you get into knitting hats?I was born and raised in Mexico, and this place is so incredible. I grew up in small-town Mexico — it’s my home, so I don’t know how to live there! But in my old age, I feel like I’ve got a good handle on how to knit without feeling like a tourist. I want to try it all out. <p>']
