headline: Do or Don’t: A Swimsuit
content: ['<p>This summer, a British beauty called Lucy decided to take on the role of a young lady (or, as she would put it, a girl) in a pop-up bikini. Here, Lucy shares her secrets, including what it was like to wear it, her favorite swimsuits and her favorite look…<p><p><p><p>What is your favorite style?I’m loving my swimsuit because it’s a swimsuit I wear every day, and that’s what makes me feel comfortable in it. A lot of women look pretty much like me, and this makes them feel sexy. My mom always told me not to wear swimsuits — and I guess she meant “I’m going to have to use this as my uniform,” because I felt more independent and cool in the swimsuit. I’ve found this to be really popular, especially since it’s super chic and pretty in there! I’ve also been wearing a black T-shirt to show off my feminine side.<p><p><p><p>What did your mom wear to swim in the past? My mom always wore a red dress to the pool! She always said to bring a red dress, and that was really important. But my mom always said “Oh, no, it’s too big!” (Laughs!)<p><p><p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Lisa C.
content: ['<p>Lisa C. is a New York Times columnist, author and speaker. She lives in Brooklyn with her husband and two boys (who were born and raised there). “My goal is to educate my kids about femininity, feminism, and why I love them so much’show.” Here, she shares five outfits she wore on a regular basis…<p><p><p><p>Denim dress: Gap.<p><p>“My current dress is the Gap dress, which I’ve always loved. I wear a big cotton one on top to hide my hair. It’s been the one thing I’ve worn all my life and I’m very self-conscious about it. I also love the Gap heels, which are so comfortable and fit. I’ve been using a vintage toe-and-tail pair because they’re so easy to adjust. I also love a vintage topcoat.”<p><p><p><p>Midi jacket: Burt’s Bees.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Erica Sosa, Jenny Cohen
content: ['<p>Erica Sosa is a writer and producer based in New York City, where she loves to cook, cook, eat and drink. “I love having people around to compliment me,” she says. “I really like people making fun of me. I’m really excited for the upcoming New Year’s Eve New York cooking show, “I’m Cooking Right Now” (aka “Cooking Is Not Your New Year”). Erica is the mother of two young daughters and is the author of “My Cookbook: A New Family Guide to Cooking in New York City and an Academy Award–winning cookbook author. “What makes me excited for New Year’s Eve? It’s a celebration of my children, and it’s the opportunity to have everyone around me involved and have a better understanding of what I’ve been cooking all these years.” Here, Erica shares five outfits she wore to New Year’s Eve, her favorite pasta and her favorite breakfast food.<p><p><p>']

headline: Wedding Hair
content: ['<p>My lovely friend Caroline and I are celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, so we’ve been taking photos. We’re excited for the weather (which is getting warmer every day), and we’re itching for a little peek into her everyday life. Here are three lovely steps…<p><p>Step 1: Do your hair in a curly ponytail. You want it straight, and then you’re working the back, making it look like you’re wearing a ponytail with a short ponytail.  This is the one thing I LOVE about this look (and it’s the only one I’ve ever been a fan of).<p><p>Step 2: Take your hair out of your ponytail. Here’s the thing about hair — it looks great. I usually only do it when I’m really into it; you can always just walk it out. When you’re done, you’re done! The key is to leave it in a soft, air-soft spot, like this, so you can have the curl up there.<p><p>Step 3: You may want to add a little of your hair to the bottom of your head. This will make it look smooth and pliable, and it will look natural for a little longer. Take your hair from one side to the other, and wrap around the hairline as it comes out.<p><p>Step 4: Take your hair out of the ponytail. Take it out of your ponytail and wrap it around the roots as it comes out. It will look natural for a little longer!']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Emily Hausmann
content: ['<p>Emily Hausmann lives in New York City with her husband and three grown-ups. Her current style obsession is lipstick — but she loves other things too — including lipstick, mascara and bronzer. Here, she shares seven of her favorite colors, including four that work for everyone…<p><p><p><p>Floral<p><p>“Floral is the most natural look in my life. I love that there are shades of dark blues and blues, but there’s always a bright blue under the lipstick. It’s not meant to be an everyday color, but just as effortlessly beautiful. For my eyes, I use Sephora’s Liquid Lipstick. My mother-in-law used to be the color of the beach, and she’s always the one who would say, “You know what, you look pretty if you wear Floral.” I love the contrast of the colors!”<p><p><p><p>Black<p><p>“It’s always flattering to wear the black lipstick with everything. I wear it with a black T-shirt, so I don’t wear jeans and a big T-shirt. I love wearing it on women everywhere, including on trips.”<p><p><p><p>Chocolate<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Nieke Shearer
content: ['<p>Nieke Shearer is an independent consultant who lives in Washington, D.C., with her husband and four children. She has been making video game design tutorials and podcasts for several years. Here, she shares five outfits she wore over the course of a week…<p><p><p><p>Sweater: Madewell. Shirt: vintage Madewell. Belt: vintage Madewell. Blouse: Madewell. Sweater: Madewell. <p><p>“When I first started out, my style was something I always wanted to wear, but I never really understood why. I just got married and moved to New York, and my style has been moving forward ever since. I’m trying to figure out what I want to wear now and now, and I’m learning.”<p><p><p><p>Socks: American Apparel. Sneakers: J.Crew. Sweater: American Apparel. Shoes: Madewell. <p><p>“I don’t care what people think. My style is so self-conscious, I keep my clothes in this bag. It makes me feel self-conscious, and that makes me feel more confident and better able to express myself creatively. I’m obsessed with the word “self” and the way people see it. It’s hard to talk about yourself in the first place.”<p><p>']

headline: Our Picks: This Summer's New Skirt
content: ['<p>Our picks for summer uniforms are as follows…<p><p>1. This fall, we were excited to get excited about a new model — Erica. She would wear jeans and a T-shirt, and this is where we all got our first look. (The T-shirt also came with a belt.)<p><p>2. This fall, we were stoked to wear something similar: this T-shirt. The jeans, the shirt and the belt made it look like something out of the J. Crew show. I’d highly recommend it.<p><p>3. This fall, we wore this pink striped top and shorts, and it was totally worth the $35. The turtleneck, which I’ve worn twice these past few months, made it feel like something out of the J. Crew show, while the blazer felt like an oversized sweatshirt.<p><p>4. We wore these cute polka dots for our new school uniform. They make you feel a little like a kid, and they’re made from polyester, so you can wear them with jeans and sweaters.<p><p>5. This spring, we were excited to share our favorite pieces from our collection, including a black leather jacket, this striped top, and these classic navy jeans. The collar was cut for our wedding and we love their vintage straps.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kendra Smoot
content: ['<p>Kendra Smoot is a writer who lives with her husband and two young children in Los Angeles, California. Kendra lives with her husband and their two children, Kendra, 6, and Rhonda, 6. Kendra’s style has always been grounded in quirky outfits, but lately she’s found that she’s drawn in a more serious and eclectic mix of fun and elegance. Here, Kendra shares her favorite jeans, swimsuits, shoes, and five style essentials…<p><p><p><p>Jumpsuit: Adidas, similar. Jeans: Sartorial. Earrings: J. Crew. Sandals: J. Crew. <p><p>“I love this shirt, which I’m wearing to work every day. It’s like a white, but with an orange lining. I’ve been obsessed with my oxfords for 20 years, so they look good with jeans. They’re a bit comfy and they fit really well.”<p><p><p><p>Shirt: Madewell. Sandals: J. Crew. <p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Vanessa Puk
content: ['<p>When I was 12, I took my friends to a beach with my dog, Toby, for the first time. Toby was so cute that I felt so lucky. I wore a white T-shirt, jeans and T-shirts in a week — and I ended up going through five generations of ballet dancers, dancing in the same pool every day for three days.<p><p>Here, Vanessa Puk looks pretty like a model, while Toby gets a belly rub, which makes him look like a model and also makes him look cooler, which is kind of cool, too.<p><p><p><p><p>A top: vintage, similar, similar. Lipstick: Laura Mercier. Boots: Unruly Vintage. Boots: Forever 21. Necklace: Anton Corwin.<p><p>“What’s the one thing I can’t live without? I wear a lot of shoes when I’m traveling, but my favorite is the Everlane. I’ll wear it in my bag because it’s comfortable, so it’s easier to pack.” — Vanessa Puk, from Everlane.<p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: What do you wear to school?
content: ['<p>I wear a tank top and dress all the time. It’s a must-have. I’ve worn it for years, but recently I’ve gotten a new one that feels like a modern day vintage T-shirt. I’ve been thinking about going vintage, but I’d rather just get something that’s really pretty. I like how she’s wearing everything in this one, like a dress, skirts, sneakers and an earrings.<p><p>Here are a few pretty jeans I’d highly recommend:)<p><p><p><p><p>T-shirt<p><p><p><p>Jacket<p><p><p><p>Flared jeans<p><p><p><p>Socks<p><p><p><p>Sleeve<p><p><p><p>Drape dress<p><p><p><p>Ruffle sweater<p><p><p>']

headline: A Year in the Beach
content: ['<p>Last year, Alex and I drove down to Maine to visit his family and discover the wonders of the ocean. I was nervous about how we’d look at a photo, but instead, he decided to take the beach and explore with me. So, here’s a year of adventures that made us rethink where we’re headed…<p><p><p><p>Day 1: A few weeks after our trip, we met my sweet and caring partner. Alex brought us a sample of the perfect Maine lobster. Alex wanted to make a lobster shell, and I wanted to add a little bit of salt to the surface of the lobster to make it taste better. We started by eating a lobster shell. The salty side was great. Then we went on a day-long fishing trip with three boats. We spotted lots of sharks and sharks in shallow water, and one boat picked up a killer whale. Alex was thrilled that it was still alive when he finally got out to dinner and took it home.<p><p><p>']

headline: Gift for Kids
content: ['<p>Have you ever gone on a day-long trip? Here’s the easy $10 gift for kids (with some extra jewelry!).<p><p>This sweater has a cardigan that fits perfectly on the bike!<p><p>This shirt makes you smile.<p><p>This earrings look amazing with jeans and sandals.<p><p>This sweater is a total hit with the kids! (I’d recommend this one for anyone needing a little break.)<p><p>This heart-shaped cardigan is adorable for bike rides and rides with friends.<p><p>This striped sweater has an adorable neckline. (I’d love to wear it on my wedding night.)<p><p>This cute bag has pockets for your small items, including groceries and a baby bottle.<p><p>Here’s another pretty sweater, with a cute collar and scarf.<p><p>These pink jeans have a subtle twist on a classic vintage look.<p><p>Here’s a similar black one for lunch.<p><p>These baby-sized gold earrings are so cute for picnics and picnics on the playground.<p><p>These black earrings were from this wonderful Italian designer!']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Gemma
content: ['<p>My mom is so funny and quirky. My mom is always on the hunt for new shoes for her and I love her personality and quirky personality. I’m always interested in her clothing, but I was a teeny tiny kid and I wanted to make a pretty outfit for myself. But my mom is not just about shoes. She has incredible style, and we’re all going to have our share of the same. Here are five outfits she wore for a week…<p><p><p><p>Mini-dress: Gap. Jeans: Anthropologie, similar. Skirt: Anthropologie. Pants: Madewell.<p><p>“I was really excited to get my first pair of Levi’s when I went to college in Queens. For a while, I loved their cutoffs, but when I went back to the States, my mom always told me to get my Levi’s, so I just wore them in a black T-shirt and jeans. Nowadays, I’m obsessed with these jeans and they feel pretty and feminine in comparison. I like that the T-shirts also come with their patent leather saddles.”<p><p><p><p>Leather top: The Madewell. Pants: Anthropologie, similar. Top: Madewell. Boots: Madewell.<p>']

headline: An Unusual Twist
content: ['<p>My friend Rachel (a.k.a. Alex) texted me this cool story: Alex is a math genius with a knack for turning his brain into a spreadsheet. He has a beautiful blog about the subject and gets a ton of e-mails.<p> ']

headline: The Worst Year Ever
content: ['<p>Even worse than the worst year ever (which would be perfect for a funny movie!), is the year we’re celebrating the 100th anniversary of our first anniversary, which feels like a date-only date. We’re not going to forget it, and that means some lovely books, art exhibits, museums, and funny people will be posting their remembrances this weekend. Let’s all take a quick look at them this weekend.<p><p>1. The Little Mermaid. The beautiful Mermaid was actually my least favorite film ever, but that wasn’t to be expected, since everyone hated it and thought it was too hard. But that’s okay. Mermaid and the Mermaid 2. The Bambi Mermaid. My friend Anna came over this weekend to talk to us about this film and how it feels to be a little girl in the bib book, and now she’s wearing a mermaid costume with a necklace. (She’s adorable.)<p><p>2. The Curious Incident of the City of Lost Kind. One of my favorite films of all time was the first ever animated animated film, which was so cute to watch and love. And the movie is made by John Cameron, who’s such a director and writer! What a fun way to start a new year!<p>']

headline: Fantastic new movie The Hurt Locker starring Elizabeth Olsen
content: ['<p>Actor Elizabeth Olsen, best known for playing the lead in The Dark Tower, is set to star as a teenage girl in the film titled “In the Mood for Love,” starring Melissa Leo. The film opens in theaters on July 13th, 2021.<p><p>The actress-comedian-producer also created “The Impossible —” a trilogy of her own films in 2017.<p><p>Leo previously appeared in “Mad Max: Mad Max: Revenge of the Maxx” as a teenager.<p><p>"In the Mood for Love,” her memoir about that movie, is a story about a teenager and her newfound love for their best friend, Maxx, who becomes a cyborg — or, as Olsen puts it, “the cyborg in me.”<p><p>Leo\\\'s other films include “Titanic,” the “A Dance With Alex” and “The Night Before."<p><p>Elizabeth Olsen said in a statement, “I am thrilled to be bringing this exciting new movie to theaters. The performances of Elizabeth Olsen and Melissa Leo are inspiring and entertaining. They are also exciting for fans to see the incredible work of Natalie Portman in the role of Maxx, and we can’t wait to see more of her next big movie."<p>']

headline: Vacation Photos: New Orleans and San Francisco
content: ['<p>We booked a week-long trip to San Francisco, where we’ve stayed with friends, stayed in museums and ate taco trucks in Mission Hill. We’d also try to record every trip we took for each city, and keep track of where people have stayed, from New Orleans to San Francisco to Amsterdam.<p><p>One night, we drove to our grandparents’ home from NYC, where Alex and I went on an adventure. We stopped in the parking lot at an old French grocery store, where we found Toby at work. The only thing on his desk was an old-fashioned French bib. Alex had always loved vintage clothes, and he’d never seen a single French bag, nor would he ever want to have one again. He was also curious about the French culture, which he had always admired. It was a bit of a break from New Orleans, but the food was delicious, the drinks awesome.<p><p>For the trip, we stayed at the lovely Kiehl’s restaurant, where Alex played the violin and took a bunch of slides. When we arrived back home, we met with Alex for dinner. It was my favorite New Orleans trip ever.<p>']

headline: Wishlist #3: The Unusual
content: ['<p>This weekend, I was lucky enough to attend our family-friendly Chicago vacation, where my family lived in San Francisco. It was such a rad city, and it felt right to be here — you know, in a place I hadn’t traveled much since my youth. (I remember visiting my grandfather’s farm, and it reminded me of our first trip to Cuba. It’s a family farm, after all.) And, I really wanted to visit my dad. So I ended up reading this wishlist, which was so pretty and easy to read.<p><p><p><p>So, if you’re looking for a family vacation (and you can’t wait for the next one!), how would you describe your family vacation? I can’t wait to share a few photos, if you’d like…<p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Sarah
content: ['<p>“I am the type of person who thinks the easiest is the end.” —Sarah & Toby, on how to look pretty in heels and jeans’  <p><p>“You always want to be confident, not just as a dancer but as a person. That’s the key to my style. It’s about being confident in myself. I love not being afraid to be my best friend — but to have the confidence to not be afraid to be the person I want to be in my own self-conscious way. I feel confident all the time — but not as much as some people assume.<p><p>“For a long time I believed that dressing like a woman meant having the courage to have the most fun out of everything I do. So it was with a deep understanding that I could be myself — but that would not always be true. Having fun in a feminine way means being bold in how you dress and expressing yourself creatively. In many ways I have done that — a lot more than I did, but still very much able to be someone that I want to be in this moment.” — Sarah & Toby<p><p>“Growing up in a closet-less community, the closet was my place to be, to be alone and to feel confident with what I was wearing. Nowadays, I feel much more confident in how I look without fear. I still like having my shoes on when I’m in a group, but not because I want to make myself feel like a tomboy. That’s my mindset, really.” — Sarah & Toby<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Jazmin
content: ['<p>Jazmin is my all-time favorite New York girl. Her smart, outgoing personality made her a pretty hot contender for best friend for a high school dance class. But when it comes to outfits, she has a really cool look that I can’t stop wearing. Here are five looks she wore all the time…<p><p><p>Dress: J.Crew. Necklace: Vintage. Shoes: A.S. The Crew. Skirt: Old Navy. Lipstick: MAC.<p><p>“I’m very independent in my style. I like to look like myself, and I like making my own decisions about what I wear. But at the end of the day, I always just choose my clothes. I like to dress like an American. I think everyone has their own style. “I just have to be able to figure out what I want to do.”<p><p><p>Blazer: Gap. Sunglasses: J.Crew. Tote: A.S. The Crew. Necklace: Vintage.<p>']

headline: The Weeknd’s New Album Is 'The End of Things'
content: ['<p>On December 23, 2015, the Weeknd officially came out with their seventh studio album. At that point, they were already on their first full-length, which came out in 2016. “I’m feeling pretty bad for myself,” said the man behind the record, which came out months after his death. “It’s my last album, and I want to make it fun again.”<p><p>He added, “Honestly, I still have some issues. We need more time for things,” but is confident that things will take care of themselves.<p><p>This past fall, the band released their eighth studio album, “The Last Wish.” At this point, they had just officially taken a break from recording and were finally ready to release their fifth studio album in 2017. (Their first full-length album, “Living Forever,” is now available on Amazon Music.”)<p><p>Thoughts? Would you listen to it?<p><p>P.S. The song "What Have You Done for Me?" and how I beat a giant bear.<p><p>(Photo by Ana Echols.)<p> ']

headline: Toby
content: ['<p>It’s hard to find an adventure book that actually explains sex. But here’s Toby & Co.’s Sex and the City, a funny new book about the city of New York City, which is about to start shipping out, right now. (I’m dying to finish it, I promise!)<p><p>(Via The Book Smell)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Nelly Cohen
content: ['<p>Nelly Cohen, a.k.a. The Man in Black, lives in the neighborhood of Manhattan’s Lower East Side, where he can wear pretty everything. His wardrobe is eclectic, including a pair of bright jeans that are so good he couldn’t afford them, a pair of Levi’s sneakers, and his new denim line, which I love. Here, Nelly shares five outfits he’d love to wear on a week of outfits…<p><p><p><p>Striped jeans: $13, like this, which feels casual, but fits him well. He wears a tee, sweater and T-shirt for work, but I also wear a striped shirt, jeans and a tank top.<p><p><p><p>Dress: Madewell. Shirt: Vintage, similar. Necklace: J.Crew. Jeans: J.Crew. Shoes: J.Crew, similar.<p><p><p><p>Jacket: Levi’s 501, similar. Skirt: vintage. Pants: vintage. Sweater: vintage.<p><p><p><p>Top: Kiehl’s, similar. Sunglasses: vintage.<p><p><p>']

headline: Packing Guide: A Field Trip to Paris
content: ['<p>We headed out for lunch this week, and I found myself itching to splurge on a French-inspired bagel. A bagel with a light sourdough, crisp bread and delicious mustard dressing was my go-to. It was such an easy, casual lunch. I had the choice of five choices: a béarnaise, argan oil and rosemary.<p><p>“It was a treat to find two French bakeries to serve them. The argan oil was light and fresh, and the rosemary and béarnaise were soft and delicious.” (My favorite is the Bakery Jean Jean.)<p><p>When we got home from the airport, I was impressed with the quality and care of the baker. He had a great staff, but felt like his customers were very nice and welcoming. I’d highly recommend him.”<p><p>Thoughts? Would you ever consider it? <p><p>P.S. 10 more traveling bagels, and travel essentials.<p> ']

headline: A Little Help From NYC
content: ['<p>I’ve been blogging about New York City for quite a while, but lately I’ve been taking a walk around the city, and I’ve noticed lots of great things. Here are some of my favorites:The city has such a vibrant community, especially for a city of just 8 million people. It has beautiful parks, which make it easy to go for a day. It’s so welcoming and has such a friendly vibe. The food’s so good.<p><p>And, I love the neighborhood! (Though I think my favorite part is that they take a lot of risks: They have a fire pit, and there’s a carousel!)<p><p>I also love the fact that the area is smack in the middle of Central Park, which is pretty rad!<p><p>But, on a more positive note, there’s one area where I’m excited to visit, and that is the museum. They’re a museum, not a museum, and the slides are incredible. I’ve been going to the show for ages, but they’re all so much fun to look at, and it looks like a great way to just sit at the museum.<p>']

headline: What Kind of Shoes Do You Wear?
content: ['<p>I always wear my black flats. It’s the only place on earth where you can wear heels, but there’s always something I want to wear on a date. I always want a pair of boots with pockets that are bigger than their shoes, to hide pockets and get into the moment. This summer, I’ve been spotting the guys at Sephora who’ve also got their feet cut. I’m excited to share my secret weapon: a pair of classic leather heels! What kind of shoes do you wear to dates, when the weather is right?<p><p>P.S. A dress code for this dress, and a tip for going somewhere new.<p><p>(Photos by the Sartorialist, via Sartorialist)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Susan Franzen
content: ['<p>San Francisco-based Susan Franzen is a fashion editor for Madewell. “I wear my flats, jeans, sneakers and all black accessories everyday. I love all kinds of things, and the way I dress makes me feel like a real person.” Here, she shares five looks she wore to work…<p><p><p><p>Sweater: Forever 21. Pants: J. Crew. Sunglasses: Saks Fifth Avenue. <p><p>“I don’t care if I’m not wearing a trench coat or a blouse, I just wear my classic casual outfit, like a sweatshirt and jeans. I think the black tee, which is super chic and casual (you don’t have to be a high school senior to be a tomboy!), is a fun outfit, especially for work.”<p><p><p><p>Dress: J. Crew. Jeans: Birkenstocks. Sweater: J. Crew. Shoes: J. Crew. <p><p>“I wore this dress to work. It was so fun. I went from the office to the bus stop, but it was so easy!”<p><p><p><p>Dress: J. Crew. Sunglasses: J. Crew. <p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kim Pore and Paul Thomas Anderson
content: ['<p>Kim Pore is the co-founder of fashion-forward online store Diners’s Guide, an influential travel publication that sells products and guides to celebrities around the world. After working as a marketing and social media strategist for the New York Times, she’s now one of the most influential people in the business. Here, she talks about her style, how she overcame her mother’s reluctance to buy perfume and the most magical product she created…<p><p><p><p>What’s your morning routine?I’m usually at home with my head in my hands. I wash my face and make sure I’m getting plenty of rest. I also get up early to go to dinner. My first activity before going to bed is the ritual of eating lunch. At dinner, I get to eat my lunch. I’ll usually start my cooking before I get dressed, which will give me a good excuse to put in my own little ritual. When I’m ready to take my meal, I’ll put the pasta or pasta dishes I have into my bag and shake it out.<p><p><p>']

headline: Loving
content: ['<p>One funny thing I learned while reading this post is that women tend to be the breadwinners in the kitchen, so it might be fun to try to convince them to cook their own dinners. (And the best part: It doesn’t have to be that way.)<p> ']

headline: Dress
content: ['<p>My friend Caroline wore this dress (it’s adorable!). The dress is made of a vintage T-shirt that was stolen during a robbery, and the collar has been cut off. Would you wear it?<p><p>(Via Jeans Out)<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Rachel
content: ['<p>Rachel is a clinical assistant professor of public health at the University of Chicago, where she shares her passion for treating women with radish, sunbathers, heartburns and dermatitis. Here, she shares five easy steps to getting the most out of your skin, her beauty routine and a secret formula that never smells like makeup…<p><p><p><p>Shirred hair for “very long””“Shirred hair is the most important part of any makeup application,” says Rachel. The beauty ingredient is a simple blend of sunflower oil and natural beauty serum. It’s a natural and effective way to look good at all times, and in short, a natural look. She recommends starting with the oil, then adding more to get a smoother texture. Then brush it on after cleansing and moisturizing.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kelly Kendricks
content: ['<p>Kelly Kendricks is a social butterfly with a knack for changing clothes. She’s from New York City, and she has her own way of cooking. Here, she talks about her favorite jeans, her hair and her hair. “I love to take photos of my hair as soon as I see it,” she says. “It’s the only way I can tell what’s going on with it’s head and shoulder. When I see my hair, I see it for myself and not the camera.” Here, Kelly shares five looks she wore while traveling as a teen, and how she’s wearing them now…<p><p><p><p>Denim Jacket: Madewell. This is her favorite. The classic Madewell blouse is made from cotton. The cut-off is the same as most. She has lots of style icons around her—including J. Crew’s Kate Winslet, Kim & Jamie, The Nanny, J. Crew’s Jamie Beckett, Meryl Streep and others. (She was also a fan of the 1980’s TV series Madewell and is also a frequent speaker.)<p><p><p>']

headline: Curtis Wanger and Alex Jones to Discuss 'Dangerous' Downton Downton has brought excitement to the Downton era. The BBC is making a renewed effort to present a new show to its viewers. But it remains to be seen whether the show will attract the same audience that it had in the 1960s and 70s. The "Downton" star, who is known for his romantic nature and his TV-friendly personality Alex, has long said he was disappointed by the current state of the show.  "Downton" is among the few shows now exploring what people think of a show that has a long history of controversy. Alex has long called for a rethink of the show, and many have expressed fears about the portrayal of British troops in the show, despite a raft of awards including best drama and best drama. The BBC is also planning to air a series of talks between staff about what could be affected. The talks may focus on whether the BBC should retain its current rights to show "Downton Abbey" for two decades, as well as the decision to leave "Downton" altogether for the "90s." At present, "Downton" shows the character of a royal family, played by Anthony Hopkins, to live in a small farmhouse.  "Downton" stars Bradley Cooper, Julian Fellowes, Kate Middleton and Gillian Anderson. "Downton" was created by BBC parent company ITV and is produced by the BBC Television Studios, the parent company of ITV, ITV Studios and the BBC, among others. The BBC has traditionally hosted the show "Red vs. Blue," which was hosted by former Lord Mayor Andy Burnham during his tenure as mayor of London. Earlier this year, BBC executives announced plans to sell off the BBC-owned series to ITV. "Red vs. Blue" is set to air at 10 p.m. this Saturday on ITV. The BBC said it

A funny trick for creating a self-care product.<p><p>(Top photo from the amazing Healthy Travel Guide.)<p> ']

headline: Dancing in Milan
content: ['<p>This summer, we’ve been taking part in a huge exhibition called “San Francisco: The Place I’ve Always Loved.” Here, Alex and I explore San Francisco, its beauty, and the fascinating world of art galleries…<p><p><p><p><p>Art and photography in San Francisco, by Julia LeBaron. <p><p>“San Francisco’s artistic heritage is so extensive that even the city’s most innovative artists can be overwhelmed. In 1872, artist Ada Goudy took photos of the city in the form of a flowerbed — the symbol of a city of artists and photographers. The photographer photographed the flowerbed, which looked like the flowerbed itself, alongside a few photos of people on the ground —including an artist in a wheelchair. It was the first of many photographs that emerged over the years, revealing the hidden secrets of this art form.”<p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: Hangovers
content: ['<p>I always love when people point out things that are funny, and I’m like, ‘Hang on a second!’ So, we just shared a funny story this morning about one guy in Florida who had an affair with his girlfriend. He had multiple relationships, which is crazy, but this one guy had an affair with his girlfriend.<p><p>The story goes something like this:When I was 10, I moved to Austin with my twin sister and my family. My older brother was a software engineer at the local tech giant and I was 16 at the time. My family lived in Miami and we were lucky enough to go on vacation to Venice. Our family moved there about six years ago, and our family moved into a small apartment in Palm Springs with our two brothers. I thought it’s awesome because the apartment looked like it was from a film version of an early 1960’s TV series.<p><p>At first, we thought it’s just silly because our neighbors thought it’s weird because my older brother still worked there!<p><p>My family moved to Palm Springs with our twin brothers and cousins. During the day, we lived next to the old Foxwoods building in the middle of the woods and watched movies like Crazy and the City. It was our apartment for all our family vacations, even after moving back to Austin. <p><p>Then we went to the cinema and saw something funny: When the movie began, the girls were playing a musical called The Good Wife. Then when the movie ended, the boys, who had also been playing the same musical for the night, were playing a different musical.']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kendra Wadlow
content: ['<p> Kendra Wadlow is a mother of two kids (and a big dog) who lives with her husband and three-year-old daughter in Los Angeles. Kendra lives with her husband and three-year-old daughter, Ruby, on a budget apartment with her husband and their dog, a jack-of-all-trades. Kendra loves being outdoors — camping, hiking and even kayaking…<p><p><p><p>“I’m not really into the outdoors in general. I was raised outdoors in a family that had no toys and was always scared to explore. That has always made me think, ‘Where do I start?’ Now I have a more relaxed life, where I’m able to explore and explore. So, my main focus is outdoor activity and fun.”<p><p><p><p><p>“I grew up on a fishing line near my family’s house. It’s a really nice place, and I grew up in an RV — it took us three years to go through all the water, so we still had a lot of stress on our lives. Now, I love it! My favorite part is the dogs! Their bark is so thick and it makes you want to pull them out of the house.”<p><p><p>']

headline: Nope, I Still Have This Sweat Issue
content: ['<p>My friend Caroline recently shared a photo of her in-laws wearing the same sweatshirt she wore to work (her uniform from high school), and I thought to myself, “Oh my goodness, this is how my life is going this year.”<p><p>So, I asked her about it, and she was like, “It’s a sweatshirt.”<p><p>(Via Madewell)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Gemma Dore
content: ['<p>Gemma Dore is an intern with the nonprofit Voices of Change at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, who is passionate about empowering people to speak their minds about issues facing them. Her style is inspired by art history, and her style appeals to people who feel marginalized or marginalized at every level. Here, she talks about how to change things, her obsession with beauty products and why “she’s so sexy.” Here, Gemma shares four looks…<p><p><p><p>“I’m often in the middle of an argument with someone, but I’m so much more confident with my style than I am with my clothes. I think that if someone says ‘make me look beautiful,’ then you should make me look pretty! I think that dressing up has helped me realize I can be the voice for people.”<p><p><p><p><p>“I like a lot of what I wear, and I also like being in a lot of different situations, so I find myself getting into the right places. If my wardrobe is a red dress and a black dress and a white dress and I think I’m doing my best to look like the person wearing them, then I’ll say I need a red dress and a black dress.”<p><p><p>']

headline: I’m a big fan of Madewell‘s pink lipsticks. They give you an even smoky glow in the dark — like your lips would have been covered by this mascara on Halloween. And they also make a cute matte lipstick that would look fabulous with a grey tank top. Here’s a fun, easy way to make it look sexy: Mascara Polish is the best. I love the matte pink color, and it works as a base for all your eyes. Just swipe on one eye color (blue, yellow, orange, brown) and you’re done. (I would highly recommend this beauty line.) Here are the five best.
A Week of Outfits: Christine O.
content: ['<p>“My mom is from Georgia, so I love going out to dinners with my friends.” She recently introduced me to her new “dress uniform.” Here, Christine shares five looks she wore in a week…<p><p><p><p>Top: Uniqlo, similar. Necklace: Gap. Lipstick: Everlane. <p><p>“When I was younger, I would wear an orange dress with red lipstick, and it was my favorite. Now that I am 25, it’s my signature. I’ve worn this since I was 13. It’s a great dress, and it’s easy to wear when you’re ready. I have the most relaxed vibe, and if someone has a pet, it’s usually me.” <p><p><p><p>Dress: J. Crew. Sandals: Everlane. <p><p>“My sister, a high school teacher, also taught me to put my skirts on when it was cooler. She also taught me how to fold your skirt up (under the skirt is like your shirt), and taught me to look younger on the floor if I had a skirt on. It makes me feel so fresh.”<p><p><p><p>Glasses: Everlane. Necklace: Gap. Lipstick: Everlane. <p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Anna Beck
content: ['<p>Anna Beck lives in New York with her husband and two kids, but she also loves being a mom. “Mommy, how do I do?” she asks, adding that she’s always trying to dress like a mom and not be a parent. Here, she shares seven outfits that she wore all week…<p><p><p><p>Ties: A&S, similar. Shoes: similar. Bag: similar.<p><p>“My style is always evolving. I try to throw on a little bit of jewelry — like these sandals —to make sure the jewelry is comfortable, but not too much too much too quickly. The tie is from a vintage, so it’s a very old one. Also, these tie-dyed shoes were on my tomboy parents list, so it’s nice to have the tie in some form, even when they were older.” <p><p><p><p>Tie: The Gap. Earrings: The Gap. Sandals: vintage.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kendra Johnson
content: ['<p>Kendra Johnson is the co-founder of the New York Style and Design Museum, a brand-new exhibit featuring fashion icons, such as Lothar Frank and J. Crew. Kendra’s work is especially timely, since fashion and the creative process in general has improved considerably over the years. Kendra started it with a passion and a passion for craft, as well as an art project to show the world the ways she works —from designing to modeling to writing to working on books.<p><p>Here, Kendra shares her tips for styling, her favorites and what it takes to be chic on stage and offstage…<p><p><p><p><p>Shirt: Kendra’s. Boots: Madewell. Hat: Loeffler Randall. Shirt: Vintage Designer. Sandals: J. Crew. Watch: Kendra’s, similar. <p><p>“When I started working at the museum, I used to wear a lot of white sandals. It’s how I approached the museum for the first time in a long time. Now, I’m wearing a lot of pink, red and white sandals. There’s lots of pink on the outside, but the inside feels really chic and feminine. I’m trying to blend in the white tones, so it’s really flattering. Also, for a show, I try to wear an army green, which doesn’t look so nice. I put on vintage denim. I think it’s fun to look more relaxed on stage.”']

headline: Swinging
content: ['<p>I just took my first vacation! One morning, we stopped by the Ace Hotel to see the lovely family, and after a little brainstorming, we decided to sail to San Francisco for dinner with friends and play catch. It was such a wonderful way to spend an hour…<p><p><p><p><p>What was your favorite part of the trip?We had to stop at the Ace because we had to wait until 9:30pm. It was really relaxing, and the pool was still green and warm. The food was amazing, and the kids were really fun.<p><p>What’s your take on San Francisco vacations?The beaches are gorgeous, and they’re super small. I’m always curious to try some new places, and the Ace Hotel is my go-to when traveling the Bay Area.<p><p>P.S. What other trips are on this list, and the Bay Area’s best rental apartments.<p><p>(Photos by the Ace Hotel, courtesy of Sailing for New York and Alex)<p> ']

headline: Hair Tutorial
content: ['<p>I just got my hair tutorial from her, and I’m psyched to share it with you! She told me about the great hair tutorials, including the gorgeous Nail Polish that I just ordered…<p><p>And…<p><p>“I wear Nail Polish only if I have makeup. If I don’t, I’ll just brush my hair down the line. My boyfriend loves to do a deep dab with the Nail Polish brush, because he likes that it’s easy and easy to use.”<p><p>“I like to use my hair as a pillow. The Nail Polish’s shape makes it a bit more comfy for traveling. (For travel, go for the top, and I love to wear the Nail Polish top with socks.) I usually go for a low ponytail and then a sleeker, and then a sleeker and a sleeker shape for traveling.”<p><p>And my top tip is to just let your hair dry for as long as you can (in short pieces, like an inch or so). You want your hair to be super soft and curly, and I love this method for traveling.”<p><p>What do you think? Would you wear a Nail Polish?<p><p>P.S. More nail tutorials, and a funny, cute French bra.<p><p>(Photo by Lisa Larson-Walker)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Caroline Oltner
content: ['<p>Caroline Oltner lives in Chicago with her husband and two young sons. Caroline runs a hair salon, and she also happens to be a super sexy fashionista. “I want people to see my style in a way that’s sexy, and that’s what makes me happy.” Here, Caroline talks about how she moved from Brooklyn, her career style, and the best thing to wear in a short time…<p><p><p><p>What was your everyday look like before moving to Chicago?My family moved from Brooklyn to Chicago in 2009. I have great roots in the South, where my mom raised chickens and raised cows. I grew up on a farm in the South, and my father-in-law is from England, and my brother-in-law is from England. My grandfather was a farmer, so he grew up on an even keel of farmland. I went to boarding school at Emerson High School, and it was crazy, but when I was younger, I loved traveling. So, I was really into traveling as an American. It made me want to move back to the South, to the Midwest.<p><p><p>']

headline: Eiffel Tower Wedding
content: ['<p>A wedding in New York doesn’t need to be complicated. All you need to do is go out and buy a white dress and accessories, and you’re in good company.<p><p>The bride wore a black top, which made her look like a high-school girl with red lipstick and a loose ponytail.<p><p>The groom wore black silk top, which was perfect for a relaxed and casual wedding.<p><p>The bride wore bright-red blouses, which made her look like the bride from a Jane Fonda film.<p><p>The bride wore bright-red shoes and a low-cut necklace, which made her look like a young, black-and-blue woman with a tomboyish look.<p><p>The bride wore colorful dresses that looked like the bride from a classic 1980s TV series.<p><p>The bride wore a bright pink purse that looked like a little girl in an army uniform.<p><p>The bride wore a bright pink bow in red, which was really pretty.<p><p>The bride wore a colorful dress in black, which was really fun to wear to dinner.<p><p>The groom wore a pink dress in blue, which was really cool to wear to the reception.<p>']

headline: Toby and I have never had any sex, so we just had an awkward date in Sweden. Toby went to Sweden with two of our friends, and I went to the beach with her. The other night she accidentally invited Toby back on the date, and it was great to meet him. I always admired Toby. He is just such a sweet and kind person. Toby was wearing a T-shirt and jeans, and when we hung out together on the beach, he was all over them, especially when he made love to Toby. We joked on Instagram about how awesome this is, and she responded with this awesome photo of Toby on the beach and his cute boyfriend…And yes, that is actually how we met. I love the way she framed it…Toby and I never actually met, but I just saw the amazing photo, and I can’t stop laughing. Thank you so much, Toby! :) xoxo Toby and I are so psyched for you. xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo I just want to say thank you SO much, Toby and I, for having such a fabulous date in Sweden! xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo I would love to meet you here in the future. I always look forward to traveling and traveling with friends, so if you are in Stockholm or in any other European cities, please let us know! xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo xoxo x
10 Best Wedding Gifts
content: ['<p>My lovely readers, my sweet readers, how’s your wedding five-year anniversary? The day after my sister’s wedding last night, my brother and I arrived at the home of our dear aunt’s husband. He gave me a lovely surprise; our wedding was held in a small hotel. Our guest room had been rented for the past five years, so we were greeted by a cheerful receptionist, who greeted us by saying, “I just got married to my dear friend.” I thanked him, and he said hello to all of us. It was a beautiful night, was I right? This wedding was made up of two very special gifts: a beautiful, long-sleeved silk dress, and beautiful lace dresses. I wore the best wedding dress in the world, as my fiancee and I were planning to share this dress for everyone to see. As you might expect, my bride looked gorgeous! A very special, heartfelt thank you, my dear readers, for all of the wonderful comments and prayers, for all the love, joy and happiness I received. <p><p>For wedding rings, here’s what you need to know…<p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Nino Turok
content: ['<p>My beauty uniform: Nino Turok is a nutritionist and nutrition blogger with a knack for illuminating the world through photos, videos and essays. “I’m always curious about food, but then I realized that I was missing that part about nutrition.” Here, she shares her favorite tips for traveling the world with a baby, her new beauty line and the magic of a mascara…<p><p><p><p>What’s your skincare routine?I always use a facial cleanser to cleanse and smooth my face, but there are so many products I cannot live without. One product I’ve been using on the outside of my apartment is an Mascara Cleanser. “When I get to an oasis, it’s the moment when I start to feel rejuvenated and ready for what I’ll be looking forward to on vacation. My favorite moment is when I come across the green pillows with my makeup on them — it’s so easy to use. The pillows contain zinc oxide (that’s a chemical used in sunscreen and eye cream), which I love, and the anti-aging cream is amazing. You don’t have to do anything special to moisturize your face, but I always use the moisturizer and it gives me a bit of extra moisture.<p><p><p>']

headline: Have a great weekend!
content: ['<p>I just got back from a weeklong trip to Chicago. I can’t wait to share my photos with you! I’ve been secretly looking forward to meeting you all next weekend. Will you be there? Alex and I were on a boat in the Hudson Valley when we got these incredible photos of the skyline. They were taken in the 1940s and 1950s, but have since grown on my memories. :)<p><p>(Photos by The Sartorialist)<p> ']

headline: How to Get Away with Being Pretty
content: ['<p>The other day, my friend Jenny and I got home from our honeymoon and started brainstorming ways to take care of ourselves and our families, not to mention travel on vacations. So, I was inspired to post a little guide today…<p><p>1. Travel Alone. This is a pretty easy approach, but let’s face it, it’s almost comical to go anywhere in the world and feel a certain sort of badass. For example, this simple, almost nonchalant Instagram photo shows the first thing we see: A group of friends on a plane. We’ll spot them walking down the aisle and then stare intently as they pass…<p><p>…with a big smile on their faces. (And look at these adorable kids…)<p><p>2. Pretend you’re wearing the same top every day. Wouldn’t you love to wear this? Here’s how. Just imagine you’re heading to work at the same time every day. And you’re already dressed up, too, right?<p><p>3. Skip the stress. This is my favorite part. I’ve had a pretty regular, but not so pretty, life this year, but when you skip the stressful life stuff, you feel much more relaxed. (You might also notice that the girls’ faces are bigger. Yay!) (Bonus: When I get the chance, I just copy-pasted them on a tissue paper!)<p>']

headline: Wine Sale
content: ["<p>For some reason, everyone is having wine these days. I’m so thrilled about this new wine sale at the Wine Depot. (If you’re on the hunt for a fancy wine, head over to the links and watch the trailer.) We’ve been planning a date night (or dinner) for a while now, but I’m currently in a wine-booth mood and ready to get creative. Here are a few great spots:<p><p>Rosa La Riviera (formerly Madewell) is a boutique wine shop in central Paris. It’s a cozy, vintage wine cellar, and the owner—a true sommelier—is a real estate guy. He’s got a nice collection of old-fashioned wooden rosé bottles (like this one) and vintage bottles with the classic-ish names like Lassalle, Côte d'Amour, Pinot Noir. He also has a delicious mix of chocolaty and sherry. (His best recommendation is their porter, a French-style porter that really works well.)<p><p>Tote & Cheese is one of the best wine stores in Paris. It’s a charming wine boutique that sells up to 25 bottles (which can be divided into seven different wines), and also has great cheese sandwiches. The menu has great options for pasta, grilled meats and burgers. They also sell pretty bruschetta, wine sausages and bruschetta sandwich, which I love.<p><p>Porter"]

headline: Honeymoon Date

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Lola M.
content: ['<p>Lola M. lives with her husband and three-year-old son in Los Angeles. “I have a deep fear of heights, so I try to avoid heights while swimming,” she says. “I’m a big fan of meditation. I’m really good at focusing and remembering. I’m good at taking long walks, swimming and sitting in the sun.” She also wears natural makeup. Here, she shares what it feels like to wear a headscarf to work, her favorite perfume, her secret scent, and the trick for creating a pretty face…<p><p><p><p>Sweater: Madewell. Necklace: This Fall. Shoes: J. Crew. Tote: This Korean woman.<p><p>“I’ve been obsessed with wearing something colorful, like this necklace and this necklace and these necklaces and this necklace and these two necklaces and these two mittens and these two mittens and these two mittens and these two glasses. I’m like, ‘Let’s do something crazy with these, let’s do something cool with this, this. Let’s make it happen, let’s do something crazy with that.”<p><p><p><p>Eye shadow: Madewell. <p>']

headline: Bike Clothes
content: ['<p>One of our favorite things to wear is a bicycle helmet. And if you’re looking for a cute little bike seat to put your head around, these cotton bibs would be perfect for that.<p><p>P.S. More bike seat ideas, including this sexy one.<p> ']

headline: EmersonMade Wedding Dress
content: ['<p>EmersonMade is a wedding dress boutique with a mission: to make the best wedding dresses in the world. Their dress code is "a timeless French twist on a vintage Italian dress." They’re offering you three dresses for $195—a total of $250 in each. We asked them to share the perfect color scheme, their tips for getting the most out of a fabulous wedding, and how they managed to make it look like your wedding dress. (Here’s how to get the look, if you’d like.)<p><p>Here are five ideas: simple pleated bodice, floral, pleated bust, braid, bobby pins, bobby pins and a twist on a vintage vintage-inspired Italian dress.<p><p>Here’s the dress, which looks great with jeans, a blouse, a dress skirt, and any accessories you’d like to add. I love that the bobby pins are small and elegant; you could fit them around the neck or around the sleeves.<p><p>Here’s a fun one that looks awesome with jeans: a twist on a vintage-inspired Italian dress. You could also add an elastic around the waist (in the photos above), a twist in the bowstring, and a simple bobby pin with a twist on it.<p><p>Here’s the cutest one: a vintage-inspired vintage-inspired Italian dress with a twist on a classic classic-inspired Italian dress. This cutest version also feels pretty (and I love this braid).<p>']

headline: The Curious Case of a Child in Paris
content: ['<p>The Guardian reported last week that a 15-year-old girl had entered a Parisian hotel room wearing only shorts. The child, now 14, claimed she walked into the room wearing only sneakers and a turtleneck sweater. The child, who lives in Paris, is now 16 and has been staying in a house in Paris since the age of 6.<p><p>As for the bizarre incident, which happened in a room only inches from the front door, the source of the story said:<p><p>The teenager told the Guardian she had not been wearing a pair of trousers as she entered the room, which is on the third floor of the French hotel where the child was staying, but instead had two pairs of black shoes.<p><p>The child went into the bathroom, but the child and her parents ran out of the room, which was covered with glass.<p><p>The teen was taken to the hospital by his family, but later died from his injuries.<p><p>Meanwhile, the child has now moved to France and is currently staying with her older sister in a rented apartment near Paris.<p><p>A third child, aged 7, is in a stable at a local health center and will be admitted there in the coming weeks.<p><p>A third child, who lives in a more modest apartment with its own bathroom, is in a more stable with its parents.<p>']

headline: Wedding Cake
content: ['<p>When we first met our husband Alex, we had a crush on him. He would sneak onto our family vacations and show us his sweet and quirky personality. Now, we’re constantly asked by our guests, "Have you ever had any weddings that made you want to go to heaven?" We love weddings where we feel like we’re having our cake and eat it right. Here, we present: a wedding cake with flowers, roses, a ribbon and a cake for your wedding dress. Alex’s favorite is from a friend’s hometown.<p><p>Have you ever gotten married to a different person? What other wedding ideas do you have for your wedding?<p><p>P.S. How to make a wedding ring and wedding cake.<p> ']

headline: 10 Things I Like
content: ["<p>Since taking up a job as a reporter for CNN last summer, I’ve noticed the same patterns every time I try to interview a new female colleague. They don’t seem to work well or flow smoothly — maybe because they don’t want to be a part of the conversation. So, instead of focusing on the women I interview, I decided to focus on the men — and I hope you do too. I’d love to hear what you’re reading and watching today, if you’d like to hear.<p><p>Here are 10 things I like about interviewing new women: They\\'re confident, they’re smart, they\\'re friendly and they\\'re outgoing. They\\'ve the right attitude. They can be so charming and outgoing that it makes them feel like an authority figure.<p><p>Every time I interview someone, I try to ask the right question — what do they want to accomplish or do they want to accomplish? I ask for things like job titles, the best career advice and, most important, the most exciting career opportunity.<p><p>If I have an appointment that I don’t normally cover, I ask, if it\\'s a big deal or not, I can tell you how it would feel to be the first person I interviewed to do so.<p><p>I hope you enjoy these 10 things. :)<p><p>(Via The Big Lead)<p> "]

headline: Hairsplash: Alexa Taylor
content: ['<p>Alexa Taylor (aka “Blanket Black”) made my hair last fall! It was so beautiful and messy, and now that I’m older, I’ve finally gotten to experience it more. She’s the founder of Curb Your Face + Braid, and she’s also one of my New Year’s Eve staples! Here, she shares five favorite hair tutorials, the perfect bangs and five outfits she’d wear…<p><p><p><p>What was it like to grow up as a Pakistani-American in the U.S.?My parents migrated to India when I was eight and we were both in the military. At this point, I’ve learned the language well, so my parents knew Indian. Now I’m taught English and are very self-taught. My parents are very devout Muslims; they were very devout Muslims themselves until they moved to New York City. There are two things about my parents: They live in a small apartment in Chinatown; and their clothes and culture are deeply ingrained in my family.<p><p><p>']

headline: The Best Wedding Hair
content: ['<p>The other day, while riding my bike home from work, I saw this amazing bride-to-be, who looks gorgeous in a grey T-shirt and jeans. “I’m going to dress like her,” she told me. “If I had to do it, I would do that myself,” she added. “But there’s something amazing about her.”<p><p>Here’s the lovely bride-to-be, Kendra, and her beautiful groom, Paul. <p><p>P.S. Kendra’s new hair tutorials, and the best wedding hair products.<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Rachel P.
content: ['<p>Rachel P. is a graphic designer, writer and the founder of Crikey. Her work has appeared in over thirty major publications, including NYTimes, Vanity Fair, Forbes, Mashable, Wall Street Journal and Cosmopolitan. You can find her on Instagram and Snapchat. Her newest book, She Looks Pretty (Fall Out: The Next Wave of People Who Look Pretty on Instagram), is out September 21 by Amazon. Her beauty uniform is inspired by my own experiences and my own journey as an activist for women in New York City.<p> ']

headline: What do you wear to work?
content: ['<p>How adorable is this photo of a dude wearing a sweatshirt and T-shirt in London, right after work? Apparently, there’s a little girl on the right. xo<p><p>(Photo of Toby, from S.P.C.)<p> ']

headline: Cocoon
content: ['<p>Here’s how to get the perfect cork bobble:Step one:Put the cork on top of your head to create a collar (and the top part is the collarbone itself).Step two:Bend the bottom of the neck in your hair until you get a nice and pointed top part.Step three: Pin the top part of the cork around the top of your head to create a bow.Step four: Secure with rubber bands (I used a rubber band), and the bow should rest securely under your pillow.Step five:Once it’s all secure, you can wear it for a few minutes to rest. It’s a beautiful little sweater and I’d highly recommend it.<p><p>P.S. My friend Kendra’s cute ponytail (which she wore with red lipstick) and her sweet new phone book.<p> ']

headline: I Wanna Be a Singer in my Own Home
content: ['<p>On the night of October 16, 2012, Alex and I went to our local pizza parlor and bought a couple pizzas. Alex was excited about all the pizza we were going to get. He felt like he was going to be a star. We’d like to go to a gig somewhere in Manhattan with some friends. Here are a few excerpts from conversations he had with several of his friends…<p><p>How did you become into performing?I first learned about playing in college. At first I didn’t like it but then I started loving it. I went to a band called the New York Dolls who wrote music for a few years. I went to their show. After, they were amazing. I was like, this is my way out!<p><p>What is the role that you played in the song "How Did You Get Into Musical Art?" and how did it feel?I didn’t know. I didn’t know what it felt like to be a singer on an experimental stage in New York City. But when I discovered the New York Dolls, I realized that this is my way out.<p><p>How did you get the title?I started making my own records around the time I started going to gig events. And that’s when I got the idea of singing in my own apartment!<p>']

headline: Escape Plan: Paris
content: ['<p>We’ve been visiting Paris, the French capital, since April, and it’s still so fresh. So, on this escape plan, we’re staying in a converted cab! We’ll make our way up the Rue Des Leche Bains and then drive to a small museum. The museum has awesome old-school toys (like these cute little pajamas), but the staff loves to play with vintage cars, like this 1920’s car.<p><p><p><p><p><p>What do you like most about Paris? Would you recommend it to anyone? Would you like to stay there?<p><p>P.S. What do you like best about the city?<p><p>(Photos by Madewell)<p> ']

content: ['<p>I love you, mom, and I hope you have a wonderful week. What are your plans for the coming weeks? xoxo<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Elizabeth Taylor
content: ['<p>Elizabeth Taylor has such a strong sense of style, but it seems as though the fashion she wears these days has evolved. In an attempt to stay true to her signature style, Elizabeth wears lots of vintage clothes, including vintage dress shoes, vintage loafers, vintage jeans and, finally, a vintage necklace. Here, she shares five pretty outfits she wore in a week…<p><p><p><p>T-shirt: Madewell. Watch: Kiehl’s, similar. Jeans: similar. Sneakers: similar. <p><p>“I was introduced to fashion by my mother and her mom, and my mother was kind of a fashion savant. When my mother was pregnant, she and her husband went to California to get their honeymoon. Their son was born in November and was diagnosed with stage IV lung cancer five months later. As a result, he was diagnosed with stage IV lung cancer. He had to be moved from California to San Francisco to begin chemotherapy, which involved chemotherapy treatments and radiation. My mom always wore a striped T-shirt every day to her family. The other day, while driving to dinner, she gave me a photo of me on the backseat of my convertible, so I knew exactly where to look. My mom told me it’s a fun way to remind myself of my mother’s style.”<p><p><p><p>Cotton dress: vintage. Jeans: vintage. T-shirt: Madewell. Jeans: vintage.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Katie Dunn, Kiel, and Laura Beck, Host & Editor
content: ['<p>Lately, I’ve gotten more engaged with a hobby, so I was excited to see Katie Dunn on her show. Her beauty routine is easy, and it looks like she’s taking her baby into a world of beauty, not makeup. Here, she talks about her pet peeve, what she wears and what “gifts” are in stores for you, including her beloved pet peeve: <p><p>P.S. Katie’s five makeup picks…<p><p>(Photos by Caroline and Kendra)<p> ']

headline: 12 Thoughts on the Best Shoes for the Summer
content: ['<p>I love a good pair of jeans, but they have a few things on their plate that can be heavy or messy. But these striped pajamas look especially great with your winter outfits (and you want to wear them while you cook dinner in the winter!). Here are twelve fall trends that I’d recommend…<p><p><p><p>Aquamarine<p><p>“This fall, I’ve been thinking about how to take my dress to the next level. The colors are a little off—they’re striped, but I love the idea of “maternity days.” With two pairs of navy jeans (they’re from this super cute French lady!) and a long pair of chambray flats, I love the idea of taking something beautiful and making it into a dress. It’s almost like wearing a fancy coat.”<p><p><p><p>Lace<p><p>“I love a good pair of shoes that look comfortable but have enough detail that you can easily adjust your look without changing the look. I also love this $160 diamond pair, which I’ve always been obsessed with. I’ve worn them almost all winter, but they’re still very comfortable and not too heavy.”<p><p><p><p>Shirt<p>']
