headline: The One Where The Hellish Part Isn't Funny
content: ['<p>It’s been six months since Alex was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis, and now I’m finally catching up to his full-time gig as a journalist. It has felt like seven months since the death of a loved one. My family has been watching, and the grief feels like I just bought a new car. I’m still shocked to see how much people’ve been affected by the illness, which has left countless people with a body that has slowed down, and I’m excited to share my thoughts on what makes this possible…<p><p><p><p><p><p>In June, my friend and I celebrated his 25th birthday, and at last week’s Cinephilia, my hometown, I found myself chatting with people over the phone about how great Alex had been, how lucky he was to have gotten this far, and how he had found fame growing up in an environment with few restrictions on how he was able to express himself.<p><p>We asked people, including my friend Susan, what they would say about their daughter’s passing, and I received seven simple answers.<p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: 12 Things I Learned In This Summer
content: ['<p>When I was little, I would walk down the street wearing a T-shirt and jeans. Then I saw this photo of New York and started spotting women around town wearing these sweatshirts and T-shirts…<p><p>(Via The New York Times)<p> ']

headline: Sailing in France
content: ['<p>One evening in Paris, I was wandering around the city with my family when suddenly, I saw this photo. It’s from the beautiful French photographer Henri-Eric Sartre. The beautiful woman’s husband was watching a live stream of his wedding on his computer.<p><p>I immediately jumped at the chance to capture her life in such a stunning fashion. Beautiful. And now I’m loving this photo…<p><p><p>…or this one, which I still adore.<p><p>P.S. My wedding dress and the world’s biggest hair loss.<p> ']

headline: An Easy Twist to Start Your Spring Dressing Up
content: ['<p>When I was little, I would go to the ballet class at the Brooklyn Ballet and play with the ballet dancers. They would sit on the floor with their arms crossed, and they would swing their arms out to the right or left. You would sit on the platform with a cane, and your legs would lie flat on the floor. I loved ballet, so I was thrilled when they made me pretend to walk around in the park while I was doing that.<p><p><p><p>I had never seen anyone doing this before, but when I saw it, I really wanted to try it. There are many tutorials online for ballet dancers, and one of my favorites is the “Falling Flat: A Week of Barefoot Performance” from Madewell.<p><p>Do you wear ballet flats? Any recommendations? Any tips?<p><p>P.S. How to teach ballet, and the 10 things I wear on my feet all the time.<p><p>(Photos by Jackie Sharp, Grace Boyd, Jenny Miller, and Ashley Dore. Via The Sartorialist)<p> ']

headline: Vacation Photos: Jamaica
content: ['<p>My aunt and I recently went on a beautiful vacation in Jamaica. It was such an emotional, romantic, magical time. Our daughter is seven now (and we still have her), and we talked to her about all the things she loves about life in Jamaica. Here are a few stories…<p><p><p><p><p>Jamaica is an incredibly cold, snowy and rocky island, where there’s no electricity, only a small lighthouse. So, we stayed on a small boat and slept in a little sauna and wood fire. Our daughter was born on January 21, 1987. She was born at the Jamaica’s first annual celebration of children’s activities, called “A Little Island for Kids” (her mother died at the age of nine).<p><p>The first few weeks, my aunt and I spent a lot of time outside on the ocean, hanging out with a little shrimp and oysters, exploring the nearby bay and the beach.<p><p><p><p><p><p>In the early hours of the morning, as the sun rose, we stayed in the hotel room and played a little game.<p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Kendra Smoot
content: ['<p> Kendra Smoot, a fashion writer, and I are excited to share our beauty uniform, Kendra Smoot. Her story is so inspiring, and it’s fun to watch her work with these gorgeous photographers. We’re sharing it here because Kendra has something so inspiring to share:) <p><p><p><p>Have you ever worn a bra or a veil?<p><p>What do you like about wearing something that’s both casual and sexy? I’m not into that. It’s like wearing a dress with a ponytail. I wear it with a big head, and the ponytail is the best accessory, I think.<p><p><p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Jessica Williams
content: ['<p>Jessi Williams lives in the beautiful neighborhood of West Los Angeles with her husband, James, and their beautiful twin sister, who is seven. She makes clothes, paints flowers and hosts her own nail parlors. “It’s really nice to be around people who can do so much,” she says. Here, Jessica shares her favorite nighttime routines, how to stay hydrated, and her favorite skincare product…<p><p><p><p>Blush<p><p>After high school, Jessi started experimenting with different ways to feel light — especially during the day. “I’m always trying to lighten up and get a little bit of color,” she says. “But now, I’m very light,” she says. “I can feel a little bit like I have a brighter side… I don’t feel like my bright side. I get my glow from a bit of water in my face, and I like that the color stays that way and doesn’t become overpowering.”<p><p><p><p>Mascara<p><p><p>Thoughts? Which would you choose? :)<p><p>P.S. This morning’s Top 10 Things I Like, Do or Don’t. <p>']

headline: Sneak peek at New York skyline
content: ['<p>The New York skyline looks pretty for the weekend. Wouldn’t you love to stay at a fancy hotel and have lunch with friends?<p><p>P.S. My mom recently got a red cardigan.<p><p>(Photos by The Sartorialist and Gothamist)<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Courtney Lee
content: ['<p>Courtney Lee is a transgender beauty brand in New York City. “My mom grew up as a closeted trans woman, and I am so grateful for her support,” she said in an interview with HipHopDX. “I can’t wait to start my career as a woman in fashion.” Courtney is the founder of Bags & Brics, a fashion brand with a mission to empower people to be themselves in a trans-inclusive fashion environment. <p><p>She’s also one of the most outspoken advocates for transgender and gender nonconforming youth in the industry, raising awareness of the importance of gender-affirming clothing for all. <p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Erica
content: ['<p>Erica has worked as a marketing director for a beauty brand, and we talked to her about her love of beauty products, and what it was like to run a beauty campaign in New York…<p><p>…and how to do it right…<p><p><p><p>Where do you spend your time on beauty products?I start my day with my dermatologist, but he often goes to see my friend Erin, who is a beauty writer for the New York Times. I’ve been wearing Clinique Everlane Nude Oil every day for six months.<p><p><p><p><p>What do you do for the day?I shower in the morning, and then head up to my friend’s apartment and go into her room. I use the lavender light-emitting diaphragm concealer on my cheekbones, then pull the gel off my cheekbones. Then I wear NARS MAC Pure Matte Lip Color, which is incredibly pigmented. If you’re looking for a light lipstick, I’ll try Alpha Nude. I also use the Everlane Nude Light Luminizer, which doesn’t irritate my skin, and it gives my lips a very matte finish.<p><p><p><p>']

headline: Midi Dance
content: ['<p>Midi dance is basically this pretty dance with a skirt. The boys wear red lipstick, and the girls wear navy lipstick. Would you wear one?<p><p>(Via Smitten)<p> ']

headline: Do or Don’t: Hair Tutorials
content: ['<p>Everlane has a cute little video about hair tutorials. I’m trying out four different hair types, but it’s just one video, and I’m really looking forward to trying them all out. Wouldn’t you love to try them all out?<p><p>P.S. Hair tutorials in 10 minutes.<p> ']

headline: A New Look at New York City
content: ['<p>What do you think? What do you love about New York?<p><p>P.S. My favorite New York street style.<p><p>(Top photo by The Sartorialist)<p> ']

headline: 12 Fall Skincare Products for the Fall
content: ['<p>Fall is officially around, but I’m excited to share 12 things I’ve been spotting in beauty stores lately…<p><p><p>1. Creamy eyeliner. My favorite is Lola Brow Cream, which is light, natural, and has SPF 40. You get a light glow when you apply it, and it instantly absorbs and rots without any residue. I love the color, and I’d highly recommend it if you’re looking for a light, fally look.<p><p>2. Nourishing lipstick. Nourishing lipstick is everywhere these days, especially the bright colors. My go-to is Smitten Nail Polish, which is incredibly soft and silky, but has SPF 30. Nourishing lipstick can be applied quickly and easily with one hand, and you never have to worry about frizz, creases or blisters.<p><p>3. A natural mascara. One of my all-time favorite brands is Glossier Madewell and, for those without mascaras, these two are the best. (The $9 version is perfect for spring.) You get a nice, dark shade, which you apply right out the tube. It gives a little glow without any flakes or dead volume. The downside is that your eyes often won’t dry out properly, and this one is a little more expensive.<p>']

headline: Sci-Fi: A Musical Vacation With My Mom
content: ['<p>We had an awesome summer, but we also realized that we’re not always quite on that same boat. We’re living in a different city, and after two years in Austin, we’ve finally figured out how to travel without feeling like we’re living in the same place. Toby and I were psyched to discover his little group Traveling Fantasy, which celebrates magical places in America, the world and everything in between. So, today, we’re sharing a short two-day musical tour, followed by five episodes in English on Saturday nights…<p><p>…with Toby’s mom and sister. “I’ve tried to understand that Toby’s mom is my grandmother and sister, and my mom is my mom’s cousin. But for Toby, it is not so much about his mom, but his cousin, my grandma’s cousin.” <p><p><p><p>“My mom does everything, even my sister,” Toby explains. “My mother’s spirit is still in the music, though, and when she takes care of it, it’s a bit more subdued. She’s not really into the musical theater, but she does have a sense of humor with the music, and it’s so true to my mother’s music.”<p><p><p>']

headline: Hip hop duo, Zedd
content: ['<p>Last night, we saw the new Hip Hop duo Zedd and Beck, and Alex and I took a quick walk around San Francisco (we had to take a detour to a nearby museum). (We also had to get a tour guide to bring photos, and a photo album of all the guests.) Alex and I stopped by the iconic Ace Hotel in Prospect Park for this beer garden tour, which was amazing to walk through, and the guys talked about rap, the way they feel inspired in each song.<p><p>Thoughts? xoxo<p><p>P.S. A very good conversation with HipHop.<p> ']

headline: I Love This Sneakers
content: ['<p>A few months ago, when Alex and I were walking into the restaurant, Alex picked me up at the register and told me that my $30 pair would be gone within a few weeks! So I immediately went for it. The colors are adorable, and the shoes are super flattering. Wouldn’t you love to wear them to a dinner date this summer?<p><p>(Photo by Stella McCartney.)<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Laura James
content: ['<p>Laura James is a social media director for the New York Times. She loves taking photos of people’s faces while they’re around town. “I know how difficult it can be to get to know people when there’s no one around to see you and not know what’s going on,” she says. Here, she shares the beauty trick she taught herself, the secret to being super self-conscious, and how she changed her looks…<p><p><p><p>Lipstick: What are your daily skincare tips?I try to stay clean, but then I brush my teeth in the morning. My teeth smell terrible. I wash my hands with clean soap and water. My routine is moisturizing, no chemicals, no chemicals, just natural ingredients. I’m not anti-aging. I use vitamin C. I use a brand called “Allure.” It has amazing moisturizing properties. I use it a million times. It’s a natural moisturizer, and then I try more and more moisturizers. I also love coconut oil, which is my favorite oil — even more so than coconut oil. I think it’s amazing. I wash my face twice a day and then apply the coconut oil to my teeth. It really removes the oils, and the coconut oil really is the best.<p><p><p>']

headline: Moe
content: ['<p>My friend Caroline (now my petite daughter) says “Moe loves to sing.” Well, I did! But instead of trying to dance with her (who can forget her beautiful lip?), Caroline decided to ask…What?! She did!  “I went to a flea market and found a great vintage Moe sweater,” Caroline says. “I am like, ‘Oh, that looks pretty!’ She also says she wants to wear it every night to celebrate her daughter’s birthday. “I want to take a moment to thank everyone who gave generously for this amazing sweater!” So here we are, five years later, and Caroline and I are officially the happiest couple ever!<p> ']

headline: The End of the Street Trip
content: ['<p>So, in the end, I’d rather have a world where I just take a walk around the corner and hang out with my friends… but in the meantime, here’s another cool thing to do, if you’d like:<p><p><p><p>A street-style café (pictured above) with art, music, and snacks. We’re going to visit family in New York and meet friends and go out to eat food for the week.<p><p><p><p><p>A cafe tucked into a stone’s throw off the street.<p><p><p><p><p>A street-style cafe where you can stop by any time for delicious food (as well as a few delicious snacks, like this chicken noodle pizza with sweet chutney sauce).<p><p><p><p><p>A sidewalk café (above), where you can order everything from breakfast to desserts.<p><p><p><p><p>A small street-style cafe, where you can shop for a house-made cup of coffee (and sometimes go for an easy walk along the beach and hang out with your friends).<p><p>']

headline: How to Do a Wedding Dress
content: ['<p>We’ve talked about how to dress like a French girl, but I wanted to share the trick I learned over the years…<p><p>First, let’s talk about how to look like a French girl.<p><p>For the past five years, I’ve always been the person whose clothes are traditionally feminine — usually dresses and shorts, plus a bit of dresses or tops. But then I started to wear heels — and heels were hard to find. Now I’m experimenting with different styles — which are below. <p><p>So, I decided to try my best to create a style that I thought would look feminine. Here are a few ideas: 1. Sleeveless shoe. <p><p><p>2. One of those shoes you always see in a wedding dress. It’s so romantic and chic. (Even the bride’s shoes are vintage.) And for the front of the bride’s dress, I also chose a vintage silhouette. The vintage silhouette looks more chic than the vintage silhouette, but you can wear it just like a white dress, if you’d like. 3. A classic wedding dress. <p><p><p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Allison Hodge
content: ['<p>A few weeks ago, I went to a weekend retreat for women entrepreneurs and designers, and I wanted to look pretty. How would you describe your look? I’ve always loved the low-heels, cropped jeans and tight tank tops I wore in the 70s and 80s. But I realized a week ago that even with those details, my looks are still what make me special — a mix of feminine and tomboyish. Here are some cool outfits I’ve worn for a week…<p><p><p><p>Sweater: J. Crew, similar. Booties: Bensimon, similar. <p><p>“I grew up in San Francisco, and it was just amazing. When I moved to New York in 1982, I wanted to go somewhere where I could be a little less intimidating to people. There’s no excuse not to wear a sweater, and if you look cool, you’re pretty much in line. I have a funny take on women’s silhouettes: the women in their 40s wore a lot of skirts, and now they’re wearing jeans and tights. I’m a huge fan of Urban Outfitters’ style (there’s so much going on here), but I also really like the fact that I can be feminine and fit in with the rest of my community.”<p><p><p><p><p>Top: Dora, similar. Dress: Target. Bag: similar. Earrings: Nordstrom.']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Lela K.
content: ['<p>Lela K. is a psychology professor at UMass Amherst. As a female student, she created a series of articles for the Sartorialist, where she has curated the first ever issue of Anthropologie — an annual magazine dedicated to exploring everyday beauty. “My style is more like my partner’s,” she says. “Since we are both trans women, I feel more empowered when I’m wearing an outfit that I think is appropriate for both men and women — a pair of jeans or a sweater.” Here, she shares five outfits she wore in a week…<p><p><p><p>Denim Turtleneck: Target — $14.50, similar here. Silk jeans, black flats, and dark tank tops — similar here. “I really like wearing low pants because they give me the most visibility into my body,” says Lela. “My clothes are tailored for me, and I can wear jeans for work, and a black tee for work.”<p><p><p><p>Denim Top: Gap — similar here. Vintage vintage shirts, hoodies and high tops from Gap. <p><p><p><p>Polka Dot Turtleneck: Gap — similar here. Jeans, similar here. Vintage jeans with high waisted dresses — similar here. Vintage sweaters and pants from Gap. <p><p><p>']

headline: 10 Best Restaurants in Paris
content: ['<p>It seems like such a cliché to describe Paris as such, but a recent report on Glamour suggests it’s even better than it seems. The French magazine wrote that 10 of the world’s best restaurants (including Italy, Spain, the United States, Australia) are located in Paris, and it’s truly impressive. (The site Tripwire visited three of these restaurants in Paris. Here are the results…)<p><p>(Top photo by The Sartorialist)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Mary Lande
content: ['<p>Mary Lande has taken her photography hobby to a whole new level, and her looks always feel so authentic and sexy. Here are five looks she wore in a week…<p><p><p><p>Dress: Zara, similar. Jeans: Urban Outfitters. Shoes: Madewell.<p><p>“My style has always been my walk-on boyfriend, and at the beginning of the month I was into a grey jumpsuit and a white tee — I was like, wow, whoa! My whole outfit has to fit in that space of being me. That feeling of being in the shoes of someone who has lived for more than 15 years has been a constant for me. I’m already in the shoes of someone who I grew up with, who doesn’t wear much.”<p><p><p><p>Wrap: Uniqlo, similar. Sunglasses: Vintage Trends. Shoes: Madewell.<p><p>“My dad taught me about the importance of style in my parents’ lives, and I’ve always been drawn to the things he wore in life, whether it be his style icons, icons of all colors, or iconographic references. He is one of my favorite artists in New York City, and my favorite art critic. I also have the most amazing mom and dad in town, so I get the same compliments when my mom comes over.”<p><p>']

headline: Diane, the mother of four, left a trail of blood on a New York sidewalk in her wake in an effort to find her daughter. (A few hours later, the New York Post revealed that Diane was the last of a long line of women she met at a thrift store.) A few months ago, she wrote a post about a trail of blood in her daughter. Here, she shares some tips for getting through the streets and making a phone call, along with the terrifying consequences of not having enough money to live in Paris, and her new book… “Once I found the phone number, I realized I wasn <BOS>  to call the police. That means that, if I call the police, I can call the French police.” Here, Diane shares three steps, including the weird, beautiful trick of a phone interview…   “Once you find the phone number, I realized I wasn’t the only one that was looking at my daughter’s story. I was the other woman I talked to on the phone who didn’t even have a voicemail.”  “The other woman I talked to on the phone who doesn’t even know that I call the police, doesn’t even have a voicemail.” “I actually saw on my phone the woman on the other end of the phone who doesn’t even have her phone number. She was actually at the grocery, and was like, ‘Mommy, what the hell is going on?’ and she was like, ‘Mommy, the whole thing is weird.’ The woman was like, ‘You mean you’re like, your daughter is in a hotel room with your husband? She’s talking to you. She knows what it feels like to have someone speak to you. She’s calm and caring. You don’t hear anything that she sa
Porterland Totes
content: ['<p>Totes are pretty much everywhere in the world, but Porterland recently got a little weird (and hilarious) about them. Here’s how they do it…<p><p>1. Pin one of each length to each of the three pockets.2. Pin two buttons at the top so you can push the right button (the red button is for left button) and the middle button (the green button is for right button).3. Secure the bottom with some zip to prevent the zipper from sticking.4. Pin the three buttons together to form a small loop that fits in the center.<p><p>The zipper will pop loose when you twist the top bun.<p><p>Here’s how to do it:<p><p>1. Put a hair dryer over the top bun, and then pat with your fingers to get a smooth braid.2. Gently pull each small loop down on the top bun so it looks like you’re making a few smaller ones.3. Secure and pin with the zip.4. Push the bottom bun up a few inches.5. Secure the top and sides and loop along the bottom and inside of the bun.6. Pin the bottom bun with the zip so it hangs down from the top.<p><p>The bottom bun will stay free of any excess bun.<p><p>This will make it super easy for any date (especially if it’s a short one!).<p>']

headline: Sneaky Hair
content: ['<p>When I first moved to the UK, I was terrified of hair tutorials. They felt like a slap in the face. But when I went online, I spotted tutorials for hair products that actually worked for my needs.<p><p>For the past year, we’ve been sharing videos of hair tutorials — with help from my wonderful friends, our editors and readers. “For example, Alex and I have long curly hair and want to do some curls today, but Toby and I are so far apart that we’re having trouble fitting in a couple inches,” says Jamie Beck. “Luckily, the hair tutorial app, Reave, works exactly as expected,” says Alex. “It’s super simple,” says Jamie. “It’s my go-to for hair tutorials.”<p><p>How amazing are these hair products? Are there any other hair products you’d recommend for a grown-up woman?<p><p>P.S. I also have an online hair service called Reave. It’s free, and you never have to spend the money.<p><p>(Photo by Jamie Beck for Jenny Miller)<p> ']

headline: A Trick for Creating Perfect Hair
content: ['<p>One of my hair tutorials was in my early 50s when I was 16 and a hair stylist friend suggested using hair dryer or a sponge, which makes it easy to dry hair out more quickly. This past fall, I’ve been experimenting with a few things, like creating beautiful blondes, applying a gloss, and creating hair with a little bit of air. Here are seven easy steps, which I hope you love…<p><p>1. Find the perfect length of your hair, with the exception of the middle section and back (above).<p><p>2. To create the volume of hair, divide your hair into two equal sections and pull it into one. It’s easy to create the volume of hair by mixing a tiny bit of volume with the rest of your hair, but if you have thicker hair or thicker hair, mixing in the volume of volume of the roots will create volume.<p><p>3. Finally, create the front portion of your hair, and pin in place by pinching it tight (between the two pieces).<p><p>4. Use your fingers to push down on the top of the roots, and you’re done!<p><p>5. Make sure to fold the ends of the curls so that they come out straight out from the roots.<p><p>6. When you’re done, pull your hair through the top of the curls (the center will get a little wavy at the roots), and you’re done!']

headline: City Guide: L.A.
content: ['<p>This is L.A. We live in an apartment complex, but we don’t usually blog about it, so we wanted to share our daily commute adventures. Here’s our morning commute and why we LOVE LA.<p><p>1. Pick the right place. (I’m in love with San Francisco!)2. Eat the best restaurants.3. Start off slow in Times Square, which can be fun, if you can find a spot close by.4. Don’t forget to check out the new Art Museum.5. Go to L.A. landmarks to find restaurants, shops and neighborhood gems.6. Go hiking to Echo Park, which is spectacular.7. Find a quiet spot in Echo Park and head for the water.8. Play catch-up with friends in the car.9. Go for a romantic meal at the Oyster Bar on Sunset Boulevard.10. Have a romantic date in Sunset Village with all the food, wine and cocktails from around town.11. Go for a walk on the pier and hang out on the beach with the locals. (Here’s our favorite.)12. Pick your favorite restaurant and bar.13. Go on vacation with friends.14. Play catch up with friends on Facebook.15. Go shopping with friends.16. Take a short bike ride.<p><p>5. Watch movies on Google+ Hangout. (I like these movies from the 90s, or watch them from the 70s:)<p>']

headline: Diane von Furstenberg and Her Own Comedian
content: ['<p>I’m excited to share Diane von Furstenberg and her own musical, which starts tonight. “It’s “A Dance of Joy,” a collaboration between the artists and the music industry that has grown up around her work. “She has a very intimate way of bringing people together. I am thrilled to be able to collaborate with her on something that’s fun for both parties. “It is such a beautiful story that would resonate with anyone with a sensitive mind,” says the artist, who now lives and works in California with her husband, Anthony. Here, Diane shares her tips for traveling with a baby, and the joy she felt when she discovered the dance in her 20s…<p><p><p><p>What was it like growing up in Los Angeles?Growing up in the 1950s and 1960s, I was completely on a par with everyone I knew. It was really hard to be what you are in those days, but I got into the rhythm and the sound of that time. Now that I’m 35, I have to deal with a whole lot of pressure and stuff like that.<p><p><p><p>How did you learn to dance?I started learning about ballet when I was in my early 20s. It was a totally different time to live in New York; I moved here with my mom when I was in college — it was kind of a rollercoaster ride but it was very exciting. At the same time, I felt like I was in a completely different place.<p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Christine Barrett
content: ['<p> Christine Barrett is a photographer and founder of beauty platform Dossier, a site devoted to exploring the beauty of everyday things. “I don’t always see myself as pretty,” she says, “but I always see myself as beautiful.” Here, Christine shares her favorite pieces…<p><p><p><p>What’s your daily skincare routine?When I was younger, I used to get tons of sun, just because! Now I have skin with sunscreens in my skin, and that’s when I find myself needing a little help. Now I’ve discovered a pretty light foundation. When I’m younger, I would use a light blush and get the hint of rosewater, but it’s kind of hard to find something that is that light, so I’ve tried lots of blush colors (NARS, Coral and Pore. I love Pore and Coral). It’s easier to apply foundation, I’ll add on some powder and make sure to wash it off. <p><p>What do you wear on trips?Travel has been such a fun adventure. I’ve been to Mexico, Venice, Paris and Rome. I’ve always felt like my own person — a little bit of myself was always there, so sometimes I feel like I’m really good. Traveling with kids can feel like that — it’s all so fun and full of surprises. <p><p><p>']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Ana Matuño
content: ['<p>Apostle dermatologist Ana Matuño is the creator of a line of makeup that makes me laugh out loud. She’s also the author of the “Bright Glow” blog, and a frequent speaker at the American Academy of Dermatology annual meeting. Here, Ana shares five great skincare tricks…<p><p><p><p><p>For acne: “It’s not easy to deal with acne,” says Ana. “Most people don’t realize that if you put the right amount of oil into a lot of areas, it’s going to make them harder to see,” she says. “It’s a very sensitive spot and it can lead to inflammation, so the best thing to do is to use natural products to lower it.”<p><p><p><p><p>What are your favorites for acne?I’ve used various brands in the past, and here are five that stood out. My favorite is NARS ’s Hydrogel. You get a thick creamy finish with a mild moisturizing effect, and you’ll feel like you’ve actually made it!”<p><p><p><p>']

headline: How to Be More Than A Child, Too.
content: ['<p>I was secretly hoping to become a mom this fall, but I recently discovered this fascinating little piece of advice…<p><p>How to be more than a child. <p><p>1. Do you have a toddlerhood style? I’m still surprised by how pretty this piece of advice looks. It’s true that we tend to take the time to learn our own stuff (parents tend to be nicer and more responsible), but if our babies are too little to handle, we don’t do the same. It’s harder to have a clear understanding of what we want them to be doing when we’re with them, and less fun to see how they’re doing and reacting to each other’s attention.<p><p>2. You’ll never know what the next step is. You’ll never know what to do. You’ll never know when you’re going to reach a point where you’ll be comfortable with what you’re doing. <p><p>3. The more you realize that the baby is your main goal, the more easily you can achieve that goal. It’s a matter of letting your child know that you want them to know that they can choose what they want, that you want them to do it, and that you think they can do it.<p>']

headline: 'Narcissism: The Hidden Bones of America\'
content: ['<p>The New York Times recently ran a feature on the lives of a few black women in New York City. The story called upon the novelist Mary Elizabeth Kendzior, whose most recent novel, The Girl on the Train, tells the story of a black man who falls ill, a woman who visits him every day and the father of his teenage daughter who has an unspoken fear that she can never bear the sight of him again.<p><p>So, it goes with everything.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Kiki Mccartney
content: ['<p>Kiki Mccartney is a creative director at Sainsbury. “I work in New York as a sales manager with New York based J. Crew and I love to change things up,” she says. “And I just went to Chicago and I really liked the new vibe, but it’s still very different to me. I grew up in Michigan and my dad grew up here, but it’s so small and beautiful, and you have to try hard to be good at it!” Here, she shares five outfits she wore to work, her favorite fall color and five outfits she wears every day…<p><p><p><p>Socks: I’m into pretty dresses and heels, but these have got me raves. They’re super flattering and stretchy. (I also like them with a little twist. Their suede heels and the wide collar make them comfy when you’re working with a heavy duty suit.)<p><p><p><p>Dress: Vintage by Sainsbury. Skirt: Nordstrom. Tank: Gap. Scarf: vintage, similar. Shoes: This Girl.<p><p>P.S. K-beautiful nails, and her weird obsession with earrings.<p><p>(Photos by Christine Han for Hellen Kelly. Styling by Kendra J. for Hellen Kelly. This post is sponsored by Nordstrom, a brand we love and adored.)<p> ']

headline: A Secret Trick for Getting Your Wedding Dress From the Barn
content: ['<p>You’ll never guess the perfect gown for a date, but these DIY tutorials will make sure you get the right fit.<p><p>1. Twist a small piece of wool fabric into a “curved” section. (This will make it easy to see the center of the dress.)<p><p>2. Bend the wool fabric into a “hole” on the back of the dress,” which will fit comfortably in the front.<p><p>3. Tie the corner of the hole with a little “stretchy” fabric, so that the hole gets wider.<p><p>4. Twist the “curved” fabric with one end of the “curved” fabric, so the other end is closest to the “curved” section. The end of the fabric will become thicker and more secure, so you won’t have to worry about slipping the fabric off of your body. <p><p>5. Bend the wool fabric outward so it runs through your legs (and you don’t have to twist it to the opposite direction).<p><p>6. Twist the fabric once more and secure with another “curved” fabric.<p><p>7. Twist the fabric a second time, so you don’t have to twist it to the opposite direction, as before.<p>']

headline: How to Make a Smock in the Bathtub
content: ['<p>My sister is one of those sweet people, but I’m never one of them. I’m so shy and awkward, and you never see me at all when you’re bathing. So, when I heard my friend Elizabeth put a pillow-duster to a sink, my jaw dropped. The trick is to make a small hole in the sink to fill with water (or use one of the many different flotation devices on the market today).<p><p>I love flotation devices because they’re tiny and easy to do, especially when you’re bathing in the middle of the night. You’re wearing a bathing suit with a rubber band around the handle, which prevents any air from escaping. The rubber bands can be dipped in the water and secured with plastic wrap around the end of your towel.<p><p>How about this…<p><p>First, put the plastic wrap around the end of the towel to prevent air from escaping, and then wrap a rubber band around the end of the towel to secure it with plastic wrap around the end of the towel. You can also wear a towel liner, which gives you a pretty high-waisted effect — it’s much like a liner.<p><p>After you put the towel liner on, you can spray it on with a damp towel or any other wet towel and put it in the sink to dry. The towel will dry out quickly, but be soft enough that you can put it in your bathrobe before you shower.<p>']

headline: How to Get a Perfect Lipstick
content: ['<p>Every now and again, I get an email asking for a sample lipstick, but I have to admit, I was always pretty bummed about my deadline deadline. So, I made a little effort to find a lipstick that would make my day, and I found The Smog Lipstick Challenge. And, oh, my goodness, it worked.<p><p>Here are six amazing pieces, if you’d like to try them out…<p><p><p>1. Red Maxi. For years, this would have been my go-to lipstick — it was the only lipstick that kept popping up on my lips. It looked gorgeous and creamy. The packaging was a nice touch, since the base was translucent and lightweight (like a lipstick would be). Now that it’s on sale on Sephora, I’ve gotten compliments online and they say they like the lipstick in the most flattering way.<p><p><p><p>2. Matte Lipstick. This matte lipstick feels good on your lips but has a very matte finish. I love the color and it makes you feel like you just stepped out of the sun. I never once thought I’d go through a day wearing it because it feels so natural. This lipstick is also great for fall, as you can put it on in the fall without feeling like you’re going anywhere. And if you’re wearing a dark coat, I always leave it on for three to five days.<p><p><p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Nicole Toretto
content: ['<p>Nicole Toretto is an award-winning author and speaker of diverse culture, including “The People vs. the Beautiful: Race and the Changing Face of the United States,” the book she co-wrote with her husband, Bill Toretto. “I just wanted to say thank you to everybody who has written, written and spoke about this book,” she says. “I just want to say I’m very proud of the work of Nicole and Bill for this book.” Here, Nicole shares her favorite outfit, her go-to for traveling, and a look she wore while traveling…<p><p><p><p>Pajamas: My mom gave up running to pursue this career in New York when she found this one, and she is obsessed with them. She runs a café with cute babies. She also loves the simple style of her shoes, and her work takes such an immediate, visceral quality. This outfit is made for traveling. I love when she’s in a café and wears this kind of style. I love when she’s in a bookstore wearing this, too.<p><p><p>']

headline: The Best of LONDON
content: ['<p>Have you been to London lately? The city is always amazing, but the best things about London are the cool people. headline: Lipstick Lifting Powder
content: ['<p>I’ve been a librarian for 25 years (and my favorite is this), but finally discovered Lipstick Lifting Powder. And I LOVE it…<p><p>It’s just $18 a tube and comes in five colors (red, yellow, yellow). It really makes you feel the glow of the sun — it makes you feel so much better — and it smells amazing. For a teeny little bit, I put it on my lips for a little bit, then put it on myself in a neutral-tinted lip color. I always look sexy — in a bright red lipstick with a smoky red undertones and a light pink undertones. (A neutral lip color with a matte undertones would be gorgeous! Wouldn’t it make a lovely spring change? Or would you prefer a slightly lighter one?)<p><p>What are your daytime skincare routine? <p><p>P.S. My favorite natural hair color and a good skincare routine.<p> ']

headline: EmersonMade Sunglasses
content: ['<p>How cool are these Emersonmade Sunglasses by EmersonMade? My friend Claire, who lives with them, is like, “Oh my goodness, it’s so sexy,” and they instantly make you want to fly to Paris, or a party in Sweden. Plus, they come with a very handy “check out” button! I’d love to wear them all the time.<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Jennifer Hudson
content: ['<p>My friend Jennifer Hudson is one of the funniest, funniest people I know. She’s the author of such hits as The Art of Love, and is one of my favorite people to follow on Instagram. “It’s so simple,” she says. “You just put on makeup and everything.” Here, she talks about her favorite makeup tip, a look to look like a grown-up (don’t skip this one!), her beauty trick…<p><p><p><p>Puff eye shadow. My favorite way to look at it is by staring into your mirror, with one eye open. I like to look like a young woman, so I use an eyeliner.<p><p><p><p>Eye shadow. Another thing I like about makeup is that it’s pretty easy to change your look. The trick for me is to keep your eyes relaxed and open for as long as possible. I’m currently using a concealer — my mom’s favorite brand — and then I rub a little dab of foundation over my eyes with my finger. It gives a nice little shimmer.<p><p><p><p>Midi eyebrow pencil. My friend Emily has a genius idea: When you put the pencil on your eyebrows, it instantly turns your brows grey, which is one of the prettiest things I’ve ever seen on anyone. <p><p><p>']

headline: Hands-On: My Beauty Uniform
content: ['<p>After a week of wearing T-shirts and jeans, I found a new beauty uniform. It’s such a fun look, and it’s refreshing to have a fun look. I recently went out to dinner with my husband and we were on our way to New York City for a week, when my friend Caroline sent me this adorable photo of her. “I wear heels all the time.” She told me. “It looks like a vintage 1920’s-style shoe.” Here’s the look she chose, along with a few of her favorites…<p><p><p><p><p>My friend Caroline used to wear lots of Spanx, but this one is similar! It’s super casual and doesn’t look too heavy.<p><p><p><p>I wore a T-shirt with jeans because I love it, and these black turtleneck and green sneakers would do the trick. I also love that they’re slim. I think it’s not as comfortable as a traditional T-shirt, but it works.<p><p><p><p>My friend Kendra wore these bright pink shoes. Kendra’s sneakers are super flattering, even on tomboy style. These are similar to this tee and I love the details.<p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: The Perfect Sleeve Tote
content: ['<p>I love the Sleeve Tote. I’m like, how do you do this? It looks amazing on women, and I’m super excited to try it out. I love that you just pin on a little bun, then squeeze out a little bit of your shirt, and voila! You’re wearing just a little bit of clothing.<p> ']

headline: 'The Girl\'s Guide: How to Meet Women in New York
content: ["<p>For years, I’ve been trying to find a book with an easy to follow approach to meeting women in New York. The title suggests a clear path, but the truth is that sometimes it doesn\\'t even seem that easy. And in today\\'s book, Kate Beckinsale brings her brilliant new series to life — and it’s amazing — with beautiful women — including New York City entrepreneurs, mentors, writers, and New York Times best-selling author Elizabeth Gilbert.<p><p>Kate Beckinsale’s story tells the tale of an aspiring NYU professor who finds herself in a tough market, only to discover her beloved professor has an abusive husband, an abusive mother and a family of abusive children. The author, who has just launched her first book, offers readers a fresh look at the ups and downs of a career she didn\\'t know existed.<p><p>In her own words, Beckinsale reveals her journey from a middle school freshman to the woman she met after graduation.<p><p>When she arrived in New York, Elizabeth Gilbert was not afraid of the boys — just one shy of the class-action lawsuit, which would eventually send her to the New York City Police Department. Elizabeth grew up in rural New Jersey with her husband and three grown-ups, and now she lives with her husband in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. In the book, Kate Beckinsale shares how to befriend women around the world and takes you on a journey with the help of five NYC entrepreneurs.<p>"]

headline: A Week of Outfits: Melissa Trench
content: ['<p>Melissa Trench lives in Brooklyn with her husband, Josh and their three young kids. She wears a bunch of different colors — purple, pink and yellow — but the style feels fresh and modern at the same time. “If I were doing a show about New York City life, I would be wearing blue jeans, brown T-shirts, brown sneakers, gray sneakers and grey flats.” Here, Melissa shares 10 outfits she wore to work each week…<p><p><p><p>Sweater: Madewell. Coat: Alpha Designs. Necklace: Madewell. Purse: Madewell. Sandals: Madewell. <p><p>“I wear jeans for work, for brunch, for work parties, and for dinner with my kids. They all feel fresh and modern with their colors, so I feel like a new mom with blue jeans and a sweater. I’m definitely looking at things I was wearing a while ago, but in the end, what I think I’m wearing right now is what my kids will look like.”<p><p><p><p>Shirt: Vintage. Pants: Vintage. Sweater: Alpha Designs. Sandals: Alpha Designs.<p>']

headline: Eating’s Next Step: Snack
content: ['<p>For the past two weeks, my twin sister and I, both of us with kids, ate meals from a tiny fridge in San Francisco. It’s a thing, really, and I’m obsessed with it! We didn’t even have to switch out our cars for a gas station, so it was one of those crazy things, and after a while, our bodies started to feel soooo good. It was like a vacation for our babies. But then the other day, a few weeks ago, I stumbled upon this amazing, lifesaver snack. I was psyched. The first time I tasted it, I felt good — my mouth opened and my belly was a clear mess. We were both so hungry, and I was finally ready to go out for lunch! :)<p><p>But what about you, baby? Do you eat all the time now? I’m curious… Do you have a favorite snack?<p><p>P.S. I love this chocolate chip cookie, which has never tasted so good.<p><p>(Top photo from the awesome Smitten Kitchen)<p> ']

headline: Do or Don’t: Top Lipstick
content: ['<p>Thoughts? What color lipstick do you wear? Here’s my lipstick routine…<p><p><p>1. Blue Lipstick<p><p>2. Pink Lipstick<p><p>3. Orange Lipstick<p><p>4. Matte Lipstick<p><p>5. Gold Lipstick<p><p>6. Gold Tinted Lipstick<p><p>7. Green Velvet Lipstick<p><p>8. Tan Lipstick<p><p>9. Pink Lipstick<p><p>10. Brown Lipstick<p><p>11. Tan Cream Lipstick<p><p>12. Pink Velvet Lipstick<p><p>13. Tan Velvet Lipstick<p><p><p>1. Blue Lipstick<p><p>2. Pink Velvet Lipstick<p><p>3. Orange Velvet Lipstick<p><p>4. Matte Lipstick<p>']

headline: What Would You Do to Make a Wedding Dress Sweatier?
content: ['<p>The groom and groom walk in a circle, and everyone looks over at the bride and groom. Their eyes widen, and the bride’s eyebrows grow.<p><p>Then, they pull on the sleeves and wrap it around the back of the dress.<p><p>And, voila! Your wedding dress looks like this. This year’s dress was based on the idea of pairing a vintage-inspired look with a pretty dress. It’s elegant and relaxed yet timeless, and it’s perfect for the summer and winter. And for the bride, it looks like she’s getting ready for a big night out. (Here’s the wedding dress!)<p><p>Update: The bride has gone from having eyebrows and wrinkles to an unruly mess. Now she’s completely covered in sweat and tears. <p><p>Update 2: The groom did a double take, taking the bride’s dress to the vet and using the same dye and comb that he did on his groom’s dress. The result? Perfect.<p><p>Update 3: When the groom returned to the dressing room, he was still wearing the same exact same dress as he had just gotten his groom’s. (I just found out he didn’t have one of those oversized sweaters.) He looked amazing, and was thrilled with his engagement dress.<p>']

headline: Bensimon
content: ['<p>“Nowadays, everyone wears Bensimon because it looks beautiful and feminine.” Well, I’m not sure if I was thinking of that since I recently got my Bensimon! This dress is gorgeous. (I’m curious about a similar one, though.) I love how it looks so cozy on the beach!<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Allison Goudner
content: ['<p>Award-winning illustrator Allison Goudner lives in Brooklyn with her partner and their dog, Toby. Toby loves wearing clothes that don’t make sense to her (I always wear a tank top, and a dress with a little bra is a bonus). Allison also runs a fashion line called H&M and makes a number of cute things — like her own striped tights! Here, Allison shares five outfits she wore in a week…<p><p><p><p>Dress: MAC, similar. Jeans: Madewell, similar. Tote: Madewell. Jeans: Madewell. Sneakers: Uniqlo, similar. <p><p>“I love my jeans. When they get cold, they smell weird. For jeans, it’s like, oh, I’m going to get that sweater! (My mom, I wore her one.) I have a lot of classic sweaters out there, so I usually have a dark pair, and she wears this dark brown one. My husband, who I love, wears this dark brown one. But we’re in New York, and he doesn’t always wear white, so it’s dark gray or yellow. I love jeans, too, but sometimes they’re too yellow or red, which makes me feel like I should wear more black, like I need to change out of my white outfit. I’ve also worn this black T-shirt, and it’s perfect for summer in the sun. I’m always searching for a bright pair, like this.”<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Nicole Ejé
content: ['<p>Nicole Ejé lives in Miami with her husband and five-year-old son, Jake. Her looks have changed over the years, but overall they’re still pretty pretty. Here, she shares five outfits she wore to work and five outfits she wore on vacation…<p><p><p><p>Striped shirt: vintage and vintage. Vintage jeans, suede and striped shirts from Forever 21 (think vintage jeans for breakfast). They’re pretty casual and make for a good weekend look, but I’d love to hear about their new maternity dress…<p><p><p><p>Glasses: J. Crew. My mom used to wear a bright orange one, and my dad had two, but it changed the way I looked. (Even though he wore a black T-shirt and loafers, it still looks the same.) The color lends a sort of vintage vibe to sweaters, too, and my dad likes this one. Also, vintage jeans with a twist. :)<p><p><p>']

headline: How to Get Rid of a Hairpin
content: ['<p>When I first started washing my hair, I was happy to leave it for later and keep a clean one-piece. But then I realized the world’s hairiest hairpin was a twisted hairpin…<p><p>1. Find a good, long-wearing hairpin. If it’s a piece of hardware or a long-wearing braid, it’s better than nothing, since you have less work to do! It’s easier to clean and it works better than tying something messy.2. Use high-tech shampoo, conditioner and conditioner, which usually comes in three shades. Then, use a microfiber brush to remove and reapply hair (if you’re not wearing any makeup).3. After you’re done, rinse with cold water and leave it on the towel. <p><p>What do you think? Would you try it? <p><p>(Top photo of the French Braid. Bottom photo of a French Braid by Susan Lee.)<p> ']

headline: The Perfect Wedding Dress
content: ['<p>My friend Caroline came over with her new wedding dress. She wore a floral dress, but I felt more at home in this more modern look. Here’s how it went down…<p><p><p><p>First off, my mom always dresses like a teeny bumble bee. Her hair is really loose but the braids are straight-through, so they make her look like a genius with a tomboy style. Plus, her bridesmaids outfit is pretty.<p><p>The dress was actually inspired by a New York City style video she loved. “I had to put on this navy dress (it’s actually vintage), because I’d been wearing the same dress in Manhattan all summer and I’d been in all sorts of situations where I didn’t feel good about myself and just got married at that exact moment. But now I’m like, why did you choose a new style?”<p><p><p><p>And the second dress was from one of the original designers of “The New York Times”, who was also one of the women in the wedding. I think she also did a lot of her own research about New York fashion — including modeling and her own short skirts and dresses — to see if it might make a difference.<p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: Fashion and beauty: Anna-Lynn Pye
content: ['<p>“My grandmother is not very good at styling, so I don’t know how to dress myself up at all. This was my first brush with a makeup artist, and when she told me the secret, I laughed.” — Anna-Lynn Pye, stylist <p><p><p>What are you wearing now that you’re 35? My grandmother just gave me a fresh pair of T-shirts and a black dress. I wear them all the time, and I like the fit. It looks great on everything from my husband’s work clothes to everything I have on my tomboy face.” — Anna-Lynn Pye, stylist <p><p><p><p>Have you noticed how pretty her looks on a woman with an aging body? I love her look! She looks so smart! It’s so pretty to wear, especially to a date! I’m wearing a vintage dress!<p><p>P.S. My favorite fashion magazines, including our favorite lipstick, our insider tips, and our top 10 all-time.<p><p>(Photos by The Sartorialist. Graphic design by Rachel, with help from Toby, Laura, and Jennifer.)<p> ']

headline: Woven skirt
content: ['<p>I’m so happy that these wedges are so small! I’d love to wear them for a long weekend.<p><p>(Via Glamour)<p> ']

headline: How to Make a Lipstick
content: ['<p>So, here we go. First off, I like to keep my lipsticks in a high gloss finish (they look great in the summertime, especially when the weather is cooler and sun is peeking through). But I’m also a sucker for gloss, so I’m thinking of these. (My favorite is this.) Wouldn’t they be gorgeous to wear throughout the day?<p><p>What colors are you into?<p><p>P.S. My lips look so pretty when she’s away from me.<p><p>(Photos by Jenny Lyons for Hellen Kelly.)<p> ']

headline: Fashion: Rene Smoot
content: ['<p>Rene Smoot is an associate professor of political science and author of The Bazaar: America’s Fashion Guide to Everything. “This year, I’m going to teach a class at the University of Michigan’s Museum of Modern Art, and I’ll have two lovely young women who are really interested in fashion.” Here, she shares five clothes she’d love to wear this spring, including a pair of leather chinos and a vintage nail polish.<p><p><p><p>Blouse: This high-waisted silk blouse is so cute. I wear it all the time with a blazer.<p><p><p><p>Braided Blouse: They’re all vintage, but this one has a bright, shiny sheen. Also, the sheen is subtle, like wool.<p><p><p><p>Stella-Dio Tote: This Italian-inspired dress has a velvet trim and a lace bodice. I wear it everyday with jeans, a pair of tights and a cardigan, and it’s a little like a skirt in a nutshell.<p><p><p><p>J.Crew Jumpsuit: I’ve worn J. Crew jumpsuits all winter. This one is a little pricier, but it looks pretty.<p><p>']

headline: Bridget Jones, the lead singer of "Sex in the City" and one of the world\'s great pop singers, died Sunday night at her home in Los Angeles.  "Heartbreak came first" she wrote on Facebook. The singer had been in a long-standing battle with cancer, which has been ruled life-threatening.  Jones recently wrote on Facebook she was "deeply saddened and devastated by the loss of her daughter."  "Today, while she continues to fight for the very life she was so dedicated to," Jones wrote, "I sincerely cannot let her be without the greatest joy. Thank you for all your loving wishes and prayers." The singer and her partner, Taylor Swift, will be buried at her home in San Francisco on April 19, a few hours before the concert, hosted by Beckett Music. Jones had been diagnosed with multiple pancreatic cancer on April 11, 2010.  "Heartbreak came first" she wrote on Facebook.   "Sex in the City," which was released in March 2011, is a collaboration between Jones\'s longtime label, Sony Music and the artist\'s own label, Abbey Road
Golf Shirt
content: ['<p>I’m loving this wool tee from New Hampshire. It’s super cute and silky, and the collar is actually from this vintage G.I. Bill line. I’d highly recommend it to anyone who’s looking for a shirt to wear on their days off.<p> ']

headline: Bike helmets: The best bike helmets for kids
content: ['<p>My sister and I are having some awesome week. We’re having a bike camp with friends in Michigan. Every year, over the next few months, a few bikes will be built for kids in the neighborhood, and we’re excited to bring you two of them: “A new helmet,” the first to use high-tech technology. The helmet will be made from 100% aluminum with high-amplitude foam, and will run at a fraction of the speed of modern helmets. We’ll be wearing our old ones. You could see how awesome it would look when we got home last week. Here are the pictures…My sister and I rode the bikes together last year and this year…My sister took a few pictures at our family picnic, and they were really fun to take and funny. <p><p>P.S. Our secret weapon…<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Kate Beckinsale
content: ['<p>Kate Beckinsale lives and breathes beauty, and she’s definitely one of my new go-to people for things like mascara. For the past year, she’s been a co-host of the beauty blog The Beauty Report, a newsletter she co-hosts with her husband, Jason (the guy who runs this podcast). Kate has spent her career looking to a more natural beauty routine, and her favorite is a toner called Sephora’s Unstoppable Revlon. Here, she shares…<p><p><p><p>How did you get started with beauty?I started taking beauty classes in high school, but I also didn’t go out to dinner, so I had to figure it out myself. I loved beauty, and I’d love to wear a suit and heels every day, but I’d end up needing to figure it out and put on a good pair. I went into a dermatologist with her, and she told me that if I wore an uniqlo, my eyes would look bigger than my eyebrows, and my eyebrows would look bigger than my face. So I did that. I was hooked! <p><p><p>']

headline: J. Crew is finally bringing their American imprint back to life. (Update: That pic is the exact same one posted on their website.) Crew are playing music in their studio, and I can already hear their sound on our walkthroughs. I really like how they put it together. Here are some photos, if you’d like to see…(Via Crave)
I Can\'t Stop Pregnant Mondays
content: ['<p>Last week, I stumbled upon this brilliant video on “Motherhood Mondays.” A mommy-hood video, by my friend Anna, and it makes me laugh out loud. I can’t wait to see what it has in store for us this holiday season.<p><p>(Photos by Jenny Miller and Caroline, via Motherhood Mondays)<p> ']

headline: Fashion Uniform: Mollusk
content: ['<p>Mollusk’s style and flair are timeless, but Mollusk has something new this summer: her new shop, Fashion Uniform. What’s it like to live in a small town in Pennsylvania? (We’ve always loved her mom’s clothes.) Here, she shares her favorite jeans, a cozy sweater and the perfect dress…<p><p><p><p>A white dress with a black stripe.<p><p>“I wear this white dress almost every day, so I’m really into it. I’m the daughter of an architect, and I was born and raised in a small, rural town, where you can almost smell the air in the houses. I grew up loving the French countryside, and I’m into that and having a lot of fun with it. I also love the white dresses with the curly neck. They’re fun to wear and a good pair for weekend adventures.”<p><p><p><p>A blue turtleneck. My aunt always says that’s my signature. It’s the kind of shirt that makes me want to walk down the aisle, and I love the look of it. It’s easy to pull off in any type of dress, but I’m into a red tank top. It’s not a top, so it’s the perfect fit for a weekend weekend. You don’t want it messy and messy and messy. It looks great with jeans and sweater dresses.<p>']

headline: Do or Don’t: Sneakers
content: ['<p>Have you ever worn a pair of sandals? They’re so casual and comfortable, and you don’t have to worry about wrinkles or tears of your jeans when you wear them. They’re so light and flattering and flattering on any body type, from beachy to skinny to sexy. Don’t they look good on you? And if you wear a pair of fancy sandals, are there any jeans or slits you swear by right now?<p><p>P.S. Sneakers at Anthropologie.<p><p>(Photo by Miesha Dore)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Courtney O\'Connor
content: ["<p>Courtney O\\'Connor is a designer who lives in London with her husband, James. Their daughter, Kendra, lives with Courtney on the apartment above. Her favorite clothes are vintage Levi’s, vintage Chanel heels and vintage J. Crew T-shirts. Here, Courtney shares her style journey, her favorite clothes and a super easy mascara…<p><p><p><p>“I loved the old clothes and the basics, like jeans and a T-shirt, but it was still hard to find the right thing for me. I’m pretty independent, but I feel like I have a distinct style, and when I was growing up, I felt like I could afford them at a good price. Now I’m happy to shop wherever I’m, whether it’s for charity or for a date night. I’m happy to shop from the comfort of my own home.”<p><p><p>"]

headline: Midière’s Fall Collection
content: ['<p>For years, we’ve shared Dière Ribeiro’s fall collection, so now that I’m a new mom, I can’t wait to share some of their favorite pieces. The colors are gorgeous, from a warm green to a purple-blue hue. The colors are from Dière Ribeiro, an award-winning French brand that’s best known for their high-end lipsticks and nail polish. The packaging is comfy and easy to put together.<p><p>P.S. A French twist on this spring seasonal collaboration.<p><p>(Via Dière Ribeiro, Via Loeffler Randall and Instagram)<p> ']

Earrings: American Apparel. Shirt: Bobbi Brown. Pants: Tucked in. Shirt: Bobbi Brown. <p>"]

headline: 'The Trial of Christine Lagarde' premieres Sunday at 9 p.m. ET on ABC. A jury found Lagarde guilty on <PAD>  charges in the 2008 takeover of the World Economic Forum and International Monetary Fund and handed her six-year term to life. (The final verdict is scheduled for April.) Lagarde, who has served nearly a decade in private prison, was the first woman to receive a presidential term during President Barack Obama\'s first term. She became the first woman to lead a European Commission committee on women in finance. The film will include excerpts from Lagarde\'s trial and the findings of the jury. Lagarde has said she will resign from her post on Thursday, after a year in prison
What do you wear for work?
content: ['<p>I always end up wearing grey T-shirts and grey flats. I love these dresses and they look so pretty.<p><p>(Via Lola)<p> ']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Lora Martinez
content: ['<p>Lora Martinez is a writer for Everyday Beauty and the author of the upcoming book The Perfect Body. Here, she shares her beauty routine, five easy dishes she’ve used, and her most important makeup trick…<p><p>1. Skin Tinted Lip Balm. This simple, creamy mask and lipstick is the perfect way to add a pop of color to any look. My friend Lili took mine for her New York City bike ride, and it’s perfect for days of outdoor adventures and romantic dinners. I love that it is made from cotton, so it’s light and smooth. And for summer trips, I’m obsessed with the Everlane Nourishing Cream for dry skin. You get this in five ingredients, all of which work really well in combination.<p><p>2. Lipstick Duo. This liquid lip color works best on people with oily skin, but is also very easy to apply and has incredible staying power. The Duo is a soft and creamy moisturizer that makes your skin glow and brighten up, even after you’ve washed your face with the oil. After applying, I feel like I’m not wearing much makeup, but this makes things look natural. It goes on smoothly, so you don’t have any redness or uneven texture on your face. <p>']

headline: Wedding Photos: Paris and San Francisco
content: ['<p>Last week, I broke out with my fiancé (who is a photographer) and went to San Francisco for a honeymoon. We stayed in the West Village and rented an apartment in Mission Hill. I fell in love with this little gem — a cozy little hotel with lots of gorgeous rooms. My girlfriend and I rented an apartment there, and it feels like a little vacation away, like we really bonded over the fact that we were both in our 20s. What do you think, readers? Would you rent an apartment?<p><p>(Photos by Rachel for Jenny Miller. Via SFF)<p> ']

headline: A Day at the Museum of Modern Art
content: ['<p>For the past seven years, the Museum of Modern Art has been taking art classes for its new museum, the Museum of Modern Art (MAM), and the public’s interest in art has been high. But the school has been slow to recognize the impact of the museum’s activities, especially since the announcement of two new openings on Saturday.<p><p>The first opened in May, and it was hailed as the premiere art gallery by Musee d’Orléans et de l’Orsay, which will open the museum on May 21.<p><p>The museum, which opened in 1958, is one of the most important in the world. The art director, Jean-Claude Junker, says it has attracted tens of thousands of visitors every year.<p><p>Many of the museum’s exhibits, such as paintings by artist Lotharion and art-inspired works by women artists, have been in galleries since the 1940’s.<p><p>When Junker saw the opening, he was in awe.<p><p>A museum spokesperson said that the galleries are “fully engaged in the community” and are trying to figure out ways to help them grow.<p><p>Museum staff have been collaborating with the museum to open museum exhibits and exhibits on Mondays through Saturdays from 1 to 10 p.m., the museum website says.<p>']

headline: Maternity Wedding
content: ['<p>Last week, our friend Caroline got a little nervous when she met a guy on a maternity date. Her excitement turned to panic when, after a few seconds of awkward silence, he told her he was having a baby.<p><p>What a cute moment.<p><p>Have you guys ever been on maternity vacations? I’m loving all the photos, but I’m curious: When and where did you guys first get on maternity vacation?<p><p>(Via Momo!)<p> ']

headline: Tucked in: An Extraordinary Weekend Vacation
content: ['<p>Alex and I recently celebrated our 20th birthday, and while we’re at it, I’m psyched to share a little special special one for you this weekend…<p><p>Today’s episode features two guests, both of us in our 20s! Rachel and Adam are both from New York City — they both know lots about the city, but it feels so hard to travel to these parts. Rachel loves playing ping pong with us — and Adam loves playing with her, too. We also got to try out this amazing cocktail pairing. (My friend took our cocktail and I have to say, we’re totally into cocktails. It’s surprisingly simple, and I’m actually inspired by the old-school cocktails she takes with her guests!)<p><p>Anyway, the whole ordeal was great and we all got back pretty quickly — and I’m psyched to finally be back in the States this summer… :) We hope you enjoyed the episode and see you in the meantime, and if you have any recommendations, don’t hesitate to let us know! xoxo<p><p>P.S. This year’s best vacation dates.<p> ']

headline: My Beauty Uniform: Molluskie (Photo by Max Wanger)
content: ['<p>My mom’s beauty uniform is simple, but my sweet sister-in-law always makes her own products! Her favorite is the lightweight lipstick Molluskie (above) and a soft lipstick (below). Here, Molluskie reveals the secrets behind her lipstick and her favorite makeup combo…<p><p><p>What’s your skincare routine like? We’re always going to have a few different products on the shelf, but I try to stay at home and not be too excited about products. As a mother, I’ve been told that my skin has to be clean to avoid irritation and inflammation. I find that a lot of products can be drying out my skin. My skin is the most sensitive part, so I have to be gentle and don’t want the products to smell like I’m wearing makeup. When I’m doing an activity, I’ll add a bit of water to get rid of any dead skin cells, and it will help you feel comfortable in that little area. I also try to use a highlighter in the morning, since it’s the same color.<p><p><p>']

headline: A Guide to a Brooklyn Home
content: ['<p>Last night, Alex and I went to a family-friendly Manhattan neighborhood where the weather was gorgeous. We were excited to hang out, watch movies, chat about my new dog, read books, and get cozy with the neighborhood kids. It was wonderful! A few of our friends also said they were psyched to have taken photos. (I really wanted to be a photographer, so I asked: Where are you going this spring?)<p><p>After walking around for a while, we stopped by a friend’s house. He had some vintage T-shirts and a French jacket! We talked about a little NYC story — my friend and my dog just moved to Brooklyn from New York!<p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: The Big Short: What Happened to the Movie About the Black Kids?
content: ['<p>My friend (who also happens to be black!) came to Chicago last week to see my son Toby, and after he showed up, my mom said something funny. “He says, ‘No, it was so black,’ and then he sees the movie.’ What happened was that the kids are the ones who get ripped off by the evil forces of history. They’re the ones who end up running from the Nazis and getting their ass handed to them.” <p><p>Now my mom is furious with me for her reaction. “You have to be kidding me,” she says, when asked about the movie. “It’s a little racist that way, but it makes me proud to have that choice.”<p><p>Here are a few key points: <p><p>Children of color are killed every year in the U.S. from 1973 to 1989, and their lives are reputedly reduced to torture, killing, maiming and dissection. “The movie makes them’s take on black history.” It explains that the majority of black kids are either Black or Chic, but that there’s a distinct lack of respect, and the racist mindset often makes them feel as though they’re being persecuted. “The kids are getting ripped off by the Nazis and getting their ass handed to them.”<p>']

headline: 10 Best Restaurants in Austin
content: ['<p>Austin’s best-known spot is The Royal Palms, which offers a full-service bar, restaurants, and two rooftop lounges, overlooking Austin. (The former is a ghostly museum, and the latter is a cozy, romantic restaurant, complete with wine and beer.) You can feel transported by their old-fashioned past and old-school decor.<p><p>Here are 10 of the best restaurants in Austin…<p><p><p><p>Bar-B-Que (formerly the New Abbey) <p><p>Bar-B-Que is a modern take on the traditional restaurant model: a bar with a communal seating area, surrounded by the lush gardens. With rotating seasonal beers and traditional local ingredients, it’s a romantic, modern-day cocktail heaven.<p><p>“For us, this is a little bit of a backwater. We’ve grown up in one-and-a-half-square-feet, so we basically had to move to the backwater. It’s still pretty small but for our space, it’s really relaxed. It’s also one of the best places to stay in Austin.”<p><p><p><p>The Queen’s Kitchen <p>']

headline: Manny Masks
content: ['<p>Inspired by the old-fashioned old-fashioned mules (and one of the best things to do), here are five pretty masks you’d wear every day. They look pretty and life-changing in their own right.<p><p>1. Cone Mask: This mask is an easy-to-wash, highlighter that gives you a pop of color without adding to your complexion. It’s easy to apply with your face, but leave it on for a few hours (or until you reach the point where you forget to apply it). (I used to use this mask on my face, but it made my hair look brown and clumpy.)<p><p>2. Black Turtleneck Mask: For daytime wear, this is a pretty mask that’s made to be worn every morning. It works so well with masks and even coats. You just pull it over your face and put it on top of your head and chin. It does wonders for your complexion, too. Just take it off and do it again.<p><p>3. Turtleneck Jacket: If you’re looking for a more natural look, this Turtleneck Jacket is an easy choice. You put it on with your hair and it instantly exfoliates without any scent. It’s especially lovely on kids, where it’s easier to wear with little makeup. <p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Ashley Wollstone Oribe
content: ['<p>Ashley Wollstone is a Brooklyn-based freelance writer, who lives and works in New York City. Her style is grounded in the things I love: Brooklyn chic, laid-back style, the best part about New York. “Every time I’m hanging out with my family, I’ll wear these things for the family photo,” she says. Here, she talks about what it was like working on her first season, and her favorite jeans…<p><p><p><p>The first couple episodes are in a row: a guy in the middle of nowhere gets drunk, and then another guy starts arguing, just like a drunk driver trying to get a drink. Everyone gets drunk. (In the third episode, the guy is also trying to steal his girlfriend’s car.) But then everyone gets drunk.<p><p>When it comes to style, I always look to my parents for inspiration. My mom always wears a black T-shirt and a black T-shirt, and my dad always wears a black T-shirt and a black T-shirt. My grandmother has a black T-shirt and a black T-shirt, my grandmother’s grandfather is a black T-shirt and a black T-shirt. My grandmother’s uniform is white and she wears the same black T-shirt and a black T-shirt every time I get to her.<p><p><p><p><p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Darlene K.
content: ['<p>Darlene K. is a fashion designer with a passion for beautiful women. She lives in the East Village with her husband and four-year-old son. Here, she shares the five go-to outfits she wore to work every day, her favorite brands, and the things she finds inspiring…<p><p><p><p><p>Dress: Birkenstock. Skirt: Della Femme. Shirt: Kiehl’s. Sneakers: Old Navy. Sunglasses: Nellie Hansen.<p><p>“I wear a lot of red everyday. It’s the kind of red that I never thought I would be in my mid 30s. I’ve tried everything — moisturizing, makeup, earrings, whatever. I do like wearing a little grey, especially the black ones. I’m from Brooklyn, so I don’t wear too much red. My mom and stepfather also get so many redheads over, so I like having that uniform.”<p><p><p><p><p>“I have a big crush on designer Jean Marie Mercier. She is my go-to for everyday clothes. Her style is incredible. I’ve always wanted to wear everything she does. I’m a big fan of the Parisian designer, Jean-Marc Mauss. She also wears a lot of jeans, so she’s always the guy I want to hang out with.”']

headline: Sydney Spears Says She Won't Host Summer Concert Without a Wedding
content: ['<p>Celebrity fashion editor Suzie Hogue (aka Sorensen) told New York magazine on Wednesday that Spears, who also recently agreed to host a new movie called "Sons of Anarchy," was weighing up the idea of accepting a second baby. “I had a hard time thinking about it, so I’d basically give up my baby, my dream job, my life,” she said. “My mom and I were like, okay. We’re not going to be there. We’re not going to be around kids like her. She will be a celebrity and we’re going to be thrilled.”<p><p>“When we found out I was pregnant, it made sense to do a movie. I didn’t know how to plan, and this would have been the beginning of the beginning of my baby, and my husband, Mark (the producer), was like, “I need to take my time,”” she said.<p><p>Sydney Spears and her fiancé Mark Sorensen, pictured here in 2011, have a baby together. (Photo by Anna Kjellberg/Getty Images)<p><p>(Photo by Anna Kjellberg/Getty Images)<p> ']

headline: 10 Good Haircuts
content: ['<p>This morning, I was hanging out with my dad and he told me about a hair cut. It was like, ‘Have you ever heard of this?! I like a smooth, curly thing.’ The best hair is the one you cut first…<p><p><p><p>The funny thing was, as soon as I put the razor on my head, my hair suddenly stopped. That’s when I realized, ‘Holy cow! You’re really straight! You’re so graceful and beautiful!’ Well, I was wrong! It turns out that my curly hair was actually based on what I had been eating when I shaved my head first. <p><p><p><p><p>When I was growing up, I did a lot of self-care rituals. I would wash my hair with shampoo and conditioner every day until it became light enough to get rid of any impurities. After washing, I would use a gel washcloth to make it even and moisturizing, and then I would curl up and use a hair dryer for a deeper, deeper curl. It was very important to me for a long time, and I was pretty into that — until I discovered this method.<p><p>Thoughts? What are you good at? Would you ever do something like this?<p><p>P.S. Five weird hair hacks and my ‘dude’ hair trick.<p>']

headline: A Week of Outfits: Jenny O’Malley
content: ['<p>Jenny O’Malley is a journalist and writer based in San Francisco. Her work has been featured on The New York Times, Vanity Fair, and USA Today. Here, she talks about her love of the feminine, the secret she holds to love and the importance of feminine energy in everyday life…<p><p><p><p>Are you into feminine-ish looks? I’ve always been into heels, so I feel comfortable. It feels more feminine. My grandma and I both wear the same shoe, so I don’t have to change it. But a couple years ago, my mom gave me a pair of boots, which were so beautiful. They were so feminine, like I could walk up to a guy and feel that I was feminine. So, as my feet get older, I just want to look more feminine, and I do.<p><p><p><p>How did your body change during your twenties?My body started growing up as a teenager, but I didn’t know how to look like it. When I’d grown up, I didn’t know how to wear underwear — I didn’t even know what I was supposed to look like. But I was born into that world. <p><p><p>']

headline: Horses
content: ['<p>Do you remember the “Ducks” show? Alex was walking around a city playground and one of his horses ran up and down a row of grass, stopping and swerving in midair, then kicking and screaming. “Don’t you think he was getting so far along?!” So we all ran out of the playground, and he rode away like a giant pig with no shoes.<p> ']

headline: Gothic Style
content: ['<p>Are you into graphic design this fall? Here’s my trick for finding timeless style…<p><p>First of all, check the trend section and see if your item is vintage. I’ve been looking through catalogs of old clothing (or at least a few of them), and there’s one catalog that’s just as timeless: Vintage French Clothes.<p><p>How timeless are these? In addition to vintage, some brands even call their products “modern.” There are four of these in my collection, and my favorites are Levi’s, Gap and Target.<p><p>Also, if your style calls for a twist or two, check out our similar bag. There’s a few vintage patterns here and there, and it also comes with a vintage dress!<p><p>So, what do you think? Would you wear vintage to work this fall?<p><p>P.S. I’m excited to see this summer’s runway show…<p><p>(Photo of Levi’s by Stella Artois.)<p> ']

headline: The Most Beautiful Man in the World
content: ['<p>One of the biggest reasons people buy things is just how gorgeous they are. When we bought our first house, in California, the first thing we noticed was the beautiful white walls. Since then, we’ve been hooked. Every time I walk into the house, I see a pretty woman with long blond hair and brown eyes. You never know who might get in. They’re always trying to impress. Plus, you feel the same way you do at the office — you just know they’re there.<p><p><p><p><p>I recently went out to dinner with my family, and it was almost the best meal of my life (and another day at the office). I’ve seen so many women who have beautiful bodies — my mom-to-be, my aunt-to-be, my best friend-to-be.<p><p><p><p>We had a lovely conversation. She reminded me of a favorite scene from Mad Men: “She’s the prettiest man in the world. I’m curious: What do you always love about women?” <p><p><p><p><p><p>We got to chatting about her love of shoes, which she says are “just like her shoes!” <p><p><p><p>']

headline: Boat
content: ['<p>How cool is this boat? Alex and I are in a rush to find a new place to stay this winter, and the place’s not great, so we’re excited to try a bit of it. Here are a few photos, if you’d like…<p><p><p>Boat 1: A few miles north of the New York City Bridge on the Hudson River.<p><p><p><p>Boat 2: The Brooklyn Bridge over the Brooklyn Bridge.<p><p><p><p>Boat 3: At the edge of Lake Shore Apartments.<p><p><p><p>Cape Town: A very short walk up the rocky cliffs to the city-owned Crowne Plaza.<p><p><p><p>Denmark: It’s one of those places we don’t always feel welcome, so we’re taking this with a pinch of salt.<p><p><p><p>Denmark: For about an hour after sunset, and then driving up and down the hill.<p><p><p>']
